description:
If you're familiar with Boba in the Bay Area you should've heard of them by now. With a few locations in the Bay they have gotten more and more popular! 

This location does get busy, but the employees work efficiently and get drinks out in a timely manner. The lines are almost always long at this location. There also isn't much a sitting space so it's more of order your drink, wait, then go. 

Now onto the important stuff, the drinks! My go to from Boba guys is usually the matcha latte, but I went with the Hong Kong Style (Milk Tea). Can't go wrong with this if you can't decided. I suggest you ask the cashier about the suggested sweetness level as they don't recommend 100% as it can be a little too sweet for most people. The boba is always great and made just right. Can't go wrong with any of their items here.
author: Chris N.

description:
Always so busy! I mean legit always. 

This is a go to spot for us when we have visitors in town, we stop by for some Boba before we walk over to Dolo park and I've never seen the place without a line out the door and halfway down the street. 

That being said, the drinks aren't bad and they're consistent with their quality and flavour. I'm personally a milk tea fan and I don't find they're the best for them but people love their matcha drinks and I know they're an SF staple so we'll continue to bring our out of town friends by for a quick drink :).
author: Emily N.

description:
Living in Southern California, I have had my fair share of bobas.  Not to say that all the bobas I have had are good, but most of the time even the ones that are just meh taste OK to me.  So, for the most part, I will drink just about any boba.  I was in SF recently for a quick trip and while doing some sightseeing, I landed in Mission.  After struggling to find Mission (I was trying to be adventurous and took public transportation, which was an EPIC fail), I was ready for a cool drink.  The last time I was in SF, I remember that I passed by Boba Guys, but the line was way too long.  However, this time around, the line was still long, but not as long as before.  So, I waited about 20 minutes to order my boba. 

As for the menu itself, you can customize your boba (similar to all the other boba places) with the type of milk, sweetness, ice, etc. I settled for a jasmine green tea with boba, which my normal go to order.  There is an extremely small counter seating inside, but somehow I was able to find a seat.  (Note that if you sit there though, you might be in several photos of people trying to instagram in front of super cute painting of an anteater drinking a boba.  I just squished myself to the side.) After ordering, it took about another 15 minutes to actually get my boba.  After my first sip, I was very disappointed.  After a 45 minute, I was expecting my mind to be blown.  The jasmine tea had a weird after taste to it.  I could not put my finger on it, but later I realized that this was because they probably used the tea leaves or tea bags a little too long which caused a bitter after taste.  The boba was just average, just OK.  I had a sip of someone's oolong tea and this was a little better with no aftertaste. Maybe if I had it with a milk the aftertaste could have been hidden, but still this was very disappointing to me. 

It looks like SF does not have too many boba options, but with the long wait and poor boba at the end, I do not think I will ever come back here.  (Random comparison, I went to a pretty popular boba place near LA this weekend.  Even though, there was a wait, I was able to get a very good boba within 15 minutes of when I entered the store).
author: Jane L.

description:
First timer at Boba Guys! 

I was blown away by how fresh their boba is. The cashier was literally taking my order while mixing a fresh hot batch of boba balls right behind her. I tried out the strawberry matcha latte and my boyfriend tried the horchata boba both at the regular sugar levels. The horchata was ok, it didn't taste like traditional horchata, but I didn't think it was going to. The strawberry matcha latte however, was delicious! I didn't think I was gonna like the strawberry purée with the matcha latte but it was great!! 

The best part about boba guys is their boba. It is really perfect. It is perfectly chewy, you can just taste how fresh it is. 

Would definitely come again!
author: Alexa A.

description:
Boba Guys has been in my boba rotation for as long as I can remember. I'm always satisfied whenever I leave the shop, and I love how I can customize all the drinks that I order. 

I've had most of the drinks on the menu, but my go to is the Classic Milk Tea with Oat Milk (75% sweet) with boba! 

However on my most recent visit, I decided to try their season drinks. I ordered the Matcha Mango and the Ube Halaya. I actually really enjoyed the Matcha Mango - it wasn't heavy and the matcha wasn't as overpowering like other matcha drinks I've had, you were actually able to taste the mango! The Ube Halaya wasn't my favorite - the flavors didn't go that well for me, the coconut milk overpowered the Ube flavor, and was overall a very heavy drink - I definitely wouldn't order this again. The boba for both drinks was great though - boba guys has one of the best, if not the best boba in the city, I've never been disappointed by their toppings!

Overall boba guys is definitely a great spot! It'll stay in my rotation for quite a while!
author: Stacey Y.

description:
Gave boba guys a try our last SF trip. It sucked. Thought we'd give it another try, but this time we'll try a basic milk tea, not that colorful garbage. Again, it sucked. 

I've never seen a boba place without a non-dairy option that isn't almond or oat. Almond or oat completely changes the taste of milk tea. So I choose regular real milk so as not to alter the taste of the milk tea, while sacrificing my lactose intolerance. Still sucked. And the boba itself was undercooked and unsweet. 

Won't be coming back here, probably ever.
author: Dan P.

description:
Boba guys is a solid place for me to get a boba. I've been to many of their locations and the consistency of their drinks has always been the same. I can also taste the quality they put into their drinks! 

On my most recent visit, I came at night with my friend and got the Ube Halaya with boba, one of their seasonal drinks. The drink was good and had a light Taro flavor, I definitely tasted the coconut milk more though. Not my favorite drink from here but I like how they are always experimenting with different flavors and combinations. 

They also make really good tapioca balls here. I always add them to any drink I get. They have the perfect amount of chew and sweetness to them! Some of my favorite drinks from here are the Classic Milk Tea, Hong Kong Style Milk Tea, and the Strawberry Matcha Latte!
author: Michael L.

description:
Boba guys...you have ruined my life.  I was visiting from Houston and my cousin had to take me here to try the strawberry matcha milk tea with oat milk and boba.  Now I can never drink boba the same again.  I can't possibly fly to San Francisco every weekend!

Ok, but seriously, this is like the best drink I've ever had.  At first I thought it'd be weird combo because I'm not used to any other flavors infused with Matcha, but I was wrong.  This drink is creamy and I can't even explain how good it is.  Long lines that move pretty fast and no parking, but worth it all.
author: Minh L.

description: Okay so the strawberry matcha latte is the best boba drink I've ever had, like ever. And I've been to a lot of boba places. Not only does it look pretty, but it tastes amazing! When I came here on my last trip to SF the line wasn't too long, but I've heard that it can get pretty busy. Their service is fast, so even with a long line I wouldn't be deterred from getting my boba fix. I'm definitely coming here again when I come back to SF!
author: Megan Y.

description:
Yes, overhyped. But, I really liked my drink.

Still probably not the best milk tea place out there.

Went here about a month ago, came up to hang out with my partner's grandma.

***

My partner and I just came from Serrano's and got this before seeing our first movie in theaters together (and it was a terrible movie, my friends). 

But, my Indian Chai really hit the spot.
author: Lilian L.

description:
I had heard that this is THE place to go for bubble tea in SF so I went to try it and it did not disappoint. This particular location has food whereas I heard that not all of the franchises had food if I am not mistaken. The cheese fries were good but I loved the strawberry matcha latte! This isn't a typical flavor at most bubble tea places so I like the fact that Boba Guys has a signature drink that they are known for. 

I know that this place is quickly expanding since they just brought it over to the east coast and I look forward to coming back.
author: Amy P.

description:
Boba Guys creates one of the best classic milk tea drinks I've had in a while! There are around 5 locations in the numerous neighborhoods of San Francisco.

I chose the Classic Black milk tea (without boba of course) - smooth, frothy, and had a distinct, robust black tea flavor while still containing a balance of the familiar malty-like milk element. I ordered the drink 50% sweetened (the recommended sweetener level suggested on the menu), since nowadays I prefer tea and even coffee drinks to be less sweet.

My sister ordered the Jasmine Green milk tea (with boba), also ordering it half sweetened. I sampled her drink (trying to strategically sip it so I didn't suck up a tapioca pearl through the straw) and it was a superbly made tea drink, too! The green tea had a mellow, natural flavorings combined with a hint of a floral-esque taste.

FYI, the tea drinks can also be ordered as a hot version (12 or 16 oz size); iced version (16 or 24 oz size). And there are four milk options to choose from, including vegan options: organic dairy milk (the milk I chose for my tea drink), almond milk, oat milk, or no milk.

Overall, an exceptional milk tea experience! And I'm super happy there is now a convenient location in LA County!
author: Anna B.

description:
To simply put it, Boba guys serves great tasting fresh tea with soft sweet boba. I ordered the Matcha Latte with boba and I have to say I really enjoyed it. Their menu offers some unique cool drinks that I haven't seen anywhere else. I will def be more adventurous the next time I order here. Like maybe try the matchata (horchata and matcha mixed together) or the Ube Halaya.

The only down fall is that the line can be out the door. I mean this does help testify that the drinks made here are good. I came here on a Saturday afternoon and the line was also out the door! Luckily it moved fairly quickly so it wasn't too bad, but who likes to wait in a long line for a drink... Alright i'll stop ranting about the line now.

Hope you don't get stuck in a long line!

SYOY!
author: Sabrina S.

description:
First time to Boba Guys was super pleasant :) I rushed here with a friend during my lunch break at 12:30pm at work. 

We both ordered a matcha latte, and we were able to pick up our drinks fairly quickly and rush back to our office. The atmosphere of the shop itself was very open and welcoming- I believe the clean, white, & minimalistic decor is a signature style of this brand. The staff & cashier were quick to get their jobs done. 

The drink itself was delicious. I got 50% sugar with boba. The matcha is very smooth & light- but the taste of tea is definitely in there. Even at 50% sugar I thought the drink was still fairly sweet, but I think this is because the boba was largest contributing factor to the sweetness in the drink. The boba here is super soft, slightly chewy, and tastes as if it was drenched in honey beforehand. So the drink itself was perhaps cut down in sugar, but the boba definitely upped the sweetness level. But I still enjoyed the drink very much! 

Definitely looking forward to coming back.
author: Tammy W.

description:
I usually LOOOVE Boba Guys, but the seasonal drinks this time really let me down. I decided to try the Matcha Mango, which sounded really delicious. I hoped it would taste like the classic strawberry matcha latte (the iconic Boba Guys drink!!) but unfortunately, it tasted like grass mixed with a HINT of mango. It really reminded me of a La Croix because the flavor was sooo light. I wouldn't recommend getting this drink at all! 

Boba Guys still gets 4 stars though because their classic drinks are bomb and there was no wait at this location!
author: Evanie H.

description:
I love boba. I have it way too often, but it's so good I can't stop myself. Boba guys is definitely one of my favorite places to grab a cup when i'm in SF. The hong kong milk tea is my go-to, which features black tea with condensed milk, so it's very creamy and very good. 
The mission location is nice and tiny, it's not really somewhere to stick around, I would suggest taking it and walking 5 minutes to dolores, where you can relax with your boba and people watch. My only tip is avoid the horchata milk tea, I tried it before and it really wasn't good. However, the jasmine milk tea is a solid choice as well! Be prepared for a wait, you never really know how long the line can get around here, it's not as bad here though compared to the hayes valley or union square location!
author: Noor H.

description:
Food: I had the strawberry tea with boba. It was sweetened with brown sugar and had strawberry seeds in it. The boba had a nice texture, too. Would absolutely return.

Logistics: There was a bit of a wait, but not too bad. It was awkwardly crowded and I constantly felt like I was taking up too much space. I couldn't wait to get out with my tea.

Service: it was good. they can't help the size of their establishment... 

Atmosphere: lots of people taking pictures of their drinks here. I gather it's very popular.
author: Elizabeth G.

description: I love that this location is a short walk from Dolores Park. I went before closing on a Sunday and the wait wasn't bad at all. I ordered the matcha latte with boba and you can choose from either organic milk, almond, or oat milk. Oat milk is sort of like coconut milk, it's a delicious dairy-free substitute that doesn't take away from the drink's flavor. The boba was amazing as expected. I think next time I'll opt out from the honey option to sweeten it cause I think it overpowered the matcha.
author: Sally A.

description:
FIRST TIME EVER HAVING BOBA GUYS!!  Got strawberry match latte with boba.  

The cool thing about this place is that they give you different milk options (very good for lactose people).  

To be honest I wasn't expecting to like strawberry and matcha mixed, it just didn't sound too appealing to me.  Also you aren't able to change the sugar level on this drink.  So in my mind all I thought about was how sweet and sour this drink is going to be.  And was I wrong about everything.  When i took my first sip I was dreading it a little bit and when I tasted it, the tasted meshed really well together.  The strawberry flavor wasn't too overpowering and the matcha was at the right amount.  Next time I will forsure get a milk substitute -_-

Let's talk about the most important part of the drink.  The boba.  Sweet and chewy....PERFECT!!!  Can't say this is my favorite boba place but it's definitely top 5!!!  Can't wait to try more of the menu :)
author: Irene M.

description: I normally do not enjoy matcha drinks but I got the strawberry matcha and loved it! I recommend this over the normal milk teas here. Their boba is amazing and consistently soft + chewy just like how it should be. The lines are long but they go by quickly.
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
Finally, got the grass out of the ground. (Haha it's a Chinese saying not sure how to directly translate it)

Tried their signature matcha strawberry. It was reallyyyy good!!! You should not miss this drink, make sure try it out if you spent so long waiting in line and don't want to fail on a drink. It's a safe choice.
author: Xuaner Z.

description:
This is one of the smaller Boba Guys locations i've been to.

Parking here, not unlike the other places, is terrible.

The set up of this spot allows for some space to wait inside for drinks, and in typical Boba Guys culture, they try to keep the entrance/exit from mixing too much.

If you're familiar with boba guys, you know that they're quality is exceptionally high. You can get a drink you don't really like but you won't be able to doubt the quality of the product itself.

The cashier here was taking orders and stirring the boba that was cooking behind him. That didn't slow down the ordering process at all, but was pretty entertaining to watch.

I prefer the 16th street location just because more parking is available and there's space for seating if that's what you prefer, but I've never been disappointed with a order from any of them!
author: Connie T.

description:
Being from the LA area, I have been exposed to numerous boba shops in the Southern California area so I wasnt that impressed with the Boba Guys.

However, what sets them apart from other Boba/Tea shops is their unique flavors and colors of their drinks along with the use of quality ingredients. They have different options for drinks which can vary from season to season. Each drink is customized with the customer's sweetness level in mind so no drink is the same.

Overall, it's a great place to get a drink if you dont mind waiting in line.
author: Glenn A.

description:
Great bubble tea!
Fresh boba, good flavors. If you never tried bubble tea before this if the place to do it. Anyone will find something to their taste and preference.
author: Maria K.

description:
Solid boba place with some interesting twists on the traditional drinks, including horchata and chai. There's typically a line but they get your order in pretty quickly. The wait for your drink is also decent, 5-10 minutes despite a number of parties ahead of us. Service is meh, could've been better, especially the cashier. 

There's really no seating here, so unless you happen to get one of the five seats by the window, expect to take your drink and go. Unfortunately no rewards program, so loyalty doesn't get you anything in particular. 

All in all, their boba was delicious, the tea was pretty good, solid like other places and decently strong tea flavor even in milk tea drinks. Would come back since it's conveniently located in the Mission.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
This boba guys does feel a bit more rushed than the other ones, and I saw many drinks that looked like they were quickly made, and didn't have much care for the aesthetics (one of the Strawberry Matchas had the green and red layers basically mixed together, which would have sucked had someone ordered it for a photo).

That being said the drinks were still good, I had the Purple Rain, and it tasted like a mixed of berries and lightened coconut milk, and it was overall pretty delicious, albeit a bit sweet. I keep forgetting they do lighter sweet flavors, usually at places like ShareTea they always ask "how sweet?" but they don't really do it here so you have to kind of remember.

Otherwise a great place, and I am glad they are opened again!
author: Tyler T.

description:
Ahhhh oh so famous Boba Guys. I've seen so many of my friends get these over the past couple months, but unfortunately we don't have one in Virginia so this was a must try.

I was right in the area and happened to see it as I exploring Mission. It was not a large location, but I could definitely tell that lines can get pretty long so it looked like I came at a good time. 

Ended up asking an employee for their two best sellers and got the Iced Matcha Latte and Hong Kong Style drinks. I wasn't a huge fan of the Hong Kong Style one as it seemed to be lacking in sugar, but the Matcha was incredible. Went back a couple days later, to get the Strawberry Matcha Latte as it was recommended by friend and was pretty good to say the least. It really gets me thinking about who comes with these drink ideas like putting strawberry puree in matcha. 

P.S I thought it was also a little funny/cool that they sell shirts, hats and mason jars on the side.
author: Timothy D.

description:
I have to give this place 5 stars for location, cleanliness, simple shop, customer service, and consistency.

They serve the the best boba in my opinion and i say this because I have never been disappointed. Whether it be this location, the one on Stockton St. or the one in 16th St. Consistency in good quality is key. This is why I keep coming back. 

I have tried the matcha, jasmine, horchata and original milk tea. All great, but for me to know if a boba shop is good, always go for their regular milk tea. I always base it on how good they make the most basic and original milk tea. And if they make it good and not like the "usual milk tea" then you got me. The actual boba is always the same texture, not soft and soggy and not hard, cooked just right.

Thank you for making such great bobz!
author: Madel R.

description:
Boba guys has been one of my boba faves ever since they started off as a small pop up in a Chinese restaurant in Berkeley. I've been to their other locations but this was the first time I visited their Mission location.

Located off Mission this Boba Guys location is perfect for those who want a cool treat before heading off to explore Valenica or Dolores. Much like the Union Square location lines here can get long. When we arrived at 3PM on a Saturday, the line was almost around the corner and it took about 20 mins for us to get to the front to order. 

Although the line takes a while to get the register, it only takes about 5 mins to get your boba order. My go-to is the iced Horchata w/boba (Small $4/Large $5). Their matcha drinks don't fail to disappoint either. 

Boba guys has really stepped it up over the years and even sells cute mason jar cups, totes, boba bae shirts, and mugs at this location.
author: Keizzel C.

description:
Having been to Boba Guys before, I knew I had to get my Boba Guys fix when I was in town. I appreciate how all of the drinks here don't involve powders but it's interesting how each location has their own sort of specialty drinks. The location here is pretty small so don't be surprised to see a line out the door!

I wasn't in the mood for some milk tea but I opted for the matcha palmer which is a mix of matcha and arnold palmer. The drink was pretty refreshing! Once you mix all of the honey that was at the bottom, the honey gives the drink a little sweeter taste to balance out the acidity of the lemonade. 

I'm just waiting for the day they open up a location in LA!
author: Jason L.

description:
I've been wanting to come here for years but didn't get the chance until a friend took me a few weeks ago. Even though it wasn't really cold-drink weather, we really enjoyed our boba drinks from here! I had the strawberry fresca with their signature boba. My friend's jasmine milk tea was floral and not too sweet. I really want to come back and try their kiwi guava drink next time.

I liked how unique their drinks were. It's a tiny shop so you probably won't be able to sit but it's definitely worth a visit if you are a boba lover!
author: Megan K.

description:
One of my favorite Boba places in the Bay Area. I usually get the matcha strawberry tea with boba and almond milk. The ingredients taste fresh and they make my favorite boba in the area. The wait time is relatively short, 5-10 minutes but it has a long wait time to use the restroom 10-15 minutes because of how crowded it is.

It usually takes around 15-20 minutes to order your drink because of the Boba Guys hype, which I think is pretty worth it. My biggest gripe with the chain is the prices. It might come out to ~$4.50-5 for a small matcha strawberry tea which is kind of steep compared to other boba places around the area.
author: Jason T.

description:
This location is a few blocks from Dolores Park so it is super convientient to grab a drink. When I arrived, there was miraculously no long line and was able to order and get my drink fast. They also provide the 4-cup-cup holders in front so i don't have to deal with asking and waiting.  Tip : 2 doors, enter through the right one 

I absolutely am now on the boba guy train and won't get off :)
author: Na X.

description: First time trying Boba Guys and it was a pleasant experience. Luckily didn't wait that long in line. I got strawberry calpico boba and it was really refreshing and does have fresh boba in it! I'd say it's at par with Coco, they're both amazing.
author: Anne V.

description: I loved their matcha strawberry drink! I love their milk options which include organic whole milk, almond milk, and oat milk! I was so surprised how well the strawberry complimented the matcha. The boba was nice and soft and warm. Sometimes i get sick when i drink boba but i didnt get sick after drinking boba guys so that definitely tells me they are doing something right! I also like how they have a variety of baked goods.
author: Brenda H.

description:
Boba guys may be expensive, but their teas are very good. You're paying for quality teas as opposed to the powdered stuff at joints like Quickly's.  You can adjust sweetness, adjust ice level, change the milk base type. Ever since i became allergic to milk products, I haven't been able to drink milk tea at most place, but Boba guys is one of those places that has plenty of options that I can pick from. I really like the matcha drink with Almond milk. The teas are normally not too sweet at 100% here so even though I normally adjust down to 25% at other joints, I'll only adjust to 50% at Boba Guys. 

Be careful of long lines during busy times but otherwise, you can't go wrong with boba guys! They take credit cards through Square =) no worries about not carrying cash.
author: Annie Z.

description:
I love Boba Guys so much.....

I'm honestly so extra I really come from Fremont to get Boba Guys because it's really just that good.. I hella love strawberry matcha!!! Matchata is ok.. but yes anyways, STRAWBERRY MATCHA IS HELLA GOOD!! I'll most definitely come out again for more..
author: Dominique E.

description:
ingredients are fresh and their drinks are unique. 

MANGO TEA FRESCA (5 stars)- had boba guys for the first time a few weeks ago and this is what i got. it is so refreshing and i love how it's like an agua fresca but with tea. i love everything about it and it's A MUST TRY!!! it's a shame that it's seasonal because it's their best drink. 

MATCHA STRAWBERRY LATTE (4 stars) - very creamy and thick. you can taste the quality of it and i loved it but i definitely need to be in the mood for it just because it's so creamy. 

MANGO MATCHA (2 stars) - another seasonal drink but just meh. it's just matcha with mango purée and it isn't sweet at all and i didn't know that. thought it sounded promising but i think i'd like it better if it was a matcha mango latte and sweeter... 

PEACHES AND CREAM (3 stars) - yet another seasonal drink. pretty good but not my cup of tea. i wouldn't get it again but i can see why people would like it. i can't really describe it either but it's basically like the name, peaches and cream. 

sometimes there's a long line and other times there is no line but it moves fairly quickly. either way, boba guys is a must try when you're in sf.
author: Yan L.

description: I have always been skeptical about boba guys because of the higher-than-average price of the drinks and the (personally) unappealing focus on organic quality of the ingredient. I ordered the strawberry matcha latte and it was worth the hype. The line was really long (that says a lot about a business) but it is worth the wait as it is one of the few boba drinks that doesn't make my stomach upset. There is also a huge selection of drinks to choose from. The price is a little high but you do get what you paid for. Would come back again!
author: Kaylee P.

description:
My SF Family loves this place and I too enjoy it. The boba (pearls) alone are stand alone delicious, soft, chewy and just sweet enough! 
The flavor pairings are great, I have enjoyed everything I've tried. 
The renovations that they did were just what they needed a little more space with a better flow for the line. Decor is modern and up to date.
author: Sabrina V.

description:
After trying this place for the third time, I'm finally ready to give my final review. I've been to locations in New York, Hayes Valley, and now here. I recalled New York being very high quality (I got Thai tea and sampled my friends strawberry matcha latte), but when I tried it again in Hayes Valley a few months ago, I was incredibly disappointed; the boba was hard and flavorless, the Thai tea was like bitter water.

This time around I got the strawberry matcha latte, and BOY is it better than I remember. I got whole milk, 100% sweetness, and boba. The boba was a nice chewy texture with a nice taste to it, and the drink was delicious- not too sweet, not too bitter, and tasted more strawberry than matcha (which I preferred). I definitely need to explore the other options as well, so I'm definitely coming back!
author: Vickie N.

description:
This place is a good standard boba place. I like to call if 'amercanized boba' Tea is nice and light and you can adjust the sweetness and substitute milk if you are lactose intolerant. I gave it 3 stars because for the amount of effort (there is always a line) you can get better boba. You are in the San Francisco were boba is a dime and dozen. If I have had a friend visiting over, I would take them here because of the hype but there are so many other jewels. 

Don't get me wrong good standard place. Clean and service is always nice. But I don't really catch myself saying I am 'craving boba guys right now'
author: Amica J.

description:
For being in SF only one weekend and having time for a food adventure - Boba Guys was definitely on my list!

I was not really sure what to expect when it came to taste but I had to try out the "hype" for myself. I know a lot of people get addicted to the hype of places and sometimes they disappoint, this place does not disappoint. 

Yeah it had a longer line than preferred but that is what you get when visiting good quality foodie places. I decided that I would order the Classic Milk Tea to be safe and it was definitely one of the better Milk Teas I have ever had. It was not watery. The ice ratio was on point and so was the taste.

I basically want to try all the drinks on the menu so I know I will be back. The symbolic simple cute cups are highly instagram - able too :)
author: Emily J.

description:
I like this location because it's located by so many other cool places. Great spot when it's nice and sunny to grab a drink and head over to Dolores Park. I know people either hate Boba Guys or love it; I'm part of the latter.
If you're expecting your typical, everyday boba this place is not for you. If you are looking for a modern, urbanized twist on boba, Boba Guys nails it. It incorporates a lot of flavors and trends that are "in season" or trending and mixes them with the classic boba essentials. 
My favorite drinks include the matcha latte and the strawberry matcha latte. Not only do they look amazing, they taste delicious. Boba guys has a wide variety so I recommend looking at the menu first and asking the staff for recommendations before going in blindly. Enjoy!
author: Christian N.

description:
Beware of long lines.... 

What is all the hype about?  Delicious boba, of course.  Do they live up to the hype?  Here's my thoughts on the matter.  The boba is very chewy and delicious - they do an excellent job on the perfect texture and perfect sweetness.  The almond jelly is also bomb!  They make it fresh so you will do yourself a favor by getting this.  The tea itself is also good.  I wouldn't say its the best tea I've ever had, and the tea flavor itself is really a little more muted then I'd like.  But!  It's for the masses.  And it is quite enjoyable.  If you ever pass by and see no line, get in and get some!  because if you look behind you, the line will probably have formed....
author: Pauline M.

description: Their signature strawberry green tea is a must-have! I would never thought this combination would taste great, and this really blew my mind away. Strawberry sauce/jam in the bottom tasted fresh and flavorful. The presentation of 3 layers, strawberry, milk and green tea, looks amazing.
author: April B.

description:
Beyond the long lines, steep prices and lack of seating, Boba Guys still manages to top the boba charts and live up to the hype! 

Boba Guys is one of the best, if not the best, boba in the bay! That's a tall claim and I'll need to try all the things on the menu to be sure, but from the basics (teas and milk teas) which you can get elsewhere to their more unique specially drink options (such as the strawberry matcha latte), Boba Guys consistently delivers on chewy, flavorful and not too sweet goodness!

The milk teas are some of the best I've ever had not just in the bay. They use Straus Family Creamery organic milk accompanied with their in house brewed heirloom premium teas. Their syrups are also house-made so no powders and artificial replacements!

Their Strawberry Matcha Latte is not only delicious but also a show stopper and instagramable with its 3 tiers of goodness. It's still the boba and matcha you love but with a new twist. I'd definitely recommend it in addition to trying the classics of course. My only complaint was that there wasn't enough strawberry and it was mostly overpowered by the matcha flavor. Perhaps it might be different with the bigger size. 

Things to keep in mind - be prepared to wait 10-20minutes in line, know that there is no parking and prices are steep. 

Highly, highly recommended for any boba connoisseurs!
author: Mario B.

description:
Yelp 100 Challenge 2018
43/100

When I visited the boba guys in New York, I wasn't completely sure how I felt -- despite the fact that my friends were avid fans. i decided to visit again and I was pleasantly surprised! 

I got their classic milk tea w/ boba and it was really good. Definitely different from what I'm used to, but in a good way :)

Would visit again!
author: Stacy A.

description: i dont even like boba but milk tea here was great. Coming from LA where we have thousands of boba shops. This place was pretty good. Good luck guys
author: Jason L.

description:
I love their bubble tea. This has to be the best bubble tea I've had beyond making my own at home from super high end ingredients. 

I did their Muscat Oolong and it was heavenly! I normally do the tapioca balls, but the gentleman serving us recommended the grass jelly and it was well worth it! I love that they use high end ingredients like Straus Organic milk and Califia Farms Almond Milk. 

You can adjust the sweetness and I went with 50% and it was just right, just a hint of sweet without being overwhelming. 

On this visit I also picked up Cotton Candy they were selling by Sugar and Spun and oh my goodness - divine. I don't even like cotton candy.
author: Mary P.

description:
Came here on Saturday with a couple of friends and although I come to the city pretty often, I have never tried boba guys. I have heard a lot about it and I have a friend who said she loved their drinks so I was excited to try this place.

We came here around 3PM on a Saturday and luckily, we did not have to wait in line for too long. I would say the wait was about 10 minutes and so we were glad because I've heard the line is usually much longer. I ordered the thai tea with normal sweetness. 

It didn't take too long for them to make our drinks and so we were in an out pretty quickly. When I tried my thai tea, I was extremely disappointed. I did not like my drink and ended up throwing half of it away. The people who work here are nice but there drinks don't live up to the hype.
author: Karishma K.

description: I got some fancypants specialty drink that tasted pretty much like warm coconut milk with some subtleties, but Boba Guys has some seriously killer black tapioca pearls. They've perfected the process of cooking a uniformly great chew throughout the entire pearl.
author: Josh L.

description:
-Truly one of the best boba shops around, the line out the door is a testament to it's greatness. Went around 2pm on a Sunday and the line was already very long but it's always worth the wait for Boba Guys
-My favorites are the classic milk tea and matcha latte. The Thai tea is decent too but I feel they don't use enough tea, as it's mostly milk. They also used honey as a sweetener for my matcha latte and it was actually really good and something I'm not very used to seeing
-Love the ability to customize your drink from type of milk, ice level, sweetness, etc
-There is limited seating inside, as it is mostly a grab n go spot. Some of the other locations have a lot more seating
author: Jason C.

description: Hands down my favorite Boba place I've been to. It was a little overwhelming at first because of the line and because we had never been to a Boba Guys, but once we looked at the menu and waited just a few minutes it went by really fast! For sure worth the wait. It was very cute inside and most importantly the drinks were amazing!
author: Devon S.

description:
Nice solid option in the Mission. Probably my most controversial of the rankings Boba Guys is a favorite of many in the City.

This is a good location because there aren't a ton of Boba options in the Mission area so although they aren't very highly ranked in my rankings below sometimes I hop in here because they are they best of the rest in the Mission area. 


Rod M tours San Francisco area in search of the BEST standard milk tea with boba. I have individual reviews for all the places listed below.  I have a more comprehensive Tiered Bay Area boba list 104 boba spots and counting. 

I recently embarked on a completely pointless quest to rank most of the Milk Tea/Boba Places in the area.

Rules: I ordered a simple milk tea with Boba (regular sweetness, ice etc.)

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #42  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

Rod Boba SF Rating = (Taste of Milk Tea / Taste of Tapioca Balls) on a Scale of 1 to 10 (10/10) being the best score possible

* Please note that I like my boba a little bit sweet. I don't like it too milky, too strong of a tea taste or too watery.  I prefer fresh tasting larger "boba".  Powdery drinks (those places that simply have a plastic carafe that they pour out of ) and boba that tastes "old" get docked on my rating scale.  A place could have a higher Yelp rating than it's boba score would imply , if it sells things other than Boba that are good. 

SF/Daly City Rankings:

1 Itea,2 Puppy bobar, 3 Caffee Central,4 Cool Tea ,5 The Boba Shop,6 Little Sweet, 7 Good Earth Café, 8 Hanlin Tea,9 Keep it ,10 Wonder Tea,11 Enter the Café, 12 Urban Ritual  ,13 Tpumps,14 The Ramen Bar,15 Eightea, 16 Super Cue, 17 Enter the Café,18 Steap  19 Tea Hut , 20 Sharetea , 21 Tanca, 22 Boba Guys, 23 Steep, 24 T&T Café, 25 Bobo Drinks & Pho , 26 Samovar Tea, 27 5 sweets, 28 Kestourine Macrons, 29 Asha Tea House, 30 E Tea , 31 Little Heaven Deli, 32 Maggie's Café, 33 Belly Good Café and Crepe , 34 Tea Bear, 35 Sweet Heart Café, 36 Honeycreme, 37 Elixiria, 38 Quickly, 39 Plentea, 40 Mi tea, 41 Ten Ren Tea, 42 Wonderful Foods/Desserts , 43 Out the Door, 44 I Café 45 Phusion 


Just a little taste of my greater Bay Area Tiers is below (there are 6 tiers I have in total, I've reviewed over 112 + boba spots now but obviously not enough room to list them all here) 

Rod's SF Bay Area Boba Tiers: This is based on my milk tea taste/ boba taste rating scale with 10/10 being the absolute best.  I have actual ranked lists for the South 880 corridor and San Francisco in case you're wondering. 
Tier 1 (Alphabetized) "Magnificent 4" aka" I'll get some even if I shouldn't..."
Bubbly, I-Tea, Pekoe, Teatop

Tier 2 : (Alphabetized) "The Almost Elite..but not quite" aka " I'm a fan but not a die hard" 
Caffe Central, Cool Tea, Factory Tea Bar, Good Earth Café,  Gong Cha, Hanlin Tea, Little Sweet, Passion  T snacks and Dessets Puppy Bobar, Soyful Desserts,  Tea Station ,The Boba Shop, 

Tier 3 (Alphabetized)  "The Above average spots" aka " Sure why not..let's roll" : 85 Degree, BlackBall Desserts, Bobapia, Cha Express, Che-Lo, Keep it, Super Cue, T4, Tastea, Tata Tea, Tea Six,  Tea Station, Teaspoon, Teatime, The Ramen Bar, T-Lab, Tpumps,Urban Ritual, Wondertea,
author: Rod M.

description:
OVERALL: Great flavor with decent tapioca. Opt for less sweetness.

I was in SF for 2 days, and I'd heard lots about Boba Guys from my Californian friends so I wanted to see if it lived up to the hype. When I first walked into the place, I was struck by how cute and "aesthetic" the ambience was. The place was very brightly lit with white walls, and a huge picture of the logo (an anteater?) on the wall. 

 I ordered the hot milk tea with boba because it was a chilly day. I noticed that it was really sweet - I got the 75% sweetness, which was recommended on the menu, but it was still very sweet in my opinion. I wish I got the 50% sweetness. I think it would've tasted a lot better if the tea was not masked by the sweet flavor.

Definitely would come again though.
author: Sarah W.

description:
On a cool spring day, my friend from SF decided to visit me on the East Coast. She told me about Boba Guys, a shop declaring that they have the highest quality boba milk tea in the world. As someone who has had boba around the world and drinks boba like water, I was intrigued. I came to visit her two months later, leaving my halcyon New England summer to brave that famously cool SF mist. 

When I arrived at Boba Guys, I was struck by an overwhelming sense of confusion. This place claims to break down cultural barriers, and yet all I could find was a bunch of cool hipsters taking orders in an establishment that could have been any of the other bastions of the millennial foodie craze. What cultural barriers did Boba Guys manage to break down? It almost seems like they did the opposite and uprooted boba tea from its Chinese roots into yuppie land.

"Give the place the benefit of the doubt," I said. So I waited, and thirty minutes later, I had boba in my hands. I ordered both the classic milk tea and the matchata. It was a long wait, but the check out process was seamless, and  I had a good chuckle when I noticed the "Boba Bae" t-shirts on the wall. I imagined a tribe of Boba Bae influencers promoting the "next level quality" that Boba Guys claims to offer. Amped up by the hype, I took my first sip, hoping their #fightthepowder ethos would change the way I saw boba, but alas, I was disappointed.

Was it me? Did I expect too much? Did I order the wrong thing? Nevertheless, here is my experience:

1. Boba - to me this is the most important aspect of the drink. Unfortunately what I experienced was inconsistency in bite. Some pearls were perfectly al dente, some were gooey and slimy, and some were rock hard on the teeth. They claim that they are ballsy, that they don't break your heart, but guess what, Boba Guys, you broke my heart with how you made those balls!

2. Tea - the way they brewed the tea led me to question if they actually gave 110% a damn in everything they do. The tea and the milk, independent of the sugar, should balance each other. The sugar acts as a flavor enhancer in the background. I did not get sugar because I wanted to taste how well they performed the flavor balance between tea and milk. The tea overpowered the milk, a bitter dryness lingered on my tongue, and I knew from that moment that the tea was brewed past its peak.

3. Ice - Why would I rate the ice? It's just ice after all - but to me, the ice cuts and balances the richness from the milk and it is important, so important, that boba places let you choose how much ice you want (Boba Guys does not) What keeps me coming back to boba milk tea is the lusciousness of it all. Unfortunately, I could not taste this lusciousness in my Boba Guys milk tea. What went wrong in their small batch drink making? Did they not taste their artisanal creation? Was my order in an assembly line of drinks that got watered down when I finally received my order? 

Sad and dejected from my classic milk tea experience, I thought I would find hope in the Matchata. But there was no flavor! Where was the cinnamon rice goodness in the horchata? Where was the earthy clean taste in the matcha? Sure, the two toned drink looked cool on Instagram, but I was expecting more :(

Boba Guys, you say you aren't afraid to try new things, and I wanted to like that about you. But when you don't cook the boba evenly, when you source loose leaf tea but don't brew the tea with respect, when you get great ingredients but don't pay closer attention to balance of flavor, I can't like you. 

Yet like all hyped things, you'll persist and grow. You'll reach the yuppies not accustomed to venturing into their Chinatowns for milk tea. But it won't be better, and I'll be ballsy myself and say that, in the figurative and literal sense, your boba milk tea is the watered down version of the boba milk tea that I know and love.
author: Barbara B.

description:
After seeing so many pictures of Boba Guys, we finally got to try it on our day in the city. We got the Lychee Green Tea, Strawberry Matcha, and Hong Kong Style Milk Tea. The HK Milk Tea was flavorful, except next time I think I would go for a lower sweetness level, you definitely taste the sweetness at 100%. Boba pearls were chewy and cooked to perfection. 

As per recommendations, Strawberry Matcha was definitely worth the try. My boyfriend really enjoyed his drink and it's something different. It's not on the menu above but when you get to the register it's posted to the side. 

Store itself is pretty small so it's more of a grab and go. Street parking so best to walk or take public transportation. Prices were reasonable and I like their anteater logo, nicely designed.
author: Hong L.

description:
First thing I thought when I heard about this place was "$7 for bubble tea?! That's so expensive!". Considering we usually get it for $5. 

However, I understand that they only use the freshest ingredients. Of all the flavours that we ordered, i enjoyed the Muscat Oolong the most. Will likely come back to try more flavours while we are here visiting.
author: Justina L.

description:
There is so much hype regarding this place, and the only time I've ever had it was at an amazing wedding I attended - so I was very excited to come to the actual shop for the first time. 

Horchata - very smooth with a great cinnamon flavor. I only tried a sample of this and liked it, but do think that it would have been too heavy for me as a whole drink. 
Strawberry matcha latte - I hear that this is the drink to get, so I've been wanting to try it for quite some time. It comes out in three beautifully-colored layers. I personally would have preferred more of a strawberry flavor, but I enjoyed this regardless (though not as much as other people seem to).
Hojicha roasted green milk tea - I absolutely love hojicha in general because of the fragrant "ricey" flavor. It was good here and my fiance liked his drink.
Strawberry jasmine tea fresca - I had this at the wedding I attended and not at this shop, but I'll throw it in this review anyway because it was perfectly refreshing, just like the description says. I liked it a lot!
Soy milk tea - also an item I tried at the wedding. The couple was so thoughtful to include this milk tea option for guests who can't have dairy! I'm so glad I'm not lactose intolerant though, because the soy milk tea tastes watered down and isn't nearly as delicious as regular milk tea.

I love how they allow you to sample things at the counter - one of the things we tried was this lychee coconut juice that isn't on their regular menu. I took a sip of it after I had already ordered, but we all agreed it would be something we would like to get next time! Great taste with both the lychee and coconut flavors coming through, and wonderfully refreshing on a warm day. I do feel that the prices at Boba Guys are very slightly higher than some other places, but they use organic milk and no powders in their drinks, so it's worth it. I can't say this is one of my favorite boba spots, but I'd definitely come back to try some of their other things, like the muscat oolong!
author: Nicole M.

description: There's a hair in my drink, and I pulled it out of my mouth. Unbelievable and that's why I'm giving it one star.
author: Bingbing Z.

description:
Touring SF for a bit and decided to spend some time wanding around Mission district. When I saw Boba Guys on google maps, I thought, 'I have to stop in there.' While I'm glad I stopped by, I would say that it was a touch disappointing.

Boba Guys looks tight. The folks there are exceptionally nice, the place is very clean, the signage is good, the branding is strong, and they make it clear that if you're not happy, they'll make it right. All fantastic characteristics of a stand-out place. Those are the positives.

The negatives are that the price of goods is high, much higher than any other bubble tea place. We can excuse that a bit since (according to the marketing) the ingredients are top notch--but it's still pretty high. $5.50 is what a classic bubble tea with tapioca balls will run you. The most expensive place in NYC (in Manhattan) is gonna run $4.50, and it's gonna be taste just as good. The other thing I didn't much care for is that the large bubble tea contained a TON of ice. Is it to make the tea cold? If so, I think the better way to handle that is to go ham on the tea in a cocktail shaker with ice, then pour into the cup with a smaller amount of ice to maintain temp.

This all said, the tea was good, the place was clean, the folks were friendly, but I don't think I'd go again. I do give them credit for having a strong brand and good marketing though.
author: Miguel C.

description:
Boba Guys has great Boba and overall it is a great place to get a variety of drinks. What I love is how they break down their menu and allow you to really get what you want to get. 

- The classic milk tea with boba is amazing
- The iced chai also hit the spot

I also love how they've built up their brand. They have merch and a strong presence online so it's nice to have finally visited! The line can definitely be annoying if you show up at the wrong time but if you love boba, it's worth the wait.
author: Waleed S.

description: Dirty horchata was AMAZING!! Very clean, modern facility.. friendly staff who were quick to help me and my fiancée , who had never been to boba guys before.
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Boba Guys had been recommended by a friend, so I decided to stop by when I was in the Mission this weekend. There was a line that extended out the door (it was Saturday late afternoon/early evening) and we waited ~10-13min to order. I got a 16oz (smaller size) Hong Kong Style tea with tapioca and 25% sweetness, which meant that it was only condensed milk and no additional syrup/sweeteners.

I really enjoyed my tea; I had been craving good boba tea for a while now and this hit the spot. Price was pretty standard for boba tea; I paid $4.50. The employees were really friendly. The shop itself is small & pretty crowded. They also only have one register which didn't really help with the growing line, but at least they were really fast with preparing the drinks -- once I ordered I only had to wait a minute or two. Overall would recommend.
author: Lucine O.

description:
I'm not sure if it's just me but my tea was not as good as expected. I think this place was over hyped. I actually didn't even know what to expect going in here. I thought their menu would be a little bit bigger and that they would have slushi and smoothies but it's honestly just all milk teas. 
I'm not a big fan of milk tea at all so that's probably why. The price range is pretty decent $3-5. I guess next time I have to come try the milk tea instead of getting a flavored tea.
author: Florence M.

description:
My girlfriend loves Boba Guys and after going a few times, I'm pretty obsessed with it now, too! 

Their menu is easy to understand, and you can choose your add-ins (tapioca balls, grass jelly, almond jelly), milk (organic, almond, oat), and your sweetness level (in increments of 25%). They also have a number of specialty drinks like frescas and strawberry rice milk, a few of which don't have caffeine if you'd like to avoid it. 

My go-to is the Classic Milk Tea with tapioca balls, oat milk and 50% sweetness. They use premium tea so I always want that flavor to come through, and at 50% sweetness I definitely can taste the black tea without it being too bitter and still having that milk tea flavor and consistency. 

The vibe is clean and minimalist, and service is fast and friendly which is always a cherry on top to tasty treats. I'd say the only downside is just how popular Boba Guys is and how small their locations are, as it results in quite a wait at times. Still, I always find it to be worth it - grabbing a Boba Guys drink and strolling over to Dolores Park is a great way to spend a sunny day!
author: Alex K.

description:
I used to LOVE boba guys!

I loved everything Boba guys stood for, people even thought I drank too much kool-aid and trusted too much in their marketing around fresh milk (avoiding the powdered types), freshly brewed tea, yada yada yada.

Honestly, I still believe in all the above, and think their mission is great. However, I noticed a fair bit of deterioration in standards in particular at this location.

Regarding taste: I asked for 50% sweetness for my hojicha with milk and pearls, and it was sweeter than my friend's order of the same thing, but with 75% sweetness. Please tell me how that is possible... I had it re-made, and it was still sweeter than hers. We were confused, but I honestly couldn't be bothered to ask them to make it again. 

OK, on to the service: People at boba guys have always been super nice, super accommodating, and honestly, that's a little part of why you're willing to pay $2 more than you would elsewhere for boba, right? This lady yesterday making the boba was awful and grumpy and just plain rude. She literally accidentally flung a plastic cup in my friend's face (while grabbing a cup to make a drink) and just turned around and walked away! Did not apologize OR acknowledge what happened even though my friend caught the cup and handed it back to her nicely (she took the cup back from my friend so she obviously knew it happened, but just ignored her and walked away). 

When I asked for my drink to be remade (because a 50% sweet drink should not be sweeter than a 75% sweet drink), the gentleman who took my request was very kind and immediately offered to remake it, but the same lady (who made it and overheard the question) didn't even look at me and just barked "what happened!?" and then walked away. Excuse me, but you made it wrong (and you just literally flung a cup in my friend's face without apologizing).

How awful! I loved boba guys so much I used to want to visit whenever I could, but honestly yesterday was so disappointing. Cloyingly sweet drink, boba was kinda soggy and clumpy, and to top it off, a cup flung in your face with no apology. Just gonna shake my head and walk away. I'll probably still visit boba guys, but definitely NOT this location.
author: Su Lin Y.

description:
I've always been wanting to try Boba Guys after seeing ads on Facebook. Not sure why I was seeing it on Facebook. But, hey Thanks Facebook. 

I'm such a boba/milk tea addict. When me and my boyfriend finally decided to go on a spur of the moment type deal, I was so happy like a kid finding out she's going to Disneyland (ok maybe not that excited..but you get the point). Parking is horrible. Like any San Francisco parking you have to drive around the block multiple times and hope someone moves so you can swoop in and take their spot. We circled the block maybe 10+ times until my boyfriend wanted to give up, but we there and I didn't want to lose hope. We were about to just park in a red area and hope we can just run in and get our drinks, when thank the boba gods! the car in front of us moved!! .. it was fate! 

This location is pretty small. I was surprised at how small it was. But, hey its San Francisco and I'm getting Boba, at this point I couldn't care less. I'm a real sucker for anything Matcha. So picture my excitement when I saw a Matcha green tea latte. Yup, I ordered that with boba. My boyfriend on the other hand is a boba novice and is starting to get into it, but he loves his horchata and as I predicted he ordered their horchata and loved it. I personally can't say I liked the horchata, since I've always hated horchata. But, their green tea latte was amazing! It had such great rich flavor that I have never tasted before. 

Overall I love Boba Guys and am officially addicted to their Matcha green tea latte and crave it frequently. I'm glad that they finally opened a location closer to home, in San Carlos. So I've actually been there more often. 

I would defiantly recommend this place to others especially to anyone into boba and milk teas. 
This place defiantly takes the #1 spot for me!
author: Rochelle M.

description: This place offers some of the best milk tea and boba I have ever had. They use premium quality ingredients for the milk tea and the boba is of the right texture and sweetness. Be aware that this place has no restrooms and that the line can be over 30 minutes long.
author: Xichen J.

description:
Came here and got a Thai iced tea! It was delicious, a bit on the sweeter side so if you don't like yours sweet I'd recommend asking them to use half of their sweetener! 

I also tried their milk tea, always a safe and good option. It was not the best I've had, but is on par with other ones I've had.
author: Melina T.

description:
This is not my favorite boba place in SF but is one of the them that won't let you down.  If you're a tourist or even have never tried it before, I would give it a chance. 

I'm not much of an explorer when it comes to my boba tastes so I like to stick with the basic jasmine milk tea with boba. The tea flavors are fairly strong but I feel like they make the drink so sweet! When I get 75% sweetness it still tastes like it's half sugar. Luckily, they have really great customer service and will remake you a drink if you ask. Boba is typically good here with a chewy consistency and strong taste as well. Other drinks that are popular are the HK milk tea (super sweet side), Thai tea, and the strawberry matcha. 

Honestly I think a main reason I don't like boba guys as much is because their milk teas just doesn't taste like the traditional places (ten ren) that are my favorite! they aren't bad though, so definitely give it a try.
author: Anna L.

description: Best tea. Delicious matcha ice-cream.  So happy about the option to get ice-cream with milk tea
author: Vicky T.

description:
My friend and I actually found out about Boba Guys because of their stand at San Francisco Matcha Festival. The weather that day was in the high 80s and low 90s, so if the trio colored matcha strawberry latte wasn't eye catching enough, then the fact everybody was standing in an open field under the blazing sun was. 

On our way back to the train station, we actually took the wrong bus, ended up going the opposite, and became very, very lost. By coincidence, we ended up a block away from this particular Boba Guys on 19th Street and decided to drop by. And WOW. Apparently (by the amount of Matcha Festival cups lying around inside and out of the store), a good deal of the festival attendants came out this way to try out more of their stuff. So congrats, Boba Guys! You're investment seemed to pay off pretty well while we there! 

This particular store is pretty small. It's a counter, a bit of room, and a counter-bar along the window. During the time we were there, 30-40 people were trying to occupy that space all at once. There was a literal line that went out the door and down past the next door building and a number of people passing us by were calling us crazy. Which, screw you too, buddy. But that does highlight the point that this place wasn't really built to have a whole lot of people sit down and linger here, though they did say their other locations ARE. They all seem to have a clean, almost See's-candy like aesthetic, but more hipster. Largely relies on natural light, which I appreciate. 

To me, Boba Guys covers an variety of styles and types of milk tea (Thai Tea, Hong Kong Tea, your give coffee milk tea) and a number of different kinds of teas. It's gratifying because you usually go to one place and they have an assortment of that TYPE of tea/milk tea (ex. a list of Hong Kong styled milk tea + [insert flavor]). They also have a variety of snacks at the front container. There were SMALL WAFFLES, OKAY. THEY LOOKED BEAUTIFUL AND DELICIOUS. Oh, and for those who haven't had this kind of matcha latte before where the layers are initially separate, remember to Instagram or whatever first, then stir it before drinking. They also keep a pitcher of water and a stack off cups on the side table where the straws are, or at least they did while we were there. If you see that the pitcher(s) is empty, move or leave it on the pickup counter so the staff doesn't have to wade out into the crowd to get it. It also has the bonus of getting the pitcher refilled more quickly. Anyways, their milk tea isn't overly sweet, but I'd highly recommend the 25% level of sweetness. My friend found her 50% matcha latte to be a bit on the sweeter side and I'm inclined to agree. I'm hoping to visit one of their other locations soon, they're spreading like wildfire!
author: Christine L.

description: Parking is a bit of a hassle. If you are past that, this is a good Boba spot. They have a lot of no milk options. The cashier was friendly but others not so much.
author: Sunil R.

description:
This spot for Boba Guys is small and there was a long line on Saturday evening. Waited about 15-20 minutes in line but once I ordered the drink they made it and the order was ready within 3 minutes. This spot is not a place for hanging out necessarily, there was about 4 chairs for you to look out the window but it was very clean and bright inside.

P.S. they don't have the sesame drink at this location.
author: Yenni H.

description:
I love that you can customize almost every aspect of your boba experience and they have local/homemade ingredients! Choose between different milks and extras (like boba or jelly - which they make in house), and pick a level of sweetness. The sweetness level aspect is not unusual, but I GREATLY appreciate it when places let me dictate the sweetness because I actually don't have a huge sweet tooth.

I ordered the matcha milk tea with boba, and I loved the texture and sweetness from the boba. The boba was actually still warm from being made! Make sure to stir immediately so the boba doesn't clump up. Delicious!

I will say though, if there is a wait out the door, it's not worth waiting for. There are plenty of really good boba places in SF (like Asha Tea House for example).
author: Alice L.

description: Six eighty fucking 2! Here's the thing, if I'm paying this much for boba it better be the best thing I've ever tasted in my life. It's way too sweet. Pro tip: if you like your drinks less sweet, don't get a specialty drink. The matcha strawberry was so sweet I think I have diabetes. So overall boba guys is way too overhyped giving its fucking price. Okay I'm done thanks.
author: Nicole L.

description:
I actually love the boba guys fruit-based drinks more than the standard milk tea at this location! 

1) Strawberry Matcha Latte: this is my favorite drink here. It's got the creamy bitterness of the matcha balanced with the milk and strawberry purée to make for a very tasty, not too sweet drink! I really like it with almond jelly, but their boba is also really good too, and they make it in house. 

2) Strawberry Cali-pico: this is a seasonal drink (still available as of 1/15/16) and modeled after the Asian strawberry calpico drink. They mix strawberry purée with a little kefir yogurt, and it tastes fresher and better (!) than a calpico. I recommend adding almond jelly or boba to this to keep it interesting.
author: Inga C.

description: Not my cup of tea. I prefer other boba spots over Boba Guys. Maybe I just had a bad drink my first time around, but I think it's just over-hyped.
author: Sophia S.

description:
A good staple boba place. If I could rate it a 3.5, I would! Located in the Mission, it's in the heart of tasty desserts and yummies. Parking isn't the best around here unless you find a side street that happens to have curb long enough for your car. 

I came here by recommendation by a friend and ordered the Strawberry Matcha Latte with boba, something that they are apparently known for. It was a mighty tasty drink, super creamy, and flavorful. I asked for less sweet so they gave less strawberry puree and also less boba. The taste didn't have that absurdly artificial taste which was great, and it didn't taste watered down after the ice melted. Two of the main things I look for in my milk teas (:...

The reason I would take it down 1.5 stars is because the staff seems totally burned out when I went, even with less sweet it was quite sweet, and the pricing is a bit steep. It cost $4.50 for a regular :|... But definitely a nice place to go if you're looking for a quality drink for a steeper price!
author: Stephanie F.

description: Boba guys has been on my list of bubble tea shop to try. It's probably one of the most instagramable drinks with its iconic anteater and its colorful teas. I ordered the matcha strawberry milk with almond milk and boba. I enjoyed my drink, but probably would get regular milk with it next time. I liked that their strawberry syrup wasn't overpowering with sweetness. Their boba was perfect and had the right amount of chewyness. However, I don't think this place would rank as one of my all time faves. Their drinks run on the pricier end at ~$5 a cup. For norcal though I think boba guys is a good pick.
author: Carmen T.

description:
I think is this my favorite bubble tea place everrr!

I got the iced matcha latte with 75% of sweetness and tapioca.

Parking on the side.

There's plenty of seats and tables.

Employees are nice and friendly.

Music is great. Good vibes.
author: Aprille B.

description:
I got the classic milk tea with boba. Was it exceptional? Not really. I think this appeals more to people who like the light and fresh tea taste with their boba. I personally like how boba tea was originally made - with creamer. It feels more satisfying to me, as it is thicker, creamier with more flavor. 
Having said this. I would go back again and perhaps try the Hong Kong style tea which is made with condensed milk.
author: Deborah L.

description:
Boba Guys is one of the places that I think truly makes San Francisco so unique and special. Their drinks are so unique and you can't find them anywhere else! You can also tell they really put effort into the quality of their drinks and care about their customers' needs. Not once have I ever been disappointed by their drinks or customer service! 

I love the location of this Boba Guys. It's located smack-dab right in the Mission, surrounded by tons of yummy restaurants and pretty close to the Castro and Dolores Park! BEWARE THOUGH, parking can be a nightmare though and it might take you a while to find. The shop itself is pretty small, and there's usually a line of customers trailing down the sidewalk. The wait can be long, but it's worth it if you have the time. This is a great place to grab boba after lunch or dinner with friends or family! 

What's great about their drinks is that you can alter the sweetness and ice level, and for the ones that have milk you can substitute it for a non-dairy version, such almond milk or oat milk! So far, I've tried the Classic, Thai, Jasmine, Iced Matcha Latte and Hong Kong Style. My favorite has to be the Hong Kong Style and Thai Tea. The Hong Kong Style is black milk tea made with condensed milk. It has a richer, creamier taste than just the regular Classic, and it tastes sooo good with the boba or egg pudding. Their Thai Tea is also probably the best I've ever had. I usually ask for more half and half in it since I like it creamier, and it's perfect! Do i even need to get started on their boba? There's something about the boba here that makes it tastes so different from other places...It has the perfect chewiness and sweetness and I can't get enough.

Overall, this place is a must if you're ever in San Francisco. It's an experience worth having and the boba is definitely worth it!!
author: Tina L.

description:
I get to know this boba shop from my sister, she came here on last Monday but it closed. My hubby and I came on yesterday Sunday around 3 something. And we line for 20 minutes to get inside the shop and ordered drinks. Their shop really small and not much space you can stand or sit. The wait for getting drink wasn't too long maybe only 3-5 minutes. They are efficient once you ordered. 

I looked at their menu from their shop, I was undecided because they have so much premium tea and house special tea. Finally, I ordered classic milk tea (Decaf Black) that is non-caffeine which is really suit me. Because I cannot take coffee or stronger tea. They could make me feel very awake later. I added black pearl into my drink because they are famous with their boba. The boba is soft and sweet. I got unsweetened milk tea and less ice. I would say it's perfect for me. Because the tea don't taste sweet but with its boba, it's kind satisfied. My hubby ordered lychee green tea with black pearl. And it taste light to us.

You can choose organic milk, soy milk or almond milk. Added topping would cost $0.50. You can adjust sugar and ice level. They serve 2 sizes for hot and cold. The parking here I guess not that easy to find. We got über here so everything is easy for us, we just get down from the car and line.

I would really recommended their decaf milk tea for people who can't take caffeine because you don't really can see it much from any boba shop. I like it.
author: Jaane F.

description: I've been here many, many times. Excellent boba, the trick is to avoid the long lines.
author: James N.

description:
What a joke went thru a questioning process for just a latte after answering all her questions including my name while no one was there at the location 
Finally had my latte and guess what you have to enjoy your latte the way they want you too not your way as no sugar or sweetener at all except their own syrup !!!!!!
Defiantly to the place to get your drink I'd choose Starbucks over this place
author: Farid F.

description:
The Bay is all about that matcha hype right now, and deservingly so. Matcha is life! :)

Unlike other boba shops that have hundreds (slight exaggeration.... kind of), Boba Guys has a simple menu. Think In N Out - they don't have 20-30 options like other fast food restaurants, but what they do have is gooood. I chose the strawberry matcha latte since it seems like everyone one IG was drinking it. Slightly skeptical of the taste since it reminded me of those Starbucks colorful drinks that taste absolutely awful, however, the matcha latte here is mm mm delicious. Who knew strawberry goes so well with matcha! $5 for a cup is pretty expensive though, but hey, a treat every once in a while is okay.

There is probably always going to be a line out the door since the shop is so small and there are limited seats, but they don't take too long to make the drinks. It also gets quite stuffy inside as well, so it's a good thing Dolores Park is only a couple of blocks away!
author: Cathy C.

description: Overrated and underwhelming. Drinks always tastes watered down. Gave it one final try and finally decided I won't come here unless I'm absolutely desperate for boba. They do get the boba consistency spot on though.
author: Rene C.

description:
Ummm -- HOLY MOLEY.  I heard this place was good but I wasn't ready.  I'm a regular boba drinker but I always try spots near me.  I happened to be in the neighborhood and decided to give it a shot -- WORTH IT.  

There was a line which there usually always is - but it moves fairly quickly.  I ordered the matcha latte with tapioca balls, 75% sweet -- I literally was taken back when I took my first sip.  

The hype is real y'all.  

Honestly the best I've had -- worth the trip.  The boba itself is phenomenal and the matcha latte is delicious. 

I highly recommend this spot and I'm officially a die hard fan.  I will definitely be back!!
author: Michelle S.

description: I've been wanting to come here (or any of their locations) for ages, but finally made it here this evening after picking up my car from Honda on Folsom. I was expecting a long line (that's been my experience every time I've attempted to go to one), and there wasn't one at all! My lucky day. The woman who took my order was nice. I told her it was my first time. I requested the iced matcha latte with boba and she asked how much "sweetness" I wanted and offered that she usually goes with 50% which I appreciated and went with. The woman who made/served the drink let me know to shake up the drink before sipping on it. I took a few pics and took a sip and it was perfect- cool milky perfection with warm, soft boba and a soft honey flavor. My only requests next time would be to have more of the albums/books with the current featured drinks and I'll probably ask for less ice next time.
author: Zinia G.

description:
A very small shop that offers a majority of the drinks. I always get the strawberry matcha latte with extra shot of matcha and 75% sweetness. I came here on a sunday and the line was ridiculously long. I waited about 30 minutes for my drink but the line kept moving and there wasn't much of an hold up. On the weekends expect to wait. The drinks are always A1 and consistent. I will be coming back in about a month. There isn't a sit down area but just a small area for standing with a bar counter. This place is designed for grab and go. 

****NEW NEW NEW********

BOBA GUYS COFFEE BLEND created  by  FOUR BARREL

$20 + Free Drink
author: Brian C.

description:
Finally got to cross Boba Guys off my long list of boba bookmarks! 

Truth be told, I didn't want to burst anyone's boba bubble with my first impression of Boba Guys. During my first trip I got their Strawberry Matcha Latte with boba and was really let down, it was way too sweet, the drink seemed a bit too gritty for my liking and I felt that the strawberry overwhelmed the matcha flavor. The boba was indeed cooked well, which was the only redeeming factor. I was pretty let down considering the drink wasn't what my Instagram hopes and dreams were tastewise and almost $6 for a drink didn't make sense. Instead of throwing my hands up and finalizing my thoughts on my experience, I decided to give them a second chance.

I went back and decided to go with a more classic type drink, Jasmine Milk Tea, with Almond Jelly. This time 25% sweet. Was I crazy? Had I developed an affinity for a more pure milk tea drink without tons of sweetener? Had my first sip and BINGO! That's the type of drink that made me realize Boba Guys definitely has something. Absolutely, refreshing and well brewed Jasmine Tea, creamy Strauss milk and 25% sweetness was perfect. I suppose, for those without a sweet tooth ... do yourself a favor and get 25% for a slight sweetness that allows you to taste the flavor of the milk tea. The almond jelly was okay, a little more of the harder side and difficult to drink through the straw leaving me to have about half of it left over in my cup. 
Side note, the almond jelly does contain dairy (for those lactose intolerant).

Price is a bit steep for a drink, but I can see how it translates as Boba Guys provides quality ingredients and doesn't use gimmicks in order to draw in customers. The service is always fast when I had visited and the shop smells amazing. A few drawbacks are that the shop itself is a bit on the smaller side, closed on Mondays, drinks on the sweeter side and the AC unit drips onto your head if you are standing in the doorway.
author: Janet N.

description:
Oh Boba Guys. How far we've come from little shops in Chinatown to now mainstream fancy teas and milks to cater to our ever changing tastes. Boba Guys has a bougie feel to it with its Straus milk and high end loose teas, but it does come out pretty tasty. 

DRINK: Classic Milk Tea. I always opt for the 50% sweetness and I do appreciate now how more and more places allow you to control the sugar level. It came out just right so it actually isn't too sweet, but tastes like actual tea. Also, the tapioca was cooked to perfection, so that's always a good sign! 

Overall, a solid boba place that has more unique flavors, but also can stick to its classics that can compare. A Western approach on some of the ingredients, but definitely still very tasty.
author: Albert H.

description: The best boba in the city.... BUT the store on 19th smells terrible like spoiled rotten milk. Super gross. Such an amazing business I think they can do better in the smell department. Obviously I'll still frequent this place a lot but I'll breath out of my mouth so I don't feel sick from the rotten smell. None of the other stores smell like this. I recommend making an essential oil spray (oil and water to dilute) with peppermint, lavender, and citronella oils, it not only keeps bugs away it smells super good.
author: R R.

description: It didn't feel nearly worth the hype nor the price, let alone the combination of the two. We got the Horchata and the Rose tea, both with boba. Neither were as flavorful as almost any other decent boba place.
author: Thomas S.

description:
Bobs Guys is my favorite pearl milk tea place in the city (though Plentea is a fantastic second choice). My favorite drink is a honey-flavored black milk tea, though I don't think it's available year-round. Today, I tried the strawberry matcha latte for the first time, and it was delicious - and super cute! It's prepared carefully in three different colored layers, resembling a slice of watermelon. Don't forget to get tapioca, which serves as the "seeds" of the watermelon!

They are often busy, but the line moves pretty quickly. It's worth the wait!
author: Lauren C.

description:
My wife and I came to this shop after the cherry blossom festival based on the recommendation by the sister in law. Since we were in the area, we definitely had to see what the hype was all about this boba shop. It seemed like we came at an opportune time as the line wasn't really long and the stories we have heard is that the wait can be pretty horrendous at times. 

My wife ordered the decaf black milk tea and I had the lychee green milk tea with boba. Both teas tasted very light and refreshing as you can tell that  they really strive to deliver quality drinks. I could tell that the milk had a higher quality taste and the boba wasn't so overly sweet. You can goose from several milk options ranging from organic milk, almond milk and soy milk. Regardless of what you choose, it seems that you can't really go wrong with whichever drink you choose.
