Overall, we see the hype about this shop and for me, the hype is well warranted. This shop serves up some great tasting boba and is definitely a must go if you are in the city.
author: Chris A.

description:
I've had boba guy a few times and I always thought it was good milk tea but today it was fantastic. It really does depend on what you get. The first couple of times I got the thai tea, horchata and matchata. They were pretty basic good tasting tea but today I got the Strawberry matcha with almond jelly and wow it is so tasty. I normally like my milk tea with a stronger tea flavor but this was still very refreshing and the texture from the almond jelly is so yummy in my tummy. 

I also got to try the lychee green milk tea and that was also very good. For both drinks I just got the regular sweetness just to see what they think the appropriate amount of sweetness is and it's close to being on point. I would have like to have it a bit less sweet but still overall a great drink.
author: Andrew T.

description: The horchata was great and packed a bunch of calories :). The place also had a nice vibe and a good crowd standing the line. Would def recommend.
author: Ara H.

description:
Finally got to try this place after wanting to try it for forever! My friend got Thai Tea and I got their regular milk tea - always a good and safe option. I always try to get 50% sweetness 'cause some milk teas are super sweet! Their milk tea was just alright - it tasted like any other new boba places in the East Bay area. 

Location is pretty small and parking can be a hassle depending on what time of day you decide to come. We came in the afternoon and got lucky with parking. Although we parked a a block down, it was still pretty close. 

I honestly don't understand why everyone recommends this but I wouldn't mind coming back to try a different drink. Maybe then, I'll love Boba Guys.
author: Sheila C.

description:
I came here  for the first time in 2015. My friend and I tried something new like rose and lavender milk tea. We did not like it. But I still come back to try the classic milk tea. It was extremely delicious. The boba and the tea are of extremely excellent quality.  I got hooked from then. 
Always stick with the classic.
author: Tammy K.

description: This place did not live up to any hype I've heard via wom. The lychee tea was unfortunately awful and tasted more like a fake watermelon flavor you would get in a snow cone:/ They should really improve that drink to include real lychee or some lychee infused add on like a syrup or jelly with real lychee  The lines are extremely long and the cashier left to go help the baristas for over three minutes before I could order...also the line was full of high schoolers that had no spacial etiquette. Waste of time and money.
author: Diana L.

description: Finally got to try this place! I've always wanted to try this place after seeing pictures and reviews. I ordered the strawberry matcha with almond milk as I was recommend this Combination by a friend. It didn't disappoint a bit! I thought the almond would taste too much like almond, which I don't usually like, but it wasn't noticeable at all. The wait in line and for the drink also wasn't long as well. They have a variety of specialties they can make but the drink I've ordered is one of the most popular one, and I would recommend anyone to try it!
author: Katie L.

description:
Kind of overhyped around here. It's good don't get me wrong but not how the hype perceived it. 

Strawberry  drinks are so good
author: Kelsey D.

description:
I've been wanting to go to Boba Guys FOREVER. 

I know they're opening in SoCal soooon and cant wait. But I was able to go to one when I visited NorCal. 

Was not disappointed. 

This location is really small. Not a lot of seating and I don't think there is even a bathroom? 

Parking is super hard to find. Best bet to go with someone and have them circle or idle as you order. 

I got the lychee oolong and the muscat something. Ordered the strawberry matcha but didn't taste it. 

The lychee was with oat milk and I really liked it. 

But the drinks were really satisfactory and the girl working was really helpful! 

Can't wait for the SoCal location to opennnnn.
author: Maria A.

description: I must say that I'm impressed! I usually am not even a fan of the type of drinks that Boba Guys offers, but going with some friends, I decided to try out the strawberry matcha latte and was amazed! The matcha tea in the latte retained a nicely bitter, powdery characteristic, which was offset by the sweetness of the strawberry puree and the creaminess of the oat milk. I also got their housemade almond jelly in the drink, which was the perfect textural complement. Boba Guys has gotten me hooked on finding good matcha lattes, and I'll be back for more!
author: David K.

description:
This was on my "must-try" list when visiting San Francisco last week!

My friends all ordered the strawberry matcha latte with boba and it was definitely worth trying! I wanted to get the dirty horchata, but it is pre-mixed so I could not order it dairy free. :( I ended up getting a regular matcha latte and it was enjoyable, not "powdery", but not the most amazing thing.

We came back a second time before going home and I ordered the Jasmine Green Tea with lychee and I DEFINITELY recommend this one. Sooo refreshing and the lychee was great. I also suggest getting it 75% or 50% sweet.
author: Ranae A.

description:
I've heard of Boba Guys for some time now and have been wanting to give that place a try. What I didn't know was that they were all over San Francisco, including the Mission!

It was a Saturday evening coming here, so parking was extra difficult.  While one of circle around, the 3 of us jumped out to get in NO line (woo-hoo!) and ordered.

This location is very small with no where to sit or really to stick around for long.  This place is more of a "take-out" place.

Looking at their menu, I can see what the big deal was! They seem to have a variety of unique Boba drinks that I don't usually see at other Boba spots.  They also have merchandise, haha.

So here's what I had:

MATCHATA (16 oz) - $4.75
+$0.50 Boba 
A secret menu item turned not-so-secret.  Organic matcha whisked over their house made horchata.
See what I mean?!! Matcha AND horchata!!! I could I possibly pass this up!  The only thing about this one is there is no sweetness adjustment, which I'm completely fine about.  I did like how it's not so sweet.  Besides you get a lot of the sweetness from the warm and chewy (pretty much perfect) tapioca balls.  When this was given to me, you have the bottom layer of the warm boba, then the white layer of matcha, and the top layer is the matcha.  You stir it and let be ice mix it all up! This taste was quite unique--you get this slight gritty semi-sweet texture from the horchata and the earthy taste from the matcha.  I recommend trying this one.

KAYA TOAST - $3.50
A thick slice of brioche toast served warm with their own housemade kaya coconut jam.
So the kaya coconut jam is like this sweet custardy spread that is mixed with coconut milk and has pandan leaf flavor.  The consistency is like condensed milk.  The Boba Guys made their very own!  This took some time to make but the it's worth it!  I would say around 5 minutes (it just seems long compared to how fast drinks are made here).  The kaya toast was served warm, cute into 4 and topped with a decent amount of kaya.  It was so delightful and made me miss Singapore so much.  I wish I had taken a look to see if they sell a jar of their kaya.

I really am impressed. The staff was friendly and efficient.  I hope to come back soon to try everything else. Thanks Boba Guys!
author: Tu-Anh N.

description:
Ive always passed by the location in NYC but never went in. WHAT A MISTAKE THAT WAS!! If the new york location is anything like the mission location, i have a lot to look forward to when i return!

I got the hong kong style tea with boba, and it was so perfect. What separates it from other boba places I've been to (chatime, cocos, kung fu, vivis) is the high quality of tapioca. Its substantially chewy and has a nice bounce. Also the ratio of tea to boba is spot on. I asked for less ice and 25% sugar. Although i didn't use it, I like the option of adding sugar syrup. Service was friendly, ambiance was chill, and prices reflected the high quality of the drink. Would go again 10/10!
author: Laura E.

description:
With all the different boba places it is really hard to stand out but Boba Guy does just that. I usually don't order my drinks with boba pearls but there something really good about them.

Matchata - Matcha over horchata milk tea. Horchata with boba, that's unheard of! Must try for all your Horchata fans.

Strawberry matcha - Layered with red strawberry jelly on the bottom and green matcha on top. This drink is IG/snapchat worthy. Love everything about it. Warning, it is highly caffeinated.

My only complaint is I wish they were open later. I always just make it right before they close. Especially on Sundays.
author: Michael C.

description: Long line but the staff is super nice. The drinks are unique but I wouldn't say they taste amazing
author: Apoorva D.

description:
I've never quite understood why people love Boba Guys. It's alright, I suppose, but what makes it so special and why are there always such long lines? The hours of operation here are too short - who closes a boba shop at 6pm (on a Sunday) and even 9pm on other days is too early for considering its prime Mission location.

After several attempts, I was finally there in line at a time when the shop was open. I ordered a large 16 oz hot Hong Kong style milk tea to satisfy me on a cold evening. It was ok but nothing made it spectacular. I guess it's nice that they have a few seat inside.
author: Yi Z.

description:
Fresh tasting tea. The jasmine tea was excellent. The matcha tea was similar to Starbucks matcha latte but minus the syrup so it was more on the slightly bitter side. Hong Kong style tea was similar to the teas I get at HK cafes. Boba was soft with slightly chewy texture. Overall, I like the tea here but it is a bit more on the pricey range at $4-5 for a regular size. My only drawback from this place is the way they handle their honey or syrup because I could feel the stickiness from handling my cup. 

Maybe if you never had boba before, you would be mind blown because milk tea is awesome in general and you've been missing out your whole life. But if you visit boba shops a lot, Boba Guys doesn't really stand out in particular. They do have some interesting menu options that are different from your regular boba places.

Shop is quite small and there's four stools by the window counter. Definitely a cute hipster place for tourists to come check out and discover the world of boba and get that Instagram photo in. I hear lines can get pretty long. They even have a funny sign that advises customers to stand with "appropriate spacing as if you are at a middle school dance". Best to come at night when there is no wait since they close at 9/10 PM.
author: Diana C.

description:
I came here the third time with my friend and ordered Matcha milk tea (with no ice + 25%sugar) with my friend - both of us ordered the same drink. It taste pretty good and remember to stir it. I was drinking halfway and I realized it was sweet and the other half that I finished later tasted plain.

The line was pretty long and the drink came out pretty quickly.

I always come to Boba Guys because they have supreme quality boba and the drink looks pretty too!
author: Evelin F.

description: Boba Guys anywhere is always good. My favorite aspect about them is that everything is real and high quality, none of that fake powder and artificial syrup. Love them!
author: Cindy M.

description:
Is Boba Guys worth driving around the Mission for over an hour trying to find a parking space? Definitely! I'm happy to say my first experience at Boba Guys was pretty awesome. 

We arrived at this tiny boba shop thirsty for bubble tea and found that they do things a little differently. It wasn't like the standard boba shops where milk tea is a dime a dozen. Boba Guys was all about fresh ingredients, fighting the powder, and offered a different way to drink your boba. We all went for the Horchata!  

While drinking our Horchata and trying to take pics, a guy offered to take a group photo of us. Coming from New York the thought did cross my mind that this guy might be a camera thief. Quickly my paranoid thoughts were washed away as the guy turned out to be one of the owners of Boba Guys, Andrew. He was super nice. We talked to him for a bit about how we liked our drinks and he gave us some insider information that at the time they were considering opening up shop in Manhattan.

Fast forward to about three years later, I am happy to say that I can now get my Boba Guys in Manhattan. It's nice to have seen their success grow from pop up shops with lines down the street to three brick and mortar locations in NYC. I can't wait to try the Strawberry Matcha Latte!
author: Rachel A.

description:
From my various samplings of boba places around the bay area, I've always heard rumblings of the popular boba guys, but never had the chance to give it a try.  Luckily, we were in the area and I finally got to give it a try...the best thing? NO LINE! woop woop!
Ever since that first time, I've paid Boba Guys multiple visits and tried their classic milk tea, hong kong style tea, and the earl grey tea.  All of them are great and their "grade A balls" live up to the name.  ALSO, there are plenty of customization options (sweetness, milk, toppings)!
Note: just like in-n-out fries, the shelf life for boba guys boba isn't very long...
author: Alex J.

description:
Went here with a couple of friends for a trip to SF. Parking was horrendous, but it was worth going rounds because the boba is ah-mazing. The tea is at the perfect "strongness" not too strong and not too weak. The boba itself has a nice chewy texture and tastes fresh (doesn't have the gooey film that covers boba when it's in the syrup for too long). 

The pricing is a bit high, but that is what happens when you go for high quality product. 5/5 recommend to try if you're visiting or haven't tried it before!
author: Sally T.

description:
A little disappointed in this place. From the long line outside of this place, I'd expect their drinks to be extraordinary. I'm very picky when it comes to boba drinks, especially coming from SoCal where there are boba shops literally in every block. 

From all the Instagram and snap chat pictures, I was looking forward to my visit here. Boba guys was nothing but ordinary. I got their jasmine milk tea which is one of their most popular drinks according to yelp. I felt like this drink was a little too watered down even with light ice. The drink wasn't too sweet which I actually prefer, but it lacked flavor from both milk and green tea. 

If you're a fruity type of person, you may not find anything on the menu that you like. They only have one drink that consists of fruit - Lychee green tea. 

Boba guys is most likely a one time visit for me. Now that I've tried it, I can cross that off my bucket list.
author: Shelly S.

description: I was lucky when I made a visit to Boba Guys.  There was a line but it wasn't long at all.  Some of the people in the line were particularly rude but that might have been the one negative thing.  The menu, to me and my daughter, was not the easiest thing to piece together.  Luckily, there are instructions.  There are lots of things you could add to your drink: boba, almond milk, different jellies, etc.  You could ask also for your drink to be more or less sweet. THat's always a nice thing but sometimes I feel it's hard to judge when you don't know what their idea of SWEET or LESS SWEET are. Their boba was pretty good. The staff were super sweet and friendly. I kind of hoped that there would be more a selection as far as their offerings but the things that they had were really good.  I wasn't impressed with their liege waffle with the chocolate drizzle.  I was hoping that it would have been made in house. It was packaged from some outside company and delivered there. Umm, I don't think I'll make that same mistake twice. It wasn't good at all. In fact, my daughter wouldn't even eat it. I had their refresher. It was just that, refreshing.  The matchata wasn't all that.  It was nothing special at all. I can't tell you even what was missing. All around it was missing that UUMMPPHH that makes it special.  The one thing that I did really like was the strawberry matcha.  It was not only pretty but it was just sweet enough and just strong enough. I'd return for another one of those. The cost isn't more than what I'm used to at home in SoCal. It's too bad there isn't an area to really sit and enjoy your drink but then I could only imagine how crowded it would stay if that were to happen.
author: Chris C.

description:
I can't rave enough about Boba Guys. It's the best place to get boba in the Bay Area. And also pretty much the only place I've seen so far that has vegan options for the milk.

My favorite drink here is the strawberry matcha latte, which I got with oat milk and boba on my most recent visit. I love the strawberry flavor, and the boba is just the right texture, the right balance of soft and chewy. The oat milk is also amazing and I'll be purchasing that same oat milk for myself. The problem I often find with almond milk in iced drinks is that it tastes sort of watered down, but the drink I got pretty much just tasted like a drink with regular milk.

The other drinks are also solid. Highly recommend. I just wish Boba Guys was available a little closer to Mountain View!
author: Livvie L.

description:
I wanted to love this place but I can't. I have been seeing this place all over Instagram and when I was finally able to try it, it was a disappointment. I got the Matchata with boba and it tasted very diluted and bland. I couldn't really taste neither the matcha nor horchata in it. The best part of my drink was the boba and for that, I must say you guys sure know how to make some bomb boba! It has an excellent consistency and level of sweetness to it. 
 
Will I be back? Mmm yeah, I think I will.
author: JoJo C.

description: There's a reason why the Boba Guys is one of the most instagrammed food locations- the drinks are beautiful gradients of yumminess. With crazy concoctions mixing traditional bubble tea with matcha, horchata, and strawberries, it blends a bunch of cultures into its bubble tea, quite fitting for the mission. I got the matchata boba tea, a mixture of matcha and horchata.  I was a little skeptical at first, but it was delicious and not overly sweet. I can't tell if it's good or bad that this place is a little bit of a hike for me. If I lived near it, I'd probably drink it every day.... TAKE MY MONEYYYY.....
author: Jenny C.

description:
I think this place is overhyped. It's ok boba. It's real milk. But that's about it. 

Yeah I like the design of the shop and it's pretty hip. But I think it's not worth 45 min of wait kind of good. 

Also make sure you ask for 25% sweetened if you want to be less sweet. 50% is still pretty sweet for me.
author: Xiaoyin Q.

description: Cute little boba shop in San Carlos!  I love how you can order your drink and specify how sweet you'd like it (25%, 50%, etc.) because I always tend to think boba drinks are a little on the sweet side.  I ordered the Strawberry Matcha Latte with boba. Loved the combination of matcha and strawberry purée.  The boba was super fresh, soft and chewy just the way I like it!  It's a must visit when I'm back in the Bay Area again.
author: Amber D.

description:
Sometimes it makes me sad that there aren't many boba options in SF. Then when I really think about it, who needs more options when they have one of the best places anyway? 

I love boba guys because they don't have a crazy overwhelming menu and they have an awesome matcha which is all I really need anyway. The boba is always soft and sweet! That's a plus. The lines seem long, but it moves by fairly quickly. The only huge downside really is their lack of parking!
author: Maleah M.

description: Good quality tea. I had a large thai and added in boba and grass jellies. Longest line iv ever seen I had to wait behind like 40 people down the block but it was good once I got in. Prices have risen 50 cents vs whats on yelp and its weird a boba place charges extra for boba as others have said but otherwise tasty.
author: Sean G.

description:
My fave is the strawberry matcha latte! Never disappoints! I need to try other flavors too.

If you go during dead hours like 2-3pm, no wait!
author: Angelica P.

description:
Today was my 3rd and LAST time coming here. The first two times would have been worth 3 stars since the tea was alright, but the customer service was good. Today was the worst customer service I've received from this place. I purchased two jasmine green teas with boba and I asked for extra boba as well. This place is always so stingy with their boba so I wanted more in my drink. It's 50 cents for boba so they charged me $1 since I wanted 2 servings of boba. When they called my order, I went up to get my drinks and I was so disappointed. There was barely any boba in my drink and I asked the person behind the counter (black man with glasses) if there were 2 servings of boba in the drinks since I paid for extra. He had the rudest tone, rolled his eyes, and just said "yes". What kind of customer service is that?!?! Also, why would you talk to another POC like that??? I paid for extra boba and I know that I didn't receive that. And the tea was very watered down, it barely had any flavor! It felt like I straight up drinking tap water with boba in it. Today was the most disappointing experience and it's upsetting that I brought this to their attention and they didn't bother fixing it. Instead they chose to be so rude and disrespectful. I won't be coming here any more and I'll be sure to let my friends know to avoid this place.

Long story short: don't come here for the super over hyped watered down tea, average boba, and shitty customer service.
author: Jasmine V.

description: Jasmine milk tea with scrambled almond jelly was exactly what my body craved. (Kaya toast was just okay... the plush, thick slice of toast took a few minutes, and was a little conservative on coconut spread.) I caught them just before peak evening rush and was glad to control the sweetness towards the lower end of the scale. Good quality milk. Snagged one of the few stools to nosh for a few minutes before wading back out through the line of customers.
author: Ruth C.

description:
35 min from waiting in line out the door to getting my boba.
4 stools inside to sit along the window.
$3.75 - $5.75 + extra for boba 
I couldn't even see the grass jelly in my drink - it  was super minimal. 
Over hyped, would not wait in line, doesn't stand out from other boba places.
Tried the iced matcha latte and Hong Kong
author: Anmy V.

description:
I love Boba Guys. Nuff said.
In all seriousness, I really do. I've been to all their SF locations. I can bear waiting in line (which goes by pretty fast) for Boba Guys. My favorite is the strawberry matcha milk tea. Fabulousness in a cup. They use fresh whole milk from Straus Family Creamery-Pt Reyes. Other alternatives available for non-dairy drinkers. I drive to SF from Napa County and buy two, one to drink there and then and one for the road. That is all. Hail Boba Guys! Can't wait for you to open up in San Ramon. See you there!
author: Chek B.

description:
I had Boba Guys cater my summer wedding and it was AMAZING! 

For catering, I ordered 120 drinks for 142 guests. I was able to select 3 flavored drinks. I ordered: jasmine milk tea, Thai milk tea and strawberry tea fresca. The quality of the drinks was just as delicious! It was pure bliss to drink boba tea drinks right after our ceremony haha. All of our guests enjoyed it and raved about it even after the wedding. 

Thanks Boba Guys for coming to my wedding! Best decision ever. Every time I drink Thai milk tea, I will remember the wedding all over again.
author: Ali N.

description: Of course there would be a line at boba guys in San Fran just like there is always a line in NYC. Boba guys is my favorite boba place, it's light, it delicious, its got so many options, you really can't go wrong. My favorite is the hojicha with grasss jelly, 50% sweetness.
author: Ann S.

description: I love love love this place ! Thai tea is my favorite drink ever in life so when I go here am just in heaven. I always go for the 24oz Thai the but the guava drink they have idk what is the name I forgot but it's really good too and the pearl is amazing I guess people call it boba I call it pearl lol but yea deff worth the wait line is usually kinda long but they so move really fast
author: melisa r.

description:
Came 30 minutes before closing, and had no line to wait through, so I was very pleased. The cashier was very friendly and attentive in suggesting to get between the regular milk tea or the Jasmine. He suggested Jasmine since it has less caffeine since it's so late in the night to drink milk tea. 

However, I was really craving regular milk tea, so I got the Classic Milk Tea 100% sweet, and my friend ordered the Thai Tea (asked for 100% sweet, but was told, they only make this in 75% sweet). My classic milk tea was made with organic milk and was delicious & very satisfying. The tea flavor was very strong and flavorful. The Thai tea's flavor was good, but not sweet enough like how most places are. 

Price is a bit on the higher end. Parking is very difficult to find in this area. 

But I highly recommend this spot and I will definitely be coming back!
author: Cindy D.

description:
I've spent years thinking I didn't like Boba, and after visiting Boba Guys I realize that I've wasted a serious amount of precious time! YUMTOWN! 

So far, I've only tried the Iced Matcha Latte (with almond milk, 25% sweetness) and my life is forever changed. No shame in stopping to take a pic on the sidewalk. 

There is a reason why there's always a line outside of this place. Actually, several reasons. And they're all those little chewy Boba balls in the bottom of a tasty, delicious drink you can eat!
author: Traci A.

description: It's good because it's not too sweet. But comparing to Chinese boba milk tea, I'll give it 3 stars.
author: Yudi L.

description:
Visited this location many times. Coveniently a couple blocks away from Dolores Park.

This location is very small. It has extremely limited seating, which consists of one bench outside and four bar stool seats inside.

They sell merchandise like water bottles and bags. They also sell some snacks and sweets which is advertised by the cashier.

I believe this is the first location Boba Guys opened at.

Great service at this location. Staff was friendly.

Their drinks are very high quality. My favorite boba shop in the city. Their drinks have a tea-y taste instead of an artificial taste. 

They have many different milk options. Soy, Califa Almond, Straus Milk, and Oats milk which is a very nice selection.

Now about their Boba Balls! So delicious and addicting. Their boba balls are chewy, a tad sweet and overall good quality. I hate it when tapioca balls are super soft or mushy, it's gross. This place has by far one of the best tapioca balls.

My top drinks that I order here are Thai Milk Tea, Jasmine Milk tea 50% sweet, Matcha Green Milk Tea, Rose Milk Tea, and Horchata!
author: Michele G.

description:
Was on my way to meet up with a friend for dinner who really wanted to try Boba Guys. I picked up a Classic for him and a Lavender Black Milk tea for myself. I usually go for the Golden Honey Black but unfortunately it's out of season at this location. 

If you're going for Lavender, get it at half sweetness. I went for 75% sweetness and it's still a touch too sweet for me.

Overall I wouldn't say this is the best I've had. I appreciate that it's local, organic, etc. but I don't think it's that tasty - especially at the price point.
author: Heather N.

description:
Overpriced and simply not very good. 

Saw an article this week in SF Gate about these guys so had to come try them out for myself. Tiny little place with line out the door looked promising but didn't deliver.

I ordered the Thai Iced Tea with boba. The tea was pretty good and made with organic Strauss milk. They definitely take pride in using good, quality ingredients. However, maybe I was there on a bad day because whoever cooked up the batch of boba clearly never checked that it was cooked through. Nothing worse than biting into a boba to find it hard in the center like partially cooked pasta. No matter how good the tea was, it didn't make up for the awful texture of the boba. Definitely not worth the trip out to the Mission. 

Sorry guys but you can't call yourself the Boba Guys and post up signs about your "Grade-A Balls" if the boba you serve is not even cooked all the way through.
author: Betty R.

description:
Walked here with my coworker since its not too far from my office. There was a fairly long line considering it was 2pm on a Monday but the line went fast. Had the horchata with almond jelly which was pretty good but I had better horchata when I lived in San Diego.

I'm used to boba places that have blended drinks like ShareTea so this definitely wasn't my favorite place but at least I got to expense the drink on my company credit card. I don't think I'll be coming back here unless my coworkers drag me here.
author: Eric B.

description:
Overall pretty solid boba! Hella courteous staff with a minimalist/hipster vibe. Simple menu (which I like vs reading though a million options like at Quickly). I like how you can pick your level of sweetness. Every drink starts out as 100% sweet (like a can of soda), & then you can go down in incriminates of 25%. I always get the Jasmine Green Tea (almond milk) at 50% sweetness with boba. 
You pay about $1 more than most boba places, but hey, that SF rent is $$$$, so I get it. 
The ONLY suggestion I'd make is to lighten up on the ice. I paid for a 24oz, but probably only had about 12oz of actual liquid (if that) + the boba pearls at the bottoms. So just ask for really light ice. :)
author: Kristina M.

description:
This is a great place to go when it's warm outside! They have enough flavors to please everyone's palates. If you're a first timer I would recommend the regular milk tea or the jasmine milk tea!

Note : this location is the only one that does NOT have the seasonal mango flavored drinks!
author: Nimeela D.

description: BEST bubble tea I've ever had...and I drink a lot of bubble tea. My favorite was the green tea with coconut milk and the hubs loved the horchada. Wish there was a Boba Guys in DC!
author: Megan C.

description:
I have to admit, I was a little underwhelmed. I got the matcha and my boyfriend got the rose and while both were quite refreshing and tasty, neither were super impressive and I'm not sure I would wait close to a half hour in line for it again. That aside, service once at the counter is quick and we got our drinks not long after ordering. It does get quite crowded while you wait for your drink though since the interior is pretty small. I actually really liked my boyfriend's rose drink, it was delicious and not too floral. My matcha drink was pretty good as well, just not as memorable.

Side note: I'm not sure if the boba is normally like this since I was only here once, but it was pretty hard.
author: Janice L.

description:
Boba Guys is the only boba shop in the Mission, so the line is often pretty long. Weekend afternoons/nights are the worst. 

I'd say the sweetness is similar to the average boba tea, but I always get 25% sweetness because I don't like it that sweet. Boba is softer rather than firmer (which I like). 

They don't have a huge variety of drinks, but in a way it makes it seem more "high-class" and easy to choose. Before you order, make sure to check out the seasonal flavors on the side of the ordering counter. I usually end up picking some fruity flavor from there (strawberry jasmine tea fresca, strawberry matcha, and peach green tea were all great). 

Overall, it's a bit expensive for the price ($4-5), but if you're here, you probably don't have an easy alternative. At least you can Instagram a hipster pic of your tea on the pretty patterned wall outside. 

Note: Watch your step at the entrance. You can tell there were originally yellow markings to show that there's a step there, but it's worn off over time. They should probably repaint it!
author: Christine L.

description:
Good stuff.

A few of my friends and I were itching for boba, so we stopped by Boba Guys on a Sunday afternoon. There was a short line, probably about 10 minutes or so. I ordered the Iced Matcha Latte with almond milk (at no additional charge, pretty neat) and quite enjoyed it. The matcha flavor is bold and full-bodied, but not too overpowering over the almond milk. The honey came through very nicely and was a tasty, untraditional touch. A bit pricey, but that's definitely reflected in the quality ingredients. Would come back.
author: Patricia Z.

description:
When I visit SF, Boba guys is a must in places I have to visit.  I order the jasmine milk tea with boba, and it is SO GOOD.  It's super creamy, but you can definitely taste the tea, and it's never watered down.  The boba is also a perfect texture :)   

Note: Their drinks are super sweet, so I always get 75% sweetness (I think that's also what they normally recommend on getting)

The only downside to this location is that it's super small (although their other locations are on the smaller side also), so it can get pretty packed sometimes and the line can get pretty long.
author: Elena T.

description:
ERRR. Not worth the hype, TBH. 

Waited in line for around 20 minutes and was super excited since everyone seemed to be enjoying their drinks. 

We ordered:
-1 16 oz. iced Jasmine Milk Tea without toppings, organic milk, 25% sugar // Asked for no ice, still got ice. Jasmine tea flavor is super faint- overpowered by milk (at least 2/3 of the cup was milk instead). Also, organic milk tasted more like soymilk since it wasn't rich or creamy at all....a 1/5 drink.

-1 16 oz. iced HK Style Milk Tea with pearls, organic milk, 50% sugar // Condensed milk overkill- can't imagine what it would be if it was 100% sweetness! There was barely any boba and the boba was too stiff- not soft at all. It says "blended with condensed milk"...felt like I was eating straight out of the jar myself.

Pros:
+Fast service. Waited in line for 20 minutes, ordered in 1 minute, got the drink in 2 minutes. 
+Cute concept. Cute ant-eater, crisp interior. Good selection of basics on the menu!

Cons:
-Meh service. Lady looked piss the whole time...good thing I didn't tip. 
-Pricey. $8 for two drinks? I would rather spend my $8 on a cream tart at Tartine's. 

Tips/Observations:
-Why don't they have a stamp card system? Not that I would want one..but I'm sure there are die-hard fans here. 
-Small space. Definitely grab and go unless you manage to steal a spot by the window. 
-What is their signature drink here? 

Overall, not impressed. They can't even get the basic teas right....not even sure what more to expect.

Nice try, Boba Guys. May attempt to get it again at a different location...and try their swirly pink drink.
author: Hurjane V.

description: I really enjoyed my boba, I got a classic milk black tea with tapioca. I really appreciated the nerdy vibes and atmosphere, from the tag line on their cups (Drink Well and Prosper) to the "Stranger Things" themed decorations (it was near Halloween when I visited). I definitely want to check it out again and try another flavor.
author: Pamela O.

description:
lawd forgive me for what ima bout to do with deze black balls.... *SLURP, ball straw bouncin, gulp...*

i humbly believe the strawberry matcha latte is the holy grail of all boba drinks. There's a reason you see stretches of people down the sidewalk going into a small tea shop. The flavor is a sublime combination of bitter and sweet, and you will be bittersweet after you hit the last sip. You will be convinced that the last sip is the saddest sound in the world. Lift your lighters for boba.


The boba here is perfect, substantial and full of chew, noticeably superior to the other boba tea shops I've been to. I can feel each one of them go into my mouth and I just want to stuff as many as I can into my mouth. 

Your dirty mind aside, say a prayer after you mix the drink and before you take a sip. Helps to  ground your mind before you get lifted af by deze flavors. 

That said, if there are over fifteen people walking out the door (which there likely will be), walk away. Surely you have better things to do than to wait half an hour for boba? 

5
author: Tony L.

description:
Boba Guys is always on my mind whenever I make a trip to San Francisco!! Customer service is on point, no matter which location you go to. My favorite is the Strawberry Jasmine fresca. It's so refreshing and boba is done perfectly. 
If only they expand down in Cupertino or San Jose!
author: Halina H.

description:
This place is so overrated.

I was visiting SF for the week and so many people told me that Boba Guys was the must have boba place in the area. I honestly didn't quite understand the hype. The drinks tasted a bit watered down and the boba wasn't anything special. The line was long and the drink wasn't worth it in the end. During my time in the Bay, I had much better boba at other places.
author: Jenny S.

description: I admire their efficiency in crafting perfect drinks. They truly live up to "the hype." It's definitely worth checking out if you happen to be in the area.
author: Marinella G.

description:
I love me some boba. Always. And after seeing soOooOO many photos on social media, I knew I had to try it when I visited SF. 

I went here twice. In one day. I was THAT obsessed. The store itself is quite small and only offers a bar-countertop with just 4 stools available for seating. So if you plan to sit around to do do any work, this is not the place to do that. The line can get long and extend outside, but it does move pretty quick. 

[[Iced Matcha Latte with Boba]] Lately, I have been obsessed with anything matcha, so this drink was definitely calling my name. The matcha was smooth, bold, and not chalky. I absolutely hate it when matcha drinks are chalky. Yuck! The boba was soft and chewy; a little sweet, but not too bland either. Add-ons are an extra 50 cents, but so worth it! 

The first time I went, I didn't have them change the sweetness level and kept it at 100%. Now I am one to usually take my drinks pretty sweet. But this was just way too sweet. So the 2nd time I went, I had them knock it down to 75% and it was a little better. The next time I go, I think I'll do 50% sweetness.

You can choose from regular milk, almond, or soy milk you won't get charged extra! Sweet! 

It is a bit pricey here. If I remember correctly it was around $5 for the 24 oz. However, the pricing is reflected in the quality ingredients, so it's definitely worth it.

My first time here, I drove, so I was lucky enough to find a spot (metered, of course) within a 5 minute walking distance. The second time, I Uber-ed it so no need to pay for parking, yay!

I am hoping that Boba Guys will one day open in Orange County because I will be all over that shiz.
author: Michelle T.

description: Good boba, but a bit overrated. Definitely don't think it's worth waiting the super long lines, unless your a visitor and/or it's your first time. Horchata and jasmine flavours were delicious, strawberry matcha latte was way too bitter for my liking.
author: Kartik M.

description:
I've had a lot of Boba and I think these guys do the best. Maybe that explains the long lines standing outside of every one of their locations.

I normally get the standard black milk tea with dairy and 50% sweet is plenty. Add boba and regular ice and it's the perfect drink. Just a bit creamy, the right balance of tea and milk and large but firm boba.

They even have regular lids instead of those melt on plastic punch-through ones, so you actually feel like you're drinking an adult drink although maybe not as fun for the kids.  Oh, and black straws.

Definitely worth the wait, so go early and often.
author: Bob K.

description:
Good quality teas and ingredients. They have a solid, not too complicated menu.

It's a bit pricey, given that they over ice the drinksa little and recommend getting less sweets
author: Daniel W.

description:
I always make my son day when taking him here after a long school day. Good service reasonable price. Usually there is a line but moves very quickly. 
Thanks Boba guys!
author: Maria H.

description: Pricy but I definitely think they have some of the best boba around - perfectly chewy and sweet.
author: Joanna L.

description: Really good Honk Kong milk tea. I would go one step below standard sweetness though. They come a little too sweet.
author: Brett P.

description:
what to order: anything! 
tip: almost always a line but it moves quickly and the quality is definitely worth the wait.

First off... I'm from SoCal which means I've had way too much boba in my life. But that also means that I know the difference between great, good and bad boba. I can confidently say that Boba Guys is great boba!

I have yet to order something that I didn't finish within the first 15 minutes.
author: Thuy-Vy N.

description: Their drinks are always consistent in quality which I can always appreciate and love their creativity with favors. Strawberry matcha lattes with boba and almond jelly is my go-to.
author: Michelle P.

description: Got the Strawberry Tea Fresca with boba after dinner. I've had it several times before in other stores but it was really disappointing this time. I remember the strawberry flavour used to be pretty strong and the sweetness was just right. However, the one I had tonight was watered-down and I felt like I was drinking water with syrup with little strawberry flavour. The texture of the boba was weird too - overly soft exterior in general with some individual ones with firmer core.
author: Joyce L.

description: Of all the boba places I've tried, this is the only boba place I'm happy to spend $4 for boba. One of my friends who visited the Bay Area said it was the best tapioca pearls he's ever had. It's sweet and the perfect chewy texture. I love the matcha-horchata!
author: Anna C.

description:
I was super wrong thinking this place is "just like any other boba place", it's far from me since I live in the South Bay but happen to be in the area, I think they do have quality tea, price is a tad bit pricier but I guess it is the quality of it, about $4.75 per drink 

Open a location in the South Bay, c'mon lol
author: Precious C.

description:
Yum! I'm a fan of Boba Guys they have good tea flavor and well made toppings. 

My only request? Please use the sticker caps, I order at least 2-3 drinks when I come here and it's so easy to spill with the regular caps as I walk all the drinks to my car. Can't stack them in a nice plastic bag :[
author: Gabby N.

description: After waiting such a long time to try it I wasn't loving my boba drink. Pearls were a little too chewy? Idk tea was too floral- maybe I was just stuffed from dinner XD ~ I would try it again tho and get something more traditional and even less sweet :)
author: Coco J.

description:
I went here two days in a row! That's how good it is. A little upsetting how far away it is from me since I don't live in SF. I got the strawberry matcha and omg it's delicious! The strawberry jam is house made! The boba is super fresh and soft. My friend got the Hong Kong with almond milk. The second day, I got the same thing and my friend got the hibiscus mint tea!

It is a small location with four stools to sit on. They do have some merchandise available too. Although it was a long line, the service was fast. 

This place has raised my expectations for boba. Definitely will be back!
author: Kalani M.

description:
Boba guys has come a LONG way since my last review from a little bar area in a ramen restaurant.

I've tried this place a couple more times and still didn't like it UNTIL I tried their matcha latte. Skip everything else on the menu and get the matcha latte.

Be warned, line can be long and finding parking is THE worst.
author: Mabel Y.

description: I was born and raised in the Bay area, yet I never been here until now! I heard of the hype, and I think this time the rumors matched the reality! I bought two bobas to try more of a variety. I LOVE the boba; it is probably the top of my choices, and I drink A LOT of boba.
author: Jessa L.

description:
While waiting for a reservation for our restaurant we came here for the first time after all the hype and social media posts about how awesome boba guys is and it certainly is. 

Ordering the basic milk tea as I usually do the order was done in around 5 minutes. It tasted a lot better than most bobas that I've drank from t4 or other chain brands. However, the price tag was 4.50 for a small drink so it was a little expensive. 

The experience was good though and I guess it was worth it for a first time try :)
author: Bhargava S.

description:
I am such a sucker for Boba Guys. Frankly, this place has ruined most other boba places for me because of its great quality. I can actually taste the tea in my drinks and the high quality of the milk is seriously refreshing. I also really appreciate that they have non-dairy options (woohoo almond/soy milk!). I've definitely gotten a couple of friends completely hooked on this place.

My two favorite drinks here are the thai tea and the coffee milk tea. I have yet to find another coffee milk tea that can hold a candle to the one here. It is a bit on the sweet side so I'd suggest getting less sugar if you don't like particularly sweet drinks. However, it's such a good blend of flavors with some strong, tasty coffee. I have a bad habit of comparing all other thai teas to the one here as well. 

The classic milk tea and hong kong milk tea are also great choices! If you want something that's outside of the box, I would recommend the strawberry matcha~
author: Lakshmi M.

description: As someone living in the Bay Area, I have obviously heard about Boba Guys. Coming from Berkeley; Boba Guys has superior boba to anything compared to the East Bay. I didn't even know that the "boba" I had been drinking before I went to this place tasted bad, and Boba Guys really opened my eyes. The matcha boba is my favorite, and I'll definitely be back.
author: Heather Z.

description:
I've had tea a couple of times before, and I think I just don't really know how to order. 

I've tried the horchata and matcha, both of which were a little too much for me towards the end. I always love the taste at first and get sick of it by the end. The lavender black milk tea is just not really good in my opinion. I tried the almond jelly and wasn't a big fan of that, but the boba here is SO good. I love how perfectly honey-ed and chewy it is. 

Anyways I like this place but it's not like heavenly for me. I'll definitely come back and try more tho.
author: Diane Z.

description:
Their tapioca is hard! My second time trying this spot and oh no, their boba is still hard. I like them soft. They are a busy place but my best guess is maybe... they mix the old boba (it gets hard as it gets old) and a newly made one? Or it is intentional? to enjoy hard and soft mixture texture together. Hm. I want all of them soft and chewy!! 

I also ordered "no sweet" (meaning zero sweetness), but it is very sweet. I know boba has lightly sweet flavor but feels like this was coming from 3 table spoon of sugar or Stevia in the tea.
author: K O.

description: Matcha strawberry latte! The line was super long but on a warm Saturday it was worth the wait. They don't ice down your drinks which is good. $6 for a drink is a splurge but it's not something I would make a habit. The drink was freshly prepared and refreshing.
author: W A.

description:
So I finally found the source of the inconsistencies with their tea drinks - the horchata. Been back a few times and it was always good then got tempted by a special matchata (horchata topped with matcha). It looked beautiful but again it was really watery with hardly any horchata flavor. Boo! 

Stay away from the horchata and you'll be all set. Still the best balls around!
author: Jean K.

description: It is a little on the pricey side, but still good bobba. We didn't have a long wait when we went, walked right in and got it. I got my normal classic milk with bobba, and thought it was really good. My girlfriend got the jasmine milk tea and absolutely loved it. We haven't really been able to find it anywhere else back here on the east coast.
author: Brian S.

description:
Every time I come here it's so so good. This time I got a jasmine milk tea, 50% sweetness, with boba. 

Staff was super nice, and my tea was ready super quick. Coming on the weekday is the way to go -- no line at all. On the weekends it takes around 30 min in line.
author: Hayley D.

description: I was browsing on yelp when I found this boba shop. There's quite a few of these boba shops through out sf but I decided to go to the one in the mission district. There was a line when I went and it took around 15 minutes. I decided to get the oolong milk tea with boba and boy was it delicious. You can really taste the tea and none of it tastes fake. The boba was chewy, which is how it's supposed to be. Overall, I think I've found my new favorite place for boba in NorCal!
author: Wilson C.

description: Awesome bubble tea!  Rose black tea with Oatly is my go to drink. They have a few different alternative milks here and they all taste bomb no matter what you get. Really centrally located too, so I like strolling by and nabbing some whenever I'm in the Mission.
author: Sarah D.

description:
Been wanting to try this place for a while. I was super excited to finally try it, although I'm a bit disappointed. This place is definitely over hyped. Luckily my boyfriend and I didn't have to wait too long before we ordered our drink but by that time, the line behind us got insanely long. I ordered the iced matcha green tea latte with boba and my boyfriend ordered the strawberry green tea latte. 

I asked for 50% sweetness and still thought my drink was too sweet. In all honestly, the drink was just mediocre. I expected something great, considering the long line of people but it was just like any regular green tea latte. My boyfriends strawberry green tea latte was interesting though. Also, the boba was really hard and kind of gross. This place is more of a three and a half stars but oh wells.
author: Annie H.

description: Simply the best milk tea I've ever had. I visited the Bay from out of town, and boy do I miss this place's tea. Seriously, I keep telling my friends about this place and waiting to go back!
author: Maxine M.

description: The almond jelly is amazing- so fresh! The flavors are standout. This is by far my favorite boba place in the city. Great customer service and the line moves fast.
author: Jenny H.

description:
The sign outside welcomed customers with, "come in and try our grade-A balls." I gave their jasmine tea a shot. You have the option of choosing a topping, type of milk, and sweetness. 50% sweetness was enough to taste the jasmine flavor with a kick of sugar. I have to be honest, the milk tea looked equivalent to murky swamp water. It looked displeasing at first, but after the first sip, it tasted just all right. I think all the hype is mainly about their so-called "grade-A balls." The consistency was sweet and chewy, aka any typical description of tapioca balls.  

Maybe it's the location, but the standards of this boba guys is mediocre.
author: Rachelle Y.

description:
Having been to the Union Square location, my friends and I happened to be close enough in the area to the Mission location to make a trek there. Had the Golden Honey Black Milk Tea with boba. My thoughts on the product here match what I said in my other review; the tapioca balls are definitely top notch and that you can tell that the good ingredients are in play. Downside of course is that the boba here is significantly more expensive than your regular boba shop and the line is usually out the freakin door.

Boba Guys is good, but it's definitely not good enough to make me make a trek out of my way to come here.
author: Alexander Y.

description: Probably my favorite pearl milk tea place ever! Minimal seating, but the drinks are all PERFECT. The many options, including great milk alternatives, will keep me coming back whenever I'm in town. Can't wait until Boba Guys sets up shop in South Bay!
author: Allison T.

description:
Boba Guys... where to start.

Finding this location was pretty tricky since it was basically being covered by construction, but don't worry... you will see the line.

I've seen many of my friends get Boba Guys and I really wanted to try the hype. Let me tell you, it was definitely worth the hype. I got the Horchata and it was so good! I love Horchata and this one hit the spot. The boba was soft and not overly chewy, which was awesome! 5/5 I approve.

My friend got the basic Thai Tea and it was also good! Good balance of sweetness and tea. Yummmmmmmz.

The line was not long at all. We went in and out in like 15 minutes with time to spare in the meter. It's a pretty small shop, but definitely worth the trip. 


If you are around the area, do come here. 


GET SOME BOBA, GUYS ~
author: Martin N.

description:
Boba is good but line is long! I waited for 20-30 min on a Sunday afternoon. Prices are also comparatively higher, but you can tell that the boba and tea ingredients are quality, so perhaps the prices are justified. 

I got a 16oz Golden Black Tea with almond jelly, 25% sweet. I personally like my milk tea to have a stronger tea flavor, and Boba Guys lived up to expectations with a fragrant, fresh flavor that was not overwhelmed by the milk. The almond jelly had a nice, subtle sweetness, but the texture was a little harder than I expected. It was a lightly sweet and refreshing drink for a warm, sunny day in the park. Overall my drink ended much quicker than I would have liked; should've paid the extra $1 and sized up!
author: Hali M.

description:
As a young professional, caffeine is what gets me through the day, but coffee is too strong and eventually makes me crash. So, my favorite afternoon pick-me-up is tea from Boba Guys. I'm already obsessed with the Lychee Rose, which I'll have with or without soy milk and with little to no sugar. 

Of course, Boba Guys have great staples like standard milk tea, Hong Kong style milk tea, and matcha green tea. Tea has countless health benefits, and tastes great. One important note is that I love unsweetened bitter tea. It is super refreshing. 

If you've never had a milk tea, give it a try. It you are a regular, Boba Guys will give you high quality drinks at a reasonable price!
author: Joanna S.

description: I must say this place is too hyped for me. I've been dying to come here but they have weird hours and are always too packed . We came here yesterday around 2 pm and the line was almost 20 people deep. I was a little discouraged but I still got in line lol . I ordered the horchata with boba and it was good and my buddy ordered the Thai tea . We orders such basic drinks maybe we will come back and try more !
author: Monica M.

description:
Good Boba, not sure it's worth the long waits.

I've had a bunch of their flavors and lychee is my favorite.
author: Tucker N.

description:
Definitely one of my favorite places for boba in the city. If you're trying bubble tea for the first time, go to Boba Guys and you won't be disappointed. I've had consistently good quality of tapioca and tea from this place. For sure 5 stars for the drinks and marketing, but had to knock off one star because of long lines and there's very little seating. This is a place to grab and go unless you come at a really random time. I wish there was more seating here so I could hang out while drinking my bubble tea.

This is one of the few regular bubble tea places that serve the Hong Kong style milk tea, which is black milk tea made with condensed milk. I really enjoy it as it's not too sweet (but I do usually get 50% sweetness on drinks here). They also serve a Horchata drink which is unique and good as well. Their classics like the jasmine milk tea and the iced matcha latte are always delicious and a staple for me. To me, their menus and choices are straightforward and easy to understand. Even first timers would be able to go through the bubble tea ordering process.

Positives:
+ Consistently good quality
+ Interesting marketing
+ Some unique drinks

Negatives:
- Pretty long lines
- Very little seating available

Recommend:
+ 50% sweetness
+ Hong Kong style milk tea 
+ Iced matcha latte
author: Angie N.

description: Honestly my favorite Boba place ! My favorite drink would probably be the horchata boba. My only complaint would be that the actual building is pretty small, but overall the boba is delicious!!
author: Adrian P.

description:
Now what is it about boba that brings out the youth in Asia, or is it actually euthanasia? That might depend on how much boba tea you guzzle, which if you are young, gifted and Asian, could be enough to give you a permanent brain freeze or cause suffocation by excess tapioca balls. Now I'm not a doctor, I just play one on TV, but the popularity of boba tea has been unequivocally mind-blowing, and the Boba Guys, Andrew Chau and Bin Chen, appear to be riding the wave by offering their own fashion-forward take on it.

I finally tried their product at their first shop after dinner at Hogs & Rocks up the block. It's not my first time trying boba tea, but it might as well have been, since it took me a while to make my way through their menu as I was surrounded by impatient hipsters heaving audible groans in my direction. I impulsively went for the $3.50 Iced Coffee Milk Tea since I wasn't getting any guidance from the order taker. Then I was asked a battery of questions that led me to customize my drink. First, it was the tapioca balls over coffee jelly for an extra fifty cents.

Then I chose the Straus Family Organic Milk over a soy or almond milk substitute, which I assume caters to the lactose intolerant among us. Finally, I had them turn the sweetness up to 100% which is their default option. I must admit the result was pretty refreshing (photo: http://bit.ly/1mpEuVo) as I pondered the meaning of the aardvark logo (photo: http://bit.ly/1R5KaAG), though in hindsight, I probably would have taken the sweetness down a notch. Now that I know the routine, I can more confidently order my boba among the young, gifted and Asian lest I be taken out by euthanasia.

BOBA - 4 stars...refreshing brightness if a tad too sweet
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...hip and tight space like a pair of snug white chinos
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...aggressively cheery
TOTAL - 4 stars...the Boba Guys may be on to something here
author: Ed U.

description: Rarely do I go to Boba guys due to sucky parking, however when I'm in the Mission, I'll stop by for my boba fix. I ordered a large jasmine milk tea with boba. I find their jasmine milk tea really good, and their boba is made perfectly! This is just my go-to choice from boba guys. I chose organic milk and 75% sweet... YUM. There is always a line when I go, but it's never an unbearable wait. The boba shop is small itself so the line looks long. Def worth a try if you haven't!
author: Lucy L.

description:
Boba Guys ROCKS. Love the aardvark, love the interior, LOVE the Jasmine Milk Tea (at 75% sweetness)! The lines can be heinous but boy is it worth it. The staff is cute and friendly, but the boba is cuter and friendlier. I went with the Jasmine Milk Tea with regular tapioca (bomb) and my boyfriend got the Horchata Milk Tea with regular tapioca which was equally dank. You can really taste the quality with that Strauss milk...

This place is awesome!
author: Nicole W.

description:
Im a boba purist, I generally stick with classic flavors. What I love about Boba Guys is that they managed to surprise me with delightful new flavor combos and other tasty treats, while also keeping the tapioca on point!

the Boba: the texture of the boba is consistently very good, just the right amount of firmness and chewiness, not gummy or over-gelatinized like a bad take out restaurant that has boba sitting around for hours.

Flavors: Enjoyed hot bergamot milk tea and on another occasion the HK milk tea with option to adjust sweetness level. 

Strawberry shortcake cotton candy: So good (like magic evaporating in your ) because it has that fresh strawberry flavor that reminded me of Japanese strawberry candy. I especially liked the little crumbles of cheesecake that melt in your mouth at the same rate of the cotton!! How do they do it??

The real star of the night was a special with Kiefer and strawberry, it tasted like fresh strawberries in the summer, with a hint of that tart yogurt flavor and a smooth texture.
author: Candice C.

description: My go to boba to use for comparing is Jasmine Green Milk Tea. Boba Guys is able to make it just perfect! I get it with 75% sugar (which is the recommended). They are kind enough to ask if dairy is ok; since so many Asians are lactose intolerant. If you could handle the dairy, then I'd recommend having the real stuff!
author: Mo W.

description: As a boba connoisseur, I can confidently say this establishment lies in the average range. Not a wide selection of flavors. Their classic milk tea tasted superficial and just based off sweetness. Their almond jelly was tough and not worth the extra 50 cents. They had a line going out the door when we arrived which baffled me considering the quality of the product. Probably because there aren't as many boba establishments around. Either way, I was not impressed.
author: Andrew E.

description:
One of those typical tourist attractions. 

I have a lot of friends from the 626 region and every one of them want to come up to the bay area to try boba guys. The debate between norcal and socal boba is never-ending and honestly most boba places taste great! But what I love about Boba Guys is that their ingredients are fresh and I'm a giant sucker for the aardvark logo. 

It's a little pricey for me but if you love paying for quality, then it's a great place!
author: Christa L.

description:
I fell in love today ... with boba :'). Growing up in the Bay Area I've tried a lot of different boba places in my life but Boba Guys by far tops most other places I've been to. 

Ordered the rose black tea and horchata boba with pearls. The rose black tea was good but would have tasted better if I'd chosen a higher level of sweetness (75% instead of 50%). By itself the black tea would only garner 3.5 stars but oh my gosh the horchata boba (100% sweetness) was heavenly. It was THAT good. The cinnamon flavor was on point and the boba was soft and chewy. Who would have thought that horchata would go so well with boba??

Overall definitely worth the wait. Also the interior is beautifully minimalistic. Will be back for sure!
author: Ella C.

description:
Seen this place pop up all over Yelp, so I finally went to try it. I was overwhelmed with choices - everything sounded good. So I asked for suggestions from the girl who worked there. 

She suggested hojicha, one of their premium loose leaf teas. It's a green tea that's roasted over charcoal so it had a slightly nutty flavor on top of the green tea flavor. Even though it was premium, the 16oz was the same price as their signature drinks ($3.50), so I went for it. I adjusted the sweetness to 50% and had it with almond milk and, of course, boba.

It came out quickly and I was pleasantly surprised by the flavor. It tasted slightly like genmaicha with the nuttiness, and the sweetness level was just right. The boba was pretty sweet and soft, but there were one or two that were a little hard. 

I'd like to go back to try their other flavors!
author: Venus F.

description: Something about their drinks is just so good. I always order the jasmine milk tea here, and both the drink and the tapioca are just perfect. Beware of crazy lines during certain busy hours!
author: Annie C.

description: I have to admit at first I was doubtful that boba guys was legit, to me it was just another hipster boba place in the mission. After my first visit my opinion was quickly changed, their teas are great, they have great staff, and they have really unique drinks. My go to is the Strawberry Matcha Latte, it comes out as a beautiful 3-layer drink of green, white, and pink. I've also tried the Jasmine Milk Tea, Horchata Milk Tea, and Classic Milk Tea, all are really good as well. There's usually a line out the door which moves at a steady pace. If you get the chance, check this place out! They also have another location in Hayes Valley.
author: Elaine N.

description: Sometimes I skip a green smoothie and go for a Milk Tea or a Thai Tea with boba  lots of flavors to choose from.
author: Sasha Z.

description: I had been dying to try boba guys for over a year! Due to the odd hours, I never was able to until today. I came at around 1:45 on a Wednesday which is why there was no wait, but by the time I left the line had already extended out the door. They have a pretty limited selection of drinks, but I didn't have to think twice before ordering the strawberry matcha latte with boba. The drink looks a lot better than it is. The strawberry puree by itself is delicious, but when I mixed it into the drink it just tasted like any plain old milk tea, and the boba had a weird preserved taste to it. Overall, I would recommend boba guys if you are in the area but I don't think its worth going out of your way for.
author: Shilpa Y.

description: Went on a Saturday afternoon, and waited about 30 min to order because I wanted to see what the hype was about. I ordered the strawberry matcha latte without boba since the mango matcha and a few other ones I wanted to try were sold out. It was delicious -- the sweetness of the strawberry puree balanced out the matcha and milk nicely. I was worried it would be too sweet (I don't like overly sweet things), but it was just right. Would love to go back and try some more drinks but wish the line moved faster or that they took orders while you were waiting in line.
author: Annie K.

description: I have a boba tea obsession. Although I don't claim to be an expert, I have tried my fair share of pearl drink places. Boba guys definitely stands out for quality ingredients. Much like a regular coffee drinker can taste the difference between good and bad espresso, it's easy to taste the better quality tea and milk products. I usually go for the classic milk tea. I thought the strawberry matcha was ok, but too many different flavors were happening and too much sweetness to really taste any tea. The "Fresca" teas are light and refreshing- made w real muddled fruit. It's a small complaint but I wish they used the plastic seal on the cups. If you're reading this boba guys, can u change it? So much easier to take and drink later :)) otherwise, just deal w the line and you won't regret it.
author: Joana Z.

description: Yum Yum Yum... If I am ever near Boba Guys I will drag everyone I am with to this place. Even though there is always a line at this location, I do feel it is worth the wait. We arrived to find a line of about 10 people and we were number 11. We waited about 10 mins before this huge group rolled up to meet their friend who was already in line and yup thats right she was right in front of us :( I was annoyed that I had to wait for 8 more people to get a drink before I could order. About 20 mins passed and we were at the front finally ordering my drink. I ordered a Thai tea with almond jelly. I absolutely love the almond jelly which is homemade and it is delicious. I have tried other drinks and they have never failed me. This place is a must visit and tots insta worthy pictures which is a added bonus.
author: Aulani S.

description: I like my milk tea plain, simple, and not too sweet. So I feel ambivalent about waiting in the almost always super long line and the interesting flavors that Boba Guys has to offer. That said, they use quality ingredients and you can definitely taste it. Excellent boba, just the right amount of chew. Regular sugar that comes with the drinks are waaayyyy too sweet. Be sure to turn it down a notch if you don't want a diabetic attack.
author: Nana L.

description: Super cool place for boba. I was craving for boba after a long tiring day because I remember coming here couple years back but I wasn't sure if it was actually the boba guys I went too. But it turns out it was! I recognize the customer service's voice! I got the Jasmine milk tea with boba, regular sweet. The Jasmine milk tea was really good with just the right amount of sweetness. I also taste the actual tea in my milk tea. Which really impressed me. The boba was just right. Really really squishy. Boba guys, keep up the great customer service and smiles. You guys rock!
author: Jonathan Z.

description: Don't really see what all the fuss is about. Super long queue and the end product was comparable to the other dime a dozen bubble tea places in the city.
author: David J.

description:
Luck was evidently with me one Sunday afternoon as when we finally decided to stop by here, the line happened to be short. I didn't have to wait in line too long to get my boba fix!  It was my first time here, and everything looked good, so I wasn't sure what to get. My friend who was with me and who has been here before, told me everything she's tried here has been good, so she wasn't much help. 

I decided on getting the 24 oz Lychee Green Tea with almond milk, boba, almond jelly, regular ice and 50% sweetness (only $5.45 which is actually a little less than what I paid for a similar drink at Sharetea). It was great! The boba was nice and chewy and the almond jelly was tasty. Perfect for a warm afternoon.  There was a long line by the time we left the place. 

Service was very friendly. The cashier actually took the time to ask me how my day was going even though there was a line. (Am I in San Francisco? lol) My drink also came with a smile when my name was finally called. 

This place also sells quality loose leaf teas in bags, and if you need more sweetness in your life, Sugar& Spun Cotton Candy. And if you're a fan, they also sell Boba Guys totes, mason jars and pins. 

We'll be back Boba Guys!
author: Hazel C.

description:
The hype is real about the strawberry matcha. 
I was skeptical but I had to try it and it was pretty good !

Also tried class milk tea with half the sugar which was tasty as well.
author: Feuy P.

description: Got the Thai ice tea (v basic) but can't ever go wrong with it! I have a big sweet tooth and I loved this drink. Didn't taste artificial with instant packets but actual tea and milk and sugar. Very pleased. Loveeeeeee Thai tea
author: Helen N.

description:
First time trying Boba Guys, I had the regular milk tea with almond milk and boba ($5). I didn't really care for the drink; I didn't love or hate it. It wasn't creamy and tasted watered down even though I got light ice. 

I think there's a hype about this place because they claim to use quality ingredients. Most places that use "dairy-free creamer" usually isn't vegan; they still have a dairy protein in it making it NOT vegan! I appreciate that Boba Guys offers almond milk.
author: Jessica K.

description: Boba is good. What else is there to say. They serve fast and know how to welcome customers. Boba guys, you never fail me
author: Ducky C.

description:
There are much better and cheaper boba/ bubble tea shops than Boba Guys but the Bay Area needs to step up their game. I wish that this location was a little larger in size to accommodate the individuals in line and the customers who are waiting for their drinks to be made. The quality of the Boba Guys is clean and straight to the point with what the limited flavors you want and what you can add-on inside.

For the price, the wait, and the list of flavors that they serve... Three stars.
author: Ava Elizabeth T.

description: This lived up to all of my expectations and more. They have a comprehensive menu full of sweetness choices, tea options, and different types of milk. Vegan options, so everyone can enjoy boba here. Service was fast and friendly and the boba did not disappoint! The menu is a bit cluttered so if you have time to pick out what you want in advance I'd recommend doing that.
author: Kelly A.

description: Boba guys is amazing. I went to one after walking to three other ones that were closed but I heard it was extremely good so I was determined to try it. I got in line which went out the door and the pricing was pretty decent as it wasn't extremely expensive or out of the ordinary. The drink came and it was amazing. The store i went to was really small though and I bought one to go that they've premade.
author: Esther M.

description:
Boba Guys' cups read "we take boba and tea to the next level." They must've read my mind because my milk tea craving has been on a whole 'nother level recently; so much so that it has pretty much replaced my daily cup of coffee, no joke. 

Like other milk tea aficionados, I followed Boba Guys from their pop-up location in Ken Ken Ramen to now their very own space -- a small, modern storefront on 19th & Valencia. 

This week I ordered a large jasmine milk tea (no boba, $4.25.) Sweet & creamy, with a strong floral taste. Quality tea, Straus organic milk, & simple syrup made in-house makes all the difference in flavor. Totally hit the spot.
author: Fancypants X.

description: This place is cute and super hipster! But their milk tea is alright. I got the Hong Kong style milk tea with pearls, which I liked, but I didn't think it was exceptional. The tea to milk ratio was good and the pearls were soft and chewy. My boyfriend got the strawberry matcha milk tea which is heavily advertised in their store and recommended on yelp, but it was TOO sweet. The first sip was good because it was different, but every sip after that just tasted like artificial strawberry syrup. They were sampling their Kiwi Guava drink and that was really tasty, so maybe next time we'll try other things on their menu.
author: Quan D.

description:
i got the matcha-strawberry latte with boba and it tasted pretty average to me, a little on the sweet side but definitely different! my bf tried the black milk tea and it had a strong taste of black tea which is great!

5/5 customer service: greeted warmly & nice employees
author: Tina N.

description:
This was my second time trying Boba Guys in San Francisco and the experience just wasn't as good as I'd have hoped.

My friend and I were zooming around the city and were craving boba. I suggested Boba Guys since my friend had never tried this place before. I had checked out the location at Union Square before and was fine with their HK Milk Tea. So why not give this place a try?

Protip: if you are annoyed at trying to find parking, I recommend just turning your emergency lights on somewhere near the tea shop because you can get in and out really quickly.

We arrived right at 6pm (time they were supposed to close), but luckily they were still serving drinks. My friend got the JMT (Jasmine Milk Tea), whereas I took a bold leap of faith and got the Horchata Milk Tea. The price of their boba isn't really outrageous. For a normal 16 oz cup, it's about $3.75, which is decent.

My friend enjoyed her JMT, but I couldn't figure out for the life of me why I didn't really think my Horchata Milk Tea wasn't that good. I think it was because I kept thinking I was drinking horchata, but was overwhelmed by the amount of milk. This makes sense I guess, given the drink, but I've had Horchata Milk Tea before and it was better than this...

Even though my experience at Boba Guys was a bit subpar, I will probably come back again and try their other drinks. I still have yet to check out the Strawberry Matcha Late (one of their bests), so maybe next time?

tl;dr decent boba shop with prices that are not outrageous. Just avoid the Horchata

Drink well and prosper,
author: Bryan W.

description:
SO SWEET. Please have more less-sweet decaf drink options!!! 

This was my first time drinking boba in more than a year and I was a little disappointed.

I got the DECAF BLACK (50% sugar) because I wanted something decaffeinated (my body doesn't tolerate caffeine well). At first I was going to pick the HORCHATA, which is the most popular decaf drink on the menu, but I could NOT adjust the sugar level on that one so I went with the decaf black tea, which the girl at the store "recommended". Not sure if she really knows the drinks all that well yet. 

The decaf black was VERY SWEET at 50%. It did not taste anything like a decaf black tea, but more like jasmine tea...I could not tell what was special about this drink or this boba place from drinking this tea. I think this is why there is only one picture of that drink on Yelp right now (which is mine lol).

But then I tried my friend's rose tea and iced matcha latte and both were so much better than the stupid decaf black. I feel like I was rigged. The rose tea had a very aromatic, flora scent, while the ice matcha was just beautiful to look at. 

Anyways, if I liked boba more I would have loved this place. Just sucks that I don't drink caffeinated that often.
author: Wendy F.

description:
Not really a fan of boba guys.

They recommend 75% sweetness, but I suggest 100% lol. I jump between getting 75% and 100% sweetness for my milk teas (I know so unhealthy, but so much tastier) and 75% tasted like 50%. 

There's an option for almond milk for the vegans and non-dairy consumers out there. Drinks came out pretty fast considering how busy they were. Milk tea was mediocre. I think I was just expecting more after I heard so many rave reviews about this place.
author: Joanna K.

description:
This place is pretty small and gets busy.

I tried the Strawberry Matcha Latte with almond milk and boba.  It's tasty and not too sweet.  It's an interesting combination. The boba is warm and has the right chewy consistency.
author: Lisa H.

description:
4 stars for their matcha green tea latte. It had great flavor and is better than other places. And their hong kong style milk tea was pretty good too. 1 star for their horchata which had no flavor and was very watery. 

Expect a line outside, especially on hot days. There is only some small bar seating by the window so it's best to get your drinks to-go.
author: Ali F.

description: I'm sorry for not returning sooner, Boba Guys!! Make sure you check the specials listed next to the register, there are some really yummy options...I wanted them all! I decided on the Matchata - matcha plus horchata. It's really good, tastes a little more horchata than matcha but you can still taste all the flavors. I also tried a regular milk tea but the flavor is really strong, I like it! Not watery at all. I'd definitely get either drink again but next time I'll have to go for that strawberry matcha!
author: Ashley C.

description:
