Best tapioca balls I've had anywhere! Remarkably consistent - they're always firm but chewy in the best way. WHAT IS YOUR SECRET, BOBA GUYS?!

The price is definitely higher than a lot of boba places, but I really don't mind given the consistency and quality of their products. They also have great flavors - strawberry matcha latte is one of my absolute favorite drinks from anywhere, and today I tried their strawberry calpico which was nice and fruity. 

Their normal sweetness really isn't overly sweet (compared to places like Quickly), so maybe try something like 75% sweet before dropping the level down further.

The only downside is the line that's almost always there, but it moves fairly quickly and I think the amazing boba quality is well worth it.
author: Delia Z.

description: This place has, by far, the best tasting, most authentic taro I've had in California! I haven't had anything that compares to theirs!! I knocked down 1 star because it's super tiny and the food selection isn't that great but definitely a great taste for milk tea!!!
author: Amanda C.

description:
pretty much, if i was given the chance to have the location closer to where i am. i would spend a lot more money at boba guys, it's insane. i haven't tried any of their snacks, i'm basing this more of the drinks i've purchased or know from close friends or my significant other. i went to three of the ( insert the number of locations they have in sf here ) but i'm doing a review on this one based off of my recent trip.

i won't hold this against them because i understand making mistakes happen rarely or when there's new employees under training. been there, no hard feelings. they did get my order wrong but one of the employees were kind enough to make the drink i originally ordered once again. -- they made a green tea latte, the one i ordered was the strawberry green tea latte. they were completely understanding and considerate, truly appreciated the service despite the minor mistake!

i usually purchase the strawberry green tea latte, make sure to take a pic for ig to see and stir afterwards hah. i do like it, i enjoy the sweetness the strawberry gives and the slight bitterness of the green tea. the whole milk that's in between balances both flavors out.

the jasmine milk tea is a close second, it's my go to at any boba shop but boba guys do it right. i enjoy the flavors and how well they compliment one another rather than the jasmine overpowering the milk tea, which seems to be a challenge at other boba shops. plus, it must've been good if my boyfriend downed it during dinner.

if you're ever in the city, i would recommend trying out the thai tea and the other two beverages i mentioned. it's a small spot, it's not a place to hang with groups of people or even with one companion on the side. it's kind of a place where you get your drink and bounce to venture out the city with a refreshing drink between your hands. i've always enjoyed my drinks and the timing is never wrong, it will get busy. a line will build but you get your drinks as soon as possible despite that.
author: Caed Khiara S.

description:
My brother and I swear by one drink at every boba tea shop and it is the Jasmine Milk Tea. As simple as it sounds, very few places can make it just right. 

Brother recently came up from LA and we paid this place a visit. Came here with the only intention of ordering Jasmine Milk Tea - while I typically like it 50% sweet, my crazy brother likes to ask for 150% sweet. 

Basically, tried it. Don't like it. I could barely taste the Jasmine Tea in it! Why?? Usually 50% sweet hits the spot, but for some reason, the drink had no flavor. Not sweet. No Jasmine. What's up with that?? So confused... 

Side note: Brother told me I ordered the drink all wrong - can't mess with the original taste apparently...unless you want more sweet, of course. Fine, I'll give it a another chance. 

SO I gave it a second try this past weekend. Came back with my BFF yesterday and ordered the same drink. Original. Regular sweet, regular ice. Results = omg, still no. The original is wayy too sweet. I took one sip of it and didn't want it anymore. All I could taste was the sugar and no tea flavor. 

All in all, my brother loves you guys, but I don't. When I visit him in SoCal, you'll see me at Seven Leaves where Jasmine Milk Tea is done right. 

P.S. Service was friendly and drinks were made quickly. Drinks were a def no go though. 

Two stars for the service. Zero for the flavor in drinks.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Just aight... but the decor and drinks make for highly aesthetic photos. Wish I liked it more
author: Sandy C.

description:
We don't live in SF, but when we visit, we like to try new things.
Only downfall to this location is that it's all street parking.
I had to really convince hubby to drive around, patiently lol
I believe the other location has a few parking garages close by.

Strawberry matcha latte - mix it all together 5/5!!!
Raspberry pineapple tea fresca - my son's drink. Tasted kind of weird to me, but he liked it lol
Hong Kong style milk tea - Hubby liked it. I did not. It was too bitter for my liking. :( Maybe extraaaaa condensed milk would be good lol

We also tried the cotton candy (Sugar and Spun), which we enjoyed!
Strawberry shortcake and peanut butter & jelly. 4/5!

+ Almond, soy, and organic milk options
+ Sweetness levels
+ Friendly & quick service. They were really patient w us!
author: Jinkie G.

description: Got both the jasmine green tea and the lychee. Really good! Came in at the right time, no line out the door.
author: Myleen R.

description:
Get the 24-ounce iced coffee milk tea, regular milk, with 25% sweetness. I mean, if they had a 48 ounce, I would probably need all of 0.002 seconds to decide to get that one instead.

DON'T JUDGE ME. 

But seriously, do they sprinkle crack in their drinks? What is it that keeps me coming back?

It's the almond jelly, it has to be. I mean, that or the crack. 

I'm not normally a fan of bubble tea, but this stuff's delicious! The coffee milk tea (yes, coffee + tea + milk) is my favorite. I'm not a jittery mess afterward, but I definitely don't have it during the evening of a work week (I'm old, I know). I always get an iced 24 ounce, because after waiting in that line (almost always ~10 minutes), I want the biggest version of that drink possible.

Sometimes, I've even gone twice in a day.

DON'T JUDGE ME.
author: Adena B.

description:
I love bubble tea and I was pretty happy with this place. They use loose tea leafs for their teas (that means no powder-- super plus) and the barista and cashier were extremely helpful. They guide you through your order if you're unsure/it's your first time here and if you're not satisfied with your drink in the end, the barista was nice and offers to remake your drink for you! Their tapioca pearls are also very soft and chewy. If you love bubble tea or just tea in general, you'll definitely enjoy this place like I did! 

This is the original boba guys!! The OG location so make sure to stop by this one!
author: Susan S.

description: It's definitely not worth the hype. The hong kong style milk tea had a very strong tea taste which is great, but the condensed milk was not even enough to balance the drink out. The matcha latte with oat milk took a little getting use to, but I did think it was okay. There was so much hype here that I expected it to taste amazing, but I was quite underwhelmed by the drinks here.
author: Stephanie C.

description: I never know what to choose but I haven't regretted any of my choices so far. The space is small so this isn't a place you should plan to sit or stay for a while. It's a great place to grab a drink and go.
author: Heather M.

description: My favorite boba place. Very good and would definitely recommend trying the oat milk.
author: Olvia C.

description: Despite the long line, Boba Guys never disappoints. I tried their strawberry matcha, and thank god they were able to put less puree because it was the perfect amount of sweetness for me. I don't have a huge tolerance for sweet drinks. I like that they don't charge you extra for almond milk. Most of their special drinks are already at 75% sweetness, but the staff is very flexible with adjusting sweetness if needed.
author: Shu T.

description: HK style milk tea, 50% sweet, with almond jelly! I think that's my go-to drink from now on. Great location in the mission. Really convenient esp after I work out heheeh :)
author: Cal C.

description:
Boba Guys definitely has some of the best boba in the city! When they first opened, I saw a lot of it on instagram/twitter/facebook and didn't think too much of it. To me, it mostly seemed like a novelty hipster place where people just went to take pictures (ha ha ha). The mission district is a bit of a drive from my house so I never had an urge to try it either. One of my friends finally suggested we go after dinner and I obliged because I was curious and she really liked it the last time she had it.. and also she was driving haha!

There was absolutely noooo parking on a Friday night so one of us double parked while the other 2 went in to order. I got the Hong Kong milk tea with boba, and my friends got an iced matcha latte and a classic black milk tea with soymilk (yes! You can sub reg milk for soy).

We were the only ones there so the drinks came out in a few minutes. I took my first sip and I was in milk tea heaven!!! It has a hint of condensed milk so that makes it sweeter too. The boba is really chewy and soft here... It's a little more overcooked than most places but that makes it so much more squishy and delicious! I got to try my friends' drinks too and the matcha latte was really good as well! The matcha flavor really stood out and it looks cool before you mix it with all the layers. Just be sure that they've mixed the matcha completely, or else you might get little bitter balls of matcha at the bottom of your drink...

I will definitely be back!! I can't believe I underestimated this place haha. The only bad thing is that drinks are a bit pricey here. Expect to spend $4-5 on a smaller sized drink with a topping, but I guess you're paying for quality!
author: Tara A.

description:
My family and I decided to try this place since we were in SF for the day. The line was pretty long when we got there but it went by fairly quickly. There was a leak above the entrance which was kind of annoying when we were waiting in line by the door because it kept dripping on us. Hopefully they get that fixed soon! 

Drinks: 
- Hojicha Milk Tea w/ pearls: This drink exceeded my expectations! You can definitely taste the roasted green tea flavor. The pearls were also on point! I highly recommend you get this drink. 

- Horchata w/ pearls: It literally tastes like milk. You can barely taste the cinnamon. The pearls were perfectly chewy though.

-Peach Green Tea w/ pearls: Tasted refreshing and not too sweet. But the pearls were soft on the outside and hard in the middle. Pretty inconsistent with the others ):

- Classic Milk Tea w/ almond jelly: Drink was good but the best part was the almond jelly. It was AMAZING!! I wish it were available at other places.

Pricey but makes sense because of the quality of ingredients used. They don't use powder and you can clearly see the tea being brewed in the back.
author: Alika N.

description: I went here since I heard a lot of good things about this boba place from my coworker in SF and my siblings. I was disappointed. The place wasn't as clean as I expected - it seemed unkempt. The actual drink wasn't good too. The boba wasn't the soft, chewy goodness I expect to get at boba places. The place just feels like it was built for Instagram photos and nothing more. I definitely had better boba, especially since I live in LA.
author: Jan C.

description: Ordered the coconut green tea with milk, almond jelly, and 75% sweet. The drink was delicious and I was pretty sad that I finished it so quickly. Wish I got it less sweet, but I tend to not enjoy sweet drinks all that much. A little pricy though, I paid $7 ($6 for drink + $1 tip), so won't be a regular here unfortunately. They do have other specialty drinks posted on the side of the register though, and those looked really good as well. Looking forward to trying those eventually. Parking can be a little difficult and the meters are $5.25 for an hour in the area. Nice place to stop by after hanging out at Dolores Park if you don't feel like ice cream at Bi-Rite. The wait on a Friday afternoon was about 30 mins from standing in line to receiving my drink.
author: Sandy K.

description:
I've been here twice in the middle of 2015. 

The drinks were great the first time and I don't recall what I got. The second time, horchata kind of tastes like what weed smells like. 

Drinks are decent and the seating is rather small.  What sucks is that there is no bathroom. 

It's a walk in and walk out. Cashiers are very friendly and patient. Anteater sign kind of reminds me of TeaLyfe.
author: Jessica Q.

description:
I got the classic milk tea. How can you go wrong with that? It was literally the perfect drink to fulfill my craving. I asked for extra tapioca balls. So the man at the register, who was VERY kind might I add, suggested that I have less sugar in the milk tea. This was the best thing he could have said! The tea would have been way to sweet if he didn't recommend that. It was perfect, and I'm glad I got the 24 oz!

My boyfriend got the Iced Matcha Latte. That is the weird green one you see pictures of. He actually really LOVED it, and it was his FIRST time drinking bubble tea. Yes, I know. He's dated an Asian for 3.5 years, yet this is only his first bubble tea experience! Shame on me :)!

The one downfall is the line goes out the door. You would think it would be quick since it's only tea they are serving, but it took at least 45 minutes of a wait. They do say that their bubble tea is the best quality with no fake powders and artificial syrups. So that may explain why it takes a little more time.

I will be coming back for sure.
author: Nadia H.

description:
My yelp rating of Boba Guys varies from a 4 star vs. a 5 star, just how my drinks here vary from good vs. realllllllly good. 

Inconsistency is something that a few others and I have noticed about this place, and that's probably the only reason why my rating shifts from a 4 and 5.

I usually order the Iced Matcha Green Tea Latte with soy milk! The first time I ordered it, it was the best I've had from here... creamy and delicious... still able to taste just the slightest bit of bitterness from the green tea, but the overall sweetness from their homemade syrup. The inconsistency that I mentioned about is the way they whisk their matcha powder. I understand that it may be hard to whisk extrrreeeeemely thorough, but I sometimes end up drinking balls and clumps of matcha powder, which you can imagine is very bitter and unpleasant. It makes the experience of drinking the drink a little dreadful to be honest. (That sounds very dramatic and sad haha.. but there's some truth to it!)   

That really is the only gripe I have about this place! I've tried their HK style (condensed milk!!), thai tea (condensed milk!!), classic milk tea, jasmine milk tea... all were delicious! (I'm passing on the coconut green milk tea.. it was blegh to me..) I love how you can customize what type of milk you want - regular, almond, soy, and how their toppings are homemade! (Their boba is not homemade, but they are indeed soft and chewy as advertised!)
author: Kris C.

description: Undrinkable.  I had to throw out my $5 tea unfortunately.  I tried to drink it and each sip was so gross.  The tea leaves must have been burnt because the flavor was absolutely bitter.  I didn't mind waiting in line at all.  It was super slow at first but then went quickly once inside.  They make your drink once you order in an instant.  I would have gone back to tell them how bitter it was, but the place was packed and I would have never made it back inside before closing.  Too bad, I was really craving boba and I heard this was the place to try in the area.  I guess I will give it one more shot.  If I had a coupon for my bad experience, I would def go back and try it again, and if it was good I would stick to the drink and be a regular without straying off of what works, if that makes sense.  Hopefully someone will respond and I'll update my review if so.
author: Kara C.

description:
This is my second time at Boba Guys. The first time, I got the matcha latte with pearls. I didn't enjoy it too much, but that's probably because I don't like matcha very much. 

This time around, I got the HK-style tea with pearls at 50% sweetness. I was pretty unimpressed. I didn't taste any of the condensed milk, which was also why I lowered the sweetness. I spent $4.25 for a regular-sized drink that, in my opinion, did not taste unique at all. Lines were also insane and parking impossible. However, drinks came out very quickly once we placed our orders.

I had a taste of the horchata tea and it didn't seem too special either. I prefer real horchata that costs a fraction of the price! I don't think I'll be back - I've tasted three of their most popular drinks and haven't been impressed with any of them.
author: Anna H.

description:
So I'm not that into boba but my students convinced me to give this place a chance.

I'd always see the crazy lines in the afternoons and would continue to pass this place up.

Finally I passed by and there was no one in line so I had to give a shot. Ordered the horchata with boba and called it a day.

I can see why people love this particular place. The texture of the boba is unique; it's chewy and gooey at the same time! It doesn't taste super processed at all.

The bad part is that I pass this place frequently so I need to be wise about my visits otherwise the old tire is going to get a lot rounder.
author: Art O.

description: Provably my favourite bubble tea place in SFO! Both sugar and ice level can be customized. You can even choose type of milk you want. Lines could become long sometime but it's worth it!
author: Winnie C.

description:
Boba guys like a lot of the stores on Valencia, has great ingredients like Strauss milk and grade A tea. You really get what you pay for! 

My favorites are the lychee milk tea, lavender-rose milk tea, and currently my most favorite Hojichaa (roasted milk tea). Yummm :). 

Their Belgium waffles are so good too, when you bite into them they have pieces of sugar crystals and it tastes supa buttery+sweet. 

It is a bit on the pricey side, but as I mentioned before, they have the best ingredients and you really can't complain if you want the best, right? 

Shout out to the tall Asian guy and the boba guys team, keep doing your thaang!!
author: Melanie T.

description:
I'm glad I tried Boba Guys, but I wouldn't go out of my way to get one of their drinks. I got the Hong Kong tea with bubbles and it tasted pretty good. The lines seem longer than they really are because there isn't much space inside, so everyone is pretty much waiting outside.

They did have some more unique flavors of the month. I wish I would have tried their hibiscus tea; perfect for summer and a little more unique.
author: Brian M.

description:
This place was okay IMO.  I was visiting SF from SoCal and so many people told me that Boba Guys was really good (the best in SF), so I had to try it! When I did, I was immediately disappointed because it just tastes like your typical drinks from any other typical boba shops.. 
A large drink for $5.00 and it tastes typical. Definitely not satisfied and way too pricey...
author: Stella V.

description:
I am a true fan of Boba Guys! On a hot Saturday afternoon in Valencia and near Dolores Park, expect the line for this place to be out the door, but for good reason! There is so much hype about this place and the very first time I came here, we waited around 45 minutes, but it was well worth it! 

The place inside is small, with just a window bar and a few seats, making the waiting area inside a bit cramped, yet the people working and the cashiers are always so friendly and help to move the line and wait time as quickly as possible. When it came time to order, the cashier even offered her suggestions on the level of sweetness and different boba combinations to better personalize my drink, which I enjoyed.

My favorites to get here are the Horchata and the Thai Tea! Not cloyingly sweet, and the large size comes with an even affordable price.

Overall, if you're ever on Valencia and are headed to Dolores Park, stop by here and check it out, and hope the line isn't too far out the door because it's seriously that good!
author: Kyrie S.

description:
My favorite tea place I've tried in the US! We walked by this place on a Sunday after church and saw a long line, with nothing else to do we decided to stop in. After getting our drinks it made since why the line was so long! 

The menu is simple in a good way, they have the basic milk tea and matcha but also offer some unique options. I ordered the strawberry matcha latte (iced) and loved it! They allow you to add topping such as tapioca balls, grass jelly or almond jelly and give you and option of whole organic milk, almond milk or soy. If you're new to tea they make it easy to order and you won't feel intimidated. On the other hand if you love tea and get it a lot they let you personalize your order just the way you like it and provide new options to try. 

The tea tastes great, good flavors and smooth doesn't taste fake or like it's just made from a powder like some places do. 

I highly recommend this place to anyone. They have lots of locations in the Bay Area and provide good service.
author: Christina M.

description: I had been wanting to try Boba Guys for the longest time because I saw it all over food Instagrams and was so happy to finally try it! My husband and I got the Jasmine Milk Tea and Strawberry Matcha Latte to share. But I ended up basically drinking all of the Strawberry Matcha Latte since it was SO GOOD. The Jasmine Milk Tea was good but not as unique. The place was small so we took the drinks to go.
author: Christine K.

description: Such a let down...I ordered the Earl grey and the coconut green tea with almond milk and almond jelly. Our drinks came out looking a little light. Both of them tasted watered down, not like milk teas but more like water. I was so disappointed because we stood in line for it. I'm not sure if choosing the almond milk made it taste watered down, but it really lacked flavor. I did however, like the almond jelly.
author: Vy T.

description:
I tried the Hong Kong with boba and it was pretty good. It wasn't too strong but still had enough flavor even as the ice melted throughout the day. 

I'm taking out a star though cause the other location is a bit better. The boba here was more squishy and there was a lot more ice to drink ratio here as opposed to the location on Stockton. 

I'd still come back here!
author: Erin E.

description: This is my favorite boba shop ever. Their soft, chewy boba is glazed in honey and always delicious. My go to drink is the matcha latte and it is amazing. The drinks are a little pricey ($5 for a small matcha latte), however, the quality is amazing. There has always been a line every time I come, however this location seems to be less crowded than the others. There is very limited seating inside, but Dolores Park is just a walk away. I highly recommend this place and find myself always coming back every time I'm in the Bay.
author: Katie L.

description: Alright, the hype is worth to try. I ordered the lavender milk tea and the flavor was a bit too strong, but I love my lavender and I still craved more when I finished my drink. I usually don't get the boba in my drinks, so I would not be able to tell you about those. It's not super amazing as people make it out to be, but I would get Boba Guys regularly if I lived in SF - it's a good boba spot. I love how they offer different types of milk. My friend tried the oat milk which wasn't a bad choice, but it did make her drink a lot stronger (the flavor).
author: Gielliane D.

description:
Mm I like Boba Guys. I kinda wish I could give it a 3 and 1/2 stars though because it isn't that great. 

I like my milk tea on the strong tea side and this place tasted a little watery and too milky. Still good if you're craving something sweet. I don't usually get boba but I get it here because it's sweet and chewy and pretty consistent.

Overpriced for boba though but I guess it's understandable with their ingredients.
author: Donna D.

description:
No restroom - knock off one star. Had to use another store's restaurant.

Interesting flavors. They have monthly specials. I got the lychee green tea + rose black milk tea and also lavender black milk tea thats in the september special.

I like how they didn't skimp on the milk tea when I ordered no ice (unlike other places that give you less). And also you can control the sweetness cause they have a sweetness jar/pot that you can add to your drink yourself if it's not sweet enough. Smart move.

Saw pandan macarons on yelp but they didn't have it here when I came. Just the cotton candy.

Yummy boba and HOMEMADE grass jelly whattt 

Lots of parking here. Coming back next time, but to the union square location.
author: Inez J.

description:
Woooo this is the 3rd Boba Guys location that I've tried. And the drinks have been pretty consistent across the different stores. I always get the Strawberry Matcha Latte. The flavors go so well together and the honey boba that they use is amazing (you can taste the honey)! As pretty as the drink is when they first hand it to you, make sure you stir it up before you drink it. I gave this place 4 stars instead of 5 just because the level of sweetness seemed off to me. I wish the drink was sweeter....but that's probably just personal bias. Still very good, though! Highly recommend trying out the Strawberry Matcha Latte--you'll be hooked!

The line can get long here but they're very efficient and it moves quite fast!
author: Ashley Y.

description: I tried the matcha with almond milk and boba with 50% sweetness. Grateful for the non dairy options. The matcha was yummy and the boba was nice and warm. It's nicely located next to Dolores Park, so you could enjoy your boba there. The only downside for Boba Guys is the long line.
author: Noelle N.

description:
Boba Guys was good, but really nothing special. I personally didn't see what all the "hype" was so it was quite underwhelming for me.

I think there's always a line out the door at this place because 1) it's small and 2) there's only one person at the register. No more than 4 people can stand in line inside the store so obviously the line will go out the door and there's only ONE person at the register so obviously the order process will be slow, which consequently leads to a long line.

We got the jasmine milk tea with tapioca: organic milk + 75% sugar. It costed us $4.50 for the 16 oz and $5.50 for the 24 oz. The drink was good, but nothing special. We waited around 30 minutes in line and the drink was honestly NOT worth the wait. Good thing was, our drinks came out RIGHT after we ordered, so we did not have to wait long at all for our drinks once we ordered.

4/5 stars because I would not go out of my way to go to a Boba Guys. However, if I'm around the area and there is no line, I would get a drink here. Overall, this place is really nothing special and I don't see what the "hype" is, but at least now I can say that I've tried Boba Guys and I'm able to make a conscious decision to not wait in line ever again!

TL;DR: Drink is good. Line is not worth. But if you've never had, you should try.
author: Jen S.

description:
I was so excited to finally see what the hype was all about and was thoroughly disappointed.

I ordered an iced lychee green milk tea with boba. It was nothing special. The drink itself did not taste like lychee at all, was bitter, and had an odd aftertaste. The pearls, which I had heard were heavenly, tasted normal. 
Also tried the jasmine milk tea here and it was pretty good, but still nothing special to rave about. 

Small but cute aesthetic interior & really good service but the drinks itself were subpar. Maybe next time I'll come back to try the iced matcha latte since I've heard good reviews about that.
author: Kim T.

description:
BEST Horchata so far!! Love it! I give it 5 stars for the Horchata Boba alone! I also tried their Hong Kong milk tea, but that one was ok. Their Thai Tea looks good too! I'll have to try that next time. 

Their boba texture and taste is also one of the best I've had so far. I don't know what it's life span is, but just like most boba, you don't want to save it more than a few hours or it will get hard. Just in case! 

Definitely a great boba joint! It lives up to the hype for sure! ;-D
author: Giovanna R.

description:
My favorite boba place in SF! I love the chewiness of the boba and interesting flavors offered here. 

I got the 16oz lychee green tea with milk and boba ($4.50). 50% sugar level seemed like the right call. It was super refreshing and different than what other boba places offer. You can tell everything is high quality. Highly recommend this place!
author: Linda X.

description: Two words: vegan boba. This place is heaven on earth. For real. It's so incredibly good, I make it a point to visit whenever we are in town. Now if only they would consider/open a Seattle, WA location...
author: Kayla S.

description: I cannot get over the strawberry matcha drink from here. It's the tri-colored drink with a bottom layer of house made strawberry syrup, milk, and matcha green tea. All blended together it was a perfect green milk tea with a hint of strawberry. The sweetness cannot be adjusted on this drink because the syrup provides the sugar but it was not overly sweet at all. Boba was perfectly chewy. I'm dying to go back!
author: Mymy N.

description: definitely a MUST visit place in SF. great service, delicious menu.  the line fills up super quick,  so get there early!
author: Shane T.

description: This boba place is bomb - organic milk from a local farm and lots of plant milk options. BE CAREFUL with sugar level - their "baseline" 100% sweetness level is sickeningly sweet. I have to get mine 25% or 50% if I want it very sweet by my standards. Their lavender tea is delicious, along with the oolong and my fiancé LOVES the horchata boba. They are happy to remake your boba if it's not to your liking so make sure you communicate! A side note - this location is better than the one at Union Square.
author: Julia C.

description:
The line for this one is definitely not as long as the one in Union Square. Also, I have an appreciation for the bigger store so that you have room to stand when you're waiting for your drink. 

Boba Guys drinks average between $4-5, which is a little more than I hope to pay, but it's for delicious good quality boba tea. They have a lot of options such as Hong Kong style milk tea, Hojicha and Matcha lattes.I've heard great things about their Dirty Horchata, which I believe is Horchata with espresso on top. 

The ambience here is great, the staff are friendly and the decor is very clean and modern. Would highly recommend this one over the one in Union Square!
author: Nancy L.

description:
I ordered a jasmine milk tea and I loved it. This is my favorite boba chain out here in the Bay Area and I recommend it to everyone all the time because it's absolutely the best. I'm not sure why this location has a lower rating compared to the others, but I didn't think it tasted any different from the other locations I've tried. 

-Kristen

5 stars from Kristen, Edmund wasn't here to rate.
author: Kristen L.

description: Huge fan of boba! This place.. not so much. Because I heard soo much about Boba Guys I HAD to try it. Their menu is very limited. Milk is in practically everything. Boba wasn't very fresh. The drinks my entire party got were verrryy watered down. It was just flavored syrup water and old boba which they call "tea". The "iced coffee" was just brown iced water. Disappointed to say the very least, as I did have verrryy high expectations for my first time trying it.
author: Hadeel A.

description:
If you're looking for trendy, hipster boba, Boba Guys is for you. If you're looking for authentic, Taiwan-style boba, do not expect to get it here. 

I think that living in Taiwan has made me hypercritical of boba in the US. That said, I can still appreciate boba here. With all the hype around Boba Guys, I was very skeptical. Now that I've been, I can say that I was unimpressed. 

- Jasmine milk tea with boba
- Horchata with boba
- Muscat oolong milk tea with boba

I went with three friends: all of us of Taiwanese decent, all of us have lived in Taiwan. We all felt the tea was very bland and the boba itself too sweet. My jasmine milk tea felt very watered down. I couldn't really taste the tea. I know people might say it tastes watered down because they use milk instead of creamer, but that shouldn't affect the tea strength, just the creaminess. I had adjusted mine to be no ice and 25% sugar, too. My other friends also felt the teas were watered down and the drinks too sweet. 

My friend complained about the cups. The lids are a little annoying and pop off if you squeeze the cup. Also, the tea kind of goes everywhere when you try putting the straw in. 

I feel like Boba Guys is targeted at a very specific group of people: the trendy, hip crowd. Boba isn't meant to be fancy and describing it as "heirloom tea with organic milk" only adds to the annoyingness of Boba Guys. But that's just me. I mean, boba wasn't created to be some healthy, pretentious drink, but that seems to be how they're trying to market it here. 

Anyways, boba goodness might be subjective. As long as you're not looking for a CoCo or 50嵐, you can try Boba Guys and decide for yourselves. Personally, I won't be back. There is better boba in the city.
author: Eifeh S.

description:
Coming from LA to SF, this boba place has good boba.

Loved that they had a milk alternative! Although the boba isn't soaked in honey like Half & Half, it was nicely cooked. The drink itself made the boba taste sweeter. 

They are a bit on the pricier side. But looking for a a good boba shop in SF is difficult unlike LA. I would highly recommend giving this place a shot and a run for your money. Just don't go during busy hours...we revisited the area when it was calmer. The line for this place can be quite long.... :/

The next time I visit SF, this will be the only place I go for boba.
author: Jenn H.

description: Solid bubble tea every time. Appreciated the ability to tweak sweetness levels as well as milk options. Also enjoyed both the housemade almond jelly and grass jelly.
author: Ailien V.

description:
Although I'm someone who avoids carb-y fillers like boba, I couldn't stay away from the boba at Boba Guys. I was told that their drinks were delicious, and that their boba was soft and chewy. 

These balls were supple, and released honey-like flavor while being mashed by your teeth. The concoctions are refreshing, with a little adventurous kick (Iced Strawberry Matcha Latte to Horchata to Lavender Black Milk tea etc). 

Way to incorporate various cultural flavors to create one perfect cup.
author: Grace H.

description:
Had my first Boba Guys experience here recently and am now dying to go back to try more drinks! I ordered a Earl Grey milk tea with almond jelly (75% sugar), and my friend ordered a Hong Kong style milk tea with boba (25% sugar). Both were delicious! 

Boba Guys is known for using real tea, not powders, and I could really tell! The tea was of excellent quality, and the homemade almond jelly really tastes of almond and adds a nice texture to the drink. 

Service was super friendly and quick! There's often a line out the door, but it moves really fast and the drink is worth the few minute wait.

This location is in a prime spot on Valencia Street in the Mission District, near many shops and restaurants, perfect to stop in for a quick drink!
author: Julie Z.

description: One of my favorite Boba places around. Their tapioca is so soft and tender, and they have organic strauss milk instead of powdered milk. The service is kind and they'll let you sample if you need to.
author: Shailee S.

description:
I want to like Boba Guys, but I'm currently on the 'meh' side. For one, their boba is DELICIOUS (that alone could give them a 5 stars), however, their standard house milk tea didn't scream "I want more" for me. I ordered a house milk tea with boba, almond jelly, and soy milk (50% sweetness and light ice). The milk tea formula wasn't the best that I've had, and that really shot the drink down for me. I'd probably rank their classic soy milk tea at around 2 to 3 stars (it's not the worst I've had, however it didn't make me want to go back for more). 

I would, however, consider going back in the future and trying their more unique drinks (such as the matcha-based ones or the specials menu on the side of the register). But for just standard milk tea, I definitely would say hop over to a different place. I'm from Sacramento and despite all the milk tea places I've visited (most of Sacramento/Davis, and parts of SJ and Socal) - Boba Guys isn't up to the hype for your base line milk tea drink. Maybe it's just me, but for my preferences, this place didn't quite hit the spot.
author: Li S.

description: Boba Guys is the best boba tea shop in the greater San Francisco - Bay Area.  The boba tastes better than any other place because they use real milk, including almond milk.  Also, they give you the option to adjust both the ice and sugar level.  More than anything, I love the feeling of going here because of their brand - cool, clean, fresh.  I honestly cannot say enough good things about this place and recommend it to everyone - it is a San Francisco must.
author: Lily S.

description:
Coconut oolong combo with almond milk, 25% sweetness and no ice + boba = heaven in your mouth.

I've been searching for comparable bubble tea but haven't found a spot with anywhere near the quality boba guys provides. The veggie curry rice ball and matcha custard cake at the new location in Hayes were super tasty as well~
author: Britt M.

description:
I for sure thought it was going to be super asian like tpumps or quicklys... but it wasn't! There are a lot of cutesy things there like cute mason jars or tote bags with their logos on them.
There were 4 of us, 2 ordered Thai tea with boba, mine was hk style with boba and another one was coffee tea with boba. There were a few people in front of us and one person had a large order. 

They're supposed to call your name when your order was ready. The Thai tea, they did call our name, but the hk style and coffee tea orders, they didn't call our name and someone took it! So their systems a bit flawed still. Hopefully it'll be better

I love you can choose the level of sweetness and whether you want boba or grass jelly. There are different kinds of tea and my coworkers loved the balls. Said it was chewy and soft. 

50% sweetness was just right, not super sweet!
author: Eugenia W.

description: Wow, I didn't know that I was missing such good boba until I came here. Most of the places I've gone to you take a gamble if you get Boba as to whether they'll be chewy and FRESH or hard as rocks and just sit in your stomach. We went to Boba guys twice for days and, between four drinks everything was perfect. I particularly enjoyed the jasmine flavor, taro, and Thai iced tea. Pleasant and fast service as well, I wish this was the kind of place I had on campus ( or in Illinois in general ), it would make a lot of students so happy!
author: Emma H.

description: Such a wonderful taste! Authentic Taiwanese drink!! The tapioca balls cook exactly the way I want!! Recommend to anyone who visit San Francisco ya.
author: Joyce W.

description: This was one of my and Kat C.'s last stops in our bobadventures. And this was the one that I was most excited about. I ordered their early grey milk tea with boba. It was a dream come true. It was seriously one of my favorite boba drinks of all time. The tea is milky but not too sweet, and the honey boba had the perfect amount of sweetness, warmth, and chew. It's probably a good thing that I don't live nearby because I'd probably be here every single day!
author: Stacy Y.

description: Hmmm, pretty much overrated. Small cups, hate this lid. Non-compostable straws. So so flavor anyway.
author: Tran L.

description: I can't get enough of this place! Every time I'm in SF (or whenever I want boba) I'm always craving Boba Guys! I got the strawberry matcha latte cold even though it was freezing that day, but it was worth it! It came in 3 layers that I mixed up and had a really fresh strawberry  milk green tea flavor. Nothing tasted like it was fake or powdered. Super worth it and I'm definitely coming back soon!
author: Stella Y.

description: Will drive for boba! Seriously, what do they put in this stuff? Boba Guys is literally the first stop I program into my GPS when I arrive to San Francisco and I crave it daily when I'm back home in LA. Strawberry Matcha Latte with almond milk and almond jelly is my favorite but you cannot go wrong with anything here. I even got a tote this time so I can bring a piece of Boba Guys home with me. Most drinks can be customized for sweetness and only the finest ingredients are used in making this magic.
author: Masha K.

description:
I always find myself coming back here about 2-3 times a week for the past 3 years and now found time to write this review. Personally I just don't like the flavor of boba too often but I love the texture here enough to get it every now and then. Since I generally don't like boba anyways, I traditionally get almond jelly as my topping.
My favorite drinks to get are:
1. Strawberry Matcha
2. Horchata
3. Rose Black Tea (normal milk, both hot and cold are equally good)
4. Classic Milk Tea
These are my favorites and these are all good quality. I especially love the service here and in situations where there have been mishaps, Boba Guys was definitely on top of things to make it right. Thank you Boba Guys!
author: Tiffany T.

description:
Was hankering for some boba after dinner on Valencia. A friend suggested this place as she had been here before and said it was good. 

Cafe: funny signs and quirky sayings are inviting as soon as you walk in. Like a lot of places in sf it's a pretty small standing area and seating bar area for about 2 or 3 people. 

Menu: much different and simpler than any boba place I've been too. The items on the menu are basic teas: Thai,  horchata, rose, green, black, milk, chai, jasmine, and Hong Kong. 

Toppings: tapioca balls (boba balls), almond jelly, grass jelly.  Tried the grass jelly and almond milk on the side, the almond jelly tasted like the inside of a coconut ( a little earthy, jiggly and like almond lol), the grass jelly was a little better and more tasteless but both I wouldn't put in my drink. 

Taste/order: Ordered everything on the menu. Boba itself was chewy and fresh, save a few old hard ones that got mixed in. Thai tea was classic, tasty, sweet, everything you want. Classic milk tea was for lack of better words... Classic, a little low on sweetness. Hong Kong was allright, tasted like a mix of classic and Thai tea. Horchata: "it nibbled on my tastebuds", it was cinnamony, everything you expect from horchata. Rose: pretty decent actually, surprised me with the sweet little kick it had. 

Service: very friendly. The lady at the cashier was patient and understanding, she probably had dealt with confusion about the menu before. 

Drink sizes: 16oz and 24oz 

*can switch milks around in drinks: almond milk instead of regular, other options, a lot of boba places don't have. 

**cant change Thai tea sweetness, premade. 

3 stars because old boba balls threw me off, drink choice was different but nothing was amazing for me, nothing I couldn't get from a different place for less price, oh yeah and it was a bit pricey for no reason, couldn't change the sweetness of my favorite drink. Imo if you are a more specialized stop like this, make the teas amazing :) 

Check me out on Instagram! @themodelsingh
author: Himmat S.

description:
My new favorite boba spot. I honestly don't know why it took me so long to finally try it out but it's AMAZING. The Matcha Latte is on point, sorry to all my other matcha latte's perhaps I'll take you back another day. 

I love how they use local and more natural ingredients. Some of their toppings are made in house which is so cool to me. I haven't been to another place that does something like that. 

Im very picky about the way I like my tea and the Hong Kong style tea was on point. It def had the authentic tea tones and flavor I always look for. 

The boba is definitely Grade A all the way, just like their service! The person that helped us was super friendly. 

I will be coming back real soon to get more Grade A boba!!
author: Yinja L.

description: This place was great, it was our first time there. They had a variety of different drinks and it's decent price. There service was great.
author: Noe C.

description:
ChauTime Season 3:  Episode 2 Pick A Price For Me Please, I'll Spend Whatever!!!

Secrecy fuels passion, when we figure the simplest truth behind something that was previously unknown that what gives us a wildfire of emotions running through our veins. 

Let me be the Boba straw as I guide you through your lid, to puncture through the hole, tell you to suck though this straw, to slurp up that brew to order silky milk tea flavor, and let you have a mouthful of these Soft Squishy Pearly Precious Tapioca Boba Balls to choke on and swallow and gargle. 

In My Favorite City San Francisco life's so quick, sometimes just blinking you might miss the beauty of everything when you close, your eyes. Life's short, if you're not prepared you can miss out on a lot of opportunities... just don't miss out on Boba Guys one of my ChauHandZ Top 3 Best Boba places in the Universe right along with Tpumps S.F.(Heart Eyes X Super Kawaii Emoji) X BobaTime L.A. (Dab Boy X Bad Boy Emoji)


Flavors:

Strawberry Matcha Latte- 2On like Tinasashe. Got me on a wave like mixing Purple Syrup with the Sprite. The Strawberry Syrup is the right amount of sweetness as Grape Syrup is in Codeine. Then the Matcha comes though to hit the (F5) on the keyboard to refresh you like Sprite Remix Aruba Jam (BTW if anyone can get me an unopened can or 12pack of this I will give you a bunch of ShhhMoneys it's Dreams Money Can Buy for me or I will settle for Banana Snapple)!!!

Horchata- Boba guys should be bangin and flexin Tacos in this Trap House cause this Horchata is Bangs more than those Bros Bangin Tacos In those buses. If ChauTime were to give this flavor a nickname I would name it this alright.... just hear me out ok, gimme a chance will ya, I know I'm not the best nicknamer ever but I'd call it Bang Bros cause it Slays Trick while eliminating the rest of the competition. Beyonce Formation Tour Coming Soon!!! 

Hong Kong Milk Tea- Just like all the desserts or any sweets I have tried that are Hong Kong or Hong Kong Style this was just mediocre. I don't know if people in Hong Kong don't have taste buds or anything but everything I have ever tried Hong Kong Style are Bland A.F. with no sugar and no flavor. One thing that I remember most is two weeks into February... wait I mean April but same feelings, on my birthday as a kid I use to look forward to the Hong Kong Piece Of Cake my Grandma Bling use to get me. Phuckin Luved Dat Sh*t. Now a days that is just A Waste Of Stomach Space so I guess for this Flavor Boba Guys Nails it and it lives up to its name Hong Kong Milk Tea.

Thai Ice Tea- Thai Down Pho What. Did this flavor put me in a world where I am riding on a 6'7 Baby Elephant with 24k  elephant tusks with diamond encrusted Tiffany & Co. 24k VS1  deep fried elephant ears while sippin On 2 Moscow Mule cups filled with Thai Ice Tea with a tin tray of Khao Soi and 2Chopsticks right by my side?!! No but it was different and better executed than the average over sugary and half and half basic drinks at Thai Restaurants.  

Wish I could have any of those in the palms of my hands right now it's the one of my many secrets formulas to staying "Slim Thick With My Cute Ass" oh yeah P.S. ChauTime Booty By Chau Videos coming soon just subscribe and get that work out so you can Twerk N Phuck Up Your New Louboutins N Jimmy Choos. 

Line can be crazy at times so get in "Formation" while bumpin Beyonce with your most Vogue Skimpy Outfit on and get ready to Work Work Work Work Work and Slay All Day, Okay, Slay!!!

-Damn ChauTime Back At It Again!!!
author: Peter C.

description:
Guess everyone else had the same idea to get some cold boba on a nice SF day. I got the horchata which was pretty good. The drink wasn't took heavy and tasted light. There was a good hint of cinnamon and I enjoyed it with a book at Dolores Park. 

Overall, it was good. Not as good as the Strawberry Matcha I had last time though. I would totally recommend that one.
author: Sophia Y.

description:
Oh my gosh ! That line !
We were visiting from La and had seen Boba Guys all over Instagram so decided to seek them out.  We were at the MOMA & there was one about a mile or so away.  When we got there the line was so long ! We waited 30 minutes but they must've been good if everyone was waiting too right !? 


The shop was so small that there was really no place for anyone to wait inside.  I ordered the strawberry matcha latte which is a matcha latte with strawberry purée !!  Yum!

I also ordered my friend a Matchata which is a matcha latte with their homemade Horchata.  I love it !  Their matcha lattes are not very sweet but great quality and flavor .

I will seek them out if I'm ever in town again or hopefully they'll come to La
author: Sydney S.

description:
I am not a huge fan of boba drinks however every once in awhile I'll make an exception.  I was craving something refreshing after dinner and a boba drink seemed to fit the bill. 

I had the matcha set at medium sweet with boba. The boba are very soft/chewy, not at all like the stuff you get from the average Tpumps or what have you. The flavor isn't too in-your-face, some may think it's too light or watered down however this is how I prefer it. But if you're looking for 50+ sweet fruit flavors, I don't think the Boba Guys is what you're looking for. 

The shop is pretty small with about 3 stools alongside the windows so hopefully you'll catch them at an off time. I've seen the place both empty and have seen the queue trailing out the store for several meters so it's hard to predict when a "good time" to stop by would be. 

I never usually finish these boba drinks however I somehow managed to finish my matcha boba. I considered buying their mason jar cup with the aardvark logo (adorbs) but decided against it when I remembered I have a box of a dozen mason jars at home sitting somewhere in my cupboards.
author: Esther A.

description: Boba has great texture and consistency and the matcha/strawberry with almond milk is phenomenal. Expect a wait, especially at this location.
author: Melody T.

description:
Great quality which is good but in terms of flavor... it's okay. 
Boba is chewy and yummy though. I like how they use good products. 
There's just too many boba places but if I'm nearby, I'll get some.
author: Claire J.

description:
Someone needs to explain to me why my coworkers and friends take Uber just to come to this place because I don't understand the hype. When I came here, the line was out the door but the store was very helpful and had a huge pamphlet that you could flip through while you are waiting in line so you can see what kind of gimmick they use to attract their customers. (As an example of what a gimmick is, iTea uses unnecessary loud banging noises to trick customers into thinking that they're doing some magical technique to make their drinks taste better when they're really just dissolving the powder.)

In this case, they don't use powder, they use syrup. (Which is actually much better than powder, admittedly.) They also make their own "housemade" syrup which um, just tastes like regular maple syrup.

My friend and I ordered the regular milk tea and Hong Kong milk tea. 
Regular milk tea tasted like mostly milk with a hint of tea; the HK milk tea tasted like 90% condensed milk and 10% tea. 

They claim to use quality ingredients which is why they charge a ridiculous price of $5 for a large drink (which I would not mind paying if it really did taste like a $5 drink) but I'm guessing they just don't know how to use those quality ingredients properly to make a decent drink. Not the workers' faults because their employees are amazing, but otherwise, someone please explain the hype to me. 

Sorry, wallet. Sorry, stomach.

The boba itself was actually pretty good though.
author: Lawrence K.

description:
Great boba, guys.  I really enjoyed my milk tea here! The tea was strong and the boba was the right consistency.  It must be the "premium tea" and "high end milk" they keep bragging about.

The space is pretty small, just 3 bar seats facing the window so it definitely seems more like a grab-and-go type of place.

PS, you can order a "serving" of almond jelly if that's what you're into.
author: Alison L.

description:
We wanted boba/PMT while in the SF area, and we had all heard of Boba Guys before so we thought to give it a try. Luckily, there wasn't much of a line when we entered, though one formed as soon as we got our drinks. The store is pretty small so don't be too daunted by the line going out the store!

The interior was clean and modern. We had a hard time deciding which drinks to get because we had heard so much about which ones were good! To be able to get a taste of what they were, I decided to get their classic milk tea. It ended up tasting sort of...bland. The tea could definitely be brewed stronger as I could hardly taste it. The pearls did not live up to standard. Some of them were hard and even the chewier ones had hard centers. Did not live up to the hype!! My friend's muscat oolong was the same way, and way too sweet for me at 75%.

The person taking my order was nice and made sure that I would get what I wanted. My drink also came out super fast. The store was marketing itself as having high class, special blend teas when I could hardly even taste it. It felt like it was hopping on the boba trend and trying to turn it hip and trendy whilst not paying attention to their drinks. I would come back maybe one more time if I find myself in the area to try their matcha latte, but it's not worth a trip especially with so many other places closer to South Bay.
author: Jessica L.

description: This place is just really aesthetically pleasing. The boba here is actually pretty good too, but I don't think it would be worth let's say a 30+ minutes wait. I would definitely recommend this Boba shop for anyone who is visiting San Francisco and likes to explore the boba industry and take a nice picture for their social media. Parking might be a hassle though since it's street. Come in, get your boba and take a pic.
author: Jonaly N.

description: I am a boba aficionado. This boba is the best I've ever had. I got the decaf lavender black tea 25% sugar. Had it after my dinner at Foreign Cinema. Beyond delicious.
author: Amanda W.

description:
First off, I'm not a huge milk tea fan. I LOVE BOBA and I love tea, but I don't usually drink it with milk. Boba Guys will be my only exception. You can adjust sweetness level, ice level, and most importantly you can choose what kind of milk you want. You can choose between fresh milk, soy milk, and almond milk. Having soy milk and almond milk definitely helps take away my milk anxieties.

As for toppings, they have boba, almond jelly and grass jelly I believe. I only tried the boba. It was super good, tasted like little gummies and super fresh. However, I did notice that they did harden a bit faster than other bobas, but if you drink your drink fast it shouldn't be a problem. 

Also they have strawberry matcha, as all you Yelpers can see, this item is not shown on the menu.. I wonder if there are any more "secret" items? :P
author: Samantha P.

description: Overrated, pricier than any average boba drink  but the drinks are very flavorful. The boba is not as soft and plump as tpumps boba pearls per say. I would say this place is a choice to try atleast for the hyped experience.
author: Stacey M.

description: Strawberry matcha latte, that's all you need to get! Absolutely the best drink, perfect combination of sweetness from the strawberry purée and enough matcha flavor where it's not watered down! Oh yeah, add the boba, it's also fresh and delicious! The line also moves surprisingly quick!
author: Stella J.

description:
I forgot to update this review! 

Boba Guys may have had a slow start but I love this place. Favorites are the Indian Chai with Almond Jelly and Tapioca and Black Milk Tea, and the Matcha Almond Latte (or Matcha Strawberry). Although everything is good (except I'm not a huge fan of the HK milk and the Thai Tea - too sweet). 

I love that they offer Califia Farms Almond Milk. Pro tip - ask for it less sweet I go for 25-50% depending on what I order. 

Make sure to try their homemade almond jelly!

Pro-tip: Get the Hong Kong toast is served on thick cut brioche bread and topped with a heavenly condensed milk cream spread and honey.
author: Jess C.

description:
Definitely one of the better boba drink places around. 

I've tried the strawberry fresca jasmine tea, classic milk tea, jasmine milk tea, and lychee green tea. All were good except for the lychee green tea... there was no lychee flavor and tasted a little weird... Definitely try their milk tea drinks instead. You can adjust the sweetness level as well. 

Their most popular drinks are the classic milk tea and jasmine milk tea. This place won't disappoint. I also love their homemade almond jelly topping! Add this to your drink! (+50c)
author: Kimberly H.

description:
The quality of the boba drinks here are so good. I've tried their Earl Gray Milk tea and Matcha green tea both with honey pearls and both times have been very consistent with service and the chewiness of the pearls. The only downside is that their drinks are a little bit on the pricier side-- about 4-5 bucks a drink BUT the fact that they use quality ingredients such as strauss organic milk and freshly brewed tea to handcraft your drink is definitely something to consider than using powder and condensed milk. You can also customize how sweet you want it as well! I still have yet to try their snacks here, although they do look somewhat promising.

There isn't much seating here, just four stools by the window and plenty of standing room. They win me over their giant flask of water and other science-y things laying around.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
Mixed reviews for this place so I will give my two cents as well...

The Bad:

1) No more ice matcha latte on a Saturday afternoon. One would think you would be fully stocked on the weekend especially SATURDAY!!!
2) Lackluster pearl drinks.
3) Slow much??? There was not even a line. 

The REALLY BAD:

1) You know it was awfully bad when your WHITE boy think it's bad.
2) The classic and the jasmine milk tea was bland, watery, and tasteless. Why are you skimping on the ice? 
3) Real tea, not powder forms please!

Dear Boba Guys,

Please keep your balls together. You left me underwhelmed with your over-hyped pearl drinks to only be in the trash halfway finish. I always finish my pearl drinks, but not this time. What a shame.
author: Owie N.

description:
What's the difference between Wonderful Foods, TeaWay and Purple Cow? 

I have NO IDEA.

Boba Guys trumps all the others. I already pay $3+ at any other bubble tea shop and they're usually filled with lines of teenagers. This place has homemade jellies, boba pearls and the best of all - horchata milk tea! I like the hipster vibe. It's probably not for everyone but for someone who spends a lot of time in both the Mission and Richmond district, I love it.
author: Samantha L.

description: First time visiting - it's fast and good, but not best. Ordered the Hong Kong Milk Tea and it doesn't have quite enough of the 'tea' flavor or taste.
author: Logan K.

description:
The best part about this place is there is no powder mix. The tea is actually brewed loose leaf. 

Hypes:
- Boba - Theres something about their boba that is magical and different. The texture, the perfect amount of sweetness...its good
- Jelly - Grass jelly is good
- I had the coconut green tea with milk and 50% sweetness. WOW. Something I wish I had more of after i was slurping my straw at the end for more. 
- Black milk tea also is a hit
- You can choose your amount of sweetness in quarter percentages (i'd go with 25 or 50)

Gripes:
- Sounds good, but honestly wasn't a fan of the almond jelly. Don't fall for the reviews...its really not all that
author: Shaila S.

description:
I'm pretty health conscious so I struggle with treating myself to boba - except at Boba Guys. No artificial ingredients, no powder, no fructose. Just the finest ingredients and you can really taste the difference.

Simply put, Boba Guys serves the best boba I've ever had. Once you try it, you will have a hard time getting boba anywhere else again. The service is fast, the price is worth it, and the quality is second to none!

Boba Guys' slogan is "serving the highest quality bubble milk tea in the world." They're right.

How to order:
1) Pick your drink
2) Pick your temp (iced or hot)
3) Pick your size (16 oz. or 24 oz.)
4) Pick your topping (tapioca balls, almond jelly, or grass jelly)
5) Pick your milk (organic, almond, or soy)
6) Pick your sweetness (100%, 75%, 50%, 25%, or 0%)
7) Become addicted!
author: Jordan H.

description: Boba Guys is my San Francisco favorite! Located in the Mission district, I stop by here every time I go to this shop filled area. While it doesn't have a lot of seating and usually a long line out the door, it is worth the wait. They offer almond milk for those who can't take lactose, and you can vary the sweetness as well. It is not only extremely customizable, but delicious as well.
author: Tooka Z.

description:
I've went here a few times. The milk tea is good. But the last time I went the worker who made mines put a big thick piece of ice, I couldn't even put my straw through. I had to ask them to put new ice. The worker laughed at me. I kinda got put off from the place. 

Also if you want lots of ant eater merchandise that's the place to go to.
author: Sareen K.

description: One of the boba places in SF. My favorite one is the Thai iced tea. There's a reason why there's always a line.
author: Zuki G.

description:
One of the best boba spots out there! They use Strauss milk in their milk teas and they do not use powder. I got the iced matcha latte in the 24oz cup which was $4.95! It's steep compared to other boba places but trust me, it's worth it! 

I came in at around 3pm on a weekday and it wasn't too busy. Total wait time was probably 3minutes. I recommend to everyone to get 50% sweetness for any drink because 100% is compared to soda (according to the workers).
author: Michelle T.

description:
My favorite boba joint to date!

Their menu offers a variety of teas, but it's not so extensive that indecisive people like me get perplexed just looking at it. I usually go for the more "traditional" teas like Jasmine and Earl Grey, but I love their Horchata and Lavender Black as well! I LOVE that they use real, loose-leaf teas. I also appreciate that they use real milk and even offer dairy-free options for the lactose intolerant who still want to enjoy milk tea. Their drinks taste freshly made and high quality. 
They are also one of the few places I've found that offer almond pudding (house made) as one of their toppings. If you enjoy almond pudding like I do, definitely give it a try with your drink here! I really love it in my Jasmine Milk Tea.
If you're a milk tea connoisseur, this place is DEFINITELY worth checking out!
author: Carole Y.

description:
My first time trying Boba Guys and it was great! I went on a Sunday afternoon around 4pm. The line was out the door but it was worth the wait. Their ingredients are hand crafted, and the quality is impeccable. 

My drink: 
I got the Coffee Milk tea with almond milk, 25% sweetness and boba. And it was perfection. 

Ambiance: 
Fresh white paint and earthy tones give this environment an openness (which is needed because it's small). It was a bit warm inside but with the door open and the large windows, it helped minimized the stuffiness. 

My experience: 
I met the manager while ubering (she was my rider) and she was sweet as pie!! Her staff were very customer-oriented, conscientious, and professional. All in all, I'd go back again.
author: Stephanie A.

description:
5 stars for the boba, 3 stars for the drink. So i guess it evens out to 4 stars lol. 

I ordered the HK Style Milk Tea with boba because I heard great things about it on yelp. The milk tea was not bad but still bland. I like my milk tea strong, and this tea was very watered down and too sweet even at 75% sweetness level. It wasn't bad but it's not really something I'd order again. 

I'll be back for the boba and to try a different drink next time.
author: Destynnie T.

description: I was pleasantly surprised by Boba Guys today- I got the iced matcha latte with organic milk, 50% sweetness and honey boba. It wasn't overly sweet and the boba had a good texture. Drink wasn't powdery and tea flavor was strong. I thoroughly enjoyed my drink, and in my opinion it may be even better than Half & Half in LA. My fiance got the rose milk tea, and we were also pleased with his drink. Worth checking out if you're in the Mission!
author: Jessica Y.

description:
I've been to two different locations and this one had quite a wait. But the line moves pretty quickly. I feel like the milk tea itself is pretty standard, nothing too special and actually lacking a bit in flavor...

What stands out for me is how chewy and perfect the boba is. None of that soggy or hard tapioca here! But they're prices are higher than most places so it's up to you to decide if it'd be worth it. I personally would like some better milk tea first since the boba is only an addition.
author: Liza X.

description:
I think I've been spoiled by all the boba selection in Socal D:

Since it was my first time, I went with the regular Jasmine Milk Tea. The tea here was good quality and had a fresh taste but didn't really leave an impression in terms of flavor or novelty. 

Props for good hype and marketing though!

*Also parking is a struggggle because the area has lots of shops and restaurants around (but then again where in SF is it easy to park haha)
author: Amanda K.

description:
$8 for two cups of disappointment. Wah wah wahhhh.

Now, I'm not a boba snob by any means, but I'm gonna try to stay away from this location from now on. My last visit here was mediocre and unsatisfying to say the least. 

I've tried two items at this location:

+ Jasmine milk tea, iced with whole milk, 50% sweetness, $3.50
+ Classic milk tea, iced with almond milk, 50% sweetness, $3.50

Boba texture was inconsistent throughout both drinks--- a mad turn off for me. While some of the balls were good, others were disgustingly hard to chew. I was a bit confused. Were the bobaristas just having a bad day, or are the boba gods just testing me?

I also found the flavor of the Classic Milk Tea boring and a little G rated. I was expecting a more potent black tea sensation to seduce and satiate my olfactory receptors then cleanse and caress my taste buds, but nope. My drink was super watery and I could barely taste the tea -_- 

To make matters worse, there were little pieces of almond jelly floating around my drink that did not belong there. It didn't really do much for the taste but it did look reaaally weird, like tiny flakes of dandruff. Who wants to see dandruff in their boba drink? Surely, not I. And once again, I fall into a state of disappointed confusion. Why boba guys, why.

The jasmine on the other hand was very fragrant and floral, and although it still tasted a bit watered down, I enjoyed it way more than the Classic. Not sure if there were any rogue almond jelly pieces in this drink though because the milk may have camouflaged it. 

The good:

*Thumbs up for organic milk and customization options! Not many boba places offer soy/almond milk swatches. 

*Pretty quick service! It gets pretty busy here but you'll get your drink in less than ten minutes.

The bad:

*Claustrophobes beware. Not very roomy inside.

*Inconsistent boba. Some chewy, some hard, some inedible. 

*Poor overall drink quality. I didn't ask for almond jelly, yet pieces of it still managed to find its way into my drink. Whaddahail.


*Oh and good luck finding parking, ha.


The end:


I was ready to fall in love with you, Boba Guys. But the chemistry was just not there.  Whatevs. To play it safe next time I'll be going to the Union Square location instead. Peaaace.
author: Noimee L.

description: I was visiting SF from SoCal & i love iced coffee. BUT this has to be the BEST iced coffee I've ever had! It was AMAZING! The staff was super friendly and gave suggestions on what to order. They explained what ingredients were included in their drinks. I still dream of this iced coffee haha too bad SF is so far from LA . Most memorable part was when they asked for my name, Dalila, pronounced (Delilah) hard to spell- I get it has happened all my life- but the barista got creative & spelled it *Delight-la
author: Dalila B.

description: Came here with friends on a saturday night. Drinks are always better for to-go. The place is pretty small with at least 4-5 high chairs. Few flavors to choose from. Superb boba and long-line is always expected.
author: Rj M.

description: I love boba guys because they serve quality tea using local, organic ingredients! Be prepared to wait - there is almost always a line, especially on the weekends. Your drink is fully customizable. You can adjust sweetness levels too. I often get the HK style milk tea with 25% sweetness, which is just honey. Add boba! They also have housemate grass jelly. YUM!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Oh man...I wish they would open one of these in SoCal! I'm so glad I made the drive out here despite the traffic and parking because I love some good boba.
I got the muscat oolong  milk tea with almond jelly (75% sweet). It was a really amazing combination :) And quite different- I've never had muscat (grapes) in milk tea before. They also make their almond jelly and grass jelly in house which makes it extra amazing. I also tried their jasmine milk tea with boba that was pretty yummy. The boba is perfectly soft and chewy. I appreciate that they use high quality teas and milks (organic). The only reason I had to knock it down a star is because I didn't like the regular (black) milk tea very much. It tasted bland and watery to me. But overall, a great boba place. I want to try the whole menu 0_o
author: Tiffany O.

description:
Dude. Boba (+1). Chewy.


Price: Typical for boba. Look to spend about $4 a cup.

Parking: Street metered parking.... $0.10 per minute. Dang. Good luck.

Service: We waited about 20 minutes for our order of 4 drinks. They also messed up on my drink so I waited another 5 for them to fix it. They were very apologetic about it though.

Food: I personally don't like my drinks sweet so I ordered it with no sweetness. My friends ordered theirs with minimal sweetness, but it was still hella sweet. The drinks were tasty at first, but we all couldn't finish it by the end and felt nauseous. 

Notes: parking sux. They offer different types of milk (+1) and exotic flavors of tea (+1).

Overall: I probably wouldn't come here again. I'd like to try the other boba places and hopefully won't feel like barfing.
author: Krystle T.

description:
OMG I LOVE BOBA GUYS! At first I was really skeptical about trying it, because I heard it was an American boba shop and I mean, boba didn't come from America... But I heard so much about Boba Guys that I was like "I've gotta try it" and I am so so so freaking glad that I did!

As a Norcal native who's going to college in Socal and who's extremely addicted to boba, I've tried pretty much ALL the boba shops in California (message me to talk boba). And if I had to narrow it down, I would put Boba Guys in my top 5. They make their drinks with Strauss milk.... AKA the best milk in the world AKA the expensive milk in the glass bottles at Whole Foods. Their milk tea is so so so milky which I love and their boba has the perfect consistency.

Beware of the long lines, however the service is fast and their staff is extremely friendly! :) I will definitely come back next time I'm home and try their other drinks.
author: Chanel H.

description: It's everyone in my party's first time at Boba Guys, so had to make the stop here while in the area. This one is a tiny location, but line went by fairly quick. You probably can't go wrong with any of the boba options, but a popular one is the Strawberry Green Tea Latte ($4.25). Think of a strawberry paleta for the creamy flavor and pretty colors of the drink. Get your drinks with 25-50% sweetness unless you want diabetes. They also have non-dairy options like almond milk and oat milk (they newest alternative --pretty neat formula as I've learned from an employee at another location).
author: Cindy Z.

description:
Good things are things like laying in warm sheets out of the dryer. Playing with puppies. Enjoying the sun on a wonderful Sunday on a summer afternoon. Bad things may include things like laughing at funerals, not telling your friends when they have stuff stuck in their teeth and never changing the batteries in the remote control and waiting for someone else to do it because you're too lazy. 

Drinking Boba guys before a volleyball game is in the middle. I'm really spoiled. I'm from southern California, my entire family is from Hong Kong/Malaysia and having spent lots of summers in Hong Kong/Singapore, the best boba is back there. Their boba is good-- probably really good, but it's a little pricey for just boba and probably not the best before a volleyball game (milk was a bad choice). 

A small part of me dies when I'm submitted to expensive boba, so I took off a star. And I reaffirmed my decision in taking off a star when I remembered how long the line was.
author: Lai-Nin W.

description:
I've been drooling over pictures that I had seen of Boba Guys milk tea before I had even tried it. Being from Seattle I dreamt of trying it and now that I live in the Bay those dreams came true. 

This place did not disappoint. The way they make their milk tea is an art. I got a classic milk tea and it was the best milk tea I've had. Not too sweet and also great tea flavor.

If you haven't tried this place yet and you're dreaming about it like I was...don't worry...your dream will come true some day too. And it will totally live up to the hype.
author: Derek C.

description:
I'm bubble tea spoiled. Southern California has some serious competition for boba. When I moved to San Francisco my quest for boba went something not at all like this:

Wandering, wandering nightmarishly the streets, onlookers glancing and turning away, focusing instead on their soggy mission style burritos. Perhaps assuming my staggering stride the result of drunkenness at best, and perhaps an indication of something darker. A flagging of unwholesome stock that, though they may have tried, could never grasp the joys of yet another conference dominated by talks given by sales persons. Grim grey-yellow circles beneath my eyes. a hollow, raspy breath. An occasional moan escaping parched lips..."where is my boba?" "Where is my milk tea?" 

Finally, down a relatively quiet offshoot from the rush of Valencia, a sign. Small and cramped, easy to miss were it not for the 15 minute line out the door. The mysterious /Orycteropus afer/ or aardvark; a nocturnal beast native to the African continent. Whose carcass, when properly prepared, is said to grant the ability to pass through walls in the night, and perhaps lead knowing of more powerful mysteries.

I peered deeply into the glass wall, allowing my eyes to focus on  a small counter, too small to be very practical, and a very few scattered bar stools. Then, hope! A sudden beating in my once hollow heart. By Jove! at least eight kinds of tea, many fruity, all with options to adjust sweetness. Then I recoiled in horror...the prices...twice the cost in my former homeland! I recoiled, yet the landscape was barren for other options. The aardvark peered down at me modeling what to do. His sticky tongue darting long into the glass.  I too stood. I joined in the line, behind the many other hopeful seekers. Waiting, waiting for the fleshy yielding of the dark black tapioca balls as they roll, plump and promising, finally to be violated by teeth, swallowed, and then seen no more. The milky, viscus liquid cool and sweet..I wait, I wait, "Boba! Boba! Cthulhu R'lyeh!"
author: Charlotte B.

description:
I happened to run into this Boba Guys location on the way to Dolores Park and had to grab a drink.  

This time I tried a simple classic: Jasmine Milk Tea with boba.  You can usually tell if a milk tea place is good if their jasmine milk tea is good... and this place is good.  I'm still a bigger fan of Ashas (has an SF and Berkeley location) but Boba Guys is always a great idea if you're in the neighborhood.   

I had a sip of my friend's coffee milk tea.  I thought it tasted good, but wouldn't choose that drink here.  There's much more interesting and better tasting drinks.  

If you want something super Instagrammable and yummy, I highly suggest the matcha latte with strawberry and boba.
author: Shannon L.

description: Service really fast nice staff and flavorful drinks thumbs up for the Horchata Milk I Love it.
author: Sherisa W.

description:
Trying really hard to think of a boba place that I would prefer over this in the Bay Area and not a single place comes to mind.

I've only been here once, ordered one drink, and it has already found its place as one of the best boba spots I have ever been to!

I had a hard time deciding what to order since everything looked amazing, and finally decided on the coconut green milk tea, with almond jelly and 75% sweetness. This was the perfect level of creaminess and sweetness! Anyone who loves coconut milk will definitely enjoy this drink. The flavor is not artificial at all and their almond jelly is super smooth and not overwhelmingly flavored. 

Definitely want to come back and try all their other drinks!
author: Joanne Y.

description:
To be honest, what first caught my eye was the armadillo sign. Who associates armadillos with boba? Stop by here and you will! My husband and I were exploring the area, and since he loves boba and milk teas, we decided to give it a try. Plus, it was a warm Sunday afternoon. The shop has a clever set-up to keep the lines neat and to separate the entrance and exit lines. We got in JUST before a large rush of people and it only took about 5 minutes for our drink to be ready. Very fast service!
