The sleek logo gave way to a very clean, white (almost bathroom-like), no-frills interior with some wood trim. There were a few seats at a bar along the wall/window, but it looked like the majority of customers were of the "grab-and-go" mindset.

What I loved:
-The guy taking our order helped us through the various options, such as size, tea, add-ins, etc.
-He gave us a free sample of the house-made almond jelly.  It was UNREAL.  You must try it! With its pure, strong flavor, it reminded me of exactly what almond extract should taste like.
-You can choose the sweetness of your drink to fit your liking!

The scoop: Fast and tasty with staff who are willing to help you make decisions!  Try the house-made almond jelly!!
author: Carlye M.

description: Best boba place, easily. Lines get long and go out the door, but that's totally expected. There are so many cool and creative flavors; I've tried the lavender black tea w/ milk as well as the lychee green tea w/ milk. The grass jelly and almond jelly are made in-house and the tapioca is grade A. All of them are fantastic. I also love that you can customize the sweetness and ice in the teas as well.
author: Katherine Z.

description:
My friends and I were in Mission, and decided to stop by Boba Guys for bubble tea. I've heard there is always a line, but on this visit, which just happened to be the night of SantaCon, we were the only ones at and inside the door. 

There is a "bar" near the window with a few stools, but other than that, this is not a sit-down place. Unless you're tired, I'm not sure why you'd be sitting down here when you could be window-shopping on Mission, though. Since the place was a desert, the three of us sat at the bar and talked. There is a beverage dispenser of water with cups and extra simple syrup to sweeten your drinks. 

FYI: There is no restroom. 

Overall, this is a good place for bubble tea in Mission.
author: Jen B.

description: I love this place! The boba here is amazing. There are sometimes long lines, but not always. The staff are very friendly. It is a little bit expensive, but worth it. I love ordering the rose tea, with extra boba. I would totally recommend this place.
author: Summer B.

description:
I've tried the other Boba Guys place (the one on Stockton St.) and I have to say I prefer that one more. 

This place is so small, it doesn't have any seating area. The other place was slightly bigger with a few chairs. 

The pearls at any BG is the BEST though! Best texture (firm and chewy) out of any PMT place. Sadly, I couldn't give it 5 stars because my matcha latte wasn't mixed at all (the sugar syrup was at the bottom) and the dirty horchata was so bitter. It didn't even taste like horchata anymore. 

I love their idea though with the organic milk and clean products. Definitely worth a try in SF! Go to the other one (approx. 1 mile away) if you can...I've also seen the co-founder/business owner at the other one and he was so nice!
author: Ranice L.

description:
My relationship with my Boba Guys drink was positively correlated: the more I drank the drink, the more I liked it.

I guess that's like some of my relationships with people. Don't worry, I'm not a vampire...I think.

I can't quite recall what specific drink I had--perhaps their $4.50 (?) INDIAN CHAI (??)--but it was freshly-brewed in front of me on what they term their "slow bar." The tea is tasty, but they're way too generous with their ice, so much so that I had to ask them to remove a chunk for me because it was just getting all up in my boba business.

Irritating ice aside, Boba Guys' tapioca pearls are definitely the best I've had. I've stopped consuming chewy balls, for health reasons (don't even), but I would make an exception for Boba Guys' balls.

I just like saying that. ;)
author: Adele F.

description:
I'm excited that a Boba Guys location opened up closer to where I live. The other one is too far away! Or maybe I'm just spoiled. Anyways, I cannot resist a pit stop for boba when I'm taking a walk in the area. The line gets long pretty fast, but it's a small place so most people just grab and go so it's not too crowded. Plus there are a ton of unique menu items so you will have plenty of time to decide what you really want.

I settled on the Hong Kong style milk tea with boba. Tasty. Fresh. Sweet. Everything you could want in a good milk tea. The service is good, and the atomsphere is super hip. The wait in line is always more bearable with good music in the background! Anyways, I had a little taste of the beverages that my friends got, and everything seems delicious. My boyfriend got the coffee milk tea with boba... the boba ended up tasting like coffee. That was awesome.

I still cannot figure out the Boba Guys animal mascot... how peculiar.
author: Stefanie C.

description: The Boba Guys here is awesome!Today I got the Thai tea and it was so good with the grass jelly.I would recommend it to people who like boba and the customer service is good because they are kind.I really like boba and they took it to the next level.Their space is small but there are lots of people.Its good!
author: Justin H.

description: hmmm... i forgot what i ordered. But the drink was A-ok, nothing different from all the boba places. Friendly staff.
author: Maridel A.

description: GRADE A Balls for sure. Horchata boba is a must. The boba is warm and whatever drink you choose will be made to your specifications.
author: Caleb S.

description: Best milk tea in the town! I have tried basically every milk tea shop in SF and Boba guys is the best one. The sweetness is just right and you can taste the delicacy of both the milk and the tea. House milk tea is my favorite but other drinks I've tried are also decent. I would also recommend the handmade pineapple cake .
author: Lorenzo M.

description: The jasmine milk tea and matcha latte with normal sweetness are both my favorites! Although every time I order a drink they always taste a little different, I wish there was a little more consistency in how sweet the drinks are. But they do seem nice enough to adjust drinks (I just never stick around to do it because it tends to be crowded)! Anyways, love boba guys and will continue to support!
author: Jenny E.

description:
I love Boba Guys! I just wish they were located in a better neighborhood with better parking. 

It's really funny for me to say that one of my favorite drinks here is the Hong Kong Milk Tea (besides the Matcha Tea Latte). I was born and raised in Hong Kong so I find it sad or amazed that the Hong Kong Milk Tea here is legit. They really got their recipe right because it tastes like home. I was very hesitant to try it because can a hipster/American boba shop really make great Hong Kong Milk Tea? Boy, was I wrong... Maybe it doesn't tastes exactly like the ones in Hong Kong since I haven't been back in a long time, but it's surely close enough for me.

Overall, don't be afraid to try new drinks! I highly recommend the Hong Kong Milk Tea and the Matcha Tea Latte! They are both great drinks. I do recommend the Coffee Milk Tea if you really love the coffee taste.
author: Wendy Y.

description:
I love their tea here!

My favorite tea would probably be their signature classic milk tea. I normally don't like milk tea because it's too sweet but their mixture here was surprisingly perfect.

Customer service was on point. There were no lines when I went so my order was taken immediately. Waited a couple minutes for my order and got it.

Would love to come back again! I suggest trying their specials.
author: Aj C.

description:
The line here is pretty long on the weekends. On a Sunday afternoon, we had to wait about 15-20 minutes in a line that went out the door. I've been to the Boba Guys in New York, and thought that it was a bit overrated and expensive. This location is marginally cheaper (by about 50 cents) and is better than the NYC location.

I got the iced matcha latte at about half sugar. It had a good matcha flavor and texture, but was still a bit sweet, so I probably could've gone with about 25% sugar. The tapioca was the perfect consistency for me -- very chewy without being soft.

Boba Guys is always consistent in its very good quality. If you have the time and money to spare, it's a good bubble tea option, but it's not worth the 30 minute wait!
author: Stephanie H.

description:
**BOBA PRINCESS APPROVED**

Good Milk Tea & Boba Quality (Grade A): CHECK
Reasonable Prices (~$4 per drink w/topping):  CHECK
FAST and FRIENDLY Service: CHECK
Great Location: NO, worst ghetto neighborhood ever
Decent Ambiance: Half Check

TIPS:
+ Organic Milk Teas! Ask for less sweet
+ Must try tapioca pearls- they're perfect little balls of divinity 
+ Cash or Card accepted
+ NO Rewards/Stamp Card Available
+ To-go boba shop, no space to sit/enjoy

[[INTRO/LOCATION]]
I had a long day working in SF and just ate a mediocre dinner at Akiko's-- I needed boba dessert! Boba Guys has been on my radar for quite a while, so CARPE DIEM! My biggest woe was that I circled around the one-way 19th and 20th streets for 15+ minutes to find parking. I mean literally every nook and cranny were taken up. I parked on a curb not so legally...and just ran inside to grab my boba fix. The neighborhood isn't pretty either. I went around 7PM but I would not stay here when the sun sets...it looks completely muggy and robby. 

[[AMBIANCE]]
There were about 6-8 people inside the boba shop which made it way too crowded. I was getting claustrophobic. They have a few chairs around with a counter top but it's by no means an enjoyable atmosphere to relax at. The vibe is modern trendy with their minimalistic and hipster decorations. Their menu is limited but only to keep the quality of their products. So don't expect a 100+ items menu like TapEx haha, they only have the basics- classic milk tea, green, Thai, taro, etc.

[[MILK TEAS]]
Their organic teas are authentic. It mirrored Ten Ren's taste and quality which impressed me greatly. I opted for the regular sweetness since I wanted to taste how they originally made it- big mistake. Both the Classic Milk Tea and especially the Thai Tea were wayyy too sweet, and I like Dr. Pepper so my sweet palate is already pretty high bar. 

[[BOBA PEARLS]]
However, their boba pearls were cooked to perfection. You must try it. There is a difference between OVERCOOKED and Perfectly Cooked pearls-- Boba Guys does it right! If the pearls were overcooked, you would taste a soggy, fuzzy texture surrounding the core of the tapioca pearls before you bite into it. There would be a clear difference in textures of the outer vs inner layer of the balls. Perfectly cooked pearls are soft and chewy and with each bite, the texture is always consistent from the outer layer to the inner layer. 

Thumb rule about boba pearls: If your tongue is confused by the texture, it's overcooked. If your tongue is soothed by the consistent soft, chewy texture through each bite, it's perfectly cooked.
author: Donna T.

description:
Heirloom muscat oolong boba tea?  What?!?!  Sign me up.  

Hold the milk and sugar.  Amazingly refreshing for boba tea.  Loved the subtle muscat flavors.  Check the mason jars for sale.  Super cute with the little anteater on the side, of course.  

Next time, I would prob opt for half the boba.  Super filling after dinner.
author: Cynthia C.

description:
What's so special? I'm not a fan of boba in general since it's just tea and milk. This was no different. They use high quality ingredients (Straus Organic Milk, Oat Milk, soy milk, almond milk) but it still tastes... exactly like what I can make at home. I acknowledge that their tapioca balls/glass jelly are special but the rest is pretty standard. 
Also they don't carry nonfat milk - they only have half and half that they use for all their drinks. -1 star for this and I don't understand why they can't carry other varieties of milk.
author: Melody L.

description: Creative flavors and toppings. Love the ability to choose sweetness level. We got a hot classic and it was hot and classic.
author: Carl B.

description: I don't know what happened, but it's definitely not as good as it used to be. They've become inconsistent. Their horchata (my old favorite) has tasted off the past two times I ordered it. Just didn't have enough spice to it or something so I took it back and had them replace it with Jasmine milk tea which was decent. I'm still a fan of their actual boba, but sad to say the quality has gone down. I expect more especially if I'm paying over $4 for a drink. Good service though. I appreciate that they've replaced my drink every time I wasn't satisfied with no questions asked.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
The hype is real and the line is worth the wait.  I'm usually just a simple regular jasmine milk tea with no toppings or passion/lychee or strawberry mango with real fruit buts kinda gal.  We literally buy milk tea every week sometimes 3 times starting from Friday - Sunday and sometimes it can come out to be as muchh as a car payment per month!    I don't like to try anything new or any other flavors but these below is purdyyyy GOOD!

Matcha tea 
Strawberry matcha
Thai tea

All YUMZ and all natural and organic is such a plus!!!
They even ask you what kind of milk you want - regular, low fat or soy milk too!

Love!
author: Jennie D.

description:
I am absolutely obsessed with this place. To be honest, I went here when they first opened a couple years ago and was not impressed. Fast forward to today, and I can't get enough.They have a good tea selection for you to choose from, and their drinks are made fresh to order.  I'm a regular tea drinker, and noticed their tea quality definitely improved since when they first opened. I LOVE the fact that you can choose your milk (regular, soy or almond) at no extra charge, and that you can choose your sweetness level. I usually prefer when my drink is less sweetened, but for some reason, I've become addicted to one of their specials... their strawberry matcha latte (which you can't adjust the sweetness level to). It uses fresh strawberry puree - you MUST try it!!!

I can't speak for the toppings since I've never added them to my drinks, but my friends have had their tapioca balls and their house-made jellies and like them.
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
Boba Guys had me at "boba".  Came here on a recent trip to San Fran and I am in love.  This place is not your typical boba shop where drinks are heavily loaded with sugar and artificial flavors.  It's fresh brewed coffee and steamed tea.  I am an tea enthusiast and this makes me quite happy.  They have plenty of classic milk teas to choose from as well as premium milk teas.  I went with the lychee green tea bathed with almond jelly and of course, boba.  My boyfriend went with the matcha green tea with almond jelly.  Both were really delicious, however mine was more so due to the sweetness level.  

Boba guys allow you to choose your own sweetness level and the milk used for your drink; PERFECT.  However, what is not perfect is the size of this place and the parking issue.  This place is super tiny.  It is hard to maneuver around this place and it's very crowded.  Also, we paid $6 for an hour of parking and that's as much as our drink.
author: Sally H.

description:
You would think a shop called Boba Guys would get their balls right. Unfortunately, every mouthful was a surprise. Some were perfectly QQ (no, I'm not a fob) and some were way overcooked. Yikes!

Horchata with boba is probably the most *unique* drink here, because really, have you seen any other boba places with horchata? The drink itself was not bad, but it's not something I'd get again. It's definitely a "been there, done that" sort of thing. The Hong Kong Style Milk Tea with boba was better, but way too sweet! If possible, ask for less condensed milk.
author: Christine S.

description:
Since moving to the area, I have heard that Boba Guys is the best boba around. 

Pro:

-The tea itself is good, you can definitely taste the tea instead of the gross powder that some shops use in their milk tea. 

Con:

-Hour wait in line


Overall, the tea was good, but not amazing enough to be waiting an hour in line again for anytime soon! I recommend this place for those who like more creamy milk tea as opposed to a stronger tea tasting flavored milk tea.
author: Brittani C.

description: This place is nice, bigger. Service wasn't as the first time (the owner was at the other spot my first time and thus super impressed with his friendliness). Appreciated that they had a cover for the line on a rainy day. Tried their milk tea this time. Pretty good. The milk they use is just so so good. My friend's first time & she got the rose milk tea iced. It was good. I preferred it hot. I'd come back because I love boba! And this company does know how to make it!
author: Stephanie A.

description: stopped here twice while visiting San Fransisco -- very good beverages! tiny place, pretty cute. didn't wait very long for my drinks either time and they were reasonably priced.  the boba itself was chewy and delicioussss and i'll be back next time i'm in the area!
author: Sarah S.

description:
Good boba in SF!

PARKING: Street parking kinda sucks, we circled the streets like 3 times and couldn't find anything.  We ended up parking in a 15 minute meter area so it was enough to order and leave.

ATMOSPHERE: It reminds me of a hipster coffee shop and you can tell they put a lot of thought into their decor and how they brew their teas.  There's a small area to sit near the window but other than that it seems like most people get it to go and walk around.

FOOD: They have a lot of different milk teas to choose from and they describe the flavors of each one but I got the rose black tea, no milk and boba.

ROSE BLACK TEA - not as good as half and half because the rose flavor wasn't that prominent and the tea flavor lacking.  Maybe it was because it was black tea and normally I get green tea.  It wasn't too sweet though, which was good and I could tell it wasn't rose syrup.  The boba to tea ratio was also good - I didn't feel like there wasn't enough boba and each sip had at least 2 balls.

The boba is what made this 4 stars - it was chewy, slightly soft and sweet, perfect! Some of the better boba I've had in norcal.  

The teas do take a little longer to brew so we waited about 5 or so minutes.  You can also customize how sweet it is.

Overall, worth trying even though it's a little expensive but the boba is worth it.
author: Brittany T.

description:
So I was coming back from work and well Bart got stuck. So I got off and a friend was going to pick me up. I saw that boba guys was .3 miles away from me so I decided why not. I heard about boba guys before and wanted to try since last year but am never in the city. 

I got the jasmine milk tea with pearls and it was good! It wasn't as sweet as other places and I didn't even have to ask to reduce the sugar! I liked it a lot :D the pearls were chewy and delicious. One of the better ones that I've tried! I enjoyed my little adventure for sure. Plus the cashier was kinda cute so I gave him a tip lol the drink was $4

Def going back to try other flavors!
author: Lydia K.

description: Not sure how I never wrote a review for this Boba Guys, since I'm a regular here, but this is my favorite boba place in SF. The boba pearl here are consistently near perfect quality and the tea is amazing. Highly recommend if you haven't been!
author: Vasiliy M.

description:
3.5 but rounded-up.Size options, and wait times are the only downsides.

Not too bad of a place, just not worth the wait and hassle of finding a parking spot for.

As someone who's not from here, I'm not used to the small ass shops that can only fit a maximum of 5-6 people, and the hard to find parking (especially meters that charge $.25/cents for every 4 mins?!) for a boba place that serves a 16 oz as their "large" serving.

Ordered the Lychee green tea w/ boba and their house made almond jelly w/ 50% sweet I think. The drink itself was pretty good, and the boba was definitely not the best or worst I have tried, but still pretty good and chewy. For size though, (16oz)  it was about $5 or 6 (including toppings). I wish they had a bigger size!

Hong Kong toast was good. Tasted kind of like a French Toast w/ butter, cream and condensed milk I think? Goes pretty good with the drinks. 

Credit cards are taken, and service was friendly even though it took a while for them to take our order.
author: Rocky B.

description:
For the most part this place is pretty consistent. I've sometimes had waaaay too sweet drinks, and then when I ask for less sugar, they're like super watered down.

Favorites are Earl Grey from the slow bar, Matcha Green Tea Latte, and Jasmine Milk Tea. All delicioso! Sucks that this place is $5 a cup though :( They should consider doing a stamp card like Quickly's and all the other boba places!
author: Angela L.

description:
Finally, some accessible bubble tea in the city!  Only problem is that it is super busy so there is always a line!  Also, very very very limited space inside to hang out.  

I find a lot of their drinks way too sweet at the regular level of sweetness so I always order either half sweet or less sweet.  So definitely order at least half sweet if this is your first time around!  Besides, if you don't think it's sweet enough, you can always add some simple syrup to the tea afterwards.  The tapioca balls are the right consistency and delicious.  The best add-in though is definitely their homemade almond jello.  It's not too sweet and has a nice chewy fragrant consistency.  It's a perfect addition to a traditional milk tea.  I love that you can also order any of the drinks with soy milk instead for lactose-intolerant people.

The tea flavors are strong and good.  Coconut green tea was phenomenal and very refreshing.  I just wish they had more variety in what you can order.  There are some limited combinations and I'd love some more options--especially of the non-milky variety.

Also, they have the most awesome logo ever.  Duh.
author: Jess Y.

description:
Tea Quality: (5/5) The tea quality is high quality, you can count the individual tea particles on your tongue in every sip. The milk is organic, grassfed, massaged,  and mixes perfectly with the chilled tea, creating a mouthgasm that lasts for hours after you drink it.

Boba: (5/5) The boba is hype as balls. Perfect texture and firmness is obtained from delicate care in handling the tapioca pearls. Nothing more to say, just gooey delight.

Atmosphere: (4/5) The shop is really small in size, not much room for customers to sit, and the line usually stretches to outside the store. However, the decor inside and the merch they sell liven up the place.

Price: (4/5) The price is on the higher side but it matches the skill and care put into the beverage.

Conclusion: (5/5) Highly recommend if you are in the Bay area. Simply bobalicous.

__________________________

Brought to you by the Boba Connoisseur, your unbiased guide to boba worldwide.
author: Boba C.

description:
Decided to come to this place on a whim. My fiance and I just finished having brunch in Redwood city and had some time to kill before we headed over to Fort Mason for APE 2014 (Alternative Press Expo). As we passed by we noticed a few people in line, but not too bad. 

Finding parking in the mission is always a challenge, so keep in mind you may have to circle a few times since there aren't too many parking garages around the area. We finally found parking 5 blocks away and made our way over. There's not a big menu selection so it was not too hard to decide what to get. 

They only serve strictly milk tea in various forms, no fruit milk tea, or fruity drinks. The options were: Original Milk tea, HK style milk tea, Jasmine milk tea, Horchata Boba, Thai Tea, Iced Matcha Latte, and Coffee Milk tea. There's also a selection of teas they brew on the spot, but it takes a bit longer. There are 3 options for addons: Boba, Almond Jelly and Grass Jelly. You can also adjust the sweetness level to your liking (100%, 75%, 50%, 25%)

I ended up getting the Iced matcha latte with almond jelly at 75% and my fiance got the classic milk tea with boba at 75%. The Iced Matche latte at 75% was the perfect amount of sweetness for me with the almond jelly. Be sure to mix it up before drinking since all the syrup sits on the bottom and you'll get a huge serving of sugar if you don't. 

All and all, it's a nice place to get milk teas, albeit a bit out of the way for me. For Boba it's a bit on the pricier side.. about $4-4.50 depending if you get addons. I'd come back if I was in the area.
author: Milton F.

description:
You really can't go wrong with Boba Guys.

I've been to all their locations, even to their other one in Brisbane called the Burrow. I've tried their Classic Milk Tea, Jasmine Milk Tea, and HK Style Milk Tea. I've loved all of them so far. The Jasmine Milk Tea is creamy yet fragrant. My go-to is going to be the HK Style Milk Tea. I grew up drinking that while frequenting HK cafes in San Francisco. It tastes just like it, and while I do have a slight intolerance for condensed milk, I will go out of my way just to have it whenever I'm near a Boba Guy's establishment! Quality is always great here.

Wait time is usually quick. The bobaristas listen in on your order and usually start on it right away if there's no crazy rush.
author: Theresa L.

description:
I've loved Boba Guys for the past couple of years and I'm completely obsessed with the Stockton Street location but had to opt for the Mission location since the other one wasn't taking Postmates orders. I Postmates whenever I'm unable to get the boba myself. 

Yesterday night, I ordered my usual drink- Jasmine Milk Tea, 50% sweet with boba but was sadly super disappointed. The boba was chunked together (about 10-15 bobas) and only half of the boba in my cup was sip-able through the straw. My boyfriend got the thai iced tea and he literally fished out the boba and split them apart manually and put them back in the cup. I found it pretty unacceptable especially since we paid $10 just for the delivery (yes, I know it's not boba guy's fault for the expensive delivery cost but I wanted to show how much of dedicated Boba Guys fan/drinker I was that I'm willing to spend extra just to get it) and $10 for the 2 drinks. The tea itself was watery and not sweet at all. It felt like I was straight drinking the half and half milk with some water thrown in and chunky boba at the bottom.

I will never order from this location again and will opt for the more consistent, Stockton location.
author: Lauren K.

description: Maybe it's because I've grown up with a lot of bubble tea, but I gather the feeling that this place has a lot of instahype for above average flavor. Yes, this place has more variety and flavor than your run of the mill chain like Quickly's. But the drinks here can be overly sweet (even if you reduce %), the milk tea can be somewhat watery, and certainly not worth waiting SF-restaurant-length lines for. This can especially be a problem for the 19th St. store because it's so small and can handle limited capacity.
author: Michelle L.

description: I'm obsessed over their strawberry matcha latte with almond jelly in the 16 oz. the ratio of matcha to strawberry puree in the  24 oz isn't as well balanced , I think.
author: Heejin L.

description: This spot is cute and I noticed there was a line so figure this place must be good. I love boba tea and I always get my signature milk tea with tapioca Boba. It wasn't as milky as I wanted it to be but it wasn't bad. The line went pretty quickly too and customer service was good.
author: Rissa K.

description:
Came here once with a group of friends after getting dinner in the Mission district. I usually go to the Boba Guys in downtown SF for their matcha latte, but I wanted to try something different.

I ordered their coffee milk tea, and frankly, it wasn't that great. The coffee tasted very bitter, and the quality reminded me of instant coffee. The drink was very watery, probably due to the amount of ice added.

Maybe next time, I'll stick with trying the matcha latte.
author: Alvin W.

description:
I just moved from Fremont to San Francisco few weeks ago - one of the things I truly miss is the different boba tea houses - tea island, gong cha, T4, tea papa... You name it. And I live far away from sunset so I can't really go purple kow that often; luckily, I found this little gem in the Mission district.

Boba guys - the name doesn't sound really serious and at first I would thought it's another "me too" boba tea houses. But no! Just by reading their menu you can understand the owner has put a lot of thoughts on their drinks. Not only the detailed explanation of each of their signature drinks; you can also find a lot of little notes on the counter, wall etc about their vision, philosophy and origins. You can learn a lot about this place just by reading those signs.

So basically there are two big categories on their menu: specialty or signature drinks, and slow drip tea. For the latter category, you can choose sweetness and whether you want to add milk in it (and they have organic milk, California farm milk or soy milk as well). First time here, let me try their slow drip tea and see if they have done the fundamentals right.



-) Muscat Oolong Milk Tea with boba: A. They brewed the tea fresh from your order, turn the teapot/funnel thing upside down, and literally let the tea drip slowly. After it's done, they would pour it into a prepared beaker with iced milk, and there you go your drink. When I first sipped it, it definitely had a very strong oolong tea flavor in it. I really like the fact that the milk was not creamy at all; rather, the milk helped bring out the taste of the tea, make it more smooth, and definitely enhanced the overall experience. Boba was definitely way above average. Soft and chewy, but it's not honey boba so it's not sweet at all, which actually makes sense or else it would not go well with the strong flavor tea.

Definitely a place that I will be visiting more often. Next time I would like to try their Hong Kong style milk tea and see how it is!
author: Simon C.

description: I've come to love the staff here like family. They're fun, work extremely hard to keep up with demand, and always make sure order get out as quickly as possible. Tpumps used to be our boba go to, now it's boba guys.
author: Shane W.

description:
REAL tea + Strauss Milk = one of the best milk teas I've had in a really long time!  I'm kinda bummed this place doesn't have better reviews.  I had the Jasmine Milk Tea (regular milk, regular sweetness) and it was PERFECT.  I've never had a milk tea where the taste of the actual tea overpowered the amount of sugar in the drink.  It didn't taste powdery or artificial at all.

The tiny spot makes it slightly difficult to wait around for your drink in, but we happened to be there when the line wasn't long at all.  The staff was not so attentive and didn't greet or make small talk.  It was a really simple, Hi, what can I get you? and to the point service.

If it was a little closer, I'd definitely frequent here more often, but I'm happy to know there is a great boba spot that tastes like tea in the Mission!
author: Reena P.

description:
$4.00 for a boba in SF is a catch...let alone this standard price for flavored boba--now that's truly a miracle!

BOBA GUYS truly lived up to its hype. Boba bish says yessss to Mission's Boba Guys. This store is teeny--you wouldn't hang out here with friends, it's more of a grab and go type of place. It's got a little hipster vibe with their clean white walls and tatted up/I'm-not-trying-to-try-too-hard staff. Our cashier was a beautiful girl with sweet manners, and that was a great first impression of BG. 

My sister got the original boba with no sweetness and I got the horchata boba--we had to add pearls to both of them OF COURSE. 

Now in terms of the quality, their horchata tea gets 100% and so does their chewy and deliciously rebound-y texture of boba balls!! MY GOD I think my taste buds went utterly crazy with their delicious but small cup size of boba. BUT the small cup sizes isn't going to stop me from coming back here again. Two palms up for Boba Guys, I'll def be coming back because of their high-quality tea and deliciously chewy boba.

**Now if you'd ask me to compare Boba Guys and Purple Kow...I'm going to have to say, that's impossible. GB and PK sell different types of boba...GB is more light/clean-cut/smaller portions and PK is more creamy/huge cups/accessorized with their huge selection of add-ons. I love both for different reasons**
author: Jodi H.

description:
Their classic milk tea is awesome and I should probably stick with that from now on.

I've been to the Stockton location a few times and tried different drinks such as classic, jasmine, earl grey, and oolong all with regular sweetness, less ice, and boba.
Hojicha is a stronger version of jasmine tea so I was expecting more flavor. I'm guessing this tea isn't their forte since I barely tasted any tea. 

If you have a choice, I would recommend visiting the Stockton location instead. There are more pedestrians given that it's near Union Square.
author: Danae L.

description:
Boba Guys, oh, Boba Guys

Bubble tea with a Mission hipster twist. Can't say no to that, y'all

Amen

The bubble tea was pretty good, and the decor needs no introduction!

Where. Is. Ma. Boba!

Rawww
author: Henry L.

description:
I love this place so much, I would visit every single day if it wasn't so far from where I live. It's funny because in the front they have a sign that says "Come in a taste our grade-A balls". And let me tell you THEY REALLY ARE GRADE-A. Definitely the best boba I've ever had - if you like the sweet, extra chewy kind (soft boba lovers this is not for you). My favorite is their strawberry matcha latte, I don't know any other place that makes a drink like this. It has the perfect amount of sweetness and strawberry flavor. I'm a sucker for matcha anything so I freaking love  this and their original matcha latte). Another favorite is the soy jasmine milk tea. 

Customer service is awesome as well. One of the first times I went they messed up my order and it wasn't that big of a deal to me, but they gave me two waffles :D I'm such a big fan they gave me some Boba Guy pins too LOL. Anyways, must try if you're in the area.
author: Cecille W.

description:
I remember when this place was a popup shop in a ramen shop and they also served curry! Now it's just boba.
The shop is cute and the boba is perfect and the drinks are delicious. The Hong Kong style milk tea tasted authentic so I was very pleased because I usually only trust asian cafes with my HK style milk tea. I'll need to come back here and try the horchata milk tea...
Drinks come in 2 sizes: 16oz or 12oz for cold, and only 16oz for hot. It's $3.50 for a 16oz and 50cents for toppings (boba, pudding, almond jelly).
Service is fast and they're very friendly! Awesome customer service

They also sell other things like special mason jars, tin cups, buttons, shirts, tea leaves, and flavoured cotton candy. My only complaint would be the price of their cute mason jar. $12?! I understand it has their logo and a special lid with room for a straw but the it only saves you 25cents when you bring it in. And initially you have to pay $12 + the drink you want which averages $16 total.. That a bit intense for a 16oz mason jar of milk tea. And since you only save 25cents when you bring it in again, you'll need to come here at least 48 to make it worth it... The jar is SO cute, I just don't think it's worth $12.
BESIDES THE JAR, the milk tea at Boba Guys is amazing and I think they've really nailed the science behind preparing good boba and drinks. Awesome job, I just wish I was in the area more often to enjoy it.
author: Bianca M.

description:
You can't miss this place with the little sign hanging outside! Place inside is pretty small and there's usually a line too. The line goes by pretty fast though!

Came here on a Saturday afternoon with my boyfriend and we shared a drink. Got the Jasmine Milk Tea drink with Grass Jelly - w/ Almond Milk and 75% sweetness!

Basically, you pick:
- Type of drink (what kind of milk tea you want)
- Toppings (boba, grass jelly, almond jelly)
- Type of milk (whole milk, soy milk, almond milk)
- Level of sweetness (0%, 25%, 50%, 75%, 100%)

I think 75% was pretty good, not too sweet and you still get the tea flavor. The grass jelly was a little firmer than I liked it.

Staff is super friendly and they use Square for credit card transactions - makes thing super easy! They sell Boba Guys merch here too and they also have homemade cotton candy! They usually always have samples when you purchase boba - so try some. The Li Hing Pineapple cotton candy flavor was tasty and different!
author: Wing L.

description:
I've recently had the chance to try Boba Guys and I wasn't too impressed. I had the Soy Milk Tea with tapioca and it was waaay too sweet. To be fair, I do generally prefer my drinks to be less sweet (side effect of my newfound love of beer?), but this was pretty unbearable. I'm guessing the soy was already sweet, so adding their regular amount of sugar made it extra sweet. And they didn't give me an option of sweetness level. Boo..
The tapioca wasn't really memorable either. If I had to get a tapioca drink in the city, unfortunately Boba Guys would be on the lower part of my list. Maybe someday I'll give them another chance.
author: Athena L.

description:
Yeah, I'll roll out the red carpet you jerks.

This was stupid good. I'm talking about so good it's just stupid. A friend of mine suggested we go here for milk tea, and sure why not? I'll never pass up the opportunity to try a new boba place.

Yo... what the fuck? That was amazing. Their hong kong style milk tea that has CONDENSED MILK IN IT!? IDK YO. Seriously it was really great. I do have to say that I'm appreciative that despite the high amount of traffic that they receive, they churn out drinks in a pretty consistent basis. Although, I'm sure that's not always the case, but for my case it was seriously on point. In and out within 30 minutes!
author: Alan D.

description:
Oh hai, Boba Guys! You and your armadillo get me every time I am in the city. These guys really know their stuff. They are like the elite bartenders for boba tea, knowing how much sugar to add without overpowering the flavor of their teas. 

The teas are fully customizable from the type of black tea, to the sugar, to the amount of ice, to the milk (they use Strauss milk, of course, nothing but the best). They offer quite a variety of black and green teas. The boba are also perfectly chewy as well. There isn't quite the amount of crazy flavors that other tea places have, but the beauty is in the quality and simplicity of their ingredients here. A small selection, but everything is so so so well done. 

Come here is you like variety in your black teas!
author: Cindy L.

description:
Hey Boba Guy...

I admit.. I was a little disappointed.
It's not that your boba was bad or anything...
It's just, I heard a lot of great things about you. People rave about your drinks. People use words like "freshest", "chewiest" "most delicious" "tea connoisseur" "incredible quality" "quality"..... so I admit to coming with some high expectations.

Then I saw how your boba prices are very high compared to others. Rather than being repulsed (though I did feel a little uncomfortable) I just assumed it was because the quality was going to be so much better. I got the  Matcha green. Almond milk grass jelly. It was alright. Wasn't good enough that I'd order again, esp at that price.

having said, I am sure there will be others who love your drink. it's clear from the other reviews. 

Perhaps it wasn't fair to have such expectations but I guess that is the downside of having a good rating on yelp. So it is what it is. Maybe it just wasn't a match.

Perhaps I'll stroll in your part of town again and try again.

Until then.

bye boba guy
author: Paul L.

description:
I remember the first time I had boba guys. It was literally a hole in the wall place that sold Japanese curry and milk tea. Sounds a bit questionable right? I remember it was raved about back then too and mention of long lines. When I got there, it was empty except for one customer helping themselves to delicious smelling japanese curry. I literally thought I went to the wrong place. I asked the worker if this was Boba Guys and they said yes. They only had two options for milk tea back then, Classic Milk Tea or Jasmine. I got the classic milk tea which was pretty good and boba's texture was perfect. I didn't even know they had mason jars, but I had mine to go so of course I didn't get one.

Now I recently came to the new location. Based on reviews, I tried the muskat oolong milk tea, it's very unique and it wasn't bad. The only downside was it was a tad too sweet for me (will ask for half sweet in the future). But the tapioca had perfect consistency, it was nice and chewy and sweet. I will definitely come back to try their other selections of milk tea. I really like their idea of the slow bar (yes, they use freshly brewed tea :O amazeballs). 

They didn't have macarons that day :( but I tried their cotton candy and it was pretty good.

The place itself is very small, more like a grab and go place. They have very limited seating. It's also in the mission and parking can be a bit difficult. But at least this new location is hard to miss and you can actually tell it's a boba joint.

Will definitely be back.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Line out the door and creeps at a pretty slow pace. Service is decent but minimal interaction pretty much only with the cashier.

Mo and me opted to share an Iced 24oz Rose Black Tea, no milk, 50% sweetness, with almond jelly. UGH it was so sweet when I first had a sip. The tea itself was nice but if this was 50% sweet wtf is 100%??? I normally love the floral notes that Rose brings to tea but the extreme sweetness of this just made it taste medicinal...

Only thing that saved this drink but also ruined is a cup of water poured right in.

Almond jelly was on point though. I would get it again.
author: Christine G.

description: Don't get the hype, but everyone talks about it. I got their most popular drink and it felt watered down AF. Service was nice because they seemed passionate at serving boba, which is a nice experience.
author: Paulo R.

description:
The best boba I've ever had. 

Matcha Strawberry latte w/ Boba:
-I got it with the organic milk also. The cashier said it was pretty sweet but when I tried it, it was the perfect sweetness! Not sweet at all, if you have a huge sweet tooth. (Which I don't). The strawberry is made of real strawberry purée and you can absolutely tell once you taste it. It's my new favorite drink! Im really happy I risked it for this one drink. (I'm usually boring). She even offered me a different drink if I didn't like it. Which is great customer service. I'll be back, boba guys. 

Milk Tea w/ boba:
-Also with organic milk. Really good milk tea. It's not too milky or too black (tea). The tea was perfect, and you can tell it was brewed and not powder. If you're a simple person, this choice won't go wrong.

PROS:
-They have a lot of options.
-Boba is on point. Texture & tenderness.
-The cup isn't filled with tons of ice!
-Really nice employees who are very helpful with helping you choose a drink.
-ORGANIC MILK! Delicious, might I add.
-They make it all with love; from the syrup to the tea.
-Long lines but short waits. (Lines die down fast)

CONS:
-Pretty hot/humid in the shop.

Keep it up, boba guys! You're one of a kind.
author: Janet T.

description: What a jewel of a boba place in the heart of Mission! I wanted to see how this place did in terms of boba drinks (duh!) and I was definitely in for a treat. Not only did the place feel clean, simple and modern, the customer service was good too. We were greeted with hellos and our drinks arrived quickly. Apparently they don't use powders to flavor the drinks but real loose leaf tea. I ordered the horchata with tapioca and almond jelly for myself and I was very pleased with the refreshing take on horchata with boba! Definitely worth the trip if you're nearby!
author: Sharon B.

description: Not a big fan of matcha green tea, but this was very yummy and good! I do recommend boba guys bc they have a different taste compared to your typical boba spots! Definitely #1 on my list of boba places! Jasmine MT is also good! And the service is great! Love the workers !!
author: Rachel E.

description:
You know Horchata is my liquid crack right? 

Forget vodka, beer, or wine...just give me Horchata and I'll do the Magic Mike dance for you.

Here they have Horchata boba which I've never seen or heard of before. So you know I was all over it. 

Just take my wallet and hand me the Horchata...I didn't care that it was overpriced at $4 when a regular Horchata in the mission is about $2.50 for a small.

Whatever, just give it to me.

I even tried their weird jelly things along with their boba...since I was a little hungry and didn't want to look for a snack. I was trying to combine my drink and snack hunger in one straight shot.

The Horchata here is excellent.. The boba was great, and those jelly things were interesting in a good way.

I would choose this place over Quickly, Bambu, Tea Way...etc any day.

One of the best Horchata's I've ever had!
author: Jack R.

description:
Went to "the best boba in town" stated by some yelpers. I wasn't impressed. The 3 stars is for quickness and friendliness of the staff. Although there was a small line the staff was quick at taking orders and completing the order. I ordered 3 drinks. 

What I didn't like was the actual products. I love horchata and so I ordered it. It did not taste like horchata at all!!! It tasted more like Vietnamese coffee but watered down. I also ordered the earl grey tea with almond jelly and the tea itself wasn't too tasty either. It had a hint of the earl grey tea but lots of sugar (I ordered it at 50% sweetness). I also ordered the strawberry matcha tea. That was good. No complaints there. 

So 1/3 teas I ordered was to my liking. I hope I find a better places during my visit to SF otherwise I will stay in OC lol
author: Michael S.

description:
I have been to boba guys a few times now and honestly, I do not get the hype at all. I am starting to think that people only like this place because it is one of the few places in the mission that has boba and that you can stand in line without feeling embarrassed that you are surrounded by middle schoolers. In terms of the quality of the drink, I find boba guys super disappointing.

I have had the golden honey black milk tea and the horchata milk tea and in both cases, the drinks tasted very watered down. The honey did not stand out in the golden honey black tea - and neither did the tea for that matter. The horchata was really only ok.

However, the texture of the boba is very good, chewy but not too soft or hard. Also, the service has always been really good and the cashier extremely pleasant to talk to. They also sell small batch cotton candy from local makers, sugar and spun (I met them at a food truck fair before and they seem super nice) which I love.

In terms of the ambiance, the place has no seating and can get super crowded. There is usually a line and there is no parking. It is more expensive than a regular boba place but it does have a hipster vibe. Generally I would say pass to boba guys unless you have some out of town guest that you are afraid will judge you for bringing them to a less hipster (more authentic or teeny boppy) boba place. If you want good boba, better to go to the sunset or richmond.
author: Jocelyn K.

description: It might just be this location, but it didn't hit the spot. I got the jasmine milk tea with boba, which was just alright. The milk tea wasn't strong enough I guess, so it tasted watered down. The boba was chewy and was fine. I mean service wise, it's good. I just don't really understand the hype. I don't think I'll be going to this location anymore. It's really nothing special to me, but I wanted to give it a second chance. Stopped by on a Thursday late afternoon and the place wasn't too crowded. All in all, I'd go somewhere else to get your boba fix, but if you're in the area I guess why not. You could ask them to fix your preferred sweetness level and they do have some things you can buy, such as cotton candy or teas. They do have a few chairs as well.
author: Maggie W.

description:
Parking is a pain in the butthole around here. My best friend and I considered ubering here from a different location but we surprisingly managed to find last minute parking. 

I came here on a Saturday night, (1 hour before they were closing). The place was small but super quaint, they have an awesome boba mascot of an anteater on the wall. The menu is straight to the point and the guys were super helpful with answering our questions. We came here right before the rush and did not wait long for our bobas. 

I ordered TWO bobas because I could not decide and I have zero regrets. I ordered the 16oz Iced Rose Milk Tea with boba and the 16oz Iced Strawberry Oolong Tea. BEST ROSE MILK TEA EVER. My go to boba drink is the Rose Milk Tea, i've tried several different ones from all over San Diego and the Bay Area but none of them are as a amazing as the Boba Guys. Trust me, i'm a Rose Milk Tea expert so just try it! The Strawberry Oolong Tea tasted like a fresca with a side of Oolong. It's a great refreshing drink for those warm days! Both bobas have the perfect amount of sweetness to tea ratio and the bobas are soft and chewy. IDGAF if it costs about $4.00, shut up and take money Boba Guys while I gloomily settle for okay (and equally priced) boba back in San Diego.

P.S. Open a Boba Guys in San Diego and I'll be your first lifelong So-Cal customer!
author: Yen N.

description:
I guess the high expectations I had of Boba Guys going in made my experience average at best. I got the horchata with pearls (4.25); honestly there's no way to make sugary, cinnamon-y milk taste bad, but it wasn't anything special. If you've ever drank the milk after eating Cinnamon Toast Crunch, the horchata was nearly indistinguishable. I had a few sips of friends' Jasmine Milk Tea and Hong Kong Milk tea, but was equally unimpressed. The tea flavor tasted like it had been watered down and relied on the sugar to overcompensate. I will say the pearls had a nice chewiness and slight sweetness which is what I look for in good pearls.

I would say try it if you're dying to see what the buzz is about but it's not worth it to become a regular.
author: Tony P.

description:
Best balls I've ever had! 

Came here on Friday night at around 8:30pm. I should've known parking would be difficult. I seriously circled around for a good 25 minutes. At this point I'm thinking "This better be worth it."

Finally got to Boba Guys and there was only one person in line. I got horchata with boba and even purchased the mason jar. I was in the moment! The guy sold me when he said their lids were specifically made for boba straws. Although looking back now, I don't think it was worth the $12 for the jar.

The drinks came up fast. The drink itself was just okay. Tasted like regular horchata to me. Nothing special. The boba though! Oh em gee, so soft and lightly sweetened. It was perfect. Grade-A balls! 

It was a nice small place in the mish with friendly employees. The drinks are okay but the boba balls were heavenly.
author: Mellani L.

description: After reading Stacy Y.'s review of this place, I knew I had to check it out. I ordered the Earl Grey with boba at 75% sweetness and I have never loved boba more. Earl Grey is my favorite tea and I would've never thought to drink it iced with pearls but I swear to you, it works. IT WORKS. The tea tasted like it was steeped perfectly and the boba was just right. My only complaint? That there isn't a Boba Guys where I live.
author: Alex Q.

description:
What is this stuff.

I wasn't aware that they moved locations, but maybe it's for the better. Came in around 8:45pm to try this place out for the first time. The decor is charming and  reminds me of Molly Moon's in Seattle, a small shop with the wooden and white counter tops.

I got the Matcha Latte w/ boba 75% sweetness.

Normally I don't care for cold matcha drinks, but I thought I'd try this out. I've seen pictures of it often on social media, so it shouldn't be that bad. As soon as the drink was ready, I noticed something peculiar already. There was at least a thick 1cm layer of honey at the bottom with more honey on the sides of the cup. Oh man if this is 75% sweetness, I don't think I could stand 100% sweetness. One sip and I wanted to throw away my drink. I thought, hmm maybe it's because I didn't mix it well enough. Mixed it again. The drink was WAY TOO SWEET. All I tasted in my drink was honey. Are their drinks normally like this or did my barista give me too much honey? Also, the boba wasn't chewy all the way through.

Boba Guys you have disappointed me.
author: Kevin S.

description:
NOTE: I do not reside in SF. 

So..... since this place is in SF and not in ATL. Hands down - best Thai Tea I've had. It tasted fresh and definitely well prepared. 

I was visiting SF and one of my friend's recommended it so why not! I even bought a cute cup from them. Wish they had the mason jars :( Maybe next time.

I had Thai Tea quite often the past few years (my main go to drink) and I gotta say Boba Guys did an awesome job. I am thoroughly impressed. 

Keep it up guys! See ya'll when I come visit again!
author: Rachel K.

description:
More like 3.5 for me, but 4 star because of the last part!

High end and hipster version of the boba! Of course this place is popular in SF! 
Everything is natural, organic, loose-leaf. With real milk (also soy or almond), and no powder. You can still choose ice and sugar level, which is something I value!

I ordered classic milk tea with no ice and 25% sugar. As for tea, it was strong and you can tell the quality is good, and the sugar level is not too high (25% might be not sweet at all for most people). It is tasty, but not worth waiting in line and all the hype. 

BUT I also think Boba Guys is a good place for your non-Asian friends to be introduced with the divine of boba milk tea! Since many popular places in bay area might make one feels a bit overwhelmed due to the large menu (mainly Chinese), and very specific "boba shop aesthetics".  Boba Guys's entire branding doesn't have these factors, but the tea is legit (haven't try the boba yet), so get your friends here! Get them addicting to boba milk tea!
author: Ya K.

description: I've been to the boba guys location in NYC and thought I'd stop in one while I was in San Francisco. Honestly I'm still not sure how I feel about boba guys. I am not big on their milk teas -- I prefer more authentic Taiwanese brands. However, I enjoy their special drinks like the strawberry calpico and matcha strawberry drinks. Those are very unique and taste pretty good. I guess overall, I think this place is pretty good. A little over priced when it comes to milk teas, but their specialty drinks may be worth it. This location had efficient service and no line when I was there.
author: Annie W.

description:
I can always count on Boba Guys for excellent tea, this has never changed. 

Hong Kong style w/ condensed milk is MY current Boba Guys favorite. Strong black tea expertly brewed and just the right amount of condensed milk added? Easy Sunday. Then to top it off, perfectly cooked boba balls? 

The last time definitely had to have been a fluke. 

Really love how Boba Guys has expanded. They make their own jellies (almond & grass!) , macarons, and Kaya bread. They also carry Sugar & Spun (cotton candy). 

Also!!! They have handled mason jars with the logo for sale, $10. It's my personal favorite and I use mine daily at home. 

Oh and if you have the time and enjoy a great cup of tea, give the slow bar a shot. 

Keep up the good work guys!!
author: Susy C.

description:
I really wanted bubble tea and I figured SF would be an area with some great choices to offer. Come to find out that they aren't like the ones in Seattle. Many are not owned by Asians. This place has a reputation of being called "hippy bubble tea" not sure why. I'm not from the area but from what I understand it's because it's not an Asian bubble tea place. 

I digress... This place is simple. Few options with selective jellies and boba add ins. They serve the typical Hong Kong milk tea, Thai iced tea, etc. Reminds me of drive thru boba in Bellevue. The boba was soft, sweet, and chewy aka perfect! They had a flavor I have NEVER seen before at a bubble tea place, Horchata! It intrigued me a lot so I ordered it. It was delicious!! 

I was talking to the owner a bit and he believes he has the best boba in the world. I felt that was a bold statement. He said he has compared his to many places in popular cities, however in the back of my mind I kept thinking "drive thru boba is very similar and is just as good". He boasted about how they make everything from scratch such as their own syrups. I think that's wonderful and I can't say whether that's not true for any other place but it's good to see that he is so passionate about what he serves. His business is obviously doing very well. 

I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a new and unique bubble tea place in SF.
author: Eva C.

description:
I cannot think of one bad thing to say about this place. If you're like me and like your boba on the soft, almost creamy side, you will adore this place. I ordered the jasmine tea with boba and it was so delicious I thought I was gonna cry. My friend got the matcha green tea with cream and I tried some and it was so good. I don't like matcha and I actually really enjoyed how this one tasted. The aesthetic of the place is definitely a plus and the service is so amazing. I ordered and literally 30 seconds after I left the register it was ready! The girl on bar was like sonic the hedgehog or something (the bar is right next to the register so she was like lightning quick at pouring in the tea, milk, sweetner and boba).
To date, this is the best boba/milk tea I have ever had. And that says a lot coming from a Bay Area native from San Jose. Just spectacular.
author: Kyle D.

description:
Tasty boba tea. I got 50% sweet jasmine with oat milk. Perfect (and vegan without jelly)!
Somehow I guess I got lucky, based on reviews, and the line wasn't long at all. Quick and friendly service.
author: An B.

description:
This is by far the best boba place for  authentic jasmine green tea place I've tried in San Francisco. The price is doable and not too pricey. Just about right $4. The jasmine green tea was very fresh and tasted amazing. 

I also got the regular milk tea, I felt like it was a bit too much milk, but overall was way better than quicklys and those other chain stores. 

I also got The mason jar they have, i would say it's quite pricey but then again you get 25cent off any drink when you bring back the mug! So if you drink boba enough you'll get your money's worth :) I'll have to admit this is the most creative jar I've seen also. It has a handle where you can easily hold and even a straw hole on top !! I love it :)
author: Jenny S.

description:
Everyone has his/her own preference when it comes to boba, but I think Boba Guys can be universally appreciated for 1) their perfectly cooked tapioca balls, 2) their range of (really, really good) flavors, and 3) their convenient Mission location. I also really love that there's no extra charge for subbing in almond milk.

Perfect for a sunny afternoon in Dolo!
author: Kelly R.

description: I'm not going to make this review too lengthy, but all I have to say is that boba is definitely better in the 626 or OC. The service here was good and the line wasn't too bad since it moved pretty quickly, but the drink itself was just okay. I ordered the iced matcha latte with almond milk + boba. I ordered this mainly because it was under the "good drinks to try if it's your first time here" part of the menu, but I think the drink could have been better. Some of the boba was hard and although they told me to give my drink a good stir before I drank it, I don't think the amount of sugar on the bottom of the cup mixed well and fully diluted with the rest of the drink. Honestly I can't judge a place by one drink, so I would come back again to try some of the other drinks that I saw on the menu, like the Calpico one and the lychee rose one!
author: Kiana N.

description: Great boba!! The service is on spot and really cares. They bring out the drinks super fast and this place probably has the best quality when it comes to drinks. The sweetness at even 50% was a bit much for me but I think they do a great job in giving you options. The almond jelly was amazing and I got the oolong tea. I hope they open up more shops and I'll be back to try the other flavors and the grass jelly in the future. I can see why people come here so often and it becomes an expensive habit!
author: Lily P.

description:
I am obsessed... like... utterly, completely, head-over-heels, obsessed! HK style milk tea is the way to go! It contains condensed milk, so the drink is pretty darn sweet. I prefer going with 50% sweetness. And their boba... *heart eyes* omg. Perfect consistency and texture. I try really hard not to get boba most of the time because they're empty calories, but I cannot resist the boba here. 

Also... they sell the best pineapple cakes in the world (every time I discover someone going to Taiwan, I ask for them to bring Sunny Hills pineapple cakes back to me, and yes, this includes a friend of a friend of a friend). It's pricy though... $5 for one, which is more expensive than a large drink, but oh so worth it.
author: Anna Z.

description: I asked for no milk and it turns out they put milk in mine. Too bad as it tasted good but I'm dairy intolerant. What a waste and poor customer service. She asked me if I wanted milk and I said NO.
author: Addie S.

description: This place was delicious. Definitely recommend. The line was out the door but the service was fast. It was my friends and I first time. The people that rang us up was very helpful. Gave us good recommendations to pair it with. I would come back again.
author: Vanessa W.

description:
Hype? Nahhhhhhhh, I actually really like this place, although none of my friends do.

Although the price is expensive ($5-$5.50 for a large iced drink with boba), the quality is good. I would say they have the best boba I've ever had, always warm, chewy and sweet.
Disclaimer: I've never tried sharetea/plentea so I can't compare it to those, but hell, a large drink at quickly's is also $5 and I would pick this place over them any day.

Funny note: This place used to be all non-asians working, now it's all/mostly asian, are they trying to look legit?
author: Da X.

description:
I find with overwhelming disappointment how odd it is that a lot of Boba places and Pho places are rated 3.5 stars. I don't understand it. Its like a thing, and for the most part these are perfectly legitimate, delicious pho and boba places that are being downrated for reasons I cannot understand.

For starters, Boba Guys is awesome. They serve delicious milk tea(s) in a large variety, allow you to control (somewhat) your sugar / carb intake in one drink, and have amazing boba (there goes to carb macros!)

I also enjoyed their almond pudding, although I'd still go for the boba over the pudding. 

Their teas are smooth, creamy and delicious, and come in a variety of sizes. The staff is friendly and it's clean inside. Honestly, what else could you ask for?
author: Lorrie M.

description: Waited 20 min, when I got to the place they told me they don't take 100 dollar bills. Why can't they make it apparent before people jump in lines?
author: Ge Y.

description: Boba Guys was the 1st boba I ever had that was served in a mason jar with a handle. It was also the 1st time I tried honey boba. I thought the boba & tea were just OK. The tea wasn't as flavorful as I would have liked. I had their tea @ a warehouse party. They use organic milk which I think is great. I'd love to try their grass jelly next time which I hear is made from scratch! For those who don't care for milk tea, they also serve asian toast!
author: Brenda L.

description:
Excellent Bubble tea! One of the best one I had in a while!
The guys are cool, and helpful. Unfortunately it opens only at 12:00. I would like to talk my morning coffee on my way to work! :-)
author: Vincent S.

description: Not sure why this place is so hyped. My Thai Iced Tea tasted like water and the Earl Grey tasted like eraser. Would not come back
author: Catherine S.

description:
Underwhelming boba. I got the regular black milk tea with boba and almond jelly. The milk tea tasted diluted and almost watery. The boba was too soft and too sweet. I wish the almond jelly were bigger, but they were small tiny bits at the bottom that reminded me of soft tofu. I was actually excited for the almond jelly but that quickly deflated. My friend enjoyed her drink, which was almost milky but with a different tea. She also liked the boba, but she really likes sweet things in general. It tasted like there was too much sugar and syrup that it was soaking in.

Too bad because the place is super cute and so is the aardvark decoration
author: Jeanne K.

description:
I get a boba craving every time I visit home! After all, living in Maine does NOT present the best opportunities for enjoying boba. 

I persuaded the bf to come with me to try the Horchata w/ boba as well as the Classic Milk Tea w/ grass jelly. The friendly Asian dude with glasses told us that Classic & Jasmine were the most popular, but come on, I HAD to try the horchata! 

On to the review... the Classic and Horchata were both extremely sweet. It's cool that they make their own syrup and all, and they do allow for customization,  but I didn't think the regular would be so sugary! The small 16oz drinks also came PACKED with ice, not so cool considering that these drinks came out to $4 a pop. The boba was sweet and chewy, but not any sweeter or chewier than any decent competition. I personally LOVE grass jelly, but I was disappointed by their homemade batch. The squares were a bit too firm and large to easily get sucked up through the straw, and a cup of grass jelly with no drink is never any fun! 

At the end of the day, this place is okay. It's cute and they have seasonal flavors like strawberry jasmine tea (I wish I tried this instead). I left wondering why in the world they had an aardvark in their logo, and it turns out that it's because 'they have a built in boba straw'. It finally makes some sense!
author: Christine L.

description:
Combination of great natural ingredients and friendly service!
Only thing about this location is that its really a drop in and go place. There isn't much room to linger inside and I always find this place really stuffy when waiting inside. 

Tried their classic boba with black tea and couldn't be happier. Great drinks!
author: Brian L.

description:
Ahhhh the Boba Guys! I totally love this place--the vibe, the decor, the aardvark cups--it's the tea equivalent to the trendy hipster San Franciscan coffee house, minus the pretentiousness. 

I was pleasantly surprised when my friends and I got to catch the owners working the time we went in (see Sabrina C.'s review). They were super friendly and patient as they helped me make my choice as to what to order, and really helped make our experience (especially since we were showing visiting friends around SF). 

I got the golden honey black tea, and although my taste buds aren't refined enough to differentiate the many subtleties they talked about (the golden tips are the sweetest part of the tea leaf and creates the honey-like taste and the rest flew over my head), I did enjoy my tea and was excited when I caught onto the sweet aftertaste. It was pricey, but worth it. 

To me, the fact that they really stand behind the quality of their teas ("If you don't like it, we'll make you anything else on the menu, whatever you want!")  means a lot and isn't something you always find at a PMT/boba place. 

Watery? A bit, but that's only because they use milk and not cream, and real tea rather than powder--the way that tea should be.
author: Wendy W.

description: Saw this place on Yelp before heading to SF as I'm obsessed with iced matcha. I saw the pics of the strawberry matcha and thought there was no way the two could go together. I was wrong!! I didn't initially fall in love with it, it took me about half way through the drink to really get into the flavor. I found myself craving more later in the day and the next day! The boba was perfect as well, a little sweet and texture was exactly as boba should be, a little soft and a little gummy bear-ish. Lines may seem intimidating but they go very quickly! Wish they would open in LA or OC in SoCal.
author: Asma w.

description:
Awesome boba! Small place, so don't rely on staying here.

Good flavor selection and I love the logo.

Head to the park to enjoy your boba!
author: Michael Y.

description:
Am I in a science laboratory or in a boba shop?? It's a mix of the two and I love it! There are all kinds of glass beakers and glass test tubes that hold tea leaves and tools like matcha whisks and such. Such a creative idea on styling the space. There was even like a glass beaker terrarium on the counter. They have a statement on their outside window by the door about how they put a lot if science into their boba making process, which is pretty clever. The only thing that would make this even more awesome is if the employees wore white lab coats and safety glasses while making the boba. But I guess that would be really hot - it was already a warm day in the Mission when I visited and it gets pretty warm inside this little shop, especially with lots of people inside. They also had some fans on, so maybe there's no central AC. So...maybe no lab coats...

They also sell cute mason jars with their logo (I think it's an aardvark? They like boba too!) for $10. Not only is it cute, but it's reusable! If you bring the glass mason jar in, you get 25 cents off your order. So you're helping the environment by reducing waste and saving some money too! Technically, you'll need to visit 40 times to break even, but if you are planning to go everyday, or even like every week for a year, it will pay for itself. Plus you can use it for other beverages at home too. It has a handle. 

Ok, so how about the most important thing - the boba? I ordered the classic milk tea with tapioca balls - it was my visit and I needed to go with something basic. But they had a lot of other drinks on the menu that made me want to try something different - they offer an horchata boba (that's very original), an iced matcha latte, Hong Kong style boba (black tea with condensed milk), and a Thai tea boba (I love Thai iced tea). 

The milk tea was really good - just the perfect sweetness. Very refreshing on such a warm day. Maybe it tasted good because they use local Straus milk, I don't know. The tapioca was just a tad chewier than I prefer. But the liquid part was yummy. I'm not a boba connoisseur but I know what I like when I taste it. Even though it was busy, my order came out in like five minutes from the time that I ordered it. Speedy! 

I'd like to try the matcha latte and the Thai tea the next time I visit!
author: Sylvia K.

description: I've been to Boba Guys before but I've never been to this location! It's small and cute with only a few seats. The drinks are pricey, but I don't drink boba very often anymore so I didn't mind too much. My boyfriend and I shared the jasmine milk tea and the matcha latte, both at 75% sweetness. The jasmine milk tea was good, not the best we've had but it was good. However, the matcha latte totally overshadowed the jasmine milk tea because it was sooo yummy! Matcha flavor was on point and the boba was cooked perfectly. I'll admit, the first time I had Boba Guys I wasn't too impressed, but this trip completely changed my mind! Would recommend the matcha latte 10/10!!
author: Alyssa W.

description: Rating based on the drinking that I always get! Large Iced Matcha Latte with tapioca balls. :) A bit expensive for some boba though.
author: D H.

description:
Just when I thought my SF boba adventures couldn't get any better, 

I have heard about this place for a while and finally got to check it out. And from the # of check ins, you can tell I came back for more! Who knew an antelope would be an iconic mascot for a boba drink.

Drinks:

#1: horchata - It was delicious! The cinnamon flavor was prominent but not too overpowering. Don't expect it to be like the kind you would get from a taqueria but it comes pretty close. 

#2: hong kong style milk tea w/ almond jelly & boba (75% sweetness) - my current fav! The milk tea is tasty, with a good tea and milk ratio. But the star of the drink is the ALMOND JELLY! I highly recommend that with any milk tea (not sure how it tastes with other drinks). The boba has a good chewy texture too. 

#3: mango matcha latte w/boba - The cool colors of the drink caught my eye. okay taste. But not great enough to get a second time. 

Everything else:

The drinks come out pretty fast and the employees are patient and helpful with deciding on drink orders. The place is small with no more than 4 seats so expect a grab for the go type of situation.
author: Christine N.

description:
I don't see the hype. 

Ordered the horchata boba. I found it too sweet and some of the boba was too hard. 

I guess it's an ok alternative for the mission area to get your fix, but it wouldn't be something to frequent.
author: Noelle H.

description:
I've come here multiple times and have experienced both the long line and no line at all - it really depends on what time you arrive. 

Here are the drinks I've tried:
Hong Kong style tea with condensed milk: VERY sweet, even when we ordered less sweet. I've also tried it with half sweet, and in this case the coffee like flavour of the hong kong style tea showed through more. Either way, their hong kong style tea is pretty good.
Jasmine milk tea: Standard jasmine milk tea, refreshing and well made.
Iced Matcha latte: Perfect balance of matcha flavour without making it too bitter. 

Their boba is quite nice and chewy too with a good consistency. They also sell boba guys mason jars which look pretty cute if you want to fit into the hipster mission district. I think my only complaint is that it's quite expensive when it comes to milk tea places and it's just on par with other places such as sharetea/chatime/kung fu tea.
author: Theresa L.

description:
Perfect balls, probably the best in the city. But the price - while totally justifiable given the incredible quality of the ingredients, from the tea leaves they source and brew to the high-quality organic milk options and housemade syrups - makes it hard for me to come here every possible chance I get, hence the 4 stars. I grew up with powdered milk boba so the incentive for me to make a trek here just for organic dairy and for almost twice the price is lacking. So I only go to Boba Guys if I'm feeling the need for something exceptional and special and leave my daily indulgences to cheaper places like i-Tea or Wonderful Food Co.

But the tea and the chewiness and size of the boba balls are top notch here. In addition to their classic and HK milk tea boba drinks, I recommend the hojicha (red/black tea) and horchata boba. Follow the anteater!
author: Tiffany H.

description: Can't say enough good things! The absolute best boba I've had in my life. We absolutely loved the Thai tea, and my personal favorite the Strawberry matcha latte with oat milk. We also like the Horchata.
author: Amber R.

description:
I made a trip out in the rain before running to a movie yesterday and was very disappointed with the level of service. They completely forgot to make 1 drink in a friend's order then blamed it on another customer taking the missing drink. After we asked for the missing drink (an iced milk tea) they then made the incorrect drink (hot tea) which accepted due to our time constraints. 

Waiting 30 minutes for the wrong order which technically cost less than the missing item isn't exactly what I'd consider a good job. I won't be coming back here for sometime.
author: Kellyn W.

description:
I have been always been a loyal Boba Guys fan before it became so popular. I live quite far away but I still make a trip here at least once a week to get my boba fix. 
I usually order something different every time, but I have to say my favorites are the strawberry fresca with soy milk and the lychee green tea with soy milk. 
And if you're feeling hungry, make sure to try the almond croissant or HK toast! 

I love everything about Boba guys, including the quality of ingredients, clean modern interior, and friendly service.
author: Michelle F.

description:
Drinks: Earl Grey Milk Tea with Boba (from their premium drinks list) 

Takes: Finally found their store front! I've been to their pop up location in Berkeley (holla to that delicious alcoholic boba horchata nigori over there) I loved how they don't use the powder stuff to make their drinks. Boba was chewy. The only downside is the price. As other yelpers have mentioned, I honestly don't think it's worth the $5 sticker price, but that must cover the higher quality ingredients they use.

Service: The guy making the drinks was the same one from the pop up location! Pretty chill dude, and he answered questions customers had regarding the drinks as well as how this business came about.

Parking: street parking 

Price: Drinks range from $4-$5 each depending whether you get premium or not.

Bottom line: Go here for your unique premium boba drinks fix!
author: Jash P.

description:
Binky and I have heard so many good things about Boba Guys for WAY too long! Finally, this past weekend, Binky and I decided to grab some tacos and boba in the Mission. When we got to the location (very, very small), we were taken aback by how LONG the line was. Binky was a little hesitant to wait ~25 min for boba (we parked in 2 hour parking....). However, the boba fanatic in me persevered and I was able to whine about this "once in a lifetime" chance until Binky relented. 

Boba Guys has SUCH interesting flavors. Binky ordered a HK style MT with boba and I ordered the Indian Chai with boba. WOW, both drinks were SUCH a treat. The tea was wonderfully strong (and very high quality...) and the cream was fresh, thick and delicious -- EVERYTHING we could have ever asked in a boba drink and MORE. The boba in my drink was a tinnnnnnnnnny bit inconsistent (some tapioca balls were harder than others...) but the drink was so delicious (overall) that I hardly cared (big deal for me since I LOVE boba and could eat it on its own.....). Binky and I normally prefer to go to more traditional boba locations. We have tried similar locations (probably Boba Guys knock-offs) in San Jose but have never been too impressed. Boba Guys has changed the game for us -- can't wait to be back!
author: Christine H.
