description: Really like the selection here, ordered strawberry green tea boba, looks amazing!!! They also have sunny hills pineapple cakes
author: Rossy W.

description:
Boys and girls rarely agree on anything but I think there is one thing they CAN agree on: good balls ARE essential. Perfectly symmetrical, soft, squishy, and bouncy. Balls like this get me super excited especially when I'm enjoying a mouthful of them. 

BOBA BALLS that is you pervs!

The Boba Guys have perfected the boba balls down to a science and I love that they use top notch, organic ingredients. They even make their own syrup which means they are serious about their balls; I mean their boba drink. 

I adored Boba Guys when they were at their pop-up at Ken Ken Ramen (http://bit.ly/1fiXJcx) and was ecstatic to find out they would have their brick and mortar. Over 3 months later after their grand opening, I finally was able to make my way to Boba Guys' brick and mortar since they extended their hours of operation. And they now accepted CC's. Yay!

Not only do the Boba Guys now have a permanent space with several stools, they have expanded their menu. Instead of just 2 tea offerings, they have 8+ offerings including Classic Milk, Jasmine, Soy (vegan friendly), Horchata, Thai Iced, Iced Matcha Latte, Coffee Milk, and HK Style. They even have a "Slow Bar" where they brew your tea to order. All their drinks are $4 ($5 for slow bar drinks) which is very reasonable considering they use high-quality ingredients. This ain't no Quickly powdered shiet. *Rolls eyes at stingies complaining about the price* 

I decided to stick with their basic Classic Milk Tea ($4) which was sadly not as good as I remembered them to be when they were at Ken Ken Ramen. I like that they use very little sweetener but the tea flavor was too subtle and our drink needed MORE ice. After a 30 minute wait for our drink on a hot Saturday afternoon, our drink arrived to us almost room temperature. By the time we walked back to the car, all the ice (the little that there was in the cup) was all melted. *Sad Pouty Lip*

It was a crowded so the wait was somewhat understandable; I mean fobbee teens who have nothing better to do wait for up to 2 hours at Tpumps. 

3 stars for the boba milk tea but an extra star for their deliciously satisfying pandan macarons (3 for $5) and for carrying Sugar & Spun's cotton candy in cookie butter: http://bit.ly/GOf9i9. 

Not going to lie, it's been nearly 2 weeks but I'm still a little bummed about their boba milk tea. Oh well, at least the balls were good. A good pair; I mean set is all you need sometimes right?
author: Cherylynn N.

description: The bubble tea is regular, same as you would have gotten any other place. No reason for the huge line.
author: Norcloud S.

description:
I don't know about Boba Guys. I love boba but I guess I ordered the wrong thing? The ambience is cool. Modern, cozy, & neat. I love how they serve mason jars...nice little keepsake for customers.

What I Ordered:

* Iced Matcha Green Tea with Strawberry: It tasted like a watered-down iced green tea frapp with strawberry juice. Kinda odd combination. 

* Horchata Milk Tea: It was ok. Not like a taqueria horchata...more like a cinnamon flavored milk tea. They consistency was a little paste-like.

Anyway, at least I tried it. Not coming back though. Would much rather have TPumps or even Quickly for that matter.
author: Ralph N.

description: Not that impressed -- I had the matcha latte, and while I'm hard pressed to dislike anything with matcha, it just didn't "wow" me. I'll stick with my regular spots in the south bay.
author: Jen R.

description:
Small shop, but the guys who work here are so welcoming it's crazy. Upon ordering, the man behind the register introduced himself and a fellow barista as the owners, and gave a brief introduction to the shop and the organic, fresh ingredients they use (no creamer!). My friend and I asked about the Golden Honey Black Tea and why it was more expensive than the rest, and he happily gave us a background of the tea and what makes it so special (basically, this tea is made up of the tips aka the most expensive part of the leaf, which produces a honey-like sweetness when brewed). He told us that if we're tea enthusiasts then we would be able to tell the difference, and encouraged us to try it. If we didn't like it, he pointed to the sign posted on the wall that dictated their promise to make any drink on the menu for us if we didn't like what we got. 

Since he was so convincing, both of us decided to try it, Golden Honey Black Milk Tea with half sugar and pearls, and neither of us were disappointed. At first, it tasted kind of watery, but it occurred to me that this was due to the fact that they use fresh milk instead of creamer, which gives milk tea that thicker consistency, so I shifted my focus onto the tea instead. You really could taste the difference in this type of black tea; the aftertaste was indeed much sweeter, though not sugary, making this a very light and refreshing drink on a surprisingly warm San Francisco day.

Another thing -- they sell Sunny Hills Pineapple Cakes!! These are my favorite pineapple cakes that I'm only able to find in Taiwan, and I usually bring back boxes and boxes of these when either my mom or I get the chance to go visit family, so it's amazing to see that this cute little boba joint sells this too! I'm not sure how fresh it is though, but now that I know that Boba Guys carries this, I know where to get my hands on one if I ever get a craving. THANKS BOBA GUYS!!
author: Sabrina C.

description:
I am a big fan of Boba Guys! My favorite drink is the Strawberry Matcha Latte, and I typically get it with almond milk. I love that they offer dairy-free options, because I know several other boba places simply use non-dairy creamers. 

Sometimes the line is long, and the 19th St shop is really, really small.
author: Maranda C.

description:
Love this place so much! It's hands down the best boba tea place I've tried in SF. Sometimes on a nice day the line is out the door, that's how good it is! 


My goto drinks are: 

Thai Ice Tea w/Boba 
Jasmine Milk Tea w/Boba
Strawberry Fresca Jasmine Milk Tea w/Boba
 
Note I always ask for 50% sweetness, you should too if you want to taste more of the tea! 

The boba and aloe jelly is made in house and so is the syrup! They don't use fructose syrup!!! 

They also use stratus farms milk
author: China D.

description: I'm so excited I finally found a place in SF with boba that I ilke!!! Having lived in the SGV in LA for a while, I've become extremely picky/particular about the kind of boba and milk tea that I like. My friend recommended the strawberry matcha to me and omg... it was so good. Really tasty creamy matcha with just a hint of strawberry taste and sweetness. The boba itself is really good here too, although I think ymmv. Their boba is a little on the chewier side which may be offputting to some people but I actually kind of like it. Plus it actually has a nice and sweet honey taste!! (: I'm so so glad I have somewhere to get my boba fix in the city now!!
author: Stephany L.

description: I have always love their drinks but this is my first time going to this location. I wanted to get the bottle ones for togo, but after asking the cashier girl she assumed i was looking for the mason jars then said no. Have to ask her again but she didn't seem to know their own products. But that's fine so I went ahead and order 3 drinks. I guess it's close to their closing time so she didn't bother to explain the drink sizes when I was confusing either. Turned out their "regular" size is the smaller size not the 16oz, so I have to come back and pay to change all 3 drinks to the bigger size. What throw me off the most is her whatever attitude. Girl your job is just to take customer order, isn't it your job to help if they have questions about your products? I work in retail too so i know it can be frustrating sometimes but hey it's not like I was giving you troubles so why the attitude?
author: Zoe Q.

description:
Stop and smell the roses! 

When I saw Boba Guys post their rose flavored tea on Instagram, I squealed in delight!

Literally. I can get my favorite (FAVORITE!) tea flavor AND I get to suck ballz through a straw?!

* Can I get an amen! *

Top notch, good for your body ingredients (Straus Creamery organic milk, organic Five Mountain tea and home made syrup) and the finest balls your mouth will ever come into contact with. 

I'm sick of other places that use powdery stuff and artificial flavoring in their "milk" tea. That's why I'm sticking to the real thing (even if real = $4 or $5!)  it's the best afternoon treat you can give to yourself. 

Drink milk. It does your body good.
author: Janice C.

description: Fresh, incredible boba and aloe drinks, great snacks, friendly service, and I love their green tea soft serve with organic dairy. I also love how you can completely customize your drink, down to sweetness level and type of milk... best boba in the city -- the lines out the door don't lie.
author: Emilie M.

description: So good! Came here for the first time after hearing about it for so long and I returned later that day with a friend (: the menu is easy to understand and has great options. Sadly I didn't see the specials (hung next to the register) until after I ordered. Service is also very quick!
author: Brianna N.

description: I was super excited to try out boba guys after seeing their many posts about how much time they spend on developing their drinks and using all of these good quality ingredients. But boy was I disappointed. you would expect their drinks to taste a little bit better here, right ? I have ordered the matcha strawberry drink in which I was super excited because it looks so pretty in the pictures, but I was so disappointed, maybe matcha and strawberry does not go together at all? :( I really like the concept though. I came back another time to try the green milk tea with almond jello. The drink was really lacking in tea flavor and I felt like I was drinking water with milk and with a tiny tea flavor. But I really like the almond jello here. But I believe this place is super over hyped.
author: Janet Z.

description: Love this place! Offically addicted to Milk Tea and can't drink milk teas from any other places. Just not the same. I'll been to most of their locations and they never disappoint.
author: D V.

description:
I've had this place bookmarked for the longest time and thanks to my cousin's spontaneous idea of coming here, I was able to uncheck it from my list. 

The inside is sort of small. There's standing room, but only 4 chairs to sit at so it's best to take your drink and go. The counter where you order has a lot of goodies behind glass so be sure to check those out. They also sell Sugar n Spun cotton candy at $4 a container which is $1 cheaper than buying it from an actual Sugar n Spun stand so that was cool. And their adorable mason jar glasses? $10 each. 

Parking is all on the street and it's metered so make sure to bring coins! 

My cousin, my boyfriend, and I ordered the coconut green tea, muscat oolong, and horchata boba in that order. I have to say, I was not blown away by their horchata at all. You could definitely taste the cinnamon, no doubt about that and the boba was hella soft, but it just wasn't spectacular. I actually ended up liking my boyfriend's muscat oolong better. 

Overall, it's decent. Maybe I set my expectations too high for the horchata. Definitely gonna come back and try something else next time!
author: Venus L.

description: This was the best boba tea experience of my life. I can't wait to come back for the matcha flavor. I had the Indian chai with 75% sweetener, which is the recommended amount. Next time I will go for 50% sweetener, though the 75% wasn't sickeningly sweet.  I can't wait to be back.
author: Serena L.

description:
If you don't want boba, you have to tell them? Because they won't even ask if you want it, charge you for it, and when you ask them to take it out (without refunding you) they'll return to you the same milk tea without boba (so it's half empty). The worse part really is I tipped them (effectively paying $6 for 8oz of tea like this was some pretentious coffee shop in Seattle) 

:)
author: Ivy M.

description: By far my favorite boba place and I'm not much of a boba person! Their strawberry matcha latte is such a unique flavor and I love it! If you like more simple flavors I'd reccomend the Jasmine milk tea!
author: Kasey L.

description: Boba guys are warming up to me. They always have a location where I am craving boba like in the Mission area. The line is kind of ridiculous and there are like no tables in many of the locations esp this one. I like how there is a good size menu but not overwhelming with 50 different boba drinks. You can basically customize your drink however you like (type of milk - almond, soy, regular, sugar level, ice level, size, and hot/cold.) I got a warm boba which satisfied my boba craving and also kept me warm on a cold day. A bit pricy but overall I would come back.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Boba in the Mission?! Absolutely unheard of, but at the same time, it kinda works...

When trying any new boba place, I always get the original black milk tea. It's a classic, yet it tastes differently depending where you get it. Boba Guys' classic milk tea is refreshing and delicious. It's not overly sweetened, but not watered down either. I love how it has a distinct, but mild, tea taste that isn't hindered by too much cream.

One outrageous, crazy flavor Boba Guys offers is horchata. It's refreshing, and the cinnamon flavor is strong. However, it's not as creamy as I hoped, and it doesn't pair well with the sweet boba. It was a very very very strange combination that was worth a try, but not worth repurchasing, unfortunately.

The boba is sweet and chewy, but maybe shy of undercooked because some balls were just too hard. There's some inconsistency with size, and near the end of the drink, all the boba were all sticking to each other so that it was difficult sucking them up through the straw.

Service is super quick, friendly, and very upbeat. The shop is very clean and modern, though very small. There's only window seating that seats only 5 or 6 people. Although Boba Guys has good drinks, they're much pricier (average $4 here) than the typical boba shops on Irving St or Clement St.

In one word (or two), I call Boba Guys "hipster boba".
author: Priscilla W.

description:
This boba shop offers refined tea brewing with organic ingredients to boba drinks.

Looking at how they brew tea for each serving, shows the visual quality, timing and process to their precise tea brewing.

I ordered up their Lychee Green Milk Tea with boba and you can taste the difference in terms of freshness compared to other boba tea drinks I have had before!  A tad bit on the sweet side for my usual liking to milk tea boba drinks, but still good, nonetheless.

It was 5 bucks to experiment the slow tea brewing.  It was interesting to examine their process.  It was as if I was in a chemistry lab - measuring and timing the boba making.  

It was simply a good boba show and boba drink.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
What stood out to me:

-the tea is REAL and legit. None of that powder business

-no extra charge for almond milk. Huge plus for me and my fellow lactose intolerant folk

-almond jelly... Kinda tastes like sweet tofu tbh lol would not get again (can't get it with hot drinks btw)

-samples of interesting cotton candy flavors like salted caramel peanut butter. Delish!

-a 12 oz hot drink is the same prize as a 16 oz cold drink (that you can get w/ no ice)

-wonderful staff. So nice and accommodating even when there's a huge line out the door 

Altogether no complaints! Just prob wouldn't get the almond jelly again
author: Leesa L.

description: Not impressed. I got the decaf black milk tea, 25% sweet no ice, and I expected much more tea flavor than I got. I was also somewhat disappointed that the Thai tea sugar level can't be adjusted and that it's really sweet (according to the cashier). Interior is nicely decorated and has a nice clean look, but drinks are just okay. I had a sip of my friend's horchata which was really creamy, not too sweet (can't adjust sweetness on this either), and not too heavy on the cinnamon taste. But horchata being better than the actual milk tea at a boba shop is just...kind of =/. The pearls are good too, pretty chewy. But, not really liking the milk tea! All prices on the board include tax which is nice; price is on the expensive side at $3.75 not including pearls ($.50 more I assume) and for a smaller-than-standard (where my standard is Sharetea cup sizes) cup.
author: Andrea W.

description:
The boba balls are correctly chewy and not mushy. 

I bought a Thai Iced Milk tea boba and it was good.  If you're in the Mission and want boba then yes this is the place to get it. 

I also noticed they had chocolate black sesame and matcha green tea cotton candy packed in plastic tubs so I picked up some to give to a friend.
author: Peter H.

description:
This boba place is absolutely my favorite spot in the city. Every single location of Boba Guys has quality drinks, so it doesn't matter where I'm at in the city. If i crave boba, I can rely on Boba Guys just about anywhere and everywhere with that A1 drink. 

There's something so unique about the boba, either the chewiness or the taste. You can't really find the same balls anywhere else. It's definitely Grade A balls just like they say. 

There is also a variety of tea and choices. Every single one of them is so natural that even when I intake 16 oz. of sugary liquid, I can still feel healthy. So, seriously, choose anything that you want on that menu, and I can promise you that it'll taste delicious and natural. The tea taste is definitely there, and that's how I know that their drinks are definitely all natural. 

Oh, I also forgot to mention somewhere above that they give different options of milk! I always get soy because my stomach can't really tolerate dairy. So, if you're lactose and tolerant, don't be afraid to drink milk tea because Boba Guys can accommodate your needs.
author: Wendy T.

description:
Boba guys is different from any other boba place I've been to! 

During my trip to SF my friend suggested we go here. They have the traditional flavors but their mission is to create new and innovative flavors too! 

I stuck to the traditional matcha green tea. I wish it was more flavored with matcha. It was very light. The boba (tapioca balls) was chewy but soft it was perfect! I'd have to come back when I'm in town.
author: Ednalyn M.

description:
This is one of the most popular boba spots in the Bay Area. I was pleased with the quality of my drink, but I don't think it's something I'd go out of my way for. For the price point and wait time, it was a great experience, but not a must-have.

I went to this location on Black Friday (2016). To our surprise, the line was already out of the door. It's a very small shop and the wait took some time. I got to the front of the line and ordered my drink. The workers were very nice and went through orders very quickly. I personally don't like spending more than $5 for boba, but for the one time, I was definitely willing, especially with all of the hype surrounding the shop.

The wait time for the actual drink wasn't too long. I ordered the Muscat Oolong milk tea with boba. The taste was definitely interesting and worth the wait. It felt very authentic and flavorful. The only thing that disappointed me was the small size of the drink for the price. However, I left feeling pleased.

There's a ton of hype surrounding boba guys and it is well deserved. However, if you're like me and love boba all over the Bay Area, this isn't anything to go out of your way for. The price point brings it down a little bit, in my opinion, but in many ways, you get what you pay for. I would highly suggest Boba Guys to any first timer or SF tourist.
author: Calvin T.

description:
"I'M SO HAPPY RIGHT NOW."

That's literally what I kept repeating as I sat in Boba Guys' new shop and sipped on my boba. I've already reviewed Boba Guys' pop-up store, but I just can't get enough of them so I thought I'd give this page some lovin' as well. I'm so glad I finally decided to visit their new shop because it pretty much made my day.

There was no line when I walked in, just a small crowd of people waiting for their drinks. I wanted to try something new, since I've had the Classic and Jasmine already. I had trouble choosing between Hotchata and Iced Matcha, so I asked the guy (co-owner, I believe), decided I wanted a little caffeine, and went with the matcha. With boba, of course. 

I think this goes without saying that I LOVED MY DRINK. The boba was the perfect chewy, the matcha perfectly sweet, and I never wanted it to end. I kinda wish they offered Large sizes because I'd get it every time, no shame. I actually thought about getting a second drink, and was so, so close...

I said this in my last review and I'll say it again: Boba Guys is QUALITY. Straus organic milk, homebrewed tea, and NO POWDERS. I don't think you can find all of that in any boba place. Their overall brand is awesome as well - I especially love the handpainted aardvark in the store :)

I hear the Guys like to experiment (just look at their lab coats and beakers!), so I hope I get to visit again when they do something weird and awesome with their drinks. 'Til next time!
author: Alyssa T.

description: I don't really understand the hype of this place, especially since its more expensive than other places ($4-5 for a regular drink). Boba is good and made with fresh-tasting tea but tapioca is a bit too sweetened. Got the Hong-Kong style (yum! made with the standard condensed milk) and jasmine green milk tea. The drinks were a little watery though.
author: Cheryl W.

description: Pretty good boba! There is a lot of hype surrounding Boba Guys but it's not the best I've had in the Bay Area. The cafe is clean, not good for hanging out in though since it's pretty small. Overall, tasty boba with good options for those who are lactose intolerant
author: Jessie C.

description: I had brunch in the area with friends and wanted to grab some boba afterwards. Definitely on the pricier side when it comes to boba, but the milk they used was super creamy! Loved it!
author: Kevin T.

description:
Everyone got a free sample of cotton candy but me.  

At 6:30pm on a Saturday night, I was the only person inside aside from another girl waiting for her drink.  After that, about 5-6 more people came in and I kept hearing "Would you like a sample of our cotton candy? You just grab it like this.... yes, just like that."

Wow, why does that sound so sexual.

As for the boba, it's definitely high quality.  I got the Classic Milk Tea with almond jelly  as a standard milk tea drink, also because the horchata milk tea was sold out.  The tea is strong and the almond jelly is definitely better than the supermarket boxed kind.  

Parking is a biatch in this area and we were literally circling for 20-30 minutes before we found a spot.  Even the nearby parking garage was full.

I'll have to try other drinks to determine if this would be a boba spot I would want to take people to.  So far, it's high quality but the unique factor will be based on how well the other drinks are made.  Also, it'll have to withstand the fact that boba is making a comeback with mustache foam.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Okay I'm giving this place 4 stars for my friend's drink haha.

I ordered the strawberry matcha, but I wasn't a huge fan. The matcha flavor wasn't very strong and it honestly just tasted like milk with boba. Their pearls are really good though, they have that perfectly chewy consistency down.

My friend got the Jasmine Milk Tea which I loved. The tea flavor is really fragrant and you can actually tell that they used Jasmine tea. The balance of milk and sweetness is just right, and again, pearls were perfect.

Friend's drink saved my impression of the place, would go back to try other drinks if I'm ever in the Mission!
author: Jenn L.

description:
Store open when in the mood for Boba Tea?
FINALLY.
 
Sign inviting you to come in for their "grade A balls"?
SERIOUSLY?

Teeny Pineapple Cakes from Taiwan?
https://youtu.be/O-zpOMYRi0w

Decaf tea options?
SCORE.

Three kinds of milk?
SOY.

Level of sugar?
MEDIUM.

Organic ingredients?
DEFINITELY.

An extra charge for adding boba ($0.50) to your boba tea ($3.50)?
RIDICULOUS.

Armadillo drinking boba tea on the logo?
RANDOM.

But how'd it taste?
BOBALICIOUS!
author: Amy C.

description:
Really nice boba place. Looks really nice and clean. So I don't think that that this is the best boba I've ever had, I'm not even sure what would be, but this is a pretty good place, albeit on the expensive side.

I ended up ordering the horchata el salvadorian style boba with almond jelly. The cashier recommended it because it had a bit of almond in the milk used for the drink portion. My friend got the iced matcha latte with horchata milk rather than regular milk. Also delicious! 

Overall, great place, great cashiers. 

Protip: Always ask for suggestions.
author: Nina Y.

description:
Mehhhhh. Overpriced for mediocre milk tea.

There was a big hype about this place all over social media, so of course, I had to try it. I was highly disappointed. It was too watered down for my liking.
author: Steffi G.

description:
I'm always on the lookout for good tapioca milk tea, so I decided to give Boba Guys a try when I was in the area.  I had read about the hype online, so I had high expectations for my milk tea.

First, let me describe my perfect tapioca milk tea.  The milk tea is creamy, slightly sweet, with good tea flavor.  The tapioca balls are soft and sweet, with no hard centers.

I ordered a Jasmine milk tea without modification (normal dairy, no sweetness adjustment). The milk tea was not very milky, as if it was watered down, and it was not sweet at all.  The tapioca was good, however.

Considering the out of way location, the quality, and the price, I probably won't be back.
author: Nadeem A.

description: I came at around 3pm on a Saturday, and the line was LONG. I probably wouldn't have waited in line normally, but I wanted to see what all the hype was about. I ordered the Strawberry Cal-Pico drink with tapioca. I'm normally not a huge fan of tapioca in general, but I admit the tapioca here is better than all the ones I've had before. The texture and flavor are both tastier and easier to eat. The drink itself was okay but definitely pretty!
author: Katherine C.

description: Quality over quantity at this little boba place.  They don't have the crazy number of flavored teas, but what they do have is authentic and and fresh.  The boba was great as well.  Popular place in the Mission so expect a line at peak boba times, but service was very fast so you get your tea pretty much right after you order it.
author: Ronny T.

description:
i ordered the coconut milk tea with almond jelly. bad combo
the line was a million miles long. 
i don't get all the hype, but i'm glad to see boba going mainstream ^^
Ps. Parking around here is reddick
author: Jess K.

description: This place is really good. I've been here once, but technically twice. The first time I came, I didn't go in because it was a Friday night and the line was out the door. Parking was also ridiculous and hard to find. I went back the next day. The line was still out the door, but for good reason. Like most boba places in SF, there is not really much room inside the shop to actually hang out. The inside area is more for people to wait on their drinks. The line though, showed how popular the place is. I was recommended to come here by a friend of mine. I got the Jasmine Milk Tea. This place uses loose leaf and brews their own tea. The drink was probably some of the best milk teas I have ever had. i will definitely come back the next time I am in the area.
author: Jonathan E.

description: Even though the wait was a little long (on a Saturday sunny afternoon), I thought that this is a great spot! You can definitely taste the overall high quality ingredients that they use. Yes it is pricier, but the tea is great and you can add a combination of add-ons for a fixed price. I love experimenting with lychee jelly, almond jelly, and boba and this is the spot to indulge in all three. They also have very unique flavors for the more adventurous!
author: Helen F.

description: Pricey, fancy boba but good quality.  I like the Golden Honey milk tea with almond jelly, 50% sweet.  There's never been a line for me, and it's quick.  I just wish there was seating available.
author: Lyn C.

description: Best boba I've had in the city! The boba itself was cooked perfectly - just a little chewy yet firm. The Jasmine milk team and macha milk tea are so perfect. This is going to become a regular habit for me!
author: Jaching H.

description: Best tapioca pearls! Only downside is you need to drink them fresh. Wait an hour or two and the balls aren't as good anymore. They get tough and chewy quick. Highly recommend the strawberry matcha latte. I wasn't so sure about fruity boba before but this one gets it right.
author: M S.

description: The flavor is excellent but my drinks are never mixed well and I struggle to mix them well. No sealed top. Its expensive and I'd be okay with that if my drink was mixed.
author: Peter M.

description:
The mission district never fails to amaze me. 

Not only do the nice looking lofts and local shops and restaurants amaze me, but Boba Guys REALLY amazes me. 

Friendly staff, perfect boba, flavorful drinks, calm and interesting environment. 

Upon walking in, I was attracted by the simplistic and somewhat-scientific display of everything (maybe because the art of making boba isn't just the amount of love you add in it, it's the precise and perfect amount of sugar and milk and tea leaves added... After all, cooking is a science); their items and their souvenirs were displayed behind a glass wall, where everything was shining and placed carefully. 

Their menu wasn't confusing at all! They had their original milk teas, their premium milk teas, and more. My friend ordered the horchata milk tea (which surprisingly tasted pretty good), and I ordered the Rose black milk tea. 

I F***ING LOVED IT. 

PLEASE DO YOURSELF A FAVOR, GO TO BOBA GUYS, AND ORDER IT. 

Not only is it sweet, but you REALLY taste the floral essence of rose. It's like you're breathing a rose petal, all while chewing on the sweet and chewy boba. 

I cannot fathom how it rocked my tastebuds, but I am 100% sure I'm coming for more.
author: Mariam M.

description:
Did I just drive down to the Mission so that I could get milk tea from Boba Guys? Yeah, I did, and I would do it again.

I first discovered Boba Guys after a night out in the Mission getting my Wing Wednesday on, down the street. Of course, when we saw this ultra hipster boba spot, we just had to try it. I originally got the Duke of Earl Grey Milk Tea w/Boba ($4.45), which was absolutely delicious.

Today, I drove down with my roommate because we just had to get out of the library. I was surprised to see that the line went well out the door. However, the staff were all very quick and kind. I got the Iced Matcha Latte w/ Boba ($4.50) and my roommate got the Horchata w/Boba ($4.50). I know it's a little pricey, but you can taste it in the quality of the tea and the boba. I really liked the Matcha Latte, it certainly had a very strong matcha taste, and didn't taste watered down at all like other milk teas. You could tell this tea was made with love! 

They've got some other really interesting flavors we wanted to try like Camomile Mint, Lychee Green Tea, Indian Chai, and Roe Black Tea. Their almond jelly and grass jelly are made in-house, AND you can have the option between Straus Family Organic Milk, Almond Milk, or Organic Soy Milk. 

Yep, totally worth the drive.
author: Cara O.

description:
I've recently found my old account for Yelp and I'm in the midst of transferring over my reviews. The rating and the review are exactly the same so their overall review didn't change as I've deleted my reviews from my old account and it's not inactive. Reposting the old reviews with my previous ratings was the only way I can transfer these over unfortunately.

Review date: 4/2/2013 
I should have known better with a place that calls tapioca "boba" that it might not be legit. I walked in and at the bar there were a group of teenage hipsters (bleh...) and two older men. No ASIAN people surrounding this joint, it's a plus and a minus. I should have also known better when I saw the hipsters that maybe I should just go but nope my best friend wanted to get her drink out of a mason jar. I'm not into the mason jar hype so I got mine in a to-go cup so I can judge purely on the drink and not how "awesome" it is to get tapioca - oops I meant boba - in a mason jar. I got the soy milk tea because I asked if the drink would be sweeter because it is made with soy milk (I like my tapioca on the sweeter side) the lady said yes so I settled. Mine was super watered down and it didn't have much flavor in general. Basically I spent $4 on brown water. I didn't think much of it because I have a somewhat picky palette but my friend on the other hand is easier to please and she did not like her Jasmine milk tea one bit. She said hers was also watered down. So 2/2 that was a NAYYYY, I'm sure I'm not coming back for 4 buck funky water (considering I don't even like to drink water).
author: Yvonne L.

description: The tea, the milk, the boba, the crazy hipster gourmet flavor - all so good, it'll blow your mind. I usually can't even pretend to justify paying 5 bucks for boba, but I'd do it all day erry day for more of your muscat and earl grey Boba Guys. Please, send someone to the NYC shop to fix it because they are behind, my friend. Also, put one in Flushing or something, so I can go more often. Also, while I'm wishing for things, I want a unicorn and a date with Daisy Ridley, Santa. Sincerely, Ruobin.
author: Ruobin W.

description:
The name is Boba Guys but I didn't get any balls. I'll get them on my own terms--anytime, anywhere, any place. 

This place is super hipster as it's in Mission and with the range of bubble tea places in SF, you'll probably see less Asians here. Thanks to my OCD on Tumblr, I only know of this place through the photos of their drinks on mason jars. Turns out those jars are $10. Came here with a few friends from the area who also wanted to check the place out. You'd definitely miss this place if you don't look for it because it is small. You know you're not in Chinatown anymore when you see the iPad station and the decor and design--from ceiling to floor--is hip.

Menu is limited, to my surprise and a small costs $4, which is high for SF standard pricing and also high for New York bubble tea pricing, which $3 is a minimum. I got the Classic Milk Tea with Almond Jelly and to my surprise, the milk tea had a great balance of sweetness to it. I've never had almond jelly before so it was a first for me and I really liked it. Reminds me of solidified almond tofu. I'm glad I got to try this place while it's still new, though I really wanted to try their Lychee Green Tea. It's definitely a "East Meets West" experience and they're starting out small with some main Hong Kong food staples--it's a good experience for Americans who want to try that style. Will be back the next time I'm in San Francisco and hopefully, their menu will expand!
author: Sharon T.

description: Best boba that I've had so far. You know they use quality tea and I love that you can adjust your sweetness. I got 50% sweetness of the original milk tea and it was perfect for me. I came here with 5 friends and was the only one who wanted boba, after they tasted mine they all ended up getting their own boba. definitely worth going to if you're in the area !
author: Julie F.

description:
Pretty cool place in the Mission! There seems to always be a line here, but it's worth the wait. My girlfriend and I were in the area and decided to stop by here for a snack on a weekend afternoon. We've always heard about this place since friends have raved about it, so it seemed only fitting that we stopped by.

We ordered the Jasmine Milk Tea with Grass Jelly with Almond Milk & 75% sweetness level. Not too bad! I couldn't really taste the tea flavor at first because it was pretty sweet, but after a few stirs, it was the perfect balance. It's a little harder to "shake it up" since the drink comes with a lid as opposed to being vacuum sealed like some other places are.

The staff here is very friendly and lets you take your time when you order. They also have merchandise with the Boba Guys logo here as well as some homemade cotton candy. The Li Hing Pineapple flavored cotton candy was pretty great! Better than I expected. Also, their almond jelly and grass jelly are homemade too!

I would definitely come here again to try the other tea flavors (they have speciality tea flavors as well) and the other toppings. The almond jelly would be worth trying next time!
author: Ian K.

description:
I really enjoyed the Horchata boba with grass jelly (though the grass jelly he a bit of a mint flavor). They have a side menu every month with pretty good options too.

I recently got into loose tea and they offer some random but fun flavors. Though the prices are up there with places like Teavana. 

The music is enjoyable and it's in a pretty good location...right off the Main Street.
author: Simone J.

description: The line was so long, but the wait wasn't too terrible. I ordered the lychee green tea with boba. The tea was good, but the boba was pretty bad. They were overly sweet and some were nice and chewy and some had a weird bite to them. Very inconsistent.
author: Beverly C.

description:
Boba Guys sells two types of Toast, Kaya and Hong Kong Style. The former, home-made coconut jam and honey. The latter a whipped sweet cream also with honey. Both are on top of lightly toasted brioche.

Today, uncharacteristically, the Kaya was not sold out.

Four Stars.
author: James G.

description:
Hipster boba in the Mission. I like that Boba Guys uses real tea and unusual flavours that are not offered at your typical boba place.

Since this place is near work, my friends and I usually order online in advance and then pick it up, which is convenient if you're pressed for time since you can pay online too. Parking in this area is a bit tricky - street parking is almost always full! So this online option is also good if you're just making a quick stop since you'll know when your order is ready, and then you can just walk in to the counter (on the left) and then out again pretty much immediately.

There's a small seating area, bit the shop is quite small so I never really stick around. There's some snacks (like liege waffles) available for purchase if you're craving a little something to go with your drink.

Overall, a good place. I'm definitely a fan. After my last experience, I think I will order online more often than not since the last time I went in person, they got my order wrong and there was a line out the door.
author: Bianca C.

description:
Boba guys is solid - fresh tea and real milk with perfect chewy boba - delish. They've not only done an outstanding job at creating their brand - they also do make legit, delicious boba milk teas. In this small space, be ready to order, pick up, and head out. 

For $3.50-$5 a cup, expect a refreshing treat made by your local Mission hipsters!

Both credit cards or cash are accepted- woohoo.
author: Veronica S.

description:
Empty when I came on a Thursday around 5 but a line immediately formed right after me. Very friendly and patient cashier. 
The menu was very easy to understand compared to other boba places. Short and to the point.
$.50 for add on toppings AND you and mix and match your topping!!
They use organic milk and no additional cost to substitute for soy milk. Overall very decent pricing for boba nowadays. 

I ordered the soy matcha iced latte with almond jelly and grass jelly (also requested for less ice). It was very bitter?? I decided to wait to go home and added condense milk as my own sweetener. More drinkable after that.

I posted an Instagram photo of my drink after that.  Captioned it "so pretty but so gross". Boba Guys responded to my post within a day apologizing and offered me refund or another drink on the house. I just gave them my email and will update this review once I come back for the drink on the house!
author: Sarah T.

description: Okay, so I am in love with coffee milk tea. The one place that I get the coffee milk tea from is in SoCal, called 7leaves. HOWEVER, I came across boba guys and I have always wanted to try it and, with my luck, they have coffee milk tea. I decided to give it a try and OMG I fell in love again! They make their coffee milk tea just as good as I like it. I don't know what it is, but that mixture is just hella good and hella refreshing. I haven't tried anything else since I have been going here, but I am willing to... unless I change my mind and stick to the one I like HAH. They have two locations in SF, one by union square and this one. There could be more, I don't know. But I wish this location was closer to my house.. I love it! Good job boba guys.
author: Katie L.

description:
High quality tea and milk.  There are numbers of selection from Thai Tea, black tea, oolong, and even Indian Chai (rare at tapioca tea place).  Milk includes regular milk, almond milk, and soy milk.  Toppings include tapioca, almond jelly, and grass jelly.  For desserts, there are Hong Kong style French toast and Kaya toast from Malaysia/Singapore.  Also, you can buy tea leaf by pounds.

I drink Chai without sugar the most and taste is authentic.
author: Charles S.

description:
Actually really good. It is quite pointless to get jasmine since it tastes almost like every other boba place. 

But man that Strawberry Jasmine Tea Fresca is just so refreshing. Like I can actually taste the Jasmine, the strawberry and the tea independently yet together in the same sip! But you might wanna drink it cold/water. I got mine in a bottle, didn't have any ice left so it was too sweet. But it was good! Definitely recommend.
author: Thu N.

description:
Had never bothered going to this place, but had definitely heard the hype. 

Went with a few friends last week and we ordered four separate drinks, including the iced matcha latte with boba, Hong Kong style, and hojicha. Personally, I ordered the Hojicha at 0% sugar, while I also got a taste of the other drinks. 

Through my experience, I concluded one thing - AMAZING tea flavors! I highly recommend that if you go to Boba Guys, order one of their premium milk teas, and order it with a lower sugar content level. Many milk tea places mask the poor quality of their actual teas with sweetening agents, and if you actually try their teas with low sweetness levels, it becomes alarmingly similar to just drinking milk and no tea. However, my Hojicha was very flavorful by itself, and it complemented nicely with the general sweetness of the boba toppings. 

The Iced Matcha Latte drink is also highly recommended, while the Hong Kong style was good but not quite anything special.
author: Matthew L.

description: Went here with my Bestie it's so good. The line is always super long so it's not easy to go on lunch breaks. If we could order for pick up that would be DOPE Matcha latte is my favorite.
author: Sasha M.

description:
2.5/5. 

As a Canadian, I found the price to be quite fair, as I have seen a $6-7 bubble tea in Toronto before. In addition, all items are housemade and the owners clearly stated where all the ingredients are coming from, hence the price make sense. 

I got the Hong Kong milk tea with regular tapioca and 50% sweet, however my drink was overly sweetened. Because of that, I was unable to taste the black tea and the HK milk tea was not as smooth as the ones I have had in Toronto. The tapioca was too firm and had the same texture as the tapioca that you leave in the fridge overnight. Overall, a very disappointed drink. 

My sister had the matcha latte with almond jelly and it was simply amazing, but again the drink was way too sweet.

Despite the 2.5/5 rating for me, I would still give this shop another chance and try other flavors when I'm in the city.
author: Anh T.

description:
Ah I love Boba Guys and all their stores. I used to be more meh about them because their milk tea is definitely on the expensive side. BUT, I really admire what they stand for as a business and I get that the milk tea is more expensive as a function of the fact that they also pay for higher grade ingredients which I think do actually make a difference in terms of the milk tea that you're drinking.

At this location, I've only ordered just the standard milk tea with boba. I was actually pretty impressed at how quickly it came out--literally came out in less than a minute which was awesome. Milk tea is spot on--not too sweet, and the boba is just the right amount of chewy which is awesome.

This store also has way more space than their Stockton Street one. It was a bit dirty on the day that I went, but probably just because it was rainy? I have yet to return on a different day.  

tldr; yummy boba at a higher price, but definitely worth it!
author: Jasmine X.

description:
Boba guys was my very first bubble tea experience and it was great. The line was long, but worth waiting in. I ordered the horchata bubble tea and it was delicious. Exactly what you would expect it to be; cinnamon toast crunch flavored milk! My drink had the perfect amount of boba balls, and wasn't too sweet, it was perfect. 

My favorite thing about this place is that they use healthy ingredients as opposed to other shops that use high fructose corn syrup and lower quality products. The syrups at Boba guys are house made, and they use premium teas and organic milk. Though they charge significantly more for their bubble tea, I think it is totally worth it. Two days later I tried a bubble tea from an inexpensive asian shop and I could immediately tell the difference in taste and quality. Boba guys is my new go to spot for bubble tea!
author: McKenna P.

description:
I've come to this location and the one in Chinatown a few times and I gotta say, it's not really worth the hype for me. I'd give it 3.5 stars if I could.

Is Boba Guys delicious? Yes. Are their drinks of higher quality? Yes. Is the actual business pleasant to be in? Sure, as far as a grab-n-go concept like boba are concerned. The branding is pretty cute, with that cheeky little aardvark just doin' his thang in the center of the logo. So why the 3 stars?

Something about Boba Guys just doesn't do it for me. I feel like part of my issue is that my drink is gone in three sips...maybe instead of the 16oz size I should be ordering the 20oz? But I also feel like a lot of a 16oz from Boba Guys is mostly ice...

Had the Muscat oolong tea with light sweetness, almond milk, and boba today. I liked the flavor of the oolong with the almond milk and the boba had great chewiness and a slight sweetness, which is a great combo. Recently, I had my first oolong milk tea at Little Sweet in the Richmond and while it was a completely different variety than the one served at BG, it set the bar pretty high. 

This drink, as well as all the other drinks I've gotten from here, are good. But they're a little steep in price for what you end up with, which is delicious, and gone instantly. You want to be able to justify spending $5 on tasty boba but when the experience is so short-lived, and there are sooo many other boba places to try, I feel like it's okay to try this place at least once, just to check it off the list.

I will be back, at some point, but eagerly await exploring the other boba options in the bay.
author: Megan D.

description:
The tea and tapioca are of great quality, and there are dairy-free options, as well as options for how sweet your want your tea. If you feel like treating yourself take a quick gander at their special teas - in this store they are hung to the right of the register. I can't stop myself from getting the Strawberry Matcha Latte. Take a picture to enjoy the layered look then stir it up for a perfectly sweet, green tea beverage.

While there is a very small area to sit down this is a small location mostly designs to get in, order your tea, wait briefly then head out. Great for a walk down Valencia with a beverage in hand or a stop on your way around the city.
author: Pandora C.

description:
Pretty solid place. There isn't a ton of boba places in this part of the neighborhood so this place basically has a monopoly. I thought the boba balls were pretty good but nothing to go to town about. The tea itself is made to order and is pretty good. 

There's also gourmet cotton candy which was pretty interesting. I thought it was okay but the problem was that I had to ask for the free sample. I felt a little judged but as the Costco queen that I am, I live for samples. I personally like freshly made cotton candy. Since the spun sugar is so susceptible moisture, I think this premade cotton candy was on the tail end of freshness.
author: Anh T.

description: The best boba I've ever had! I've been to a few places in the city that left me kind of nonplussed, so I was delighted when I finally tried Boba Guys. Everything was completely on point, and in addition to that the space was nice and clean and the staff was extremely polite. I would recommend this for sure.
author: Tini T.

description:
Bit of background - I'm not the hugest boba fan in the world....and I'm seriously loving this place.

Dairy free milk options? Check!
Gluten free boba? Check!
Teas made from actual tea leaves and not powdered "stuff"? Check!
Homemade grass jelly? CHECK!

Everything tastes incredibly fresh and I love how you can completely customize your sweetness level. 

The almond milk jasmine with boba is my way to go. Run, don't walk, to boba guys (....expect a wait though).
author: Kathy O.

description:
Boba Guys are pretty cool in my book.  I was even more excited to hear that one of the guys that started this business was a Cal Grad!  Go Bears!  I love my alma mater. 

But I digress, been wanting to come here for a while and finally made time for it after a spa treatment 2 weeks ago.  I had tried to call to see their hours but it was a google voice number so I didn't leave a message.  The way they say their name on the VM was totally funny (Bobaaaa Guys!)  I felt like they are old friends or something upon hearing their friendly voice.

Now, onto the boba.  I love that they not only have almond and soy milk but don't charge extra for them.  The pearls were a tad sweeter than I prefer but still very good.  I enjoyed my matcha latte boba with 30% sweetness and almond milk.  Every sip was creamy and consistent.  

Their logo is way too cool.  So cool that I bought their mason jar mug for $12.  Whenever I look at it I think Holiday Armadilllllloooo (from that Friends episode).  Gotta love the Armadillo.

Solid place, and now I want to try other flavors.
author: Yue L.

description:
Being a 23 yr old Asian female....means that I am sort of a boba expert. It's just the era that I was born in. Before fro-yo, cupcakes..there was boba.

They aren't kidding when they say "Grade A Balls". Honestly they know how to cook them balls here.

I always hate it when I start drinking/eating? boba again...you just can't stop. But I am glad to start up this "horrible habit" of mine with Boba Guys.

-Get the green tea matcha. ER MA GAWD.
-HK milk tea - duh, never fails.

** if they don't ask you how sweet/not sweet you like your drink. Just let them know. The levels of sweetness can be altered! And they have different "types" of milk :)

so so so so good. I want them chewy balls STAT.
author: Selina W.

description:
Spectacular! I seriously expected this place to be "good" but not "great" based upon the previous reviews. But I have to say, it's the best I've had... and I've been a boba fan for over a decade, and lived all over the state.

I literally intend to try all of the different flavors here (at 75% sweetness). It's about a 2 mile walk, round trip, so I can justify it with exercise. My new go-to boba place!
author: Sean B.

description:
Amazing boba balls... Top 3 from all the bobas I've had. Perfectly chewy and sweet yet not too soft.

Drinks are very good as well... Top tier.

Wish the cups were slightly bigger but I guess that's the SF standard.
author: SJ Y.

description:
Bottom Line? Hipster friendly boba made accessible to people who aren't used to it as a drink (or the texture of boba.) Maybe it's not the most authentic, but Boba Guys does boba up right, and they also happen to be the closest boba place to my house SOOOO I do come here often. (They also offer delivery on Postmates and Doordash if you're lazy or bedridden like me-- something y'all might wanna think about!)

Consistently good because they are very accommodating to your tastes-- you can choose your choice of milk (regular, soy, almond, etc.) and sweetness (which is a new fad that I'm seeing as of now, but it's helpful for a diabetic like me!) Their boba is fairly sweet, so even if you get 0% sugar, if you get boba with it-- the drink is still bound to be somewhat sweet. I really appreciate their slow bar here because you know they're brewing you up some fresh tea :) If you order from the slow bar, it takes around 3-5 minutes for them to brew your tea and serve your drink. It goes by fast though, I promise. My favourites off the basic menu are the matcha and the hong kong (always down for condensed milk!) But if you want to be adventurous, I'm a huge fan of the Golden Honey Black (which has a hint of sweetness to it, even at low sweetness levels) and the Rose Black Tea (floral af, but soooo delicious.) The boba is always at perfect consistency-- chewy and warm, but like I said before-- I think they store their boba in a simple syrup mixture because it's super sweet and will add sweetness to your drink. 

If you're down for snacks, the cotton candy from Sugar & Spun is sold here, and they have outrageous weird flavours-- my favourite being the Li Hing Pineapple. They also have other bites, and fresh honey toast (Hong Kong Toast) topped with condensed milk whipped cream. It's sweet and decadent, but definitely reminiscent of Japanese Honey Toast (though not as big.) Worth the money, get it! 

All in all, Boba Guys is my go-to boba place because of their consistency and great quality drinks. The only qualm I have is when the line is out the door because their shop is WAY too small for the amount of foot traffic they get.
author: Christa Lei S.

description: The drinks are all customizable but they tend to be less sweet that other places. I got mine extra sweet which the person told he would be about 125% sweet since it already comes sweetened. I thought this was perfect because I tried the 100% sweetened version and it tasted pretty bland. The lychee green tea was mediocre but the boba itself was nice and soft.
author: Alison T.

description:
Hong Kong style milk tea! 
The tea is pretty good, but if you take your time, the boba balls gets all hard and not yummy
author: Christina T.

description:
Ehh. Overrated.

We got the Hojicha milk tea but it wasn't as flavorful as I was expecting. 

Quality milk, premium balls, but your tea isn't strong enough. I got light sweetness just to taste the tea, but it was an overall bland drink. Even the balls had more flavor than the milk tea itself.
author: Bonnie L.

description:
The one on Stockton has a very long line so when I saw this here I couldn't resist but to go in. I got the horchata with bubbles to try since I heard this place was an example of bubble tea heaven.I found this place to be alright but nothing really special about it.
The drink was good but not really to my taste.
My friend got the Hong Kong milk tea with bubbles and that was not bad since it got the key notes to the hong Kong milk teas I had in the past . he didn't seem to like it though as flavor wasn't strong enough for him.
The bubbles though was a little too hard in my opinion
The ship itself is small and cute but def unique. prices are moderate for drinks but it can get pretty expensive once you start with toppings.
I would say this place was eh. Try this place if you can but if you can't... you won't really miss it
author: Bei T.

description:
The strawberry matcha latte boba is a MUST HAVE! I am a HUGE boba fan and let me tell you... nothing can compare to this. I have yet to find a unique drink here in the SoCal area that can come close. But once I do best believe the judges panel is coming out haha. 

We went to the Mission location and chilled at Dolores Park while enjoying this tasty drink. Parking is pretty scary since I'm not yet used to the narrow streets but I got it done in one try haha. Thankfully there wasn't a line at all cause it would've been torture waiting to try this strawberry matcha that I fell in love with over Instagram. It's so cute how the drink comes with separated colors. Of course, you have to mix it to get the full flavor. But oh my goodness it was so good. Not too sweet which was great and the strawberry tasted as real as it can get, it seemed like they just mashed up a strawberry and threw it in the drink. I'm gonna have to watch the process next time I go :)
author: Danya P.

description:
The bubble tea here is amazing. The tea flavor is super strong, bubbles are on point, and they use organic ingredients. I haven't tried many things, but the black milk tea and jasmine milk tea are very good. I also tried the strawberry matcha latte from the special menu and it was amazing. It wasn't what I expected, so i was pleasantly surprised. Definitely should try that out!
Price is good. The quality is amazing, so it's definitely worth.
Definitely will be back for more!!
author: Maggie W.

description:
I've come back several times, hoping for a better drink with each visit... but more times than not, I've left disappointed :( 

I was most disappointed by the Iced Matcha Latte. I got it with almond milk, and it was waaayyy too milky with barely any tea flavor. It was also served to me lukewarm and tasted extremely watered down. 

I do like that they use high-quality ingredients like Strauss organic milk and Califia almond milk. They also make all the toppings in-house! The boba is nice and chewy, and the grass jelly is extremely fresh and fun to eat. I do, however, wish they came in smaller chunks that actually fit through the straw.
author: Samantha C.

description:
Finally came to this place after wanting to try it due to all the hype. I got the HK milk tea tapioca. They charge you extra for tapioca, which is nickel and diming customers in my opinion. My drink was over $5. 

The "default" sweetness level is 100% but I choise 75%. Boy, I was glad I chose 75% because  for the first time in my boba-drinking life, I had to add water the dilute the drink because it was so painfully sweet. I feel bad for whoever orders the 100% "default" sweetness because that would be like drinking straight honey. Next time, if I do go back, I will order 50% sweetness. 

IMO, Purple Kow in the Richmond district still beats this. Maybe the financial district location is better so I will give this place on more shot before I decide. Parking was a bitch, I spent like 30 minutes trying to find one. The clerk was hot though.
author: U L.

description:
I admit - I had my doubts after having my first Boba Guys experience at their pop-up location at Ken Ken ramen. 

...but the real stuff is the good stuff. Freshly brewed Tea People tea, great staff and care for customer service, and some pretty unique takes on the Taiwanese drink. They use Strauss family creamery milk and make their grass jelly and almond jelly in house. This makes all the difference. 

You might find yourself thinking "Man, this is some expensive boba." And quite frankly, it is. But it's worth it. It can easily run up to around $5 a drink for the slow bar, but the tea flavors are spot on, the ingredients are distinguishable, and the quality is there.

For those who know what's up, they sell Sunny Hills pineapple cake. This is the most amazing pineapple cake, straight from Taiwan, ever. (It often sells out)

Need to blend in with the neighborhood? They sell some pretty cool mason jar cups with boba-straw fitting lids.
author: Colleen M.

description: I had the classic milk tea with Boba. The tea was kind of weak and they were skimpy on the boba. Seemed like a trendy and popular spot. Not sure why this place has 4 stars. That's a head scratcher for me.
author: Brandon B.

description:
I am not a boba snob but I've tried enough to know the quality and how well crafted a drink should be. 

Came here a few months back and tried the Horchata with regular boba - definitely NOT a fan. Recently came back and tried the Green Tea Matcha w/ almond jelly and I am hooked!!! The tea was perfectly made, matcha was not too sweet or overpowering (like at Ramen Bar). The almond jelly added the perfect texture and sweetness to the already delish tea. Being the coconut lover that I am, I recently tried the Coconut Milk Tea w/ almond jelly, and I'd say it's a close tie. Aside from the delicious tea, I just love the way the drinks are made.
author: Katie N.

description: Very clean environment. It was a small store. I got the classic boba tea. The boba was very chewy and sweet. The milk was fresh milk. Overall, it's was good experience.
author: Connie H.

description:
3.5 stars? 3.7, maybe? 

What I liked: 
-Service. They were part of a commercial the day we went, so the film crew had some miscellaneous supplies that were piled up by the wall. Service was also slower and the line was out the door, so the owner gave everyone 15% off their orders, which was unexpected but definitely appreciated. They also continued to apologize as we were in line, which was not necessary, but a gesture that shows the type of customer service they uphold.
-Branding. I've seen their anteater while perusing Instagram and was already intrigued. It's so cute and such a simple but memorable and effective marketing tactic as a newcomer to the already-saturated boba market. 

Good, but not great:
-Iced original milk tea with boba. I can tell that the quality of the tea leaves is not the best I've had (e.g., Ten Ren/Tastea). It's not that strong. As I continued to drink my 16 oz tea, it becomes a bit more diluted, more so than is expected with ice melting. 
-Same with boba...good, but not great. I can't pinpoint it exactly, but I think I would have preferred it to be more QQ and honey-infused. I am a boba fiend, or nitpicky amateur boba connoisseur at best. 

Skip:
-Jasmine milk tea. Jasmine taste is somewhat strong, but it tastes more milky or watered down than anything else. Even my friend who got this drink preferred my original milk tea.

Overall good and would come back again, 'cause why not, I love boba...but not the best I've ever had (Drake's words, not mine).
author: Phoebe C.

description:
I am always on the look out for boba.

Stopped by here to get my usual milk tea with boba before heading to Delores Park. They make their drinks on the sweeter side do i opted for the less sweet version which was still a bit too sweet.

Made fresh to order and boba had good consistency.
author: Phuong K.

description:
Boba guys did not disappoint! The boba itself had a good consistency, not too hard and not too chewy. I liked that they offer almond milk as a choice for the milk teas, along with regular milk and soy milk. I got the jasmine milk tea with almond milk and enjoyed it. It wasn't too sweet and the tea wasn't watered down.

The service was good. The cashier was helpful in helping me decide what to order. And despite the line that went out the door, I thought our drinks were brought out in a timely manner. Would definitely come back to try their other drinks!
author: Andrea F.

description:
I still need someone to change my mind about Boba Guys. I'm sorry--I don't want to admit that I'm not a fan of this place, but I've definitely had better.

Service and Space:
Yeah, it's cramped, but I've seen worse. The people who make the drinks are cheery enough, despite dealing with a large crowd that's been waiting for their sugar fix for way too long. However, when it comes down to the time it takes to make the drink itself... that's where Boba Guys loses. My friends and I waited for 10 to 20 minutes for basic brewed tea, even sans toppings.

The people who make your drinks aren't the friendliest, though, when it comes to modifying your drink, so you better hope that they make it the way you like it the first time, or risk getting some begrudging stares. 

Drinks and Food:
Although the drinks are customizable, there is still a limit on how little sugar you can add to the drink. Perhaps not surprisingly, the Hong Kong, Thai Tea, and Horchata drinks still have immense amounts of sugar. The pearls are also hit or miss--some of them are extremely chewy, whereas others clump together. The jellies are a better option for those who want reliable taste and texture.

Interestingly enough, what I like most about Boba Guys' offerings is not actually their drink menu, but rather actually the food. If you get a chance, try their Hokkaido Toast, which is a great complement to any milk tea you order. They don't go overboard with their condensed milk, and is just barely crunchy enough for you to enjoy.

Overall? If you're going here, customize the premium milk teas, as those tend to be more consistent in quality. But at least you can take an IG picture with the large logo, because that seems to be more worth that wait.
author: Kat P.

description: Yummy yum!  There's a Boba Guys near me in Union Square but this one in the Misson is open on Sundays!  It was a warm, sunny Sunday and I wanted a good boba drink before going to a class.  I bought a reusable cup, check.  And then I got an iced lychee green tea with soymilk - perfect.  Awwww :)
author: Maile N.

description:
Best boba. Hands down. Wins with texture, taste, and how it doesn't toughen up at all in a cold beverage. The organic milk and almond milk are to die for, but I'm personally I just stick to the almond milk. My personal favorite drink is Iced Matcha with almond milk and no sweetener. I just love how earthy their match is. Thai Tea is also a favorite, Jasmine, and Honey Black Tea. 

Also if you're brave enough, try the charcoal pineapple cake! It's dry at first, but the jam in the middle makes it all worth it.
author: Bernadette F.

description:
Boba Guys was dope, they got these cool ass cups that have Arthur on one side and a Vulcan symbol on the other. Their little black balls are so ballsy good. I got the Muscat Oolong which was super good and rightly sweet the way I like it.
4 Stars cause a bit pricey after the addons but sall gucc
author: Justin H.

description:
I wanted to try this place since there was always losing huge line. There was no line today on Monday afternoon. Well... Nothing really special to me. Maybe the location and stuff just make everything fancy. I don say it's bad, it's good...but it's not worth to wait for a long time to get a drink. 
I would rather go to the Quickly on mission without any wait.
author: K K.

description:
Great location, nice atmosphere and great costumer service.

A great selection of Boba Teas you will enjoy this place.
author: Luis A.

description: Perfect place for a refreshing cup of cold milk tea and boba! There was a line going outside but it's a given on hot days. The only thing that sucks is parking but I got lucky with a spot down the street.
author: Fredelice D.

description: They use organic milks but I feel like it should be a bit creamer. Tapioca is a bit bland as well. Almost perfect. This location didn't have a long line when I was there which is great as well.
author: Ti B.

description: So disappointed ... The line keeps growing and the quality keeps going down. One of the things I loved about Boba Guys in the beginning was that they were so concerned with maintaining the quality of their drinks. You pay extra for the freshly made teas which were made in front of you before, but now they either do not steep them long enough or they are pre-made to keep the line moving. Either way, after you wait in such a long line, you expect quality that they just aren't giving anymore. The drinks aren't as good and it's definitely not worth the cost. The only good part is the tapioca balls (they are still awesome). I was a customer since they opened and I'm just sad that it seems growth is compromising their quality.
author: Cara R.

description:
My favorite milk tea place in the city! I've tried a variety of their drinks and my favorites are the coffee milk tea and the jasmine milk tea. They are a bit more expensive than traditional boba shops, but the quality of their drinks is well worth it!

The Strauss creamery milk really makes a difference! I've also tried substituting their drinks with soy milk instead. Too watery for my liking, and it takes away from the authentic milk tea taste. 

Their default sweetness is a little too sweet for me though. I usually get either 50% or 75% sweet. 

I'm not a boba fan, but occasionally, I will get their honey boba. The texture is soft, but not too chewy, and the honey adds even more flavor to the drink. 

My favorite topping is the almond jelly. It tastes exactly like the almond jello dessert that my mom used to make and it definitely complements their milk teas really well. 

I'll be coming back soon to try the rest of their drinks!
author: Vivian L.

description: To call your self "Boba guys" should imply your Boba simply can't be beat. I wish I loved it but it was just good Boba, not great. Tried a Hong Kong style milk tea and their signature horchata. Maybe because I know Mexican horchata I'm disappointed but it wasn't sweet or creamy enough. The milk tea was good, I'd order it again but I definitely will not stand in a 20 minute line for the Boba guys ever again. In a nutshell- overrated.
author: Ashlee L.

description: First time here & parking is an ass, I really wish parking in sf wasn't this horrible! Esp getting something quick & easy like a drink. But regardless, so glad I came! A few friends really wanted to try this place out so my bf & I tagged along. I got a coconut green milk tea (4/5) I tried my friends drinks & honestly thought their drinks tasted better, definitely coming back for my own full cup! the Muscat oolong milk tea was really good & a hot Hong Kong style milk tea was perfect for a breezy sf night. I did the most for my photo to post on yelp that I accidentally dropped a full cup of boba & they were nice enough to clean it up for me & replace it for free  5/5 for overall the freshness of the tea & great customer service, will definitely be back!
author: Moriah D.

description:
I was craving bubble tea one day and did a yelp search to find that the closest place to me was actually Boba Guys in the Mission and not Quickly in Chinatown.

The boba is always just right. I love that I can modify sweetness and add almond jelly. My favorite flavor is the Rose Black Tea.
author: Dawn P.

description:
Doesn't live up to the hype.

I would say that the teas here are all pretty good (I've had lychee rose and the matcha) but the toppings are all flavorless. The boba is not honey boba and has no sweetness at all. The grass jelly is also tough and flavorless, not quite sure why it's much firmer than any I've ever had before. 

If the lines weren't long and the prices were lower, I would be more interested in coming frequently. But for now, the search for good boba in SF still continues.
author: Anna M.

description: This has been our jam lately. I newly discovered the almond jello along w the usual boba, and it just reminds me of the almond jello and lychee dessert drank my mom used to make and mix, when I was a kid. Anyway, there's usually a line of at least 5 people ahead but it's worth the wait. The line moves quickly and cashier folks are kind. Boba guys is a nice treat whether you're already in the mission or not. Worth the trip from daly city, and parking usually isn't too bad. but I guess patience helps, too!
author: Roxane P.

description: I read in a "top 5 best boba places in SF" article that this place was one of the best to have a boba drink. Whoever wrote that article was right. The choices are what create the drink - I got an almond milk matcha green tea latte 50% sweetened. The taste was divine, so light. The perfect matcha green tea almond milk latte. Now trying that with their freshly made boba was a great combination but I might not get bobas in my drink as I don't favor big servings of them. Other than that I'll definitely be returning.
author: K. J.

description:
I heard nothing but good things about this place so I wanted to try it out anyway.
I got the jasmine milk tea and almond jelly. I didn't really like the tea that much and it took me a long time to drink it. I ended up tossing it. The almond jelly tasted really weird and kind of digusting imo. I do like a strong tea flavor and that's what I got but I also just got a really bad headache right after. I'm not sure if I'd come back. I am just happy that when I went, there was only 2 people in front of me. I probably would've been extra disappointed if I had to wait an hour in line like how some other yelpers had reviewed.
author: Christine N.

description:
Hyyyyyype. I mean, Boba Guys is good, but not as amazing as I thought it would be.

Strawberry Matcha Latte: The strawberry purée is a nice touch, but if I were to come back, I'd probably try the basic matcha latte.

Horchata: Probably the tastier one of the two that we ordered. 

I know they've got their premium ingredients and stuff but their drinks just didn't hit the spot for me. If I could, I'd give them 3 1/2 stars, but I can't, and I'm not rounding up today.
author: Jenny Y.

description: Yo, so I drink boba guys everyday to the point that I don't know what to order anymore. I go to all of them in SF. The chicks at the mission one made me a  one though!!! Lol best shit ever!!!
author: Pannie M.

description: I will say that the success is getting to their heads. When I used to come here a few years ago the service and boba were excellent. They need to hire people that are more courteous and less attitude. Also, I brought my own mason jar because I hate to create waste. They gave me a $.25 discount for that but then they took it back because it wasn't a boba guys mason jar. I'm conscientious enough to bring my own jar which is the exact same jar but with a different logo. I'm saving another plastic cup in the trash but you can't give me a discount because of the logo? Where's the spirit of the conservation? That tells me boba guys only cares about profits. They gave me Strauss milk as a default that has a $.50 charge. In the end, milk tea was bland and the boba was just okay, I have had fresher. And this experience left a bland taste in my mouth. Boba guys boo on you!
author: kirstenbb c.

description: Tried the classic milk tea and it's probably one of the best milk teas I've ever had. Their milk tea has the right amount of milk and tea and the tea flavor is strong enough.
author: Tammy P.

description:
This place was okay. Decor was cute and the store had kinda a chic feel. I ordered the horchata with boba and my cousin ordered the Thai tea. The Thai tea was good but the horchata was eh. To me, it was very wetted down. The boba was eh too. 

The workers are very nice. A lady stole my cousins drink and so we ended up waiting for a while but when we told the workers what had happened, they quickly made a new one! So thank you for that!
author: Charlene P.

description:
Appreciate how they didn't go overboard on trying to be too hip. The establishment is hip, but they keep it simple. Their drinks hit the spot every time. They do have some novelty items they provide, but they keep them to a minimum - props. There can sometimes be a line, but their drinks are worth the wait. 

- Strawberry Matcha Latte - You can tell they put their time and effort into making this drink, not saying they don't w the others - order one. 

Parking can and will be bad here - it's in the Mission. Their prices are fair, as they do serve up some quality drinks. A boba joint for the adult in you.
author: Jaso N.

description:
Hmm, for as much as I'd heard about this place, I'm not super impressed. I had the horchata with almond jello and my friend had the green tea lychee with almond jello. For all the claim that the almond jello is homemade, I wasn't super into it. The texture was a bit too bouncy and it wasn't almondy enough. 

I tried the tea and though fine, it didn't seem rich enough for my tastes. I don't understand. Don't feel the need to come back for it. Shrug.
author: Christina K.

description:
Great boba quality!! 

I've gotten the lychee green tea, strawberry green tea fresca, and strawberry matcha latte, all with boba. 

I wouldn't recommend the lychee green tea, it really didn't taste like lychee to me. The strawberry matcha latte has a cool mix of flavors that somehow works, but in the end the strawberry green tea fresca is my favorite. Super refreshing and great for the fruit tea lovers. 

Depending on when you go there will be a line, but the drinks come out quickly.
author: Connie C.

description:
Tried the lychee green tea, horchata, & classic flavor and all was ok.  

Yes, just ok (I've had better TBH)
author: Criselle O.

description:
I was very impressed with this place. It is the best boba tea I have had so far in San Francisco.

They offer a range of interesting flavors, including decaf (which some other places don't have). This includes Indian Chai, Jasmine Green tea, various milk teas etc.

The boba balls themselves are delicious, chewy and flavorful, while still fairly soft. I had them in a warm tea, which was a new experience and great for a cold afternoon. I am really looking forward to going back.
author: Jake N.

description:
Their menu may not be super extensive, but what they serve is good. Boba Guys does not have a crazy menu with every fruit drink you can think of (like Quickly's or Sharetea) but they have a horchata! Their horchata was sweet with some cinnamon-y taste. The boba itself was chewy and soft. My boyfriend had a freshly brewed milk tea -- coconut tea ($5), I believe. He requested some almond jello inside. The almond jello wasn't too sweet but it was just enough to sweeten up the coconut milk tea. It was quite refreshing. I think next time I'd probably order one of the brewed teas and add almond jello in. You can also request a certain amount of sweetness. I'd probably go lighter, personally.

There's only about 4 seats inside and 2 seats outside, but if you're looking for somewhere to sit to enjoy your boba, I'd suggest walking 2 blocks over to Dolores Park. 

**Bonus: they also sell the Sugar N Spun cotton candy here!
author: Connie Y.

description:
Went here for the first time after hearing so much about this place. I really wanted to like it but left disappointed.
