Don't get me wrong, it tastes good, but for all the hype I was expecting something amazing. In many ways it tastes like any other decent ( and cheaper) boba place in Chinatown. We tried the original and horchata . Original was decent, but felt there was too much ice and too little content. Horchata was OK, nbut a little wattery. Props for high-end organic ingredients it is its biggest strength. But if anything their greatest strength may be also their biggest crutch as this place is thriving off its quirky advertising and high brow aesthetics rather then the actual product itself. Will hopefully have a better experience with other flavors in the future.
author: Pat C.

description:
Quick Summary:  Surprisingly good boba with plenty of great tea options

Vibe: Ok so I'll just come out with it.  This is an uber-Americanized boba place that as a traditional Taiwanese guy, generally leads me to believe will not be high-quality but I have to say they have perfected both the texture of the boba or tapioca balls and the quality of the tea.   But they've done it in a way that also gives  the storefront a trendy, clean vibe.  I like it.  I have no clue what the anteater is for, though.

Teas:  The options are great.  Both hot and cold.  There are slow bar options where the tea is steeped as you wait.  The claim to fame is the use of all organic materials, including milk, almond milk or soy milk options - which ended up being important for one of my friends who cannot have dairy.

Overall: This is pricey stuff but for the health-conscious, this is as good a boba place as I've had in Taiwan, Flushing New York, or Los Angeles.  As a purist I wanted to hate this and go to Chinatown for something better, but I don't know if I'd find it.
author: Thomas C.

description: Great customer service, the cashier I had took his time helping me out while giving genuinely helpful advice! I got the jasmine green tea w almond milk! Anytime I've gotten my tea w almond milk at other places, it just turns out watery and nasty! But nothing was lacking w their version of almond milk tea, plus you don't get that heavy feeling that you usually do w non dairy creamer... :). With 100% sweetness, it was sweetened perfectly to my taste. The boba was also on the chewier side (some softer than the others) which I personally like more. Great experience here...
author: Brittany D.

description:
For a few weeks I was coming here every Friday afternoon.  I've been going to the Fabric Outlet every Friday trying to find some sweet dealz on upholstery fabric and the sirene song of Boba Guys was just too strong to come to this neck of the Mission without stopping by.  I don't even want to know how many calories are in one of these things, it would make me too sad.

I usually get the classic milk tea with boba, 50% sweet.  Trust me, that's plenty sweet.  I honestly don't know how anyone could get 100% sweet, it makes my teeth hurt just thinking about it.  And I have a moderately strong sweet tooth...

The milk tea is perfect, it always scratches my bubble tea itch.

I also tried the matcha latte once, that was great too, it had drizzled honey around the cup before the poured the tea in which was a nice touch.  It was also a layered drink which is just visually stunning.  They really take pride in their products here and it shows.

Similarly to ordering an espresso drink, it helps to know how to order.  You'll want to specify your drink, how sweet, with boba or not, and confirm if you want dairy milk (only in SF, right?).  The whole think goes much faster if you can prevent them from having to ask you a bunch of clarifying questions.
author: Rachel S.

description:
This was the first boba place I had since I moved from Chicago, IL to the Bay Area one week prior. I loved that I was able to substitute the milk with soymilk and that we can choose the sweetness level.  Compared to boba teas in chicago, that's a bug plus for me! 

I think the menu variety is pretty good too, although now having tried a couple other boba places (both in the East Bay), the menu selection at Boba Guys seems a bit limited. I don't mind that sometimes though. 

In terms if the place, though, I wish they had more space to sit.
author: Lusiana H.

description:
I LOVE horchata, I mean LOVE!! For the longest time I have thought that someone should put my two favorites together: horchata and boba!! And while I lived in SoCal nobody was making it.. Sad.

When I moved to the bay I yelped and found that boba guys make HORCHATA BOBA!! Definitely bookmarked. I finally was in the mission and after eating dinner, Hannah and I walked by boba guys and if she hadn't pointed it out I would have missed it! 

Of course I ordered the horchata boba and it was exactly how I would have imagined it. Mmm horchata and chewy boba.. *drool* I shall be back!!
author: Angela K.

description:
I'd heard about this place for a while, but never got around to trying it till recently. To be honest I had low expectations due to the hype and price, but was pleasantly surprised. 

I of course ordered the Classic Milk Tea with boba (75% sugar) and it was pretty darn good. I like my milk tea to have a detectable black tea taste and this definitely did. Lately I don't get boba balls in my drinks anymore, but always get it the first time at a new place and I didn't regret it. They were cooked well and were not too sweet or too bland. 

Yes their drinks are quite pricey. Maybe I just don't mind paying more for better tasting food since the expense isn't something that would deter me from coming here. Almost all my favorite boba places that aren't in the city are around $3.50-$4.00ish so it's not a huge deal to me (though their portion size is probably bigger). 

There was a line so we did have to wait about 15-20 minutes to order (which would be the only deterrent for me tbh) but the actual ordering to getting your drink is quick. The place is also TINY so it's nice not having to be squished in a corner for an extended period of time. (They do have like...3 or so seats but not worth it). 

They do offer more unique drinks that I want to eventually try, such as the Horchata boba. If I was in the city more often I would definitely come here all the time to satisfy my boba craving (which you know happens at least 3x a week).
author: Jenny C.

description:
As someone who frequents boba places in San Diego, CA I was extremely excited to try this place when I visited SF. Not only that but my favorite bloggers on YouTube seem to like this place a lot. I ordered the rose black milk tea with boba and almond jelly, my mom ordered the Muscat oolong, my dad got a coconut milk green tea...and I can definitely say this placed is overhyped-- not exactly bad tea or boba but not great either. The flavor wasn't as pungent as I would've liked, though you should take that in your own way because I personally like my rose teas strong. Boba and almond jelly not impressive either. 

Originally I was drawn by the unique tea flavors and promise of "no powder" tea, but I felt like the overall authentic taste of milk tea was lost. The Muscat oolong and coconut green teas did not have that traditional taste I'm used to. 

Or, I may just be spoiled by the boba places in southern ca, specifically kung fu tea. It's so good even Usher is a regular.
author: Ariel M.

description:
I traveled from a faraway place to consume their boba and it was aiite. I had the Horchata with almond jelly and it was good but not sure if it lived up to the hype. Kinda pricey for boba. Doesn't high class boba sound like an oxymoron? 

The atmosphere was also quite nice and I liked the artsy interior design of the place. May go again someday one day.
author: Juliana P.

description: I finally found a drink that I really like here! Muscat oolong milk tea w/ 75% sweetness. I liked the almond pudding with my drink. The guy told me that the regular sweet is at 100% which is equivalent to the amount of sugar in a soda... Eeks. Never thought of it like that.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Great bubble tea shop! 
1at time ever that my tea is brewn in front of me!
Great choice of mild (dairy, soy, almond milk). 
You can add boba, extra bob and almond jelly and also chose the sweetness of your tea. 
I love the way you can customise your boba experience!!! 
Also buy they signature mug, goes to the dish washer and you'll have a discount when you bring it back next time to refill. 
A must!!!
author: Chaseit O.

description:
Maybe it's just me, but the list of places to try seems to never stop growing.  No matter how hard I try, for every place I knock off my list or bookmarks, another three pop up to fill the void.  It never ends!  Thankfully, now that they've both found permanent homes in the same restaurant space, my trip to Ken Ken Ramen also gave me the chance to check out Boba Guys.  Two birds with one stone?  Sweet. 
  
After putting in our dinner order with the waitress, my old coworker walked over to the "bar" by the front door to put in our drink order with Boba Guys - two regular milk teas with tapioca/boba.  Served in these awesome mason jars, I thought the drinks were pretty good.  Maybe not quite as good as my usual favorite (Wonderful Foods in the Sunset), but certainly one of the better ones I've tried.  The boba had the right consistency/texture for me (firm yet chewy and not hard) and it wasn't overly sweet like how some places can get.  Similarly, the milk tea wasn't overly sweetened and had a nice balance between the tea and milk, and between the tea and boba.

At roughly $4 a pop, Boba Guys runs a little higher than what you can find elsewhere, but the drinks are good enough to justify the price.  Despite how much I like them though, the potential lack of parking in the area and the fact I have more convenient alternatives makes it tough for me to stop into Boba Guys again for my occasional tapioca fix unless I'm in the area.  Considering how good Ken Ken Ramen is though, I'm sure I'll be back sooner rather than later to hit up both again...in just one trip!
author: Mike L.

description:
I was born and raised in southern california, which is riddled with boba places galore, so I got excited seeing a boba place while walking around the mission district. Usually, Small boba shop + long lines out the door = promising boba drinks. 

To be honest, I was a bit disappointed. The two main drinks I get at boba places are taro milk tea and almond milk tea. No taro here. This place has more unique drinks that traditional boba places don't have like horchata. They emphasize their use of loose leaf teas (which is great) rather than the powdered drinks. So I tried to be a little creative. I tried to create an almond milk tea drink by ordering the classic milk tea and substituted their default milk with almond milk and added the almond jelly. Drink felt a bit watered down and the almond jelly was lacking. I've made tastier, creamier almond jelly. 

It's a different kind of boba place. If you are looking for more traditional flavored boba drinks, don't go here. It's not the same.
author: Cynthia T.

description:
Jasmine Milk (soy) with 1/2 almond jelly & 1/2 tapioca balls $5. 

Warning Boba Guys are not consistent with quality of product, and depending on the staff you will either have the best boba tea ever or the most watered down (and lacking boba).
author: Shannon Z.

description:
We came here for dinner for house of prime rib and had some time to kill. We decided to grab a drink here. Arrived to see a line outside the door. The front counter was directly at the entrance so the line didn't take too long. 

I ordered a Thai tea with pearls and almond jelly (homemade) and my bf ordered The iced matcha green tea latte with pearls and 75% sweetness. The drink looked really refreshing and appetizing. However, looks are not always what they seem. 

The pearls were hard. The almond jelly was a bit harder than I imagined and tasted artificial. I expected more of a consistency like the egg pudding toppings for the jelly. The Thai tea tastes like any regular Thai tea (nothing too special). The green tea was average. Though I did like that it did not taste chalky like other places. 

Personally, I would prefer other places in SJ like Fantasia because of the pearls/boba. This place is hip and I can see why a lot of people like it. It was just average for me.
author: Chhorvon S.

description: My favorite boba spot so far in SF . I like the freshness of the tea and natural ingredients . Sooo delicious!
author: Dee R.

description: I like the customer service at this place, I work just 2 blocks away, and I never get tired of coming to this place, also cuz I love the neighborhood B-)
author: Jath R.

description:
I've always passed by this place and I really loved the vibe the employees gave off. They were super helpful with choosing what I wanted and it was really clean! 

I got the coffee milk tea with tapioca pearls and man ! did that coffee have me energized ! It was sweetened perfectly. I really enjoyed this so I will be back !
author: Nakia P.

description: I always stop here when I'm in town. Perfect, sweet, chewy boba. None of that powdery milk teas overpowered with nondairy, syrup or sugary fakeness. I always get the classic milk tea 75% sweet. I suggest a 16oz if you're not too hungry because it's pretty filling for me. I love that they are so hip and modern. Not your classic asian bubble tea cafe.
author: Eva L.

description: Didn't like this place the first time I had it, I actually don't even remember what I ordered. Came back another time, almost a year later with a friend and fell in love. Maybe my taste buds have changed or maybe they made it better this day but my goodness, it was delicious! My friend got the jasmine milk tea and I ordered the lychee milk tea with boba and enjoyed every bit of it. It was fresh and real. And my real I mean, it's not made from powders like some other places. Boba was good, the place itself is adorable too. Even though there's only about 4 seats inside against the window.
author: Mariel Ashley S.

description:
You know what. Boba Guys is the best quality boba place ever. Best ingredients make for the best drinks. The rest just don't compare! 

Thanks Boba Guys!!!
author: Krystle I.

description:
Since I commute up to the city everyday for work and live in the South Bay, I'm not really inclined to commute up on the weekends. Tonight, I happened to be in the city for an event with Sugar & Spun present. One of the guys told us that Boba Guys sells some of their cotton candy. My ears perked up at "boba" and I had wanted to check out this spot. We piled in the car to get to Boba Guys just before they closed at 9pm. 

Whoa, they have some interesting flavors here like horchata milk tea and a matcha latte. The milk tea slow bar is made to order and has a rose milk tea on there. The menu sets them apart from your typical boba joint. Plus, they use Strauss organic milk! 

I went with the HK style tea + boba. I'm not a big drinker of milk teas (I usually go for tea without milk), but this was delicious. Not too sweet and a strong, aromatic tea flavor. 

I hope I have a chance to come back again to try something off the milk tea slow bar!
author: Katherine S.

description:
Solid spot. not my favorite but its better than a lot of other places.

I usually only get the Horchata. If you don't like sweet, then you probably won't like it otherwise it is a solid drink. Boba is chewy which is a plus.
author: Dylan T.

description:
Tiny shop on Valencia and 19th, there's a few stools inside but it's almost always packed here. Since they're located in the Mission, parking is going to be fairly difficult to find too.

I love how they portray the process of making boba like a science (since I'm a bit of a nerd). They still have the lab coats behind the front door on the wall, and they have some loose teas in a test tube-like rack on the wall behind the snack display. The Slow Bar even makes the slow dripped tea look like a lab experiment.

I've heard about these guys when they were just a pop-up but was never able to go prior because of my working hours. I got a better job with better hours and the Boba Guys got a brick and mortar, the stars finally aligned for me to try their concoctions! 

So the menu on 6/29/2014
Drinks:
Class Milk Tea: $4
Jasmine Milk Tea: $4
Soy Milk Tea: $4
Horchata Boba: $4
Thai Tea: $4
Iced Matcha Latte: $4
Coffee Milk Tea: $4
Hong Kong Style:  ($4) Black tea with organic condensed milk

Bonus points for having both soy milk and almond milk options!

Milk Tea Slow Bar: Options with or w/out milk. Sweetness level is adjustable. May take up to 5 min
Muscat Oolong: $5.50
Golden Honey Black: $5.50
Lychee Green Tea: $5
Chamomile Mint: $5
Decaf Black: $5
Duke of Earl Grey: $5
Coconut Green Tea: $5

Toppings:
Tapioca Balls
Almond Jelly
Grass Jelly

They also sell snacks like Sugar & Spun cotton candy, liege waffles, macrons, cupcakes, etc. I think it differs all the time though.

My friend and I both ordered the Lychee Green Tea which was part of the Slow Bar. She also bought a Jasmine Milk Tea to bring home for her sister since she was in town for the summer and was craving it. We both thought the milk tea was very light and refreshing (especially since it was so warm and we were walking all over the Mission) so it was worth the slight wait. I've been to other boba places where the wait is even longer, so not bad! 

I typically don't have the tapioca peals in my drinks because so many places does it wrong, but here they're so soft and not overly chewy. So good!

They sold out of their Mason Jar mugs when I went! Bummer. Looks like I'll have an excuse to go back to try again. :D
author: Kitty K.

description: Finally!  A new boba place that I can confidently recommend!  They have a small selection of flavors and I was debating between the Hong Kong Milk Tea and the Jasmine Milk Tea but when in doubt, I always default to a boba place's Jasmine Milk Tea to compare it against other places.  I had mine at 75% sweet and found it just sweet enough to enjoy.  I actually think I'd be even okay if it was 100% sweet.  It wasn't heavy so I had an easy time finishing my drink.  It was refreshing!  Next time I'm in the city, I'm definitely coming back to try the HKMT.  c:
author: Carena N.

description:
This was my first time at boba guys and it was great! The barista was super helpful with recommendations and patient as I waffled between the many choices. 

I ended up with the lychee green tea with almond jelly and my husband got the jasmine milk tea with almond jelly as well, both 50% sweetness. Mine didn't have a super robust lychee flavor, and was mote heavy on the tea, but well balanced with the sweetness of the jelly. 

A great spot to get boba, will definitely come again! Lives up to the hype!
author: Jacklyn L.

description:
I almost didn't find this place as it was hidden inside of a curry place...I only found it because of a little chalkboard sign they had on the sidewalk. Even once inside, I still wasn't sure if I was in the right place...but I confirmed it with the barista who pointed me to a paper (literally sharpie on a 8 x11 piece of print paper) menu.

I ordered the original black milk tea. I watched as the barista poured it out of a plastic drink pitcher. The fact that it was already made was a bit of a turn off. Upon drinking, there was honestly zero tea flavor...it was like waterdowned milk. While I love the idea of fresh brewed tea and locally sourced milk...it really isn't worth the price if I can't taste it.
author: Elaine Y.

description: I asked the cashier for recommendations and she was so sweet and informative about their specials! Ended up getting the pumpkin Chai which she was right, it is refreshing and quite sweet. Two Hong Kong style milk teas and one classic milk tea which were all pretty good. The texture of the Boba was pleasant and chewy. It is a bit pricey though, especially the Mason jars. But they have great drinks.
author: Rachel L.

description: Every time I visit the Bay Area, I always come here. It's a must have for sure. The boba here is absolutely delicious and the tea is great as well. One of my favorite reasons for coming up to the bay!
author: June C.

description: This is my ultimate favorite boba place. Their boba is bomb and their ingredients are real and fresh. My go to is usually the Hong Kong style milk tea, but today I decided to get a match green tea latte. BOMB. I've also gotten their horchata & Thai tea and they are both flavor filled and delicious!
author: Bel W.

description: I tried the Hong Kong Style Milktea with boba and grass jelly. It was pretty good but it tasted a little watered down. The boba had a nice bouncy consistency but the grass jelly was a little hard. The grass jelly didn't have much of a taste to it and it was hard to slurp up because it was so hard to get into the straw and most of it just sank to the bottom. I would probably pass on getting the grass jelly topping and just get boba next time. They do have an interesting selection of boba drinks, but the lines can be long and its always impossible to find a good parking nearby.
author: Lisa H.

description:
Boba Guys has been on my bookmarks for what seems like forever now. The opportunity to come here never arose though, since I don't frequent the city much. Finally though, the clouds parted and I was able to discovery what the hoopla is about this place.

Got the Horchata Boba because I figured it was the most unique thing on the menu. Wasn't bad at all. Tastes exactly how it sounds to be honest. My friends really liked the Hong Kong style tea that they got though, stating that it was bitter just like they liked it. 

The store itself is pretty cramped, and there was a pretty decent sized line when we got there, but it all went by pretty quick. The bobarista was pretty chill as well. Friendly and talkative so that's always a big plus. 

Definitely gonna give this place another visit whenever I get the chance to. The Horchata Boba had a lot of promise but I feel like I needa try out one of their slow drips to get that full experience. Will update with results eventually.
author: Sean H.

description:
I feel like I'm kinda in between a 4-5 stars with this place...so i went and did a 5...cant keep all my 5 stars to myself!

this place is not in the midst of the crazy mission district - i would say the quieter side.  

It's kinda like a hole in a wall but not hard to miss.  Theres only 4 flavors so dont expect too much.  $4 (they dont show the price either) - you can have it to go or for here in a mason jar (i think it is  super cute)
Original
Jasmine
Horchata
Soy

I decided to go different and went with horchata (thinking it was like horchata milk tea, which it wasnt) and friend got the soy.  It was definitely horchata horchata but you have the boba to chew so its interesting.  I think they said they use organic milk cuz it leaves a clean finish, no milky after taste.  Not too sweet so cool with me.  Soy milk tea definitely has a strong tea taste and again, leaves a clean finish.  It kinda has a coffee taste too.  

The boba isnt anything SUPER DUPER fancy (i still prefer t pumps' boba cuz it has a sweet finish), a nice chew though

They serve samples though in a cute sake cup and i tried the jasmine which was really good (regretted a bit getting the horchata but gives me a reason to go back) i also tried their experimental strawberry milk tea (nope for me)

The guy wore a little science white coat which i thought was really cute but i dont know if thats the uniform or if he just likes to wear one around.  But good service though. 

They also take card!  I'll be back!
author: Laurie W.

description:
This is probably my favorite boba place. I drink a lot of tea so when I drink milk tea, I still want to taste the tea. A lot of boba shop disappoint me because of how watery or sugary their drinks are. At boba guys, I believe that they use real tea to make their milk teas. The people working their are also really friendly and will fix your drink if you don't like it. 
I had ordered a hong kong style milktea and it wasnt sweet enough so I brought it back and they remade one for me. They also have the best boba. Their boba is cooked perfectly with it being chewy and soft. 
I would recommend classic milk tea, hong kong style, jasmine milk tea, and matcha iced latte.
author: Yushi C.

description:
I am hooked! I have been searching for a boba place in the city (for years) that makes clean milk teas and has options for all types of people. I'm pretty simple and go for the decaf almond milk tea (50% sweetened) and it is delicious! I adore that they drip the tea right in front of you per order. 
Happy mama over here!
author: Bree G.

description:
A modern lab of supreme boba and everything that is taiwanese, traditional, new and crazy about it

Traditional Taiwanese boba dipped in the traditional brown sugar syrup (customizable to honey syrup), bathed in the hot/cold bath of classical milk tea, Hong Kong style condensed milk tea, or any of the creative blends of green tea, rose, ... real tea leaves with milk... not just any milk Strauss, from a local family ranch.

I happened to run into the boba guys, specifically Andrew, who couldn't help but just educate me a bit on boba. I haven't been to Taiwan, but have drunk my fair share from Tea Era, Verde, to the Cha for Tea on UC Irvine campus, but his lecture was a new bell ring for me, so many variations, so much possibility.

They are starting their Kickstarter campaign this week, you can become a sponsor of their new lab, get a black card, or let's say 365 days supply of boba... wow, boba tea on kickstarter? yes the point is these guys are crazy, they are taking boba to a whole other level. 

This is a true challenge for a beverage connoisseur - one may pass by and miss this place, because it is so counter intuitive, its modern design, and glossy feel, reminds you nothing of boba, yet these people are crazy about boba, also cotton candy flavors such as thai tea and black sesame, waffles, and Hong Kong fat toast with melts and soaked in cream. 

It is NOT easy to find your perfect drink here, because everything is customizable, creating a challenge for you to step out of your comfort zone.  Choices can be overwhelming, but having choices is such a blessing. I will slowly try it all. Go try it, too
author: Dilys S.

description: I went to Boba Guys for the 5th time today and I order the Thai iced tea with boba. It was way too sweet and it was weird because the condensed milk was not infused into the tea, but rather it was on the side of the cup. The pearls were good, but the tea was still way too sweet. The price was a little higher than other boba places as well.
author: Lydia H.

description:
When you make the claim to have the highest and best quality milk tea on earth, you make quite the bold and substantial wager to someone who has definitely had good boba milk tea in asia and amongst other boba mllk tea hotspots. 

Now onto the analysis of the milk tea:
Just because you use name brand tea and Strauss milk, doesn't mean its the highest quality milk tea in the world. In fact, I've definitely been to places in Asia where the tea used is of much higher quality and potency. I also don't really see much of a difference in Strauss milk and other similar "high end" milk products. The milk tea was decently average for all their claims. Especially average for the price.

Boba analysis:
Also - their claim of cooking the boba the real, traditional way with brown sugar is nice - but in my opinion, the true traditional way is to serve the boba freshly made (warm) and a bit softer than theirs. The warm boba interacts with the cold milk tea. Thats how its supposed to be served (traditionally).

Misc:
The almond jelly here is legit. Super light, airy, and with a nice almond flavor thats not too overbearing.

Moral:
I'm not swayed by marketing. I'm swayed by taste and follow through. :)
author: Henry W.

description: Overrated. We've tried their signature boba, but although it was quickly prepared and the staff was friendly, the actual taste wasn't anything special. The almond jelly was rather tasteless. And my friend haven't gotten the boba she asked for. We definitely came out of boba guys with a bad aftertaste in our mouths...
author: Mai T.

description: The milk is delicious. More boba in my serving than I've had before. The boba is a bit harder in texture than I've had elsewhere. And I've had a lot of boba.
author: Alias A.

description:
Boba Guys has officially taken the spot on my Boba List as #1, and they deserve it.  This review is for both the Mission St. Location and the Union Square Location.

First off, let's discuss price.  These are definitely not the best prices in San Francisco for the size you get (about $4 for 16oz depending on what you order), but for the quality of tea that you get, yes this is worth it.  Many of their ingredients are homemade, high quality, and organic, and this shows in the taste of their drinks.  

Here are some of my favorites here:

*Classic Milk Tea:  The classic milk tea is set at a default sweetness of 100%.  I highly recommend that you get it at a sweetness of 50%, as the default sweetness is way too sugary and will drown out the tea taste.  The milk tea has a very good balance of creaminess and tea flavor, with an excellent sense of freshness to it.  For toppings, I recommend either their boba (scroll down for my review on this!), or grass jelly.

*Strawberry Matcha Latte:  This intriguing drink gets a lot of stares for its strange colors, but it's delicious.  They use no syrups or artificial flavors, the matcha is organic, and they use their own housemade strawberry puree as sweetener.  The flavors go better together than expected, but the matcha tends to drown out the strawberry flavor if you mix the drink.  I recommend taking sips from the puree (at the bottom) and the actual latte (top) separately.

Lastly, the BOBA!!! The boba here is chewy and delicious.  It truly lives up to their sign outside, which says "Grade A Balls."
author: Tim L.

description:
Boba Guys is basically gourmet bubble tea. Unlike the usual grungy, dark Asian joints with people singing karaoke in the background, Boba Guys puts on a rich-fancy-Mission (aka Valencia St) twist to bubble tea. They do a very good job of keeping the place clean and bright - a very uplifting atmosphere. Their bubble tea was also well made (tasted pretty high quality) and didn't have as much of that weird aftertaste you get from other bubble teas. 

It also helped that the girl who served me was incredibly pretty - although I don't come here enough to know whether or not this is the norm.
author: Don L.

description:
Best taste Boba tea in this area!! 
I am a milk tea super fan!! 

Good tea, with best milk!! LOVE!!
author: SteveMorris M.

description: Ok, so while I really liked the atmosphere of this place in the mission district, I was not a fan of my actual product. The boba we had in our drink was only half cooked at best, and was almost crunchy. Though they warned us about how sweet it might be, we thought it would be like any other boba place as far as sweetness. But our drink we so sweet and the boba was so uncooked that we couldn't even finish it :( maybe it was just our luck! But boy, was it disappointing.
author: Rachel B.

description: I got a milk tea chai with almond milk, 25% sweet. The tea itself was silky and refreshing. The tapioca balls were a bit too chewy and sweet for my liking. I'm not a huge boba person, so I probably won't go back but I can see how people would like this place.
author: Angela E.

description:
We came around 11am or noon on a Sunday and finally got to try the horchata! 

* Horchata with boba - 3.5 stars
I think I was more struck by the novelty of boba horchata. Even with my sweet tooth, this was on the sweet side for me. But as always, their tapioca balls are a perfectly soft, chewy texture.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
I tried Boba Guys Boba milk tea $4, they use Straus milk & Indian loose tea.  Very nice, kinda pricey at $4.  You can drink it there in a glass or To Go in those plastic cups.

You can drink at the Boba Guys bar area inside Ken Ken Ramen, or with your meal at Ken Ken Ramen.  Plus you can Charge it!
author: Ann L.

description:
Following a dream.

The founders: www.bobaguys.com/story/

The customers: Barely a line around 1pm for an enjoyable signature Classic with black tea, choice of milk (Straus, almond or soy) and homemade almond jelly.

It wasn't as sweet or heavy as expected. Staff was so enthusiastic and informative in helping make the decision. You could tell they believed in the dream. Really liked the almond jelly.

Liked even more the Strawberry Jasmine tea my companion ordered. Even sweeter and even less heavy. Happy with mine. Next time would have hers. Reasonable $4 for 16oz.

Back to those customers: Returning around 6pm the line was out the door. This time ordered the Kaya toasted brioche topped with homemade coconut jam.

It was really sweet, surprisingly thick and a very good deal for $3.50. Loved it as much as the Hong Kong version (www.yelp.com/biz/boba-guys-san-francisco-6?hrid=WGaOzrn5Cmda7mBPvyy2mg) and bet it pairs well with tea.

Living the four star dream.
author: Jason B.

description:
Best boba in SF and some of the best I've ever had! 

This tiny shop is almost a boba booth, with only a few seats inside and outside. It's pretty modern and hipster, so it's a perfect fit for the mission. 

We went right at opening, so we had to wait a bit while they were still making the boba. I had a matcha latte with boba and tried some of the earl grey. The boba was the perfect amount of sweet, right amount of warmth, and had the perfect chewy texture. The drink wasn't too sweet and quite refreshing. 

High quality drinks and boba!
author: Steven V.

description:
PROS
*various dairy alternative options such as soymilk and almond milk
*you can customize your sugar level 
*cute ambience/cups/logo
*seems like it's quite good quality tea 

CONS
*long line
*a bit overpriced
author: Becky M.

description:
Not bad since there are not many boba places in the area. 

Jasmine milk tea was not super sweet and light on the Jasmine flavor.

Hong Kong milk tea was a bit too sweet due to the condensed milk for my liking but good.

The boba is that perfect chewy consistency. 

Quick yet I think a bit pricey at $4 ...

Grab some flavored cotton candy with that tea.
author: Nikki S.

description:
So, so good! I drink gallons of bubble tea, so can say with confidence that this is one of the better places to drink boba in SF. In fact, Sharetea might be the only place better.

I think that Boba Guys really outclasses its competitors because of the quality of its ingredients. The milk doesn't taste like it's come out of some can, the tea clearly didn't arrive at the store in powdered form, and the boba has the absolute perfect consistency.

The menu isn't as broad as at other establishments, but if you just want a simple jasmine milk tea, definitely choose this place!!
author: Neha S.

description: I have been wanting to try Boba Guys for months. I am not a big regular milk tea fan. When it comes to milk teas, I dig the flavored ones more. I was skeptical but I finally got to try it over the weekend and now I am a fan. It is definitely one of the better milk teas I've had. I tried the soy milk tea and I snatched up 3 pandan macarons. The soy milk tea was light and creamy. The tea was not overpowering but that's how I like it. The tapioca balls were soft in every bite and they are not stingy with the balls. The drink is pricey at $4 but you pay for quality. The downside to their shop is that it is so small! There is hardly any place to sit or even stand especially on a day when it is crowded. However, that won't stop me. I can't wait to try their other drinks and it will be soon!
author: Danster L.

description:
I've been dying to try this place out and so I was excited to randomly walk by after a great lunch in the Mission. Tried both their strawberry and green matcha latte with boba and grass jelly and not bad!

The strawberry matcha was good but a bit too creamy for my preference. Green matcha was pretty standard..it was good but did not taste any different than the many other green matcha boba drinks I've had in the past.

I think i'll try out their frescas next time.
author: Jenn K.

description:
The boba is meh, the services is poor.  The almond jelly is pretty good, and that cotton candy is ok (but its just sugar and spun, so I'll just go to their website) 

Yeah, I think for me the biggest issue is definitely the mediocre boba paired with bad service.  Hey if you're still figuring out your product, fine, I can deal.  But if you're rude and try to hype your stuff up, and any other boba tea out there crushes your offering (I mean Sharetea dominates these guys) don't be snots about your product if its mediocre.
author: Jay D.

description:
The Boba Guys make their milk teas with of fresh ingredients and even make their own boba, grass jelly, and almond jelly. They also give you the option of choosing your milk tea sweetness (including a 0% sweetness). 

I had the regular milk tea with grass jelly. The milk tea tasted good. It had a strong tea flavor and it was made with actual milk! The grass jelly on the other hand was disappointing. Even though it was homemade, I didn't like it because it was a little on the harder side and not sweet at all. I usually finish all my grass jelly in my boba drinks, but this time, i just couldn't do it.
author: Susan D.

description:
Love the quality of their drinks. And I love that they will slow brew tea for you when you order it! 

I love that they have hortchata boba. You'd think since korean x mexican food was so popular that they would cross mexican x boba. But it's still a hard find, even in LA. I had hortchata the night before, so I opted for the Hong Kong Styled Milk Tea which is made with condensed milk. yummm.

My drink was made super quick, in less than 3 minutes and tasted amazing. I'd come here over T-Pumps anyday!!! You heard me! mmmhmmm.
author: Lisa W.

description:
was feeling some tea and also wanted some jelly this afternoon so Boba Guys was the closest. I usually always go to sharetea but my signature drink would not ever make it over here for ice blended. We did postmates Boba Guys which btw arrived wrapped in plastic wrap to prevent spillage - nice job on the packaging. We got 3 drinks - thai tea, rose tea with almond jelly, and honey tea with boba. The thai tea was the most unlucky and more than what hsould have spilled but that's separate from Boba Guys.

I got the rose tea unsweetend with almond jelly for pretty much $5. The quantity is about the size of a grande from starbucks which is pretty pricey I think. The drink itself though was good but a little sweeter than what I thought it would be even without sugar. The almond jelly was pretty good though - not sweet at all which is greatly appreciated.  I did get enough almond jelly to be able to save some for tomororw to drink with regular tea. 

overall, I found my drink at least that I can appreciate for the next time but still its PRICEY. I finished it in like 5 minutes...
author: Tao Tao W.

description:
MMMMMM, this place has pretty genuine milk tea. My favorite drink hands down is the slow-dripped Lychee & Soy milk tea with boba (of course). I am a boba, tapioca, milk tea, or however you say it --  fanatic AND this place really deserves five stars.

They used to serve drinks in mason jars, but because their store moved to a smaller location, they no longer do so. They do sell mason jars with their logo and if you buy one you can get .25 cents****** off your next drinks. :)
author: Mel T.

description:
It's my first time here and I got the iced matcha latte with grass jelly.  It was good and had a lot of matcha flavor.  It was a bit sweet so next time 75% sweetness would be perfect.  I forgot I wanted to try the boba too so I asked the cashier if I could add some and turns out its 50 cents for any and all toppings so my extra boba was free. The boba is really chewy and soft!  I wouldn't recommend the grass jelly.  It was cut into super small pieces, which made it hard to eat and the texture was a little hard.  My sister got the coffee milk tea and it just tasted like iced coffee.  Nothing special, which is why I'm only give 3 stars.  

Minus 2 stars for the bad grass jelly and and plain coffee milk tea.
author: May S.

description: Good amazing boba and drinks. It's a small place and the line goes outside sometimes but definitely worth it. They're teas and milk teas are just right and fragrant. Definitely coming back!
author: Brian L.

description:
If you like your boba drinks with a strong tea taste, then come to Boba Guys. 

I always order the jasmine milk tea with boba, and it's always been consistent. The boba was just okay, but the jasmine tea was pretty bold in flavor.

Interested in trying the other drinks, but it's not really the place to try your boba luck at around $4ish a cup.
author: Tina C.

description:
This place has been on my radar since it is trying to brand itself apart from all of the other boba shops. I am not sure what the significant of the anteater or animal is but I guess it is its thing. I came here around 4pm on Saturday and luckily we got there before the crowd. The drinks are more expensive than other shops, especially if you get the freshly brewed one. I tried the horchata boba and sure enough, it tastes like horchata. I really like the pearls here because they are huge and chewy so that is a plus. I didnt think the horchata was anything special or crazy. One thing I didnt like was that the drink was almost luke warm and it needs way more ice for it to be a good boba drink. I tried their classic milk tea (black tea) and it tasted pretty average to me. They have a ton of other flavors and I am not sure if I would be able to differentiate the various flavors but they sound pretty cool. 

**TIPS**
1) The Berkeley location will be closing after next week since summer is starting and there wont be as many students around. So if you want to try the alcoholic boba, you better get it then. The SF location does not have alcoholic boba.
2) Mason jars are $10.
author: Amy H.

description: I had the Jasmine Milk Tea which was pretty good. The prince is reasonable and friendly customer service.
author: Shirley G.

description:
Ordered: Classic Black, Jasmine
What to get: They're all pretty standard mixes and you can't go wrong w/ any.

Been here only twice and thought it was alright. Strangely, I didn't get a refreshing kick out of it like some of the other better boba places I've been to. It's interesting to watch them brew tea, but consistency was off between the two instances I tried it. Not enough tea in the flavor.
author: James N.

description:
Really cool boba store located in the Mission.  Sadly this place isn't the most convenient place for me to get to, but I made it just in time before closing on a Sunday, it was surprisingly busy, and unfortunately some people didn't make it before the door closed.  I love that they have a pretty minimalist menu here which indicated to me that they like to serve what they know well.  I tried one of the teas from the slow bar which took a while, but what do you expect right?  It was really cool to see the tea brewed on the spot as well.  The boba was pretty good here, about the right consistency.  The milk tea was the highlight here.  It actually tasted like tea unlike most of the sugary syrup drinks you'll find.  It's a bit pricier than most boba places but it is also reassuring that they use quality ingredients in their tea.

Overall a great experience, and I can't wait to come back to try more of their teas!
author: Bryson L.

description:
OMG, just realized I've never written a review for Boba Guys' new location. My bf and my frenchie Ninja have been coming here since they opened and we love the fresh made milk teas here. I love trying their seasonal creations and drinks from the slow bar menu. The horchata is also one of my faves! They have dog treats for my dog which is a win in my book. And don't forget to try those addicting pandan homemade macarons. 

Love you guys!

We drive up from the south bay just for you!!
author: Cindy T.

description:
when did boba get all fancy and expensive?  We tried the hong kong style milk tea with boba, classic black with almond jello, and a strawberry tea with boba.  They were all good.  The tea was strong.  The milk was good.  The almond jello was substantial.  The strawberry tea was fresh.  Boba chewy.  

Would love to try more things but spending close to $6 for boba is not good for my wallet.
author: claudia y.

description: Yummy place, Thank to the universe this place is really close from my home, always packed but having it down the block is amazing and always beat the rush hour. You won't go wrong with the horchata, the most amazing thing is that you get to control the level of sweetness on your drinks.
author: Suzy R.

description:
Boba Guys really does have it down to a science. Consistently fresh boba is a minimum for a great boba spot, but Boba Guys' focus on quality tea is what makes them really stand out.

Boba Guys began as a pop-up startup and has really come into their own in this brick-and-mortar location. Their menu is simple (don't expect lots of fruit flavors, smoothies, etc.) and their location small (minimal bench seating, so not a place you should look to hang out). This allows them to live up to their motto: "serving the highest quality bubble milk tea in San Francisco."

I've had a lot of high quality tea and a lot of boba in my life and can honestly say this is some of the best.
author: Daniel P.

description: TOOO SWEET! I really wanted to understand the hype about this place but It was a let down! I have traveled east to west coast, trying new and upcoming boba and this place is all just a gimmick in my opinion. My friends and I tried their famous jasmine milk tea, strawberry green tea Fresca, classic milk tea and horchata milk tea. All were extremely sweet for 50% sweetness. The boba was symmetrical, soft, and had a hint of flavor which is really nice to have but the drink alone was not parring well with the boba itself. It was sugar on sugar. The jasmine milk tea was Soo sweet it tasted like milk and sugar to the point where the jasmine tea taste was not even pronounced! The strawberry green tea Fresca, although very nice looking on IG the taste is like a melted strawberry artificial Popsicle that was poured into more sugar and added water for some dilution. Very disappointing! I would not recommend boba guys! However I did hear that the best one is downtown so if I am in that area I will try it again. Parking wise, it's not worth going to this location just for the boba. Parking is extremely difficult so save 30 minutes just to get a parking spot.
author: Roseanne V.

description:
Gourmet milk teas in the mission district. A simple, no nonsense menu with classic favorites and unique flavors. Everything organic, handcrafted, no syrups, no artificial colors, no powders, no nonsense! With most drinks you can tailor the sweetness and amounts of ice. Drinks start at $3.50, each topping is $0.50.

Visiting from LA and lover of all things milk tea, I had to try this place out. I ordered the Horchata with grass jelly ($4). Although I wasn't able to tailor the sweetness of this pre-mixed drink (I normally order 25% sweetness), this rice milk, cinnamon concoction was right down my alley and wasn't overly sweet. The grass jelly had a semi-grainy texture, but was a refreshing taste that didn't taste artificial. 

- They have classic and unique flavor milk teas ($3.50) like: Classic, Coffee, Thai, Hong Kong Style, Horchata (yum!) Iced Matcha Latte and Jasmine.
- Slow Bar: I was interested in their slow-brewed, heirloom teas, but I was in a rush. Earl Grey, Rose Tea, Lychee Green Tea caught my eye. I'll have to come back.
- Toppings ($0.50 each): Almond Jelly, Grass Jelly, Lychee Jelly, Boba.
- Next time I'd like to try their boba.Ask for a sample of their fun cotton candy flavors. I tried Cookies and Cream and Rice Crispies. I would have bought one if I didn't already hit my sweets limit that day.

Boba Guys, come down to so cal!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Solid boba place. Line is always out the door, but it's mainly because the place is tiny (just as all other SF places!). Don't let the lines ever fool you into thinking the place must be good. People really don't mind waiting in lines here in SF. I'm new to the area and I'm really looking for budget-friendly places with high-quality service and food. 

Boba Guys is one of them. 

I loved the service. It was fast and efficient. The Thai Boba Tea was delicious, comparable to some of the more authentic boba places I've had. The shop itself is cute, but cramped. Bright and colorful. 

Boba was fresh...I'd come back again.
author: Ritika T.

description: Probably the best boba I have had. The tea is brewed freshly, and the bubbles have the perfect texture.
author: Melissa G.

description:
So happy i was introduced to this great Boba place. Was able to meet the co founder of Boba guys who was very friendly! 

I ordered Hong Kong style milk tea and yup that was the best boba milk tea I have ever had! It wasn't too sweet and the tapioca chewiness was perfect. I love the interior of the store! I'm from the East Bay and I will definitely make the trip again! They will also have a new location coming up around San Francisco, they also have one in Berkeley that sells Alcoholic boba which I will try one of these days! 

Besides the deliciousness, GO THERE and try it out! Worth the trip.
author: Samantha M.

description:
Love their hoji-cha milk tea and their horchata milk tea! I come here almost every week to get it lollll! Also their boba is soooo addicting! It's always the right consistency with just the right amount of chewiness and sweetness. I think they definitely have one of the best boba balls in all of sf! They lose one star doe because I hate their regular black milk tea. I mean making regular black milk tea should be the most basic for any boba place but theirs just fails so hard. Tasted like waterrr when I last had it... Blehhh 

   Also they used to have sunny hill pineapple cake which were my favorite but I haven't seen it in a while :( but their pineapple cakes are sooo $$$ like 5$ for one small one... I used to buy them all the time when I lived in Hong Kong because sunny hill had a branch there but I guess they have to import it. 

Tip: they let you customize the sweetness level. I like 30% hehe
author: Janet K.

description:
Pros:
- premium teas are great! Super flavorful and fresh
- Earl Grey tea is incredibly fragrant
- Honey black tea is fresh too
- cute cups and logo
- (only?) decent place in the Mission
- not sickeningly sweet (I can get 50% sweetness here, but have to get 30% elsewhere)

Cons:
- boba is alright (a bit too firm and not as chewy as I would like)
- their regular milk tea is just not great. The tea isn't that fresh and the finished product isn't that creamy.... it almost tastes watered down
- the milk doesn't blend well with the tea-- it just tastes like milk AND tea, but they don't work together to produce a full, creamy product

Bottom line: They make a decent milk tea, which I believe is above the San Francisco average. But, they're also quite pricey for the quantity. I wouldn't recommend going out of your way to come here, but it's still a solid place to go if you're already in the area.
author: Jiann M.

description:
I am so tired of all the insanely sugary pudding filling options when it comes to Boba. Boba Guys avoids all the unnecessary ingredients by perfecting what's most important...the boba and tea itself. 

I absolutely hate TeaWay and Quickly because of how sugary and processed their foods and drinks are. Also I am Lactose Intolerant making it so that my options are slim. 

At Boba Guys I have the option of getting Soymilk instead of whole milk and I also get to have freshly brewed teas, as well as their delicious organic boba. 

Thank god this place exists because if it didn't I would probably never drink boba again.
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
I heard so much about boba guys that I was really excited to try it out!
But it was disappointing. I got the earl grey 75% sweet with boba. 
Idk if it's cuz i got 75% but it tasted rather bland and not that flavorful. It's like a hint of earl grey.
Okay their boba quality is good but just as how any descent boba place make their boba. 
I would give 2 stars for this drink I got but I feel like other drinks here might taste better so I give it a 3.
author: Irene L.

description: Amazing! Great food. Doesnt break the piggy bank and super nice staff! Im definetly coming back...
author: Mariapaz J.

description:
Locals and visitors alike line up out the door and down the block outside of the self-proclaimed tea bar with the "highest quality boba in San Francisco," drawing customers off the Mission's populous Valencia Street.
Patient patrons enter into a minimalist white-on-wooden motif tea bar to try Boba Guys'  impressive boba tea selection, facing a black on white decal of the shop's boba-slurping anteater mascot.
The boba -- chewy, honey-soaked tapioca pearls that add both texture and flavor to each drink -- are not the only item that gives Boba Guys bragging rights. A variety of incomparably revitalizing house-made tea blends sets Boba Guys apart from other Bay Area boba joints.
Boba Guys offers both heated and iced drinks from a menu of year-round flavors like jasmine, horchata and "classic milk," and a choice between three additions -- referred to as toppings -- include its popular tapioca pearls and house-made grass and almond jellies.
While most boba shops in the Bay Area rely heavily on artificial syrups and flavorings, Boba Guys' use of natural and organic resources captures distinct flavors. Real jasmine, rose, strawberry and lavender exemplify the best of its signature and seasonal blends.
Nervous first-time visitors might want to start with the Jasmine Milk Tea, its flavor a step above the basic, but no-less-tasty Classic Milk Tea.
The premium Indian Chai and Rose Black Tea stand apart as original and astonishingly rich blends. The chai blend achieves the ideal balance between sugar and spice without sweetener.
Seasonal selections include a light Strawberry Jasmine Fresca, which makes for the perfect refreshment, but a large is suggested because a regular 16-ounce cup leaves the customer wanting more.
The locally-sourced organic Straus Creamery milk has a tendency to be too thick and creamy for my taste, albeit better than the Coffeemate creamer powder used by other boba tea shops. Soy milk and Califia Almondmilk are perhaps better alternative options.
A house-made simple syrup of white and brown sugars that sweetens all drinks overwhelms most tastes, but chatting with the "bobaristas" increases the customer's chances of getting the perfect level of sweetness.
Customizable high quality thirst-quenchers served with a smile from bobaristas for around $5 constitutes a steal by San Francisco standards.
Boba Guys is located at 19th and Valencia streets and on Stockton Street in Union Square. Loose-leaf tea blends are available online. The 19th Street location is open noon to 9 p.m. Monday through Thursday, until 10 p.m. Friday and Saturday, and 6 p.m. on Sunday. The Union Square location is open 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. Monday through Thursday, 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. on Friday, noon to 10 p.m. on Saturday, and is closed on Sunday.
- See more at: http://broadview.sacredsf.org/9190/features/tas-tea-boba/#sthash.emzNb5hl.dpuf
author: Julia-Rose K.

description:
Got a super sweet tooth? Then come on in! Otherwise, you might wanna try somewhere else.

I've tried the Horchata, Jasmine, and the Coffee. Sweet! Sweet! and Sweet! 
The quality of boba and the drinks are comparable to most good places, but the base level of sweetness in the drinks is way too high! I had to get mine 50% sweet on the third try to get the sweetness down to an acceptable level. Other than that, this place is just "A-OK".

Pro Tip: if you like more tea and less sugar, get 50% sweet - its like regular sweet!
author: Matthew S.

description:
As a SF noob, bubble tea is a newfound passion/addiction/favorite thing of mine. I've only tried boba places around where I work, so this was my chance to try one near where I live... have to say, I'm a pretty big fan.

The people working here are intimidatingly cool, but also refreshingly friendly (thank gaaawd because I feel like a royal fool every time I have to answer 20 questions to get a drink).

Got the straight up milk tea lightly sweetened with pearls. Super delicious. Also #basic as fudge, but give it a go. A+

"I'll be bakkkk"
author: Andrea D.

description:
I love how easy the menu was, I didn't have to look at a bazillion different milk tea, slushy, or whatever else they have in boba houses. I tried the simplest drink, coffee milk tea. I mean common if they messed that order up then something is up! lol but luckily it was so bomb! Yes go have it, best wake me up drink. The sweetness I got was regular and it was just perfect! 

Customer service was good, the guy who made the drinks was really nice and friendly. He smiled a lot which made it feel inviting. 

The mug with the logo cost $12. Which I got haha but it's a little too pricey. The store location was every easy to spot even at like 9:30 pm. 


Overall I had a good experience.
author: Kay O.

description: Pretty tasty bubble tea here. I've only tried their basic tea with boba. Twice. And the results are pretty consistent. Not cheap but that's just the price point for beverages in SF and can't fault them for pricing according to market.
author: Joseph L.

description:
Gave Boba Guys a second chance after a below par experience, and reluctantly give a two star review.  I admire establishments that commit to responsible ingredients, so I'm sad that it it couldn't impress in the taste and price.

- Jasmine Green tea with soy + boba: weak flavor, soy might have watered it down, but even when I tried something milky (Horchata, below) I was still unimpressed.  Boba was raw in the center (by raw I mean the center is hard and crumbly)

- Horchata with grass jelly: literally just tasted like milk and cinnamon. As in I could've poured myself a glass of milk and sprinkled cinnamon on it. Grass jelly just ok, a bit firm in my opinion.

I can't say I'll be coming back with the steeper price range since the taste doesn't justify it.
author: Jocelyn L.

description: This was my very first time at Boba Guys and as always I order a Thai Tea.. The tea was super good perfect sweetness and the boba was sweetened how I like it. I will most definitely be back here at boba guys, to try some new flavors.
author: A'Niya M.

description:
I got boba here today, drank it, and then went back and drank another.

Boba texture is so crucial, and this place's is great.  Perhaps a bit on the soft side, but delightful nonetheless.

Horchata w/ boba is original and delicious (very sweet, but I'm not complaining).  Today I got one of the specials, a Jasmine + Strawberry concoction of awesomeness.

As if this place wasn't magical enough, they have a copy of the first Harry Potter on the table for anyone to read.  No other books, just HP.  Killin' it.
author: Alexander K.

description:
Boba Guys just gets better and better. My boyfriend knows the owners, and they are constantly experimenting with new flavors and upping their milk tea game!

Highly recommend the Jasmine Milk Tea with Boba AND pudding. 

There's actually something here on the menu that is even more addicting than their milk tea...THE HONG KONG TOAST. Warm thick cut toast that is soft and chewy with a generous layer of marscarpone (at least that's what I suspect it is) and honey. JUST WOW.
author: Catherine C.

description:
THERE IS SOMETHING MAGICAL IN THE TEA HERE. IT'S LIKE THEY PUT PIXIE DUST AND UNICORN TEARS IN HERE.

I remember trying Boba Guys a while ago when I first moved to San Francisco. They were in KenKen Ramen, and my friends had told me it's "one of the best bubble teas they had." I felt like that was a far-fetched statement. I went, had their bubble tea, and I totally fell in love.

THEN, they opened an actual store. Every time I was in the Mission, or had friends visiting from out of town, I would bring them here. You can't go wrong with a place that is found by two guys that are passionate about bubble tea. They're also super duper nice!

I tend to get the original or the Jasmine tea with tapioca. The tapioca is soooo good. Great consistency and chewy. The milk is soooo smooth. I guess this is how it is when you use Strauss Family Creamery organic milk. LOVE!

Word on the street is that they're opening one near Union Square. My wallet is SO going to be empty.
author: Joanne W.

description:
I like Boba Guys. Sweet and straight to the point. Although the interior is a bit cramped, the line goes pretty quickly! If it's just you and a friend, you can maybe catch seats behind the window. Otherwise, your group is in as soon as it is out.

The menu is what I meant by straight to the point. The milk teas are $3.50 (16 oz) and $4.50 (20 oz) and some you can order hot or cold. I ordered the Hong Kong Style with grass jelly. It was good, but since I normally like my drinks sweeter than the average person, I added in some syrup to suit my tastes. Out of my friends, I finished my drink first (partly because grass jelly is quicker to chew and swallow than boba pearls) because it was that tasty! Lastly, if I'm ever in the area, I'll make sure to give them a visit and then head over to nearby Dolores Park and enjoy the view.
author: Bunny M.

description: Hipster boba place. Got the classic boba milk tea and you can tell isn't just from powder, but it wasn't outstanding. Plus the drink size is kinda small. I finished my drink pretty quickly and was left with about half a cup of ice. I prefer TPumps even though it's further from where I live.
author: Mimi T.

description:
I'm obsessed with bubble tea. Being from small town NY, there aren't many options for where I can go to get it. When I came to SF, I was so happy to hear about the abundance of bubble tea cafes, and promptly came to Boba Guys.
The boba itself is wonderful -- perfectly fresh and chewy. I asked for regular sweetness on the tea (apparently you can have more or less) and was more than satisfied. I'd rather have my bubble tea pretty sweet, and this was perfect.
author: Laura S.

description: Truly the best boba drink in the bay! I had the strawberry match latte! It blew away Plentea 10x, SuperCue 50x and Tpumps 100x!!!! Smooth, delicious and top notch boba. I think the main difference is the quality ingredients used. My next visit I will order the super size because I can't get enough of it. Boba Guys please open up a store near the peninsula!!!
author: Cee B.

description:
Meh. I've been here twice, I won't come back a third. Why? You pay $5-$6 a pop, the boba is small, tastes like dirt (confirmed for a second time), the portions are too tiny, and there's sometimes a surprisingly long line. The almond jelly's interesting and I like the flavor, but it mostly disintegrates in your drink. 

Lastly, and by no fault of the business, there are waaaay too many tea drinking selfies and boba holding snapshots going on up in there by the clientele. It's a really small space, y'all - Get your boba and get out! 

Anyway, I'd rather spend this kind of money and time at either Plentea or Sharetea. Sorry, but you're not my go-to Boba guys.
author: Colleen C.

description:
Came here on a Friday evening-ish and it was surprisingly empty. My sister and I ordered the cold Hong Kong Style milk tea with no "Toppings" (boba/jelly). The price was moderate, good service (the two ladies behind the counter were prompt, courteous, and overall friendly), and the service was quick...although that might be due to the fact that there was only two other customers...

The Hong Kong Style milk tea was slightly sweeter than the traditional HK style but still pretty good. Comes in one size, hot or cold. 

I would definitely come back to try the other drinks on the menu. They serve a few baked goods, for example HK style toast (that might be the wrong name but then again I've no idea what the difference is versus other toast...?), macarons (they were out of these items when we showed up), and a few other things I can't remember.
author: Lenerd J.

description:
Horchata with boba was goood. Just the right about of sweetness.
Hong Kong Style Milk Tea was also on point.

Liking these two drinks better than the jasmine milk tea I had at their first location that I couldn't taste enough of tea. 

Their cotton candy looked interesting but a little pricey to buy. Looked like they had samples at the register though..

Really glad they have their own little place now. No more trekking over to the Mission only to see that they aren't there.
author: Yvonne K.

description: My new favorite spot for teas and bobas! I came here two days in a row -- both times for the Strawberry Matcha Latte! The iced Matcha Latte is good as well, but that Strawberry purée though?! Also tried the Strawberry Rice Milk if you want that yummy purée without the caffeine. Those boba pearls are the best I've ever had. MyDH described them as "nice, 'gentle,' and soft." Who says that about boba?? But they are that good!! LOL. Quality ingredients and its apparent!
author: Anna R.

description:
My friend took me here and I hate that I love it so much. I'm pretty much that person that prides themselves on not loving boba style drinks. To me, "it's just a drink".

It's really delicious (horchata) and I want to come back when I can afford it because I can't right now. I walked by about three times not so long ago and I just can tell you that there is always a line since the shop is really small. Expect to see teens with a phone in their hand waiting to take a photo of a cup. How cool, useful and funny... -_- But really, staff was easy going and will be back when I can afford another cup. Living in the bay is expensive!
author: Sweets N.

description:
Delicious tea flavors - check.

Lightly sweetened and perfectly chewy boba balls - check.

Almond milk option - check.

Unsweetened option - check.

A hint of snooty pretension - check check.  It's the good ol' Mish, pretty standard, but not as bad as a certain coffee bar (or two) you can find around the corner.  Will definitely be back on occasions when I have the hankering for a milky treat, but $4 for a Bubble Tea?  Really? Only in SF...
author: Michelle M.

description:
Love the name and I think the place is adorable! 

It's a small little shop around the street corner. Their menu is simple and clean so you're not bombarded with so many different choices. They let you customize your drink to any way you want it! (ex: wanting more tea as opposed to milk in your drink or vice versa, 50% sugar, 50% ice, etc..) It is pricey for boba around 4-6 dollars but it's NOT cash only so yay! They accept credit card which makes it super convenient! I couldn't decide between getting the jasmine milk tea or the regular milk tea. I decided to go with the regular milk tea because it's the most popular drink to get. My boyfriend got the muscat oolong milk tea which is a slow brew tea which means they brew the tea leaves on the spot! The slow brew options are also more expensive, because each drink is $5.50 and the regular ones are only $4.00. 

I enjoyed their black milk tea with boba. I got mine at 75% sugar because I like my drinks not too sweet. The tea was good and it was balanced with the milk. However, I didn't think it stood out to me in comparison to other black milk teas I've had before. I thought their boba was good. It was slightly too firm for me but it was still chewy. I tried my boyfriend's muscat oolong milk tea and that was definitely unique. It has this nice surprising kick at the end where the muscat taste comes through. Overall I think their drinks are good and I would come back again if I'm in the area.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Regular milk tea with pearls (less sweet) - decently strong tea flavor. Pearls were just right in chewiness and sweetness. Overall not as good in my opinion as other reviews seem to rate it.

Golden Honey black tea iced (slow bar) - this was ok. Made the mistake of ordering without sugar. Even so, not mind blowing.

This place is pretty good but don't think it lives up to all the hype. I actually prefer ShareTea in San Mateo or Tea Island in Fremont.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I normally go to T pumps, ShareTea, or Purple Kow for my boba fix. I am happy to announce that I got out of my comfort zone and finally tried Boba Guys!! 

There are only 2 shops for Boba Guys - Stockton St and 19th St. I came to the one on 19th St because it is not only closer, but I naively thought this was on 19th AVE (lulz). Located in the hipster area of Mission, this storefront is small. Since it is Mission, parking is a bit hard to find due to metered spots. I luckily got a prime parking by the front of the store..but only after circling a bit. 

Small storefront with only a bar-countertop seating by the front window that has only about 3-4 seats, and a bench in front of the windows. They have a good selection of drinks ranging from your typical Green Milk Tea or Jasmine Milk Tea to Horchata Milk Tea, which I thought is quite a unique flavor to add to the menu since it is more of a Mexican drink. Sadly, I didn't order it for my first time. Aside from the menu on the wall, there is a 'special' menu on the side by the cash register on mini-clipboards. The staff was very nice and got our drinks done by the time we finished ordering (whaaa)!! 

I ordered a Strawberry Jasmine Tea-Fresco and my boyfriend (wow, he finally shows up again on my Yelp reviews..been MIA on my adventures..) got the Strawberry-Calpico Tea-Fresco(?). You get to choose your size (16 oz - 24 oz), toppings (tapioca, almond jelly, grass jelly), Milk (Straus Family Organic Milk, Almond Milk, Soy milk), and sweetness level (see chart on wall). 

Strawberry Jasmine Tea-Fresco is good. It's sweet and I feel like you can taste the flavors of the strawberry. My bf ordered the Strawberry-Calpico Tea-Fresco and was a bit disappointed because he felt that it didn't taste like Calpico. I got a sip of his drink and it tasted like my drink, mixed with yogurt - so I guess you can say strawberry yogurt..but in liquid form? Haha. 
I also ordered a Hong Kong Style Toast with condensed milk, which was 1 thick toast, sliced into 1/4th's, with whipped cream spread and honey or condensed milk drizzled over it. Was a bit of a disappointment for me, but slightly met my expectation.. 

Overall, I think I would come back if I was in the area. It's a bit of a drive since I am not in the area often, looking for parking is complicated, and the drinks remind me of T pumps - only difference is that they use organic products and loose-leaf tea instead of powder. Also, I'm sure the lines are long during the day (came at night) and it's just too much of a hipster hype for me :(
author: Mandy G.

description: Cute little hipster boba place in the mission. I ordered the slow dripped lychee green tea with boba ($5). My friend ordered the normal milk tea ($4). A lot pricier from what I am used to, but pretty tasty! The boba texture was soft and chewy. It's definitely worth a try, but I'll stick with my Asian boba places on Irving!
author: Corinna T.

description:
Boba Guys gets  5 stars for exceptional service. rating the tea @4.5 stars

a young chinese guy asked me how i liked my tea. i told him lychee flavor very faint though jasmine tea could be tasted. chatted with him about recent trends in boba teas. he later told me he was the owner and they would make another tea for me.
COOL!

drink: lychee jasmine milk tea(4.5)
-2nd drink had more pronounced lychee taste, still subtle.
-seems straus milk  ominated the drink
-boba included but i passed
-size average, not grande as others.
4ish stars

drips:
-concern the milk will overwhelm the tea taste
would rate the milk teas 4.5 stars for now
other tea places have stronger tea taste.
author: Victor G.

description:
As a LA Native and Boba lover, I was curious to see how SF would stack up when it came to Boba. I knew options were limited however I was willing to give them the benefit of the doubt. Thanks to the lovely and beautiful Susy C. we stumbled onto the unique Boba Gem in the mission also known as Boba Guys: 

Location: Mission

Hours: Hours are a bit funky. They have two locations

Boba: Got the standard milk tea and I was impressed. It tasted similar to an Au Yu 79 or an Ozero. If this place is comparable to Au Yu, then hands down Purple Kow would have to be like 1/2 & 1/2. Which I HATE. Good thing I came here instead. 

The Boba is chewy and the tea is on point. Good job. 

Price: It's a bit pricier than what I'm used to though as Susy explained it to me, "This is SF. This isn't SGV where Boba places are on every corner and it's in mass abundance. It's boutique shop". Agreed. Though, $4 for Boba is a stretch considering it wasn't even a large size. However, nonetheless it doesn't 

Service: Good. A bit surprised seeing a white girl behind the counter though. HAHA. As opposed to what I'm normally used to in LA. 

I'm a big fan of Boba guys and definitely glad I made the trek here. Big ups to your ingredients and the Mason Jar idea. Just want to let you know that you guys are So-Cal approved, dude! 

J to the Y.
author: Justin Y.

description:
What makes Boba Guys unique:

1. Limited selection. Only 9 milk tea's. And 8 "Slow Bar" brewed tea's. 
2. Only toppings available are boba and jelly. Very limited.
3. Expensive compared to other places. $4 per drink with no size options.
4. Some unique flavors. Horchata, Hong Kong style, Chamomile Mint, Pumpkin Chai, Muscat Oolong, and Coconut Green Tea.
5. Not just boba. They recently started selling snacks too (macarons, toast, etc), but I have yet to try.
6. They sell cute glass mason jars with handles for $10 with the Boba Guys logo in the front.
7. If you bring the Boba Guys jar or your own mug, you will receive a discount off your drink!
8. Grade-A balls AKA fresh.
9. Homemade syrup. They don't use powder or artificial syrup.
10. Homemade almond and grass jelly.
11. Slightly hipster and more "Americanized." They have some non-Asian staff, which makes this boba shop a little more unique!

Note: The Classic Milk Tea is WAY more sweet compared to the Hong Kong style milk tea.
author: Vicki L.

description:
I've drunk a lot of horchata in my life, and when I heard the horchata was the thing to get here, I had high expectations. Those expectations were definitely not met. It reminded me of a watered down version of rice milk with a dash of vanilla. I opted to have my horchata with the house made almond jelly which wasn't bad except for it couldn't easily be eaten through the straw so when I finished the liquid, all the jelly was left at the bottom of the cup and, let's be honest here, eating it by itself just isn't as fun. 
May be willing to give this place another chance in the future, except this time I would order a different drink item with the boba.
author: Daniella O.

description: Not sure what all the hype is about with this place. The milk tea is super watered down. The pearls are decent, but doesn't make up for the tasteless milk tea.
author: Karen C.

description: Been seeing them and their cups for ages and finally decided to stand in the long line and see what all the ruckus was about. Ordered the horchata boba on a nice sunny day and it did not disappoint especially when I was trying to be critical! It hit the spot and it was well worth the 10-15 min wait!
author: Nadine C.

description:
boba guys is definitely different.

everything about them screams different actually. they use premium ingredients like straus milk, & different milk alternatives. 

they also have some funky drink creations such as strawberry fresca. this one tasted a bit watered down. but it's understandable because this is their forte.

we also tried the matcha with boba. this one was unique. it looked beautiful with the different layers. the taste was covered by the honey, leaving only an aftertaste of matcha.

we also tried a hot lavender black tea. this one had a subtle taste of lavender. was pretty comforting on a rainy day.

overall, I give them 4 stars for their chill ambiance, quality ingredients and for the nice cashier lady who had to put up with us :)
author: David Z.

description:
After posting my review, one of the founders of Bobaguys, Andrew, immediately reached out and expressed his sincerest apologies re: our experience. A snippet of his response is below:


"To date, we've done over 80 events over the last three years. This is the first time we had an unhappy customer. When I read the review, I did not know what to think because it's the first time someone gave us negative feedback on our catering services. After taking some time to gather our thoughts, I started writing this email.

There are no excuses and we are addressing it internally. I got the full update from the person who worked yesterday and can see what we can do to improve communication. We will fix our response time on emails/calls and ensure our team is prompt, clear, and professional. As you probably know from visiting our stores, we have super high standards. Even though we're known for our physical shops, we pride ourselves in being able to deliver a memorable experience even outside of our stores. You can see from our Instagram that weddings are our event specialty.

...We promise a next-level quality boba experience, so if we don't deliver, we don't deserve your hard-earned money."


While I still standby my initial review of my experience with their catering services; but I do commend Andrew for the way he conducts his business. His email response was exactly what I expected from Bobaguys from the get-go: personable, professional, and well-thought out. Like I said in my initial review, the milk tea and boba is delicious; and I have high hopes for Bobaguys as a business. It was just unfortunate that the day of didn't reflect that.
author: Jessica H.

description: Been here a few more times and am downgrading one star due to the inconsistency. Sometimes, it tastes amazing and sometimes it's too watery and lacks flavor. Still one of my favorites though and would recommend. Just hope you go on a good day :)
author: Claudia C.

description:
More than just a great story than 2 guys experimenting with a business, having a great marketing strategy and a large following on the internet (the guys write articles for Good magazine and Huffington Post!), I enjoyed their pop up at Ken Ken and meeting the guys in person so when they opened their new store, it's been on my list of to-go places. I finally got to come to the store and try their slow bar last night!

Bin was there, friendly as ever, chatting with my friend who was sitting alone (since I'm always late). He was eager to share his tea story and the teas they use, passionate about this project and the future of Boba Guys.
