The muscat and lychee are their two most popular flavors, and after sniffing both teas, I settled on the delicious lychee flavored tea. They brew the tea fresh, so it takes 10 minutes, and they use strauss milk. Nothing was premixed, which SFers are all about. 

I actually really enjoyed the lychee milk tea with boba! Albeit the premium price point of $5, I loved the clean feel of the store, the hipster vibe, being able to sit by the counter and watching the people on the street walk by. 

if I lived closer, I would definitely come here more to stop by for boba and to hang out. Now I'll make it a point to come here more often when I'm in the Mission. I like how Boba Guys emphasize quality and they're always eager to please if you're not satisfied. To be honest, it's a great neighborhood spot, great catering choice, and cute meet up spot, not my all time favorite milk tea (Fantasia and Purple Kow take the reign), but it's definitely quality! Follow their story by looking at Good.is! It's a great story behind the boba.
author: Joanna S.

description:
I thought this place was just "OK."  If i was craving boba and in the area i would definitely come back, but i wouldn't go out of my way and go all the way down to the mission for a milk tea. 

Their drinks range between $4-5.50 which is pretty steep compared to the $1.00 teaway.  I got the jasmine milk tea which was REALLY REALLY SWEET!!! Drinkable, but SWEET! My boyfriend got the coffee milk tea and he seemed to be happy with it.  I usually don't get tapioca in my drinks but I thought I'd try theirs it since it was my first time here.  At first I thought they were a bit hard but after a while it began to grow on me. 

What I really came here for though was the sugar spun cotton candy!! I was hoping for one of their more exotic flavors like thai tea or sesame, but they only had lemon cookie.  The cashier was kind enough to give us a sample to make sure we like it before we buy it.  It was delicious! I would definitely come back for the cotton candy and to get my hands on a rose milk tea (i would have gotten that but i didn't see it until after i ordered my drink).
author: Linz C.

description:
I've been wanting to try Boba Guys for a pretty long time! I finally got to try them on a hot and sunny day in San Francisco. Perfect for the cold drink! When we first arrived, there was a small crowd inside and outside the store. We ordered and shared the following drinks:

Rose Milk Tea with Almond Jelly - I noticed that the tea was actually brewed from real tea leaves! I really liked this drink! You can really taste the rose tea flavor. I think this would be my favorite drink! The almond jelly was soft and yummy. However, I definitely prefer their boba over the almond jelly.

Ice Matcha Latte with Tapioca - I love anything with matcha in it, so I had to get this. Flavor was pretty strong. One thing I did not like was that every sip I took, there were small specks of the matcha powder. However, I did loved the bobas! They were sweet and chewy! 

Jasmine Milk Tea with Almond Jelly - I tasted more of the milk versus the jasmine tea flavor. I think I have had better at other boba places.

Prices are a bit expensive; however, Boba Guys do use fresh ingredients including organic milk and they brew tea leaves instead of using all that powder and artificial ingredients. Also, we only had to wait for about 10 minutes even though there was a huge line and crowd ordering and waiting for their drinks.
author: Philana C.

description:
I finally made it out to Boba Guys! I was deciding between Jasmine Milk Tea, Duke of Earl Grey, and Rose Tea and since this was my first time here, I decided to go simple and get the Jasmine Milk Tea with boba.

JASMINE MILK TEA W/ BOBA
Was a hefty $4 and though it was good, it wasn't $4 good. You can taste both the jasmine and the milk tea without either flavor overwhelming the other. But the boba was... interesting. I have mixed feelings toward it. It hardened a bit so it wasn't fresh and if you're going to call yourself "Boba Guys", ya better have some good boba! It did have an interesting chew to it though, almost like the Hi-Chew candy.

With this drink alone, Boba Guys did not win me over. But I will be back at some point to try the Earl Grey and the Rose Tea, which are $5 - $5.50 for the "slow-dripped" tea. Slow-dripped boba drinks, hmm... We'll see how this goes. Until next time!

TIP: Watch out for the step! I didn't realize it was there when I was leaving and tweaked my ankle a bit. Thankfully, I wasn't hurt for more than two minutes but do be careful.
author: Sandy T.

description:
What the heck y'all???

I've tried this location twice and both times were a nightmare.

It is SUPER dirty inside. Like EWWW I don't want to put my phone down while I grab a straw dirty. 

Also, the drinks are pretty inconsistent. The first time my drink was WAYYY to sweet (100% sweetness) so the next time I got 75% sweetness and it was sweeter than the time before! 

On top of that, the person who took my order acted like my money wasn't good there. REALLY? Do you have to be that nasty and rude? So I'm indecisive. No one else was there in line but me!!! It's not like I was even holding up the line.

At least the guy who made my drink was nice. 

I like the location since it's close to my nail salon but after my last experience there, I'm not sure I want to come back.
author: Sujin Y.

description: Boba Guys have been a fixture in the neighborhood ever since they took over the Japanese snack shop that was there before. I love Tapioca pearls and the milky teas I've had in the Avenues at other HK style tea shops. I hadn't visited Boba Guys before but it sounded delicious today and there was no line so my girlfriend and I went in to get a tea. We ordered a Thai iced tea and a matcha iced tea. One of the things that was confusing and hence the low rating is that Boba Guys charges extra for Boba! I have never experienced a Tapioca bubble tea place that upcharges for the Tapioca pearls. The tea itself was good and we ordered at 50% sweetness which was perfect. So five stars for taste subtract 3 stars for charging extra for what seems like the salient aspect of the tea which is the tapioca pearls. I can see charging extra for other additions but without the tapioca pearls, it really isn't bubble tea. I'm glad I'm not that into drinking sweet high-calorie drinks regularly and I won't be a regular customer knowing this.
author: claire k.

description:
I'm definitely happy to see that Boba Guys now has a brick and mortar location of their own. The quality of their boba drinks is much better than average. They brew their tea using organic Five Mountains Tea, and add Straus organic milk and housemade syrup.

They don't have as many flavors but I like how the emphasis is on quality not quantity. The drinks come in one size (the usual size not the crazy huge size that has become popular) and are priced at $4 and up. Brewed to order drinks ($5) take a little more time. The price includes an add in (boba, housemade almond jelly, grass jelly, aloe vera) though coffee jelly costs extra.

* Earl Grey milk tea ($5, includes choice of one add in. The pearls are cooked to perfection; soft, chewy, sweet and fresh. The tea was excellent too, smooth and not bitter. The drink had a nice creaminess. I asked for it less sweet...still found it a little sweeter than I'd prefer so I might ask for half as sweet next time. They didn't add much ice (yay) but the downside was that the drink could have been colder. Also they could be better organized. The person who ordered a slow bar drink after me got her drink before me.

Boba Guys is open Friday - Sunday only for now. Later they'll add macarons and cupcakes. It's a cute spot, mostly white with wood. There are only has four chairs. Boba Guys drinks are also available at Suika.
author: Lolia S.

description:
Hong Kong style milk tea was not good. It was below average. I've had Hong Kong milk teas from different places and this is probably the worst one I've ever drank. It was very creamy/milky and barely had any tea taste to it. And like their menu claims it's suppose to have some bitterness to it, but what I got was straight up milky. It tasted like homemade milk tea when I add too much milk or condensed milk. 

However, their jasmine milk tea was good.
author: Ashley D.

description: I love how you can choose the level of sweetness of your drink. The horchata one is surprisingly good. Defiantly recommend.
author: Vika N.

description:
There's Boba in the Mission?

Boba Guys saved my ass a trip all the way to the Outer Richmond. Yes, I was too lazy to drive out to Purple Kow! This was a sufficient milk tea fix and it was closer proximity to where I was at the moment.

I tried their Jasmine Milk Tea with Boba. Pricey for just a cup of tea, but I'm willing to support the cause. Great quality tea, love the anteater logo...nothing to complain here! So happy for my cup of hipster tea! :)
author: Jennifer L.

description: This wasn't typical American bubble tea.  It was made from scratch without the fake powders.  The boba was very fresh and the horchata flavor I got was delicious.  They also have some crazy cotton candy flavors.
author: Jenna P.

description:
I expected decent tea and boba at this place called Boba Guys. Sadly, it's just another mediocre boba shop in SF. 

I heard they focused on quality tea, and yes it seems they do. But when you let the milk overpower the tea and include sub par boba... Well for $4 bucks... not quite worth it.

Update:
Could not even finish the Jasmine green tea with boba... just downgraded to one star.
author: Mendel L.

description: Their drinks are awesome! Got their hong kong style milk tea and taste great! Great place to stop by after going to brunch at radish nearby! Fast service!
author: Christopher G.

description: It was my first time here but I've seen my share of Boba Guys posts. It's all street parking around here, but it wasn't as packed as you would expect with the one near Union Square. I got the regular milk tea (basically black milk tea) with boba and 75% sweetness and my boyfriend got the Jasmine milk tea. Super small shop but it's really good!
author: Katie L.

description:
I'm very sad to announce boba guys is no longer as good as it used to be. In fact, their milk tea got so borderline disgusting that I ended up throwing it away after a few sip. 

When it was still a pop up store in Mission I've been many times and every time the boba, the milk and the tea were just amazing. This is the first time I've been to their new permanent store and the experience was very disappointing. I ordered the jasmine milk tea with boba as usual and not only the boba was tasteless, the milk tea was also very watered down. It literally tasted like boba in water. Their milk tea used to have this creamy milky taste but I cannot taste any milk in my tea at all this time.

I hope Management will see my review and fix this quickly. Otherwise, there'll be one less thing for me to look forward to when I visit SF in the future.
author: Sherry Y.

description:
Finally, a brick and mortar for Boba Guys! And a bigger menu? HURRAH!

I have an ongoing duel with lactose so I love Boba Guys for providing me with a dairy free boba solution. You can ask them which items on the menu can be substituted with soy milk. I loved the jasmine soy milk tea I ordered. No extra charge for soy - whaaat! Even more awesome. Maybe their drinks are a bit pricey but at least I'm not being penalized for my inability to digest lactose. F you, starbucks.

If you're not in the mood for boba, I highly recommend their almond jelly. It is delicious, soft and creamy, with a little wiggle jiggle.

Parking is easy. Check out those little side streets!
author: Amanda C.

description:
My boyfriend and I went here not too long ago because 1. I've never been to Boba Guys before and 2. I was craving boba. I've heard such great reviews about this place and it's crazy that I've never gone (since I've been living in Daly City/ San Francisco for 2 years). The store is pretty small itself, so you might not want to hang around inside the store, but admire the decor while you're waiting for your drink! It's very nice.

Anyways, to the menu. It's very simple; there's only a few options to select from and what stood out to me was the strawberry jasmine green tea (which I think was a limited time only) and my boyfriend got the Horchata milk tea (we had to ask the baristas what was popular and what they liked the best and their customer service was on point! Thanks guys!) One sip of our drinks and we were in LOVE. They were both delicious! 

The drinks are very affordable and I do recommend you guys to come here and try their teas!
author: Trisha L.

description:
Absolutely in love with Boba Guys! Have it at least once a week and can't get enough. Thank you!

- delicious teas
- pretty consistent flavor (had it 50-ish times now)
author: Alex G.

description:
The milk tea isn't bad, but it isn't amazing compared to other places out there. I go here when I make a trip to the mission and it is pretty much the only milk tea spot around. They are one of few places that actually serves hong kong style milk tea and the only one I know that serves horchata milk tea too. I tried the hong kong style milk tea, regular milk tea, and the matcha milk tea. I will probably order the matcha drink again...

The only bad thing I can really say about this place is that its really hot. I was sweating waiting for my drink.
author: Jade L.

description:
I really do like my boba, and Boba Guys is my go to spot.

I don't like matcha, but their Mango Match Fresca (something like that) is delicious. Very refreshing, brings a bit of tropical paradise to SF. The bitterness of the matcha is very complimentary to the mango puree at the bottom, but sadly you can't adjust the sweetness of it, so if you don't stir it up properly, you do get too much mango puree and a ton of sugar to the face. 

The grass jelly here is also excellent. Instead of a tasteless black jelly that you see at other boba shops, the grass jelly here is very complex. The texture is like a firm jello, it gives way, but has a bite to it, and the flavor of the grass jelly itself is really delicate, and has a light grassy bitterness to it. 

The service is here is good, staff is always really friendly, and will help you with any questions you have about teas, and toppings. The line though, is a whole 'nother beast. I have seen it wrap itself around the corner at prime time..
author: My V.

description:
The hype always sways people to check a place out. And I am definitely one of those people who get swayed by any type of Boba hype. New boba spot? WHERE??!! 

I had high hopes for this place because of all the rave I've heard about it. Boy was I disappointed. Overpriced and it was meh. Tasted like Quickly's. It's really nothing special. Hipster boba spot in the Mission. Nice decor and little shop. Other that that, their drinks are nothing to go crazy over. Their tapioca balls were okay.
author: Dara S.

description:
I was extremely skeptical debating myself what kind of drink to get.

At first, I had Rose Black Tea in mind, however, after eating japanese food for dinner. I've decided something that was light sounds better. 
I asked the cashier what she recommended, unfortunately, it was mostly strong tea flavors that she recommended. So I opted out of her recommendations. 
I've decided to go with Jasmine Milk Tea with Honey Boba. 50% sweet and Half & Half milk.
The boba was semi hard/chewy but had a honey flavor to it which taste really good. The Jasmine Milk Tea on it's own for Half sweet was already really overpowering!
I really hoped that I actually got to sample the tea before ordering my drink!

50% Sweet, Jasmine Milk Tea with Honey Boba did not work out for me!

I will come back to try another flavor next timee!
author: Anney T.

description:
This is probably my least favorite boba place! I am not saying it's bad, but the level of variety in drinks and flavor isn't as good as other ones you can find in the city. 

I got the Thai tea for $3 and it was WAYYYYYY to sweet... Whoa. I didn't do this but I would definitely adjust the sweet level. My friend tried the Horchata and he said, "It taste like normal Horchata with boba balls in it but I can get this so much cheaper at a Mexican restaurant" All of the drinks here are around $3.

Everything here is pre-made, that's why you will get your drink so quickly. 
All and all, this wouldn't be my first choice..
author: Sabrina L.

description:
I love horchata. I love boba. Put the two together and it's perfect. On a rare scorching hot day in San Francisco, it was a relief to find Boba Guys. 

The horchata was good,but it's a bit watered down. The pearls are cooked well, there's a good chewy consistency to them.  Perhaps I needed a larger size to accommodate for my thirstiness. For around $5, this was a bit overpriced, but I'm glad I got to try the novelty of a horchata boba.
author: Vincci L.

description: This is my absolute favorite boba shop ever. Sometimes there can be a long line depending on the time you go, but it's always worth the wait. I always get the regular earl grey milk tea, 30%, with boba every single time. Ever since I tried this drink, this is the only drink I will ever get because it never fails me. I would say try to avoid the almond milk substitution because the taste is not for everyone. I've tried the strawberry matcha and Muscat oolong and they are both good, but Earl grey milk tea wins every time. In fact, im craving one as I write this review!
author: Michelle O.

description:
It is tiny, but the sidewalk is bigger. I got the horchata for my first try and I liked it. I was disappointed in the lack of bicycle parking. 
The location is close to a lot of good meals. Somewhat in the middle of a residential area and businesses, so there is a lot of walking, bicycling and car traffic on 19th St. 
There is no shade in the afternoon, it will get hot. I like the mission of boba guys and it is nice to watch them make tea.
author: Kristal C.

description: Solid boba place! Got the jasmine milk tea with boba, which came out to $4. A little pricey but the tea is great. Boba is a little chewy for my taste but still good
author: Kristie M.

description:
Despite being disappointed with their pre-mixed milk tea from their original pop-up store, I gave their new store a shot anyway. We came in about an hour before closing and there was a long line outside. The wait in line was less than ten minutes and the wait for our tea was a little over five minutes, since we ordered one of their "slow bar" items. Their "slow bar" items are made from fresh tea leaves and so they take a little longer to prepare than their other items.

I went with the matcha latte with extra ice and my boyfriend went with the lychee milk green tea ("slow bar" item). The matcha latte was good, but it was not the best that I have tasted. I liked that they use organic milk though. The lychee green tea was okay too. It had a nice hint of lychee flavor that did not overwhelm the taste of the green tea. I am not typically a fan of boba, but the boba had the perfect consistency--soft and chewy.

The quality and taste was definitely better than our first experience and it's great that they have a nice store front now--it's very modern, clean, and "hipster" like. The only gripe I have is with plastic lids that were used for our cups. I'm not sure if they are made specifically for large straws, but my friend and I had a hard time getting our straws into the hole without our drink overflowing. I noticed a few others having the same problem too. Other than that, their teas are good!
author: Lien T.

description: We ordered the classic milk tea w 75% sweetness and received it in the blink of an eye! Great recommendation from the staff and very friendly service :) love the logo #goanteaters -rgross
author: Jordan B.

description: The drinks aren't anything special. What pissed me off is when the girl working the cash register explicitly told me "everything is milk tea" after I attempted to order a regular tea. Of course the next two ppl after me were able to order non-milk teas, had she possessed a hint of good customer service, she would've presented me with ALL my alternatives the non-milk option. You're better off going to other boba places.
author: Aaron C.

description:
Hate this location. First of all you can't find any parking. Second they screwed up my order (although they did offer to fix it). Third it doesn't taste as good as the Stockton/union square location (see my review for boba guys for that location). Fourth fix that drippy air conditioner. Water dripped on my friends head! 

I dread Sunday's because the other location is closed on Sunday's.. I'd rather go downtown. It's exponentially better!!!
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Pros:
Tech savy, great interior and customer service.

Cons:
It's confusing to think it's boba and theres nothing special to the drinks.

Food Experience:
We came here as we were waiting for our table at Radish. So I really love horchata so I got their horchata boba drink. I thought it was going to be amazing because they even put cinnamon on top but it was just a average watery chewy drink.

Conclusion:
I almost forgot I came here, unfortunately I wouldn't come back.
author: Irving B.

description:
Heads up: if you're going here to see the boba guys, they're probably not going to be there. (In case you're wondering, I was not going here to see the boba guys, but just wanted to point it out in case you were)

I was totally confused when we walked in as I was expecting to see the boba guys shown in all the Yelp photos, but it was some other guy who looked nothing like them. So I was thinking we're in the wrong place. I also was not aware that they're in the same space as Ken Ken Ramen, which added to my confusion. So we went in and out of the place probably looking pretty dumb before we finally decided that we were in fact in the right place.

Loooved the two drinks we got:
- Milk Tea with Tapioca
- Jasmine Milk Tea with Almond Jelly

The drinks were the perfect amount of sweet and came with a lot of tapioca. They tasted healthy and refreshing; definitely not like other places I've been to where it tastes like I'm drinking artificial flavored sugar. The almond jelly was rather interesting and kind of melted/dissolved in my mouth which was kinda fun. The balls were slightly hard and could've been cooked a little more, but still decent.

The hours suck big boooty. Like who closes at 2pm on a Saturday? Makes it hard for brunch, but hopefully they'll open later! 

Oh & they also have alcoholic boba! (see my picture for the selection)
author: Jeanie F.

description: Pretty good boba. It's a bit more expensive than your usual Asian boba place, but pretty good. Highly recommend their matcha green latte.. Also, be prepared to wait a little. They can get really busy..
author: Rochell S.

description:
The fiance and I had been eyeing Boba Guys since they were a pop-up shop a few years ago. We didn't make it in until this past weekend when we visited their shop in the Mission. There was a slight line out the door, but it moved pretty fast. I ordered Classic Milk Tea with boba, 75% sweet and he ordered Duke of Earl Grey with boba, 100% sweet.

They use organic Straus milk and I think it does make a different in the taste. It is very milky, but the tea flavor was strong as well. Some of the tapioca pearls were a little hard and they were also an odd size, which caused them to get clogged in the straw. 

Overall, it was a good cup of boba, but at $4+ each a little pricy except as a special treat.
author: Annaliese D.

description:
Good:
This place has Horchata Boba, I think this is the only location in the entire universe where you can get that.

Not so good:
Quite pricey for a place that sells boba drinks, however it is located in the Mission and since there is no competition around they can set the price they want.
Also by the time I went there, they were not serving drinks in mason jars anymore, I just hope they bring them back again, gives them some charm to their business.
author: H C.

description: It's delicious and it can be dairy free? Wow the best. The lady at the counter helped me through my order and was very kind. I guess she gets lots of newbies! This place is the best and if you ever need boba, go here!
author: Michelle M.

description: I was ready to accept the fact that SF lacked a good boba place...until I came here.  Their iced matcha latte is truly phenomenal.  I could drink a gallon of it without thinking twice.  Yes, it's that good.  I love that they sweeten their drinks with honey and allow you to adjust the level of sweetness. The customer service is also top-notch.  Now, whenever I'm told SF doesn't have a single praiseworthy boba place, I counter immediately with Boba Guys.
author: Michele L.

description:
The drinks here are good if you come on the right day. What really bothers me is their lack of consistency. My first visit, the drinks were amazing. I was so glad that I decided to visit the closer location opposed to going to my usual on Stockton Street.

My favorite drink here is the Hong Kong Style Milk Tea which is a Milk Tea made with Condensed milk. Avoid the Almond Jelly, it's way to overwhelming and ruins the flavor.

On their off days, it taste extremely watered down. On good days, it taste simply amazing.

As soon as they start maintaining their flavors i'll update my review. Till then!

3 Stars.
author: James N.

description:
Probably THE sweetest boba I've ever had! I got the classic milk tea with almond jelly and tapioca balls at 75% sweetness but it felt like 200% sweetness, not in a bad way at all. Good stuff. 

P.S. It's an aardvark in case you were wondering.
author: Stephanie T.

description: Got the green tea matcha with bubbles and fell in love with the boba. It was so sweet, soft and chewy. The subtle flavor of the green tea was balanced well with the sweet boba. For me, it's comparable to Kung Fu tea as both places make delicious drinks. I would def wanna come back here to try their other flavors!
author: Joyce K.

description:
My husband and I came here yesterday and LOVED everything about it. The space is  really nice, their teas are delicious, and the staff is so friendly! They even sell bags of their tea at the counter for home - and all are made to go with milk. 


I had jasmine milk tea with tapioca and almond milk, and my husband had their classic black tea with tapioca and regular (Straus creamery!) milk. Both were sooooo good. It's great how customizable their menu is (toppings, sweetness level, milk choice) and how they really want you to be happy with your drink. Also plus for non-dairy drinkers, the almond/soy options are at no extra charge! That made me really happy. It's the little things.

All in all, our new favorite tea place.
author: Casey C.

description: Might not be the fastest option at the busiest times of the weekend (post-lunch hours), but it's always worth the wait. Perfect balance between customization options and speedy preparation. The quality and flavor of the teas are unparalleled, even in a city with as many diverse food and drink options as SF. For now and unless they do something too drastic, Boba Guys is my favorite boba place in the state.
author: Kimberly R.

description:
Ok Boba Guys, I think Straus Milk Guys is a better descriptor for your shop. I liked the milk flavor and the Jasmine tea was a good strength for me. You had good milk flavor without overcompensating by over-sweeting the drink. 

Your aardvark logo and mason jars are fun too, though they obviously don't affect the quality of the drink (except in my mind, of course). 

Now, if you really want to do your name justice, get your boba up to par with the rest of your drink! They are sweet, which is good, but the texture is off. They are way too chewy. They are not QQ at all, which is what I think the ultimate boba texture should be (my favorite in the states are from Sweetheart cafe in Berkeley). I like my boba not too tough (undercooked) not too mushy (overcooked) and now not too bouncy (not sure how you got your boba to be like this). You boba are what I would call chewing gum bouncy.

Best of luck to you as you try to perfect your "Grade A balls".
author: Wendy H.

description:
"Would you like boba? It'll be 50 cents."
"Uhh you mean like extra boba?"
"No, just any boba. Some people don't want any."

They charge 50 cents extra for boba.
Someone please tell me, who goes to boba guys and doesn't want boba???
author: Olivia M.

description: I discovered their product indirectly via the Frozen Kushterd truck. They had done a custard float with condensed milk and Boba Guys boba. I took 4 Barrel coffee as the flavor so it was like a Vietnamese coffee Boba drink in one. Awesome.
author: Kim N.

description:
Really, it's the best because it's all natural. You won't find another all-natural Boba tea place anywhere.
But -- it's extremely mismanaged. No thought into how to better the consumer experience.
Last three times, stood in line for 40 minutes, only to be told, "We don't have enough strawberry puree left for the fresca." (They have some left, each time, but would rather make the dairy-smoothie with it instead).
Three times. In a row. Same sentence.
Perhaps you could have someone come out and take orders or such. So that we can be told you don't have enough strawberry puree left for your fresca. So we don't wait 40 minutes and realize we won't be getting our fix.
Or, wait, here's a better idea. If you're running out regularly, chances are you are UNDERsupplied. Order more strawberries. Make more puree. Spread more joy.
author: C J.

description:
Decent boba place with non-dairy alternatives and unique offerings. I enjoy having grass jelly in my drinks. Their grass jelly, which is made in house, has a slightly firmer texture and is a little less sweet than the grass jelly that I get elsewhere. Boba Guys satisfies my boba cravings, but I do not crave their boba drinks like I do for other places. 

Note: There's very limited seating (3-4 stools?) and no restroom.
author: Susana T.

description:
We had the Boba Guys cater at my son's first birthday party and WHAT A HIT! I've never heard so many good things about the milk tea. We had Jasmine Milk Tea and Original Milk Tea and both were huge favorites of all the party guests. 

The best part? the awesome service by Andrew himself. He delivered and served the boba milk tea with such grace, expertise (I wouldn't have the slightest clue what to put first in the cup) and a smile on his face.... I would recommend the Boba Guys for any special event!
author: Lilian K.

description:
I was quite impressed with the quality and variety of drinks they had here. What stood out to me the most were the different types of milk offered for the milk teas instead of that powdered creamer most placed use; they offered almond and soy milk.

I ordered the warm chai milk tea with soy along with boba. Even though I asked for the drink less sweetened, the milk tea still did not lack in any flavor; the drink was very tasty! The boba had just the right amount of chewiness to it as well. My bf ordered the horchata milk tea with the almond jelly. He absolutely loved it! Definitely try the almond jelly because from what I remember, it's homemade. 

This hipster boba place is definitely worth paying a visit to.
author: Maria C.

description: You should probably stick with the classic teas as those are the best. Seems like there's always a line but it moves pretty quickly. I did like that the tea flavor was stronger than most places and it was delightfully a little bit bitter (you can customize how sweet it is). I got the grass jelly as my add-on and was disappointed it was just in huge rectangular chunks. I couldn't really suck it up through my straw at all. I ended up scooping it out to eat after I finished all of my drink despite my attempts to get both drink & jelly at the same time. If they could cut the jelly into smaller chunks that would be awesome.
author: Kim P.

description:
First time here, last time here. Line was out the door. Wasn't sure what to expect,  and was okay with being surprised with the very limited menu (I'm used to all the other bubble tea places with gigantic selection). I thought maybe it was a testament to the high quality drinks I would be getting. Ordered coconut green tea with boba and their coffee milk tea with boba. They get points for having both almond milk and soy milk. 
Both drink were seriously not good,both thin and watery. Coconut tasted very fake. The coffee milk tea lacked black tea flavor, and the coffee part tasted like gas station coffee. 
The chai milk tea sounded good, maybe the others are better. But I won't be back to find out. 
Go to i-tea, Honey-B, or Bambu. Those places are delicious!
author: Traci K.

description:
I feel so hipster drinking boba out of a mason jar in the Mission. Secretly, I LOVE every part of it. 

The first time I came here, Boba Guys was about to close and they ran out of boba. My boyfriend and I had some time to kill so we decided to share a jar of milk tea and chat it up with the waiter-from-new-york-who-doesn't-like-organized-sports (I REALLY wish I knew his name, he was so nice). My boyfriend and I finished our delicious jar of milk tea and the waiter gave us another jar on the house! He told us a couple from Japan came to Boba Guys and swore their curry was the best they've ever had. We had to go watch the 49ers game so we promised the waiter we would be back another day to try the curry. My boyfriend and I came back 7 days later. This time to try their boba and curry. The curry was probably the best I've ever had. If you come here for boba, please also try the curry. Trust.
author: Cindy A.

description:
I really like Boba Guys. I'm not sure why the reviews aren't as good as some of the other milk tea places around. Maybe it's a little more expensive, or perhaps a little too hipster? I don't know.

However, overall it's a really good place. You can get your choice of the conventional teas or have them brew one of the more specialized teas. I've tried a variety but usually go with the conventional black milk tea. The you can customize your milk (default is half and half) and sweetness level (0-100%, default 100%). Once you dial it in, you can be sure to get what you want.

It's a popular place, and small, so there is usually a line out onto the street. It moves fast though and it's worth it. Check it out.
author: Brent W.

description:
One of the better milk tea places in SF! I wouldn't say it's the best, but it definitely beats out any of those chain stores you see around the corner. They only have 3 or 4 drinks to choose from, but that just means they can specialize in the drinks that they do make. It's rather expensive ($4 for a one sized milk tea) but I'd definitely prefer this over Quickly's or Tapioca Express. 

Next time I definitely want to try their ramen!
author: Jeanette S.

description: Ordered Milktea which taste a little different because of the milk they use but nothing really special to it. Also tried their HongKonh Style, its typically just a black tea with condensed milk.
author: JohnVey Rose Dhejan S.

description: I love boba l, so it was a must that 8 checked out boba guys. The place was really busy. Had to wait 15-20 mins in line just to order. Once i ordered, the drinks did come out pretty fast. Had their signature drink, the strawberry matcha latte. It was a very nice and refreshing drink. I do wish that they had their full menu displaced on the wall (i found a booklet of other drinks they make AFTER i ordered). Will be coming back to try other drinks when I'm in the city.
author: Pia N.

description:
I honestly don't understand the huge fuss and long lines. Drinks are good, but nothing special. Very small selection. I appreciate that most things are "homemade," but at nearly $4 for the smallest size, I kinda feel like I'm at Starbucks. I tried the Indian chai, which was pretty good, but could've easily purchased at a local Indian restaurant. Boyfriend tried the horchata, and as he's a mission native, said it was good, but not much different than the local tacqueria. 

That said, try it, but don't believe the hype.
author: Nicole F.

description:
A little too sweet for my taste - even after adjusting by adding "no sweetness" to my order. Maybe it was the item I chose though - the coconut green tea latte with almond milk. I wish the place had nutritional info available for sick people like me who have to watch how much fat and sugar I intake.

My stomach didn't hurt too badly after drinking it though so I might come back and just get an unflavored tea or something. Definitely a tasty dessert drink for those who don't have to worry too much about their diet/health!
author: Sarah L.

description: Yum! I actually like this place. I'm so over boba, but their stuff is good. I like the options for different specially brewed teas. It may be a bit overpriced for what that is. However, good boba is (somewhat) difficult to find, with all the options being a hit-or-miss, and you can't tell beforehand!
author: Victoria C.

description: I have high expectations for this place, however, it tastes the same as quickly, but knowing how they use top ingredients like organic milk makes me feel safer about drinking their boba tea since the ones made with powders have a lot of bad chemicals for the body, I will buy it if I'm in the area and crave for a cup of boba tea
author: A L.

description: This place is good!  I'm super excited because they have vegan options, which I haven't found at other places. My drink was so delicious. My only qualm is that they don't use compostable cups. They are really conscientious about ingredients... the environment is just as important!
author: Ms. S.

description: Loved both the Horchata and Jasmine Milk Teas. The Horchata milk tea was, as I expected, on the sweeter side but I didn't mind at all. The Jasmine milk tea was so refreshing - I could just taste the strong, natural tea leaves infused into the milk! The boba itself was on the starchy/gummy side, but it wasn't a deal breaker. Can't wait to come back!
author: Josh L.

description:
My new obsession. I was unfalteringly loyal to Lollicup and Quickly for so many years, but I've finally found a place that offers variety without charging extra. 

Things you get to choose
Drink style: hong kong, thai tea, horchata... hot or cold?
Type of tea: lychee green, jasmine green, oolong, black...
Milk: half and half (organic- classic SF), almond, soy
Additions: boba or jelly
Sweetness: 0, 25, 50, 75, or 100% (100% is the same level you'd find other places)

The milk options without extra charge are what really got me- I'm lactose intolerant but I love boba. This place is a dream.

Their logo is also fantastic. I will be back.
author: Nicole C.

description: Coconut green tea. Enough said. Ask to have it brewed a bit longer for more flavor. Get the almond jelly and call it a drink. You won't be disappointed! That's my usual go to order. I've tried many of the other drinks too. The green tea latte was definitely on point as well. I enjoy how they freshly brew the tea and the taste is where you'd want it to be.
author: Audrey K.

description: Tried boba for the first time in my life thanks to one of my housemates and their friends! I had the horchata with boba and it was delicious! Service was great, price was decent, and menu was good. I'd recommend coming here, can't wait to come back!
author: Shaniah M.

description: This place it's poor service !!! I walk in to buy a cup of boba, cuz I can't have any caffeine but I love boba so much today I just wanna eat only boba and the server just refused to sell boba for me. I asked them twice cuz I'm very surprise that they refused cuz I asked to buy not for free! Never gonna come back again.
author: Kaew I.

description:
Good tea, average boba, insane prices.
I ordered some type of honey green milk tea with boba and my bill came out to $6! Six bucks can get someone a full meal at some places, that is way to much to be charging for a drink. The tea was tasty but the boba was eh. It was kind of hard and flavorless. I doubt I will return to this place unless they significantly lower the prices. 

PROS
-good tea
-nice atmosphere
-friendly staff

CONS
-mediocre boba
-ridiculous prices
author: Carson P.

description: Went in here for the first time and tried the Horchata and jasmine milk tea with boba I liked how good and fresh the boba tasted. The only thing about the location is parking, it's hard to find.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
So we came here on a Friday afternoon, eager to try their milk tea, and hear their story. Unfortunately the guys weren't there, but the lady that served us was nice and friendly so we did got a drink.

They had three selections: Milk Tea, Jasmine Milk Tea, and Soy Milk Tea. I got their Jasmine milk tea, and I've gotta say best Jasmine milk tea I've tried. Bf got their Milk tea and friend got their Soy milk tea, both were interesting, but  tasted legit. their tapioca was just right.

For us poor college kids, it's a bit pricey, that's why I knocked down one star but I'm glad we tried it and had a good experience.
author: Oriel F.

description:
Ordered the mango matcha tea fresca and yes i could taste the "quality"!  The mango puree went surprisingly well with matcha and the pearls were nicely cooked. I do wish there were less ice so that my drink would not have become tasteless halfway through.  I also wish that slushy version is available. 

Is it worth lining up for?  The answer is probably a yes for yuppies (or hipsters) and a no for the others.  Is it worth the money?  Some people would say " it's the price for belonging...".
author: J H.

description:
Happy grand opening, Boba Guys! 

While I appreciate that Boba Guys is bringing a beloved Asian drink into the Mission, I wasn't super impressed with my order today. I ordered the classic milk tea with tapioca. Some pluses: tapioca was cooked nicely, great texture -- not too hard, not too soft. So, major kudos for making perfect tapiocas. It's a hard task. I know, because I've tried and failed. Some deltas: the drink just wasn't cold enough.. I wish the tea was cooler. Also, the milk tea was too sweet for my liking. I prefer more tea flavor and less milk and sweetness. Thus, the combination of it being room temperature and overly sweet made it hard to finish my drink. I guess what makes this place different is that they use Straus Family Creamery organic milk and actual tea for their drinks. So, it's almost gourmet boba if you will.

I am liking their overall look. It's different and original... cute anteater or aaardvark (which is it?) sipping boba, staff in white coats... like mad scientists trying to concoct the speciality drink in beakers. Well, the white coats and beakers part might be a bit too much for me. 

Anyway, it's their first day, so the wait for picking up the drinks took a while.. so maybe I' should cut them some slack. I think they will have a better system down as time goes by. Or maybe they can customize my drink in the future.. less syrup, less milk. I might come back if I am in the area, but otherwise, I think I might stick with my East Bay boba options.
author: Cassy H.

description:
4 stars? 3.5?
You tell me. 

Finally got a chance to come by on a Friday afternoon after wanting to come here for weeks. I even got a meter with 40 minutes - score! 

I think I understand why their hours are so strange - Boba Guys is not their own establishment? They're renting from another store during the time the store is closed? -- Just a guess after some observation. 

Jasmine Milk Tea - $4/cup 
Yes, it's pretty expensive for a cup compared to what you can find on Irving. Sucks even more that it's almost half a cup of ice too! The Jasmine milk tea over all is delicious. Tapioca is plentlyful (went up to the line on the plastic to-go cup). The tapioca could use a little work. They're hard and a lot of them are stuck together. I didn't get a bartender to make my drink, so no fancy shakes to prepare my drink. Mine was basically poured out of a container you'd make homemade lemonade which is kinda bummer. 

My friend ordered the Soy Milk Tea ($4) and it tasted a bit watered down, but I'm not sure if that's just the "style" of this flavor as I never had a soy milk tea prior to this experience. Also it's brown in color. 

They were also serving veggie or chicken (?) curry for $8 a tray. It smelled really yummy!

Boba Guys has a lot of potential. I wish they were closer to home and have less weird hours.
author: Jess W.

description:
I love Boba Guys! I love that they don't use powder, they brew their teas fresh and their pretty quick. They use Straus organic milk which is a + in my book. I've tried the jasmine milk tea, HK milk tea, Iced green tea matcha latte and they were all so good. The only complaint that I have is that they make all the drinks EXTREMELY sweet. Trust me! I've been here multiple times and it was like drinking diabetes through a straw. 

Always ask for light sweetness.
author: Laura T.

description:
Best boba in San Francisco. Hands down. 

You can actually taste the tea and the milk at the same time. My favorite is the jasmine green. 

Although there are only three flavors, it seems as if Boba Guys have mastered the taste for all of them. I am all about quality over quantity and I'm pretty sure Boba Guys agree with me too. 

Can't wait for their new shop to open with extended hours. 

P.S. On weekends, they have horchata.... off the chain!
author: Jonathan D.

description: The original location! A pleasant treat in the Mission as an alternative to coffee (or get coffee, since they have coffee milk tea here too). Been going since they opened.
author: Jeremy W.

description:
I really like the atmosphere of this boba shop; it's very simple and clean. Over the past week, I have visited twice and tasted the Classic Milk Tea, Horchata and Hojicha (Which wasn't on their regular menu, so may have messed up the name).

The Classic Milk Tea with regular sweetness tasted very similar to the milk teas I had as a child and definitely hit a soft spot. I got this with less boba because my friends had previously told me that Boba Guys add a bit too much boba; I thought that it was a good amount. I really enjoyed the drink but found the tapioca to be inconsistent; some were soft and chewy, and others were hard. I will probably want to reorder with less sweetness.

The Horchata was yummy. I personally like my Horchata to be more spicy (more cinnamon), and may ask if that's possible next time I visit. The default sweetness was perfect for the Horchata in my opinion.

The Hojicha had a very strong tea taste, which I really enjoyed. Would highly recommend for anyone who is feeling a strong tea flavor over sweetness.

Pros:
- High quality drinks
- Simple and straight foward menu

Potential Improvements:
- I would look at the process for which the tapioca is cooked in order to ensure greater consistency. There were some that were definitely undercooked in my drink.
author: Jeff M.

description:
This place has definitely been a hype for my friends to go to, however, it is just so out of the way from the Sunset to try a beverage that may not meet your expectations..

But luckily enough! I have a friend who works nearby. We came in around 6:30pm to 7pm and it was totally empty. We were greeted by the two workers behind the cash machine. The drinks on the menu were all $4 and the slow-brewed teas were a dollar extra. I ordered Duke Earl Grey Tea with tapioca and it came out to $5 flat. 

I was a bit surprised for what the price turned out to be for a 16oz beverage at an Asian fusion place. The earl grey flavor was present in my drink but wasn't Asian sweet like I thought it may have been or expected it to be. 

Probably won't be back but happy I got to cross this place off my list. I use foursquare and several of my friends have visited this place, after trying it out, I see why they've only visited once.. haha just kidding.
author: Yeanne L.

description:
Like many places in San Francisco Boba guys can be spotted with A long line outside it's doors. When you order they ask for a sweetness level,boba (or jelly) and what type of milk; soy, almond, organic. The 100% sweetness was very sweet. I would have probably gone for50%. They do have a carafe of simple syrup and water on a side table to adjust sweetness. I got the jasmine green tea with Boba which was pretty good except for how sweet it was. My sister got the coffee boba tea which didn't really taste like coffee... Just like regular milk tea. They also offer bubble tea smoothies, and cotton candy which I didn't try but looked to have interesting flavors. 

This is a good place if you have a bubble tea craving. But I was surprised at the small variety of flavors. They did have mango and strawberry, Thai tea n horchata , but I was really surprised that they didn't have flavors like tarowhich I find commonly at most bubble tea places.

This place also included some bar seats but was really more of a take out bubble tea place.
author: Camille A.

description:
Boba Guys is a good boba place! I would definitely visit when I'm visiting the city. I like how the boba feels very "healthy" and guilt-free. Boba Guys is probably the only boba place that offers vegan boba. I got lychee milk tea with grass jelly because I wanna be healthy. It was good! I sipped through my boba within minutes (it means its good, trust me!). 

They also have a location on Stockton by Union Square. Very smart, since this way the culture of milk tea can be further spread on to the greater San Francisco community (and tourists coming in and out SF). I
author: Cindy M.

description:
Came on a beautiful Sunday afternoon of a long weekend, so I guess everything and anything would have pleased me...

Quick story: I graduated from UCB not long ago. My roomies and I had an unhealthy obsession with boba. And sometimes, we also had an unhealthy obsession with going out on weekends. Then one night, bam, we thought, why not pair boba with alcohol? Then our conservative minds thought, nah, no way, that would never work. Lo and behold. 

Okay maybe that was unnecessary. But the point of the story is that boba/alcohol is a pretty genius idea! But then again, put anything in mason jars and we have a SF winner.

Laid-back feel, perfect for a lazy afternoon. Will definitely be back! Note, they also have Japanese brunch options, which the roomies and I may have a go at next time around.
author: Linda X.

description:
I thought it was cute to have boba milk tea served to me in a glass jar. I'd say the boba here is not outstanding nor mediocre, just somewhere in between. Milk tea was alright but the boba was a little too chewy and they were stuck together. $4 is also above average for the price of boba. 

They also have spiked boba drinks...yes, vodka and rum mixed into your milk tea and boba. To me, that's blasphemy so I didn't try it! Alcohol does not belong in my childhood drinks!
author: Cheri S.

description: Horchata is a bit too overpowering and the sugar and cinnamon + milk ratio isn't even. The Thai and Jasmine milk tea is good though, and the boba is well cooked- not too hard and not too soft.
author: Karissa K.

description:
I'm not sure if boba is something that can be translated into something upscale or gourmet as they try to do it here.

Sometimes when a guilty pleasure of sugar milk tea filled with chewy tapioca pivots to a home brewed, no powder added, gourmet treat without the ability to order crispy chicken on the side; the nostalgic memory of being in hs with your friends in a parking lot near tapex, quickly, or old tea house (Davis!) goes away...
author: Youna K.

description:
2.5 - 3 stars

Overpriced boba. The marketing here is fantastic (which drew us here in the first place), but the tea and pearls itself fell short. The pearls were a little bit on the hard side, and the tea was not that flavorful at all. I have definitely been to other pearl tea places that offered tastier, and cheaper options than this. 

Sorry Boba Guys, didn't deliver.
author: Patty O.

description: I got the green lychee drink with tapioca, $3.95 with addition $.50 for topping, which comes up to $4.45. It taste like water, sugar, and milk with a hint of tea. The tapioca balls taste awesome good. The logo has an ant eater on it. It's cute but it doesn't make up for the milk tea that is pretty tasteless. Customer service is good. I wouldn't come back to get a drink here.
author: Cindy D.

description: Went on a Sunday, was looking really forward to the Milk Tea 75% sweetness, was okay I've had better, I was expecting something better, the line wasn't too long, the tea was watered down a bit, the boba was delicious probably the best I've ever had, milk tea not so much.
author: Ana A.

description:
My favorite boba place in SF, in CA, and therefore my favorite boba place anywhere. Their diverse menu has led me to drink a plethora of their boba which have been amazing. Couple of my favorites are the Hong Kong, Jasmine Milk Tea, and Earl Grey. They have options on sugar levels. I take my friends here and they usually get something different from me and they end up loving their drink. They can do wrong. My friends like jellys in their boba which they say are good, but I always get boba balls. Let me tell you their boba balls are made to perfection. Not too chewy or hard. Perfectly made. If you like boba you must go here. 

Con: there lines are ridiculously long. I hate to wait but they are worth the wait....granted after waiting that long I usually end up getting two boba's.
author: Soroosh A.

description: I ordered the horchata boba and thought it was pretty good. I've never had horchata in boba before so I wasn't sure what to expect but it was delicious with a nice texture from the boba. When I went into the store it was a tad crowded but the line moved fast and everyone was pleasant. It definitely isn't the sort of place where you can order and sit around talking inside the store since it is so small instead just walk down the street to Dolores park and spend the afternoon there instead. I believe it was a tad pricier than what I usually pay for boba but I realize everything in SF cost more so I expected that. All in all I would be back to get more horchata boba if I am ever in the area.
author: Abigail L.

description: The best boba tea - and I've tried a lot!  Only downside is some of their locations don't open until noon.  Wish they would all open by 10am.
author: Cheryl M.

description:
Definitely a good spot that serves some good quality boba drinks and best of all they don't use powder like some other places. I'm not a boba person and usually just enjoy the milk teas minus the tapioca, but their "balls" are homemade and pretty top notch. I really appreciate the steps into crafting a perfect cup of boba, from their homemade pearls and jellies, to the quality of teas and syrups, and the different milk options they offer. The steps they take is very methodical and they really want the customer to notice hence the lab equipment visible in all areas of their shop.

I've been satisfied with both my experiences here, on my first visit I wanted to try something pretty standard so my girlfriend and I ordered the classic black and jasmine tea. We asked for 25% sweetness and I opted for the jelly, while she got tapioca balls and we were both satisfied with the tea itself and the toppings. On the next visit, I decided to try something new and try an horchata boba, unlike the other drinks, this time I wasn't able to adjust the sweetness since the horchata mix was pre-made. I tried the horchata on the first taste and the drink was overly sweet, but the staff was really helpful and offered to remake the drink and dilute the mixture by adding more milk. I was really happy with the end result of my drink thanks to their friendly and very helpful staff. Honestly can't wait to try the rest of their menu on future visits.
author: Limuel G.

description:
Honestly, some of the most genuine tasting milk tea I've had around the city. Their drinks actually come out very sweet most of the time, but if you let the ice melt into the drink, it'll dilute it perfectly so that the drink has the right sweetness. 

My personal favorite is the Hong Kong Style milk tea, a black milk tea in which they use condensed milk to sweeten the drink. I'm a big fan of that, and I'm glad they do that drink justice. 

It's a bit pricier here for drinks, but I think of this place as a treat for myself whenever I feel like I've done a pat-in-the-back worthy task for the day. 

Would recommend to others.
author: Curtis Y.

description:
I'm guessing this location is their popup store.  I was kinda disappointed walking in and not seeing the boba guys.  Maybe they're only there on the weekends?  

I got the original milk tea.  $4 is kinda pricey for something that tastes similar to the cheaper competitors.  The balls weren't too bad.

I'm glad I crossed this place off my list.  On to the next...
author: Linda N.

description:
You gotta give these guys credit. They're trying to do something different without breaking the bank.

My wife and I strolled in here after she read about Boba Guys on Yelp. The interior of this place is pretty tight. There was no AC, and since it was a little hot outside, it did get a little uncomfortable, especially since my wife ordered the slow brew coconut green tea. And unlike traditional boba shops, these guys aren't nearly as fast at cutting down the line.

I guess my biggest complaint is how pretentious everything feels. Slow brew tea. C'mon, really? All tea is slow brew. You brew tea by steeping it in hot water. This is the way tea has been brewed for thousands of years. It's nothing new.

And then there's this acrylic contraption that's supposed to look like a coffee siphon bar. But unlike a coffee siphon, you're not watching water steam in separate chambers, forcing hot water through a filter. Again, they're just steeping tea in hot water. It's silly. 

To top it all off there's all this stuff on the menu boasting about the best quality ingredients from around the world. And as I'm reading this, I'm watching the hipster kids behind the counter use Kirkland cinnamon and vanilla. Don't get me wrong, I love Costco. But I don't consider Costco ingredients rare or exotic.

Anyway, the tea was alright. I had the horchata boba. It had a good flavor without being too sweet. And since most boba shops have at least 30 different flavors, to find something fresh and unique is notable. My wife's green tea with coconut milk and almond jello was also a nice twist. I liked that.

And for about $3.50 a pop, which is just about the same price you'd pay for this stuff on Clement Street or in Chinatown, it's not a bad deal. But it's not anything worth going out of your way for.
author: Tony L.

description: YUM. I never thought a strawberry matcha latte would be very tasty but oh. my. goodness. It was amazing! It's a little bit sweet for my taste but once everything is all mixed together, it's so tasty! The drink comes out looking like the Italian flag with the strawberry, milk, and matcha layers. I would definitely recommend this place :) it's a little pricey and the wait can be really long, but it's worth a try. You do have to pay extra for toppings but they use premium milk (like the almond milk is free!). So it balances out kinda. Another great one is the Muscat oolong milk tea! What I love about these two drinks is that they're so unique to this boba shop! Try it and see!
author: Taylor W.

description:
This is one of my favorite stops in San Francisco! It is such a nicely set up store and the few times I have gone in the staff have been super friendly!

I usually switch it up when I go to restaurants or out but I've tried a couple different flavors and it seems they are all very consistently good. The after feeling is always the worst part about boba but that happens everywhere because it is so sweet. 

The way that Boba Guys' tapioca tastes compared to other places is better in my opinion. It has a distinct taste that makes it even more delectable and mouthwatering. 

Fun Fact: I have walked into this store and ordered a drink and walked out with it completely gone! 

Overall a great stop for SFEatery!
author: Brandon R.

description: Best boba in San Francisco. The managers use their full passion to make this store fresh to customers. My favorite is their Classic milktea with boba. No powder. Everything is fresh and organic. I really wish their berkeley  pop up store can still be there so I can go there all the time. Best best boba. Also, check out their Instagram to stay update with their seasonal drinks and secret menus. Best ever. @bobaguys!!!  by @ucboba
author: Bubbles U.

description: This place is by far the best boba/milk tea place in the whole bay area. Not even joking. If you have ever had milk tea in Hong Kong you will understand me. Shit they have a flavor called Hong Kong Milk Tea. I get that no ice, not sweet and it tastes just like how i have it in Hong Kong. I'll drive up here from palo alto all the time just to get their milk tea and come back home. These guys are doing it right let me tell you.
author: Mark S.

description:
I really want to like this place, but I can't say I completely do from the drink I had. I got a hojicha milk tea, 50% sweet and it just tasted very strange. The hojicha was a little too roasted, which would have been fine if the overall drink wasn't watered down. It almost tasted like water with milky food coloring and hojicha flavor. My friend also ordered his hk milk tea 50% sweet and it was even more watered down and less sweet than my drink. Please have more consistency! Even the jasmine milk teas that my other two friends got at 100% sweet tasted watery...

There are two things I like about this place though: 
1. The jasmine milk tea was very strong in jasmine and very floral! 
2. The boba was nice and chewy.

Boba guys seems to know how to do the flavors, just not the milk tea part. I hope they change something, and maybe I'll like it more next time I go!
author: Rachel L.

description:
I was so looking forward to Boba Guys. Boba in a mason jar? Can you say Instagram worthy? 

Boba guys is located inside of Ken Ken Ramen. They take over the bar area. When I went inside I was a little underwhelmed. The area was messy and unorganized causing me and my friend a little confusion as to where we would order and drink our boba.

You order at the bar because they also have spiked boba. While their alcoholic boba concoctions looked tempting I opted for the regular milk tea with boba. They ran out of boba (big no no.. come on boba is like the main item) and suggested that I try it with homemade almond jello instead. 

The milk tea was ordinary. Nothing I would go back for. The almond jello was a nice addition but how do you mess up almond jello? Also if you came for the purpose of instagramming boba in a cute little mason jar request that your drink is served in a mason jar or else it may come in a regular glass. 

Basically nothing special, not worth driving to the city for if you're coming from outside of SF. The highlight of my experience was the restroom. I'm not kidding.
author: Sarah C.

description:
I think I'm in love with this place. I get the same thing usually every time I go - horchata with boba and almond jelly. I can't find it that good anywhere else. The almond jelly is so good. Boba is good too but I have had it once when it wasn't cooked all the way.  

On a recent visit, I decided just to get the almond jelly and not boba. My mistake. I went up to the counter ready to pay for added boba and the employee said not to worry it's on me.  Turns out, he was one of the owners, Andrew. He chatted with my friends visiting from New York and gave us a lot of insight on how they got started and how they're expanding with their new location(s?). He was extremely friendly and we felt really welcomed in the small but busy spot.

Thanks for making our boba experience so worthwhile!
author: Stacey C.

description: Pretty good boba. Can sometime feel watered down if everyone is in a rush - this seems to be a common problem at more high-end boba shops like the Boba Guys. The line is kinda too long for my taste, but I love walking here from work every so often to try the unique drink combinations. I prefer Asha Tea House over this one.
author: Jessica L.

description: ERMAHGERD ! I love you boba guys love drinking ur matcha latte milk tea but today I found a plastic shard in my drink !! it was triangular luckily I caught it with my tounge double check your cups next time before pouring your drink tsk tsk
author: Ashley U.

description:
I ordered the classic milk tea and was very disappointed. 

It tasted like the ones you can get from the Chinese deli, VERY little hint of tea flavor and it just tastes like milk. In Taiwan, they actually don't use milk but milk powder.

I think this place is totally over-hyped, yeah they have beakers/ test tubes and stuff, but the tea is pretty weak. I've tried all kinds of milk tea places, Quickly, Purple Cow, Fantasia, Tapioca Express, Ocha, ShareTea, & TPump. This probably has the lowest ranking. 

Do yourself a favor and spend that $4 (pretty pricey) on something that actually tastes like tea.
author: Mengerie S.

description: NOM NOM! Love the Honk Kong syle boba! Now I am just waiting for them to be open on Saturdays to get my weekend fix!
author: Kyle W.

description:
It was my first time here today and the quality of their milk tea is just perfect! The boba is really chewy, just how I like it. Everything tastes so fresh. I ordered the original milk tea for $4. I was hoping they would serve the horchata milk tea today, but I guess I have to come back another time to try it ;) If you sit-in, the milk tea comes in a jar. It's soo cute! Main reason why I wanted to come here haha but anyways, I also ordered the pork curry for $8. I don't usually eat curry and that was the best curry I've ever had. 

Must come back here!
author: Jamie G.

description: Another place people love to love, meaning there'll probably be a line. I had the Lychee Rose with boba the last time I went. It was good, but nothing to write home about.
author: Patricia L.

description:
Overhyped but unique, I think they were smart to first start out serving their boba in mason jars. The boba presentation, paralleled with its hipster location, made Boba Guys all the buzz in SF. I mean LBR (let's be real)....boba in mason jars? So Mission, so SF.

But I come here, after the hype was calming down, and sure enough they are no longer serving their boba in mason jars but regular cups. 

I ordered their horchata milk tea since I've never seen not had this before. It was good but not great. Satisfying enough but not the OMG HELLA bomb kind of thing. It's maybe 3.5 stars in my book but the quality of milk tea and boba do not compare to (for example) Ten Ren in Cupertino.
author: Stephanie B.

description: One of the few places that serve boba in the Mission. This place is just alright. When I do go here, I get the HK Milk Tea. It's not my absolute favorite place, but it's decent. It can be really sweet just to let you know. So you can ask them to adjust the sweetness of your drink if you need to. I'd recommend it if you were in the Mission.
author: Julie L.

description: liked the classic black milk tea - great and refreshing alternative to coffee. Grab one and head over to the nearby Dolores Park.
author: Wolfgang G.

description:
Okay fine...I'll admit that one of the first reasons for why I wanted to come here a couple years ago was because they put their milk tea in a mason jar. I mean come on, HOW HIPSTER IS THAT?! Yeah there's other boba places that do that now, but Boba Guys was one of the first places that pioneered this mason jar/glass jar boba movement. It makes me sad that now they mainly just use regular cups...but oh well, they had a good run.

This place isn't just about being hipster and glamorous though. The boba and milk tea is actually good! They have a pretty wide variety of options, but I like sticking to the originals. My favorite is the jasmine milk tea, but you can't go wrong with the classic black milk tea. Go ahead and try the Rose milk tea and the Hong Kong style ones as well because those are both excellent choices as well. 

What separates this place from others is the fact that their boba is actually good too. It always seems to be the right balance of chewiness and firmness! Yum. These guys really are the boba guys.
author: Aaron W.

description: 2 stars for me, it would have been a bit more worth if it was easy to find parking, it took forever. I ordered the horchata with boba , the horchata was eh. I didnt like it. The boba was good tho. But i can def find better boba places than this.
author: Kayla P.

description: Very popular and has quality boba! It's hard to find a boba place that is consistent. I usually go for the jasmine milk tea with boba and have never been disappointed. Fair warning though, parking here is terrible and the lines are almost always long. Luckily, they service is quick and friendly!
author: Jessica W.

description:
The location was kind of hard to find without a sign saying Boba Guys lol. 

The drink was okay. I got the regular milk tea and I thought it was too sweet for my liking. I thought it was also a bit pricey.
author: Vernice T.

description: WORTH THE WAIT!!!!! So so so so yummy. I got the regular milk tea with boba 50% sweet. Those tapioca balls were the best part.
author: Nicole M.

description: Would be 5 stars if not for crazy lines! Hojicha milk tea (a relative rarity), half sweet, less ice, with tapioca hit the spot after walking SF Pride. The roasted tea flavor shone through, the Boba was toothsome and made just right, but the line was ~30 min before I had the chance to order! Once your order is in it goes pretty fast, though. Excited to come back and try other teas, just not during peak hours!
author: Julia L.

description: I like the simplicity of their menu with the added appeal of quality ingredients like Strauss milk and Three Trees organic almond milk that some other boba places don't offer. I also like the fact that they offer decaf tea, which my kid enjoys a lot. On my recent visit I ordered their Thai iced tea and coconut green tea with organic almond milk at 50% sweetness with boba and almond jelly. The Thai tea was for the hubby, which he loved. I really enjoyed my boba tea and the homemade almond jelly was delicious.
author: Rosella S.

description: I got the iced matcha latte with boba and trust me, I'm a HUGE fan of everything matcha but the drink wasn't what I was expecting. I came with big expectations due to all the hype but the drink was nothing more than what I've tasted at other decent places. The boba was a little disappointing- it lacked the softness and the chewiness and flavor as well. It didn't compliment the drink at all. I loved the interior of the shop- small but cute and cozy. I would've given a 3/5 stars but since I didn't even try the milk teas or any of their other menu items, I decided to go with a 4/5.
author: Caitlin L.

description: I thoroughly enjoyed the classic milk tea, jasmine milk tea, and Hong Kong styled milk tea. I would suggest staying with these classic flavors. The horchata milk tea and Thai milk tea were not that tasty, in my opinion. The horchata milk tea seemed not as creamy as I expect a milk tea to be, but I like that it wasn't that sweet. You can customize your sweetness level on most drinks. I did not find the boba pearls here to be all that consistent, sometimes too hard. They also have a slow bar menu where the tea or coffee is brewed by cup, but like it says, it's slower, and also more pricey. Since it sells itself as a hip, trendy boba place, expect to pay more for boba here overall.
author: Jennifer W.

description: We love their matcha tea, hojicha, rose milk tea and definately their hongkong toast. Yes the toast probably on the high end of the price but it is super yummy and fluffy that I cannot not order it whenwver we came here. The line is always long but we did the online order so we just go and pick it up. it is so worth it rather than waiting in line. The boba is fresh and chewy. I also like their almond and their grass jelly.
author: L D.

description:
Meh... This place is hella hip for a boba spot & it's MADDDDD expensive.

I'd rather go to quicklys & it would be better than this place for real. 

The only 2 things that makes this place "different" is the horchata & matcha green tea latte boba. But that ain't even boba.

Meh.
author: Jazzmin A.

description: I am an avid boba drinker and Boba Guys has time and time again wowed me at the quality, consistency, and value of their drinks. Their teas are actually real and are genuine tasting; they don't have a long list of flavors, but perfect the ones they do offer. My favorite drink is their Jasmine milk tea with either their organic milk or almond milk and tapioca pearls. I'm also impressed with their customer service and fast service. Even on days where the line is about 25 people long, they speed through orders like crazy! Boba Guys is easily my favorite boba place in the Bay Area! Keep it up!!
author: Mitchell K.

description: It was my first time trying out boba guys. Only two people were in front of me , thanks god! I  tried one of their popular drink strawberry match latte with boba and grass jelly.   After I stirred the Strawberry  and milk, it was very good ! However, I was so disappointed about the boba.  They taste hard,  not fresh at all.  Maybe boba was sitting for a while ?
author: Eva T.

description: FYI, if you use Postmates to order Boba Guys, it automatically defaults to 0% sweetness. I ordered a Hong Kong Style and because condensed milk is already an ingredient, I didnt think I needed to add any sweetness. I was totally wrong. The drink was actually undrinkable. I just confirmed with the worker, you should always choose "100% Sweetness" for it to be the normal sweetness you wouldve gotten if you ordered in their store. And btw today, it said that Golden Honey Black was sold out on Postmates but when I went in store it is not sold out.
author: Sarina A.

description:
This is currently my favorite boba place in the Bay Area! I commute to the city for school and I always stop by here on the way home after class! (: 

My go to drink here is a iced soy green tea latte with boba. It tastes a bit similar to urth caffe's green tea boba which I've been craving ever since I tried it on a trip down to SoCal. I'm very picky about my green tea drinks and this is the best I've tried in the bay so far. I love how it doesn't taste artificial or syrupy. Instead, it has a good balance of tea and sweetness. I also like how you have the option of using soy milk since I'm not that big a fan of regular milk. The only reason I took off one star is cause the green tea latte is occasionally unavailable. ):
author: Gayle G.

description: When I first came to this place, I was quite unimpressed, especially since it's on the pricier side and very hipster. I love matcha and so that was the very first drink I ordered. Boba was good and chewy! Drink was too sweet, but I usually am a little sensitive to sweetness so I go for less sweet in my drinks when I can. The next few times I came by, I tried the earl grey with boba, regular milk tea, and hong kong milk tea. They were all alright, but what keeps me coming back is their Hong Kong milk tea! My favorite. Nice tea flavor that you can taste and chewy boba!
author: Christina C.

description:
They serve alcoholic boba! It's one of those "DUH why didn't I think of that!?"

I know! it's like combining 2 of my favorite beverages. It seems like such a simple concept, but I've never seen it done at a restaurant. The boba itself is good, perfect consistency and has the right flavoring to it. However, once you add the alcohol, it adds the bitterness that detracts from the flavor of boba. I feel like I could make this drink by myself. Just buy the boba elsewhere and add my own shot (or several shots) of alcohol. 

It's definitely one of a kind. I would go back if i was in the neighborhood, but if I wanted do spike my boba, I could easily do it myself.
author: Stacy X.

description:
Their jasmine milk tea is honestly the best I've ever had. It's rich in flavor and is always fresh. I've tried the thai iced tea, horchata, hong kong style and matcha green tea as well and they are all just as delicious. The boba is really sweet and has a chewy consistency to it. 

They atmosphere of the place is really great. It's kind of like a hipster tapioca place. The wait to order is never long. I have never waited for more than 5 minutes to order and I usually get my drinks in about 2 or 3 minutes. There is a small seating area too. 

4 stars because of the price for the drink. I understand that the tea is really good quality but 4 dollars seems a little steep. Also, there's only one size for all the drinks. Sometimes I just need a large drink after a rough day. And sometimes the thirst is just real.
author: Lisa H.

description: Delicious boba, it always hits the spot! There is a queue a lot of the time but it moves quickly and it's worth the wait. I don't like mine too sweet so like that you can customise it. Delicious!
author: Allie S.

description: I am literally here almost every day. This is the best boba tea I've ever had! The ingredients are fresh, delicious, and healthier than other places. Bin and Andrew are super sweet and knowledgeable. They clearly love what they do! Cute decor, very nice staff, and great neighborhood in general. To avoid weekend lines, I recommend ordering ahead using Square's Order app - you pay via the app, so you can just hop into the store to grab your tea and run.
author: Julia O T.

description:
Gimmick or the real deal? 

It's a gimmick. And it's hype. People are just convincing themselve it's good because of the marketing (that's marketing anyway). I don't know which is worse, Tea Pumps or this place. And if you think Tea Pumps is good, you're not Asian enough or you're too Americanized to know what is "good." (Americanized versions of Asian things are always bad if you've tried the Asian-original, whether it be movies or food) And Tea Pumps and Boba Guys are oviously the PF Changs of Chinese food. "chinese" food.

For a company that markets themselves as meticulous guys scientifically crafting the best milk tea recipes, I'd say these scientists missed the mark pretty hard. I think it was not so much meticulous crafting, but more just a few guys in a kitchen mixing stuff together without the slightest culinary skill or wit whatsover... like college dorm kids that don't know how to cook or mix flavors... because these are by far the worst ratios and recipes I've ever had, aside from Tea Pumps.  

Political news needs to fact-check, BobaGuys needs to flavor-check. But they really need to think about flavors not so much in a scientific process. It's also wit and experience in a culinary sense. Like I said, it's like college dorm kids without the slightest sophistication of taste or the slightest art of cooking trying to play with a bunch of beakers n pans.
