Mixing flavors and devising combinations is wit and intuition, not calculation and process.

-------------
I came in with a large party and tried several flavors:

Jasmine milk tea: I often jude a milk tea shop by this standard. It's classic, simple, but takes understanding of milk tea to get it PROPERLY made. Well, these guys managed to screw this up. 3 of us ordered it just to be sure. And yes, they all came out identically disgusting.  -- too watery, yet milk to tea ratio... too much milk--so it tasted plain. 75% sweet. 100% sweet. Both pointless It's like adding more sugar to water. The tea was standard jasmine but more importantly, the ratios were all wrong. 

Earl Grey Milk tea: This is my staple order at any milk tea place that would serve it. I've tried it EVERYWHERE. You can say I'm a bit of a harlot for earl grey milk tea... I've been everywhere for it. Well, Boba Guys destroyed this drink. Good job. B for effort. 
It was too watery; had a sharp hint of lychee; had a gross accent of lavender, which I now assume they used the BUTT of all teas--TAZO.. or they used the post 2012 Mighty Leaf version of Earl Grey... which is beyond butt.. and I distinctly remember that nightmare to this day, and I slightly relived it in this milk tea. And the tea to mlik to water ratio was obviously wrong. It just did NOT taste good.

Horchatta Milk tea: not bad. not great. It was like a watery Horchatta with boba. Not so great. They're better off with the store-bought and just throwing boba in it. They don't know how to make horchatta properly.

Hong Kong Style: This was their best drink out of the lot. Surprisingly, for such a terrible milk tea place that Americanized the milk tea industry like Tea Pumps, which just means... detroying it.... they managed to get HONG KONG STYLE pretty good. I tried this one last in the lot... maybe anything par would seem good.

I'm not a fan of Quickly's or TapEx, but there are a few with owners that really know how to make it. But I've also had the worst of the lot, to the point of spitting it back into the cup and chucking it into the trash. And Boba Guys, along with Tea Pumps, are in a tight race for the worst.
author: Gregory F.

description:
My only complaint is that I can't get a gallon of this stuff at a time!

I got the Matcha Latte with almond milk, which was okay. Not bad, but it kind of reminded me of  the Green Tea Lattes at Starbucks. 

The Horchata, however, is a different story! It was the perfect amount of sweetness and cinnamon. Boba was very tasty, but not as chewy as I would like. 

Definitely would come back again and try the other teas! Maybe next time I'll try the Slow Bar...
author: Thea R.

description:
Okay, so maybe the mason jar is a hype, and maybe there really aren't the two fabled "Boba Guys" scooping boba and making a drink for you in lab coats, and maybe the drink is 4 dollars.

BUT. They are true to their word when they use the best ingredients. There is no powder and the drink does not separate and coagulate like almost every other boba place out there. The drink is light but not watered down and still tasty, and the drink is certainly refreshing unlike any other. I do enjoy this place, although the actual boba itself isn't my favorite. 

I'll be coming back though!
author: Brandon T.

description: I don't really understand what the hype is all about.  The GF loves this place.  I have been here a bunch of times and I cannot understand.  I feel their drinks are all watered down.  On top of that, they never give enough tapioca balls with your drink.  I would travel to opposite sides on town to get better drinks.
author: Victor L.

description: Service was great but I got the Ice Matcha Green Tea latte and it was so watery.. I had a stomach ache after drinking it.
author: evanna w.

description: Boba guys was worth waiting in a long line. I got their green tea with coconut milk tea and it was not too sweet and not too watered down. I really enjoyed it! I also like how their boba is warm and sweet! I definitely recommend trying it at least once!
author: Joan N.

description: The drinks here are pretty average but expensive. It's bad but I would go somewhere else for regular drinks. They also don't have alot of options to choose from. Overall, I would only come back if I was in the area but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.
author: Vicky L.

description: So good! Boba is the perfect texture, 50% sweet is just the right amount. Jasmine milk tea is on point.
author: Ingrid C.

description: Boba guys never fails, the wait was fine. Picked up a thai tea with almond jelly, tastes good!!
author: Kaycee-zhanel C.

description: Unsurprisingly, my experience at Boba Guys was really good. There was a lengthy line as I'm sure is normal. But once you do order it only takes about 5 minutes. I got the iced matcha latte. Matcha was great and the tapioca balls were done to perfection. Only thing is I got it 100% sweetened which is the "default". I hope a normal person does not need that much sweetener in their life. Next time I'll definitely tone it down a little(a lot). Reason for the 4/5 is that although they do have some variety; they don't have as many choices as most boba places. I did see that they have some kind of ice cream on the menu though so I'm definitely gonna give that a go next time too! Overall you have to try this place at least once!
author: Najeemah W.

description: Didn't stand up to the hype. We got the lavender milk tea and rose black tea both with boba. I'll give them credit for the quality tea, so if you're into tea you can tell it's premium stuff. However, I was extremely disappointed with the boba. It was inconsistent and some were undercooked and difficult to chew. Being a boba enthusiast, I get boba in all my drinks and will not be going back for that reason alone. The milk tea was also a bit watery for my taste.
author: Charlie 5.

description:
Fast and tasty. 

Ordered the green tea, 100% sugar with tapioca. In the future will probably go 75% or 50% sugar, as the full was a bit too sweet. 

Service was fairly quick and the atmosphere is friendly inside.

Will definitely go again.
author: Chris S.

description:
Hey! Some of these 1 star reviews are blatantly complaining about the price and saying boba shouldn't be $4. You shouldn't be disliking boba guys because they're "hipster" or because "it's too expensive." You guys are terrible. And you suck. And YES Boba Guys does use quality tea. I think. I never actually asked to see the leaves. Ehehe.


However, I'm really looking forward to trying the kaya toast. I haven't had kaya toast since coming home from Singapore October 2013~! As far as I know, no one in the bay area serves kaya toast so try that out! I will too :)
author: Margaret S.

description: Best boba in SF.  I wish they had seating space but can't beat the quality
author: Steven M.

description: I've been here twice, and both times, the boba didn't meet expectations. I got the Hong Kong (black tea with organic condensed milk) style milk tea with grass jelly the second time with 25% sugar. It pretty much just tasted like coffee. 25% definitely wasn't sweet enough. Probably go for 50% if you're looking to cut down on sweetness without losing all boba flavor. The milk tea also tasted pretty watery. A small is also $4, when I could get a much bigger drink for $4 elsewhere. I think the only thing nice about it is that the shop looks pretty cute.
author: Anna L.

description:
I love milk tea. Life would be incomplete if my last meal did not include a milk tea with strength. It sounds like these guys share the same passion for milk tea, so I really hate giving them a low rating. 

On paper, it sounds like they know what they're doing. Strauss Creamery milk and organic tea would be the perfect recipe for a Mission hipster milk tea, but the result isn't up to par. I had the black milk tea, and the most glaring issue was the absence of any tea flavor. I didn't find it very creamy or that sweet either. I mean, it was just kind of...uhhh...blah. Good milk tea needs to be aromatic, full bodied, rich, and bold. That's only possible with a proper brew of tea.

These guys seem genuine, and I'm under the impression that they really care about their drinks. It could definitely improve though. They need to make their tea stronger. It could be as simple as steeping the leaves longer, but I can see it being more complicated as well. Since they're using regular milk, more has to be added to the tea in order to achieve the same creaminess as using evaporated or condensed milk. Adding more liquid dilutes the tea flavor. If that's the case, maybe they should tell Strauss to make some evaporated or condensed milk, or they could try using Strauss' whipping cream. I don't imagine brewing extremely super duper strong tea would work with regular milk either. Even if you aerate the tea, you'll start introducing a harsh bitterness if you steep it too long. I hope that helps. I'll probably try it again when they get their brick and mortar store open.
author: Nei N.

description:
The bad reviews for this place are due to people complaining about price, long lines, and their branding (come on, really?). 
Boba Guys is wonderful.  They have some really awesome flavors like horchata and hong kong style, but all the classics are delicious as well. I am partial to the jasmine milk tea one - and they always give me the option of choosing what type of milk and level of sweetness. 
The boba itself is soft and chewy - and they give you a generous amount per cup. I can't recommend any other boba place as highly as Boba Guys.
author: Sw A.

description:
This is my second time around and its time for a review. I tried different drinks both times in order to get a taste and see what this place is all about. I tried their HK style milk tea and their jasmine milk tea. 

If you're into just the tea flavor, these 2 drinks will be good for you. The boba itself is soft and chewy and the price for these drinks are comparable to the market price as of now. You can actually taste the tea flavor. I personally like the jasmine a little bit more. 

The drawback is the location of this boba shop. The lack of parking makes it difficult and I'm sure many people ended up leaving because of it. If you want to give this place a shot, definitely go during the day and there will be plenty of parking. If you go at night, expect a wait time to order and to find parking. 

Overall, good taste and good boba but no good on the parking hence 4 stars.
author: Stephen W.

description:
I got the jasmine milk tea, and 2 STARS because I LITERALLY make the same thing (yes, I'm totally dissing my own jasmine milk tea creation)

I didn't even finish it before chucking it away, it kinda killed me since I paid $4 for it. 

Basically, back when I worked at peets and we had down time, I would create random drinks and I wanted to make my "own" jasmine milk tea. If you want to make the same thing, purchase the Peet's Jasmine tea bag (exact tea flavor), add your preference of milk (half and half or heavy whipping cream for richer flavor) and add simple syrup (This process will kind of kill you a bit inside after realizing how much sugar goes into it to match the sweetness.)
author: Harriet W.

description: There's a huge hype about this place so a friend and I decided to stand in the line and try it. I mean, it was good...but not worth standing in line for. I feel that this place has a huge hype bc San Fran just doesn't have many boba places.
author: Joy M.

description: Came here on a few occasions, there's never a wait so the drinks come out relatively fast except if you get the slow bar drinks. Classic, jasmine, and HK milk tea are all superb, the horchata was watered down in comparison to the other drinks, I wasn't a fan. My friends got their drinks with no boba and I think it dropped the price by like 50 cents. I tried the lychee green tea and that was fantastic as well - steep at $5 for the slow bar drinks but it warrants a try.
author: Ryan L.

description: Usually I take time to write a review and don't write one immediately but I had to give Boba Guys a 5 atar. I ordered 5 drinks but walked out with 7. The manager is the best manager I've ever met, he put  customers first. I first heard about boba guys from instagram and since I am in San Francisco, I might as well try it. Arrived here and the line is out the door. The girls messed up on my drinks which I wasn't really getting angry about but the manager came out and apologized to me and he will personally make me the correct drink. Not only did he remake my drink he also gave me the drinks that was messed up and some boba guys pins. This never happened to me before. The manager is really awesome. The drinks are really good also especially the Iced Matcha Latte. The boba is soft so that's a plus and I rarely get boba. Recommend if you're in SF.
author: Thuy M.

description:
ANOTHER BEST OF THE BEST BOBA PLACES. 

Lol, clearly I loveeeee boba. It's so addicting! Went here today with my cousin and gf and we loved it! They are using this small japanese restaurant as an incubator before actually finding a legit place to open up their store! CAN'T WAIT! 

They have different flavors for the day (they're pretty basic though, well today was). We each got a different flavor: 

Jasmine Milk Tea: Tastes really florally and creamy. 

Soy Milk Tea: I GOT THIS! Super light in taste! Didn't know soy boba even existed! What a clever and simple idea! 

Regular Milk Tea: YUMs. 

We wanted to take it to go, but I really wanted to take a pic of my boba in a mason jar. So cuteeeee! So glad we came here and it wasn't crowded! The workers are friendly too!
author: Katrina T.

description:
Why I love this place:

-Quality teas
-Has diary free soy free option
-Boba is the perfect texture and taste
-Homemade grass jelly!
-Clean interior and friendly service
author: Maithy T.

description:
Boba Guys continues to make me SO HAPPY! 
I had a jasmine tea with almond jelly. Once again, it was abso fabu. I love that almond stuff. I love the Boba Guys. And best of all, they are such nice people. I just wish they would come to Oakland. COME TO OAKLAND!
author: Veronica H.

description: I've never had better balls. Even when T-Pumps was all the range...I'd rather have Boba Guy's boba balls in my mouth because they're the perfect consistency; a little squishy but firm at the same time. Honestly, the balls make the experience. The drink is pretty good too. I tend to order their specials ie: the matcha latte, the strawberry cal-pico, and other milk based drinks mostly because I like to stray from the ordinary ;) If you do the same, I promise that you wont be disappointed.
author: Joshua F.

description: Kind of pricey for a drink but it was good! I got Thai tea. To me I can't really tell the difference between drinks unless it's super water downed or extremely bitter. But overall the Thai tea I ordered from here was good!
author: Monica N.

description:
I got the coconut green tea. It was brewed on the spot, so extra brownie points for freshness. The coconut flavor was strong but not overbearing. 

As my friend put it, the boba to drink ratio was just right. 

It's not your traditional boba spot but it's certainly a good different. The presentation, the set-up, and the flavors are definitely for the modern day foodies.

I'm only knocking down a star because I wish the service was as warm as their tea.
author: Francesca M.

description: This is one of my favorite boba places in the city because they cater to people with dairy/lactose intolerance.  They offer almond and soy milk as milk alternatives.  Another great thing about this place is that they homemake all their toppings: grass jelly, boba, and almond jelly.  The boba was nice and chewy but I wasn't a fan of the grass jelly.  Possibly because it was homemade grass jelly, the texture was different than the ones I'm used to.  My favorite drink here is definitely the dirty horchata (horchata with coffee). It's not listed on the menu at this location but they know what it is so just order it. Their horchata is homemade too and so good!  Parking is not easy around this area though.
author: Angela F.

description:
Truly gourmet boba! 

Great variety of flavors and the boba is good on it's own. 

The Matcha Latte is amazing! 

Their almond jelly is also a must for any drink.

Lastly, their Classic Milk Tea with boba is also a must!

MMM
author: Alex C.

description: This place looked so hipster, I was a little afraid to walk into this little store.  But I tried their Hong Kong Style milk tea, but it was so delicious I can't wait to get the chance to go again!  Also, they offer free samples of their delicious cotton candy; how cool!
author: Charmaine D.

description:
Solid. 

I don't know anywhere else in the city where I can get as high quality boba as this place. For those that ranked Boba Guys low- where do you go?? 

The key is the quality of the tea. The jasmine is so fragrant and lightly sweet. My friends who had never had boba are hooked on that one. 

I favor their Thai iced tea. SO. GOOD. 

And they let u mix different types of boba and jelly!! Awesome.
author: Grace K.

description:
I love how their milk tea tastes more like tea than crazy flavorful syrups. I enjoy the taste of tea and coffee. I'm glad I found a place like this. 

I got a jasmine milk tea and my boyfriend got the coffee milk tea. Both were pretty good. I would come back again to try their horchata. 

Its pretty low key and mellow.
author: Josephine C.

description:
Heard of this spot through yelp and figured why not.  I drove by this boba shop without seeing any signs.  Parked my car, and walked by a temporary sign on the street and saw boba.  Once you walk in, I was not sure if we were in the right spot since a host asked if we wanted to eat.  I was like uh.. I'm here for a drink only.. boba!  Then she directed me to the front of the restaurant where the bar was.  This was where they served boba.

Welcome to hipster-ville.  Crowds wearing ray-bans indoors on a foggy day and flannel shirts, skinny jeans with converse and a messenger bag. Not much of a boba fan myself.  Price is $6 for a spiked boba jasmine milk tea is steep.  Everything is pre-made and taken out from the fridge.  All the guy did was pour and stir, add some alcohol, BAMN! 

So the big question, how did it taste for $6?  Well, at least the boba was good, however all of it were stuck together.  I tried to stir and separate it, but it was not separating.  Jasmine milk tea taste like any other milk tea and heck you can get it at an Asian market. People are lining out the door for this stuff (tpump, purple kow, etc, etc).  Why didn't I think of this? I guess you can mix alcohol with pretty much anything.
author: Elliot Y.

description:
Two words: MUSCAT OOLONG

I adore oolong and the best oolong milk tea I've had so far is at Boba Guys. 

I've ordered it half sweet with grass jelly and boba on separate occasions and I think their boba is better than their grass jelly as it has the right level of chewiness. The last time I was there, the half sweet was still a bit too sweet for me, so I think 1/4 sweet would be good for next time. 

It is a bit pricey compared to other boba places, but hey, quality over quantity.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Unfortunately, This establishment makes fresh boba tea yes, brewed from simple machines and all that good stuff..The problem is, after ordering the Lychee Green Tea they serve here... you get that repetitious "thristy" feeling in the back of your throat that lasted for 2 hours...(-2)

By te way, when people including me see your signage...it makes me think of 
National geographic rather than boba. (-1)

If you really wanna charge more for boba than teaway in the sunset...at least make sure you are up to standards because so far, the only thing floating up from you guys is the liquid buoy that preceeds a flush.....(-1)

Then again this is the. Mission soi guesshaving asian standards isnt exactly fitting for you guys but on the same coin.... you're IN the BOBA business....soo yes...you are expected to abide by the same standards....


By that notions mentioned above,  I've lowered this location far below Tpumps Status. theres much more consistncy and flavor at Tpumps. Whether youre in SF, SM or Burlingame. Anything is better than here...

They don't have/give out bags, so NOT recommended for to-go for Big groups unless you're all there in person...

'
author: Eric C.

description: I was excited to try the "much hyped" selection of "authentic milk teas" at this Mission "tea and snack" shop. The service was stealthy and accommodating during the order, but upon delivery I realized that they did not fulfill all of my customization requests. Regardless, the beverage was over-brewed and held far too many tannins. Worth a second try, but don't expect to be blown away here.
author: Bartleby S.

description: Yum. Coworkers in my office are huge boba fans and recommended this place. I tried the Hong Kong tea, slightly sweetened, with tapioca. It's the perfect blend of tea, condensed milk, and sweetness. The tapioca is a great addition if you're having a snack craving mid-afternoon. Will return!
author: Jonathan W.

description: This is by far my favorite boba place. I tried boba guy when they first open a couple of years ago and didn't think much of it. I recently tried their milk tea again and now im obsessed. I've tried the black milk tea and the hong kong style and they're both sooooo good. I also really like that they have different options of milk. I've tried the soy milk and it makes your drink just a tad sweeter. I would recommend that you try this place! You can really taste the fresh tea! The only thing I don't like is that their shop so small!
author: Kelly S.

description:
In this day of age, you can't just be "art". You have to be science.

Because art is, by our modern definition, subjective. And I don't want subjective consistency in my pearls, I don't want subjective consistency in my sugar levels, I don't want subjective consistency in anything. I want objective quality every time.

And that's what you get with the Boba Guys. Some really good pearl milk tea, made with good tea and good pearls. Down to the sweet science.

That is what you're looking for, right?
author: Christophe C.

description:
Hands down the best bubble tea I've had to date. Sure it's expensive but it's worth it to me to have them make it with real brewed tea and not some powder flavoring.

AMAZING! So happy they have a spot in the east bay.
author: Claire W.

description: Tried the earl gray milk tea and rose milk tea with pearl. They both tasted good, but the two flavors were nearly indistinguishable so it probably doesn't matter what flavor milk tea you choose. The tapioca balls were too hard for me. I feel like there are better places that are cheaper too.
author: Monica C.

description: I guess this was just not my place lol. The service was nice but the drinks just didnt cut it for me. Got jasmine milk tea with 50% sugar, almond milk, and almond jelly but i didnt like it at all. Especially disappointed with the jelly since i heard so much hype about it :( i appreciated the choice of milk and sweetness though.
author: Jenny N.

description:
I live in the Mission but didn't know about this place until I walked by it on the way to Bissap Baobab last night. Poked my head in, saw that they had dairy-free options, and knew I would be coming back the next day.

Popped in around 2pm today (Sunday) and there were only 3-4 people in line. Service was quick and pleasant. Got a half-sweet almond milk matcha tea with boba -- at first I was overwhelmed by the sweetness but then realized I just needed to shake it up a bit to distribute the syrup and chill it some more. After that, it was delightful. My only gripe is that I wouldn't mind getting a bit more tea for the price -- but really, paying $4.50 wasn't too horrifying/unexpected, and the quality was indeed very good. I have a feeling I'll be back with some frequency.
author: Maddie R.

description: Boba Guys introduces the classic side of milk tea--with the all-white design, and the window seating looking out to San Francisco's Mission district. After living in Taiwan for a summer, it was a mission of mine to explore as many boba spots as possible, and Boba Guys really brings back those memories with the perfect amount of fresh and sweetness put into the tea. If Boba Guys expanded as far as Taiwan, I'm most definite the natives there would be proud and excited for such tasty milk tea.
author: Stevie G.

description:
I was so excited to hear about spiked boba drinks, my eyes were literally star struck (not literally, but loosely "literally" in the figurative sense) and I looked like
this -- (*~,* )
Yes, that's a pretty accurate depiction of my face: stars for eyes, brimming with high expectations, complete with a little drooling on the side of my mouth too. I couldn't believe my senses,  two of my favorite things: alcohol and boba drinks, together in a loving marriage. What genius! I was on cloud 9 just at the thought of that!

Alas, it was all too good to be true.
Not here. Nothin to see here. No spiked boba drinks here. My dreams just shot down before they could even take flight. (FYI: Their Berkeley location is the main store house for alcoholic bobas for all you drinkers out there.)
Anyway, no alcohol.. blasé blasé. Tapioca balls too mushy for my taste. They are especially chewy too for some reason; like, think: Olympic-weight-jaw-exercising- chewiness level. That's quite the caliber of chewiness! Not quite my cup of tea.
So in conclusion, my face was like this when I stepped out-- (  -_-)~
Disappointed and sad; mostly because I had certain expectations that weren't met and the fish in me was not gratified. 
Great service though!
author: Tu L.

description: I don't love their boba anymore. It tastes bland to me now. I'm sorry. I still come here for the memories.
author: Irene K.

description:
I love boba. I love alcohol. The combination is typically a hit or miss. Sadly, this was a miss. Every since I've heard of Boba Guys, I've been thrilled to try them. Boba? In the Mission? Served out of mason jars? Can't get more hipster SF than that. A very curious concept that needs a bit of tweaking.

The menu is fairly simple. You either get normal boba, spiked boba, or one of their intriguing special creations. Boogie bear sounded good, but I decided to see what they were famous for. The guy behind the counter was fairly quiet and had a "mixologist" attitude to him. Not necessarily bad, but not chatty or welcoming.

On to the boba. I got a Spiked Jasmine Milk Tea Boba ($6), which consists of simple jasmine milk tea, vodka, sake and pearls. Typically when you mix boba with alcohol, especially something as strong as vodka, it tends to overpower the milk tea and ends up tasting bland. To battle this, one might make the tea to alcohol ratio higher, or just add more sugar to the tea. I felt like none of this was done here, and the drink came out tasteless. It gave a good buzz, but after a few sips I was ready to go. It just felt like I was drinking watered down alcoholic milk. 

Boba Guys have been around for only 2 years. There's always room for improvement. I'm a fan of their concept, but the execution needs work. You're better off going to any local boba shop and bringing a mini vodka bottle with you.
author: Dmitriy S.

description: My coworker raved about this place, so I had to go! It's a small store with a few chairs and a water pitcher available for customers. The selection of flavors is not what you'll typically see. I saw Horchata Boba and I knew I had to order that!  It was refreshing, especially on a warm day in the Mission. I wish it had more cinnamon, but I like a lot of cinnamon in my horchata. I definitely want to go back and try their teas.
author: Vira P.

description:
Very relaxing little shop. I liked the variety of drinks here. This is my first time at Boba Guys and I got the Muscat Oolong milk tea with boba ($5) with regular sweetness. 

I usually get my boba with regular amount of sweet but this was too sweet for me. I would recommend reducing the sugar for drinks here. The muscat oolong was an interesting combination, but it wasn't amazing.
author: Amy T.

description:
My friend and I came back from SF three weeks ago, and we're still talking about Boba Guys. We had it almost everyday we were there.

Bubbles are the perfect consistency. Almond jelly is sooooo good. 25% sweetened is just enough.

I had the iced matcha latte and the muscat oolong (my favorite), while my friend tried the classic, hong kong style, and lychee green tea (i think she liked the classic best out of those options).

Ugh, now I'm sitting at work craving Boba Guys... :(
author: Ellen K.

description: Pearls are always perfect, drinks are always (too) sweet. I always recommend 25% sweetness for the best mix of tea and flavor.
author: Andrew Q.

description:
Stopped by here the other day with my cousin since her friend had been raving about it for a number of days and since we were in the city we decided to check it out before heading home. As we drove by there was a line so I thought this place must be good since there is a line out the door ( the location is tiny, that's why the line is out the door.) I get into line and read the menu and a couple other reviews to see what i'm going to order. Everyone raves that this place is organic and it's delicious so i figured why not go with just the regular milk tea. I ordered a regular milk tea and a jasmine milk tea with pearls for my cousin. The guy then asked if i wanted to change anything with my drink and i told him no. We get our drinks and it did not meet my standards of milk tea.. AT ALL. It was bitter and not sweetened at all even though the menu says that all drinks are made with 100% sweetness unless told otherwise. I thought that my cup was bad my cousins cup of tea turned out even worst.. needless to say both my cousin and i were not satisfied with our milk teas and don't plan on coming back.

p.s: the plus side the pearls were the only thing that we enjoyed from boba guys.
author: Brenda H.

description: Heard of this place from lots of people so my expectation was quite high. I have to say this place was just ok. Definitely good quality milk tea and boba though. Maybe my expectation was too high for the price and the hype.
author: Ruxin H.

description:
This place supposedly serves "gourmet" bubble tea which really means that they serve you tea that is breed to border. They also offer some funky combinations, if that's how you like it. The tea was perfectly fine but spoilt by having to drink it through a straw and the bubbles actually ruined it.  

We also had the really expensive Kaya toast at $3.75. A thick slice of Toasted brioche smothered in kaya and drizzled with honey. The kaya is supposed to be home made but is inauthentic in flavour and it was way too sweet.
author: May C.

description: I have to say this place lives up to the hype! Being from SoCal I doubted there was good Boba in SF but their milk tea was dope
author: Sallar K.

description:
Boba Guys is in the front of Ken Ken Ramen and may be one of the few places serving boba milk tea in the neighborhood.

The milk tea is amazing. It's a little like Purple Kow in Outer Richmond because they make the milk tea from...real tea. REAL TEA. TeaWay, you can learn something here. Seriously blows your mind, huh? Milk tea from tea leaves. Anyways, the drink is very refreshing, as it's not weighed down by overly sweet milk or cream. The peppermint milk tea is pretty good too. I'm not usually a fan of peppermint, but appreciated the light and airiness when I took a sip. 

The boba has a pretty good consistency, not too hard or squishy and not overwhelmingly sweet! The handled mason jars they serve the drinks in are super adorable and their logo is precious!

My only problem is the price. For $4, you can easily get two milk teas in the Sunset. But Boba Guys is unique because they're in the Mission, and they easily set themselves apart with their fresh ingredients and lovely service.
author: Viola L.

description: I'm not sure why this place has less than a 5-star rating, it is the best bubble tea in town. Not like that Quickly powdered crap, this bubble tea is made from real tea and real milk. We've been fans since they were a popup in Ken Ken Ramen, and it's become one my family's favorite weekend treats. My favorite is the rose tea half sweet. The owners are great, the classic small business success story. Definitely go out and support them!
author: Jamil M.

description: Indian Chai with Tapioca is amazing but WATCHOUT their sweet is REALLY SWEET.
author: Cameron M.

description:
So glad I came back to Boba Guys and gave it a second try! I got the basic Milk Tea with Boba and it was better than the first time I went. The milk tea was not too sweet, which I like, and there were no little black tea leaves in it like last time. Also, I was impress with the Boba! It is soft on the outside and a bit chewy in the middle. Just the way I like it! 

Again, I am a huge fan that they use good quality tea and milk in their drinks. Definitely worth the few extra bucks. I cannot give them 5 stars until I go back for the third time and see if their drinks can stay consistently good as the last time.  

Like I said, I really wanted to like this place and now I do!
author: steph t.

description:
So I've never been one for boba. When I first moved to SF freshman year in college, I was really taken aback by how much all the "AZNs" I knew swore by the stuff.  I didn't find anything appealing by it and I'd always opt for a crepe and a smoothie when going to a place like Quicklys.

Fast forward 9.5 years later and I am taken here because it's where my group of girls wanted to hang out after mimosas at Farmersbrown.  Odd, but that's how it happened.

I decided to try for the very first time a boba drink.  I got some iced coffee type with the balls.  I don't even know what it specifically was but I remember caffeine and balls.

ANYWAYS, this ish was pretty darn good!  And I couldn't believe I waited this long to try a boba drink!  Unfortunately, I've gone to my local Quicklys to also get a similar type of drink and it still didn't do it for me.  So I'm just going to assume that Boba Guys is the best there is lol.

Additional thoughts -- the place is pretty small.  Not meant to hang out there after ordering but we did and took up half of the space for over an hour.  But the girls behind the counter were nice about it.  They knew how to up-sell to us too, which was fine because that green macaroon was good also!
author: Alyssa S.

description:
One dollar sign? Heck no. FYI this boba is not cheap. $4 for what looks to be a 16 oz cup of classic milk tea and boba (I'm a simple man).

That being said this is a darn good drink. Not too sweet and the tea was strong (but not overpowering). Perfect amount of ice. 

Shop was clean and a attractive and so were the workers (they were friendly, too ;])

Would come here again when the weather warms up and I'm bringing a friend to take a walk around the city.
author: Samuel J.

description:
A round of applause for a boba place that strives for quality!

However, I like my milk teas done right the very first time and often here, I always tend to find my drinks overly sweet or something is empowering the tea taste. And this is frustrating because boba guys, y'all some pricey boba... About $4.5 for a cup.

One advantage is there's not really any other boba around the mission, so I guess people are down widdit.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
for same the price as the over-sugared, powdered milk crap that once sold for half the price elsewhere, this is a giant step up in the right direction. I finally got to try Boba guys after following an reading about these entrepreneurs. First time using Wallet at their store gets you 10% off. 

I love that they use good ingredients and make their own grass jelly. Too bad in this city (or country for that matter), the standards are so low for most asian food. Nice logo, fast service, Strauss milk, house-made grass jelly, what's not to love? I've been so sick of those Quickly's, Tpumps, Purple Cows, and cheapo places trying to over-price and sell a drink of cheap tea with heaps of sugar with powdered milk blended to a gooey mess.

yes ppl say it's $4 but that's the price of a latte or espresso drink too. I just hope Boba guys keeps it real and doesn't start making its drinks out of vats, as many of these shops do when they can't scale up. Looking fwd to trying more on their menu~
author: Emm C.

description:
I'm not a big bubble tea drinker but when I do drink boba, I enjoy having a lot of flavors to choose from and a lot of unique choices. Boba Guys offers 2 flavors and 2 choices of what to put in. That's not a bad thing, but for somebody like me it kind of detracts from the bubble tea experience. 

I do enjoy the location of Boba Guys, it feels very Mission-y. The shop sells ramen after 6:00 as Ken Ken Ramen and apparently they now sell curry during the day. I went in the middle of a normal Saturday and there were only two people sitting inside the unassuming shop. It's not apparent that the store sells bubble tea, but ask or look around and you'll realize where you are.
author: Philip W.

description:
This review is just for the classic milk tea with boba....

Nice strong tea flavor and creamy
Boba was delish and tastes like honey
I got half sweet which was perfect!!! 

Best boba that I have had in a long time!
author: Mikaela K.

description:
Sometimes I don't read the other reviews of a business before I write my review to ensure that I'm not unfairly biased. This is one of the times I did, and I have to agree with the general "this place is a bit bland" comment. My fear is that authentic, well made boba does not taste like the boba that we have come to expect. I've started to believe that boba uses over seeped tea that gives you a bitter tea kick, then they take the edge off with milk and a huge amount of sugar. 

Boba guys goes for a more subtle experience, and they brew the tea right in front of you. My experience, as the other reviews have noted, led to boba that didn't taste very strongly of anything. Someone mentioned the lack of a refreshing kick that you normally get with boba and that was certainly what I felt. 

I would guess this place probably does a delicious regular tea, unfortunately that wasn't what I tried. An OK boba place if you are really hankering for it, I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.
author: Jake B.

description:
Cute little boba shop in the Mission. My friend and I stopped by here before going to Dolores Park. 

I got a jasmine milk tea with boba and grass jelly. The tea could have have more flavor. My friend got one of the specialty teas with boba and his was fairly strong. Grass jelly was cut way too small and it was annoying because I could barely taste it. Prices were too high for what we got. 

I do like how you can choose the sweetness level and no one argues. 

Overall, I might come again only because there aren't many boba shops in the Mission and the staff is nice.
author: Winnie T.

description: Coming from Southern California and living in an area that has boba on every corner. This place is amazing. The Classic Boba and The Jasmine Milk Tea are very fresh and you have a choice of having 75% or 100% sweet in your boba. I also tried the Hong Khong Toast and that was delicious as well but I don't know when I would eat that during the day. Perhaps as a midnight snack. Love the environment inside the building and gives a cozy feeling.
author: Calvin M.

description:
While the milk tea here is not nearly as good as some other locations in the city, I am still a big fan.

Why? Because of their willingness to experiment with boba inside other drinks. I tried the Horchata and I instantly became a believer. These tasty little balls of tapioca deserve to be considered a must-have with other beverages, not just milk tea. They are the perfect complement - slightly sweet, not terribly flavorful by themselves and with a "fun" factor to otherwise a bland drinking experience.

I can imagine a world where boba is considered a required option in every beverage. Coffee with boba? Orange juice with boba? I can see it. 

Maybe lets go a little bit further. Steak with boba on the side? Chow Mein Boba? Yes. YES!

Forget the food - lets just eat boba. It's basically a better version of Soylent anyhow.
author: Dennis R.

description:
This place has got to be the worst boba I have ever had to put in my mouth ever. It was an unbearably hot day in the mission so naturally I sought out the closest establishment that sold boba tea. 

There was a line out the door, so I expected this place to be out of this world delicious. When I read the menu I was flabbergasted at the prices. Ok, I thought it must be worth it. 

Boy was it the complete opposite! Over priced boba, not cooked properly, it was really hard to chew. The tea itself was too milky. 

I will not be returning here.
author: Mary J.

description:
FINALLY had the chance to try Boba Guys this past weekend and I was thoroughly impressed! I ordered the Jasmine Milk Tea and it was suuuper noms. It had a very distinct Jasmine flavor, which I really liked! The boba also had a great taste and texture to it as well. 

I also tried a sip of my friends Horchata boba which was okay too - and yes, it does taste like Horchata.. with boba. 

Also - the owner (I think?) was testing out their new "Frescas" that they're trying to launch.. and I believe the one we tried was Strawberry? But this was really good too! And I would defs come back to try it.. as I already wanted to order it that day. Will definitely come back to Boba Guyss forsure!
author: Krystal O.

description: Boba guys definitely one of the better tapioca places I've been to. The texture of their boba is soft, chewy, and lightly sweetened. As for the milk teas, the Hong Kong Style and Horchata tastes amazing. Overall a better alternative to places like Tpumps.
author: Brian T.

description:
By far one of the best boba tea drinks in the bay area in my opinion. They treat their teas like most cafes such as The Mill or Four Barrel treat their coffees. No matter what tea you get, you must try the almond jelly, not to sweet yet great amounts of flavor. 

Definitely stop by if you are in the Mission.
author: James M.

description:
Id come here any day for the green tea latte and HK milk tea(with almond jelly or tapioca balls)~~~

Price range of the drinks range from $4-5. They have special drinks, changes with seasons and holidays. I believe they have desserts too but its not always available. Love the quick service, especially during mid day where nobody is really there. Great job boba guys!
author: Cavin T.

description: Boba in the Mission? I was skeptical, but won over by their honest tea and organic milk. Their Jasmine Milk Tea was amazing and their slow brewed Muscat Oolong was the best milk tea I've had -- even in Asia. Maybe in a sucker for loose leaf tea and organic milk.
author: Thomas C.

description: I ordered a hojicha milk tea with almond pudding. The hojicha had a really nice and strong tea taste! Paired with the almond pudding was a great choice and even though there was a line, it didn't take long to order and get my drink. Would definitely recommend! The only downside is that it's pretty pricey for the size, but I think it's worth the price.
author: Maddie W.

description: The bobas are hard and the flavors are average. It's not worth the hype. But cute cups.
author: Fernilla S.

description: There was a lot of hype for this place, which is probably what led me to be a little disappointed. Don't get me wrong, the tea was good, and so was the boba, but it wasn't anything super special. Then again, I'm a pretty hard core boba/tea critic being Taiwanese, but I would still recommend this place if you're in the area looking for a drink.
author: Keely H.

description:
First time I've seen "hong kong style" milk tea at a boba place before so I had to order it. The flavor is pretty spot on, but it was sweeter than I would like. I ordered it with almond jelly and it tasted sooo good. It was soft and full of flavor. I'll def be back and get it half as sweet.

I purchased the mason mug for $10. Total ripoff but I couldn't resist - its so cute!
author: Rosie W.

description: The matcha latte i had was way too milky.. Its like drinking straight up milk at home.. So sad :(
author: Kryzel C.

description: Every time when I m pop up on mission, here's my always must-go drink place. Good, maybe? Addicted, yes!!!! What was I fond for over here? Rose tea.
author: Ben C.

description:
Cute little boba shop in Mission, with funky tea flavors and many options for milk and add-ons. 

I got a Jasmine milk tea (without boba because I'm not that into it) - the tea was good but could be stronger. My friend got the hong kong style milk tea with grass jelly. While you can't go wrong with black tea and condensed milk, milk to grass jelly proportion was way off. He ended up with so much grass jelly after finishing off most of his milk tea.

I'll come for the friendly staff and chill atmosphere, but I didn't think the milk tea was worth the $4 we each paid. Definitely better options out there!
author: Julia N.

description: I feel like a hipster, but I have to admit that I do love Boba guys. Sure, it might not be the traditional kind of boba shop with kpop videos blasting and a billion different flavors straight outta Hong Kong, but it is a legitimate American take on it. I've tried so many different flavors here, and I have never been let down by neither the drinks themselves nor the tapioca. How many gentrifier points do I get if I say I like coming here for a drink before I head to Dolores Park? Try it.
author: Vilde E.

description:
Pricy! But pretty good!

This was my first time in their new location. It's pretty fancy and clean!

I got the Hong Kong style milk tea with pearls. It's definitely thicker and sweeter than normal PMT. I like it! Service is super fast as well. Pearls have the right amount of chewiness and you can really taste the tea.

If I had more time, I would try out the slow bar, as I've heard good things about it.
author: Michael W.

description: 4.00 for milk tea wtf. The place is definitely more expensive compared to the Asian places in the sunset and Richmond district. The shop is small and simple. The tea was very flavorful and had very strong tea taste. The boba was soft and chewy, the way I like it.
author: Jason L.

description:
I came here specifically for the horchata boba which is slightly different than the traditional horchata you would get at Taquerias.  

It's not very sweet nor heavy on the cinnamon, yet there is a distinctiveness to it.  I really like the sweetness and the consistency of the boba.  This is where many places fail but Boba Guys got this part down.  I must say though that this place is obviously caterering towards a certain crowd, and it's rather pricey for a regular sized cup.  $4.00 can easily get me 2 traditional milk tea drinks elsewhere but you obviously did not come in here for anything really authentic, did you?  If so, then you need to reconsider your options.  This is something different and sometimes, different is worth a try.

4 stars for the uniqueness.
author: Bernie C.

description:
After having been on our list since they opened their old location, we finally got to try this place! We stopped by while waiting for our table at Tacolicious just a block away. Their menu was very interesting, and had a great range of types of milk tea combinations from classic, Hong Kong style, to horchata. They also have different add-ins, such as grass jelly and almond jelly, as well as different milk options including almond and soy. There's also a "slow bar" where they offer hot brewed teas.

We ordered a soy milk tea with boba to share. There was just enough tea flavor and the boba had a good chew to them. The only negative was the syrup on the boba was a little too sweet, but it wasn't a huge deal.

This location is really just a small room that had a small counter with bar stools for about 4-5 people to sit, but there's a bench right outside the store for more seating. It's tucked away in a side street, and can be easily missed.

They also make uniquely-flavored cotton candy, as well as some Asian snacks. They've done a good job with the brand so far. I'm glad they have upgraded to their own storefront and hope they will continue to grow.
author: Vivian L.

description:
This low rating is more for the service than for the drinks. Boba Guys was one of my favorite spots for milk tea. I recently brought a friend here and was sorely disappointed. We ended up waiting almost an HOUR for two milk teas. The place was not crowded and after 40 minutes of waiting, we realized our orders probably got lost. We approached the guy making the drinks and he ignored us. :(

We ended up waiting in line again to check with the person at the register, she was more than helpful and apologetic. She checked on the ipad thing and saw that our order was marked off and asked the guy making the drinks. Again, the guy didn't seem to care and brushed her off. The girl ended up making our drinks and apologized for the mistake (this also meant no one was working the register). I appreciate the girl's effort to fix the mistake and felt bad that she had to deal with such a coworker. Boba Guys management: this girl and Boba Guys deserve better!

Unfortunately, especially because it was my friend's first time here, my experience was ruined. I don't plan on coming back here anytime soon. It's not worth +$4 for milk tea to have to deal with poor customer service. 

You can definitely find another place in the city with cheaper milk tea and better service.
author: Tina O.

description:
Delicious, and I love how they only use fresh ingredients. I had a jasmine green tea, which was amazing. The boba is just how I like it - a little more on the firm side, and quite sweet.

Only downside is that they don't have many flavors, because they won't use flavored powders. I hear they'll test out introducing some fruit milk teas, which I definitely want to drink!
author: Krista J.

description:
Their boba is totally awesome! The tea is flavorful and amazing and none of that powder stuff. The staff is really friendly and helpful as you're trying to decide between all the different options.

What's not to love?
author: Ti Z.

description: One of my favorite boba places to go to especially since it's closer to home for me. The tea is great and boba is very sweet. Order a matcha tea with boba and you're all set. Downsides are there's rarely ever parking since they're in a hot spot in the city, and their tea is on the more expensive side. Small place so don't get intimidated if there's a line outside. They generally put out drinks in a timely manner.
author: Dominic E.

description:
Hey Boba Guys, why do you have an anteater in your logo? Because you guys suck? Yeah that's what I figured.

Man, when it comes to boba I'm a very easy guy to please. Don't eff up the boba and over/under cook it and make sure the drink's sweet. But nope, that's exactly what DIDN'T happen.Ordered the Hong Kong milk tea, and wow it was utterly disappointing. No real tea flavor, not sweet, really just was like watered down tea like liquid with milk and the boba was really bad, like it was definitely undercooked, had a weird taste to it, and honestly I wanted to throw the drink away after first sip. I also got the horchata, which the cashier said was his favorite drink, especially with grass jelly added which I had ordered. Well I don't know how many horchatas they have tasted but that drink tasted nothing like an horchata. It was soooooo watery and the lack of sweetness made the grass jelly even more bland since it couldn't counter the non-existent sweetness of the horchata.

I heard this place served alcoholic boba drinks from someone or it might've been another place but this place definitely didn't have any alcoholic creations on the menu. I definitely won't be coming to this place again, take that and suck it up tasteless anteater!
author: Edison T.

description:
This place rocks! The tea is always delicious and it is so addictive. The only downsides are that the place seems to be a bit understaffed, leading to some orders taking a long time, and that they do not offer many different sizes of drinks.

Overall: totally recommend!
author: Ruth G.

description:
I checked out this place today with my friend, and I was particularly excited bc my friend from college, Bin, is one of the owners!  Bin/Boba Guys: the jasmine milk tea was delicious.  Very flavorful, perfect balance.  I also really enjoyed the actual boba, and the whole Boba Guys experience.

Also, it's the only boba you can drink out of a mason jar in the city. :-)  Definitely worth checking out!
author: Mel G.

description:
Although our friend took us here and this place supposedly makes bubble tea the "authentic way", I was personally not a fan of the bubble tea. I got the original Bubble Milk tea and found it more milky and taste-less than any other boba I've had.

This taste of boba may appeal to others, but it doesn't appeal to me. 

The atmosphere and ambience of the place is pretty cool and I wanted the place to have great boba, but...you can only lead a horse to water.
author: Lillian C.

description:
I guess I was predisposed to love this place, since I love boba and it's close-ish to my house. However, what sets Boba Guys above other experiences I have had is the exceptional cloud-like chewiness of the boba itself: a quality that speaks to its freshness.

I've had both stellar and pretty good bubble tea here. Recently, I found my perfect drink: it's hot jasmine milk tea with boba and half the sweetener. They brew the tea fresh for the hot one (I frequently find the iced one has too much milk / not enough tea), and getting it half-sweetened makes it just right. I also like that you can get soy or almond milk if you're inclined.

Yes, the lines can be long. But to me, they're worth it. The staff is efficient and friendly, and I crave that velvety boba All. The. Time.
author: Chelsea M.

description:
I LOVEE boba guys! Definitely the best boba shop in San Francisco and one of the best boba places in the Bay Area!

$4.00 for most of their teas + one topping ( tapioca, almond pudding, or grass jelly).

I usually get the classic milk tea with tapioca (w/ 25% sweet). They brew the tea with real tea leaves, use Straus organic milk, grade A boba (always cooked perfectly), and homemade pudding and grass jelly! In my opinion, Boba Guys has the highest quality boba in SF. I am definitely willing to pay a little more for boba made with honest and trustworthy ingredients.

The store right by 19th St & Valencia street where there are interesting thrift stores to check out and upscale and hip restaurants to try out. On a sunny day, you could grab some boba and make your way to Dolores park (a few blocks away)! Perfect.

The store is very small, there are only about 4 seats in the store. The staff is friendly and they really care about making sure your drink is made exactly to your liking - You can customize your drink (sweetness, more tea/less milk, almond or soy milk, etc)!


Tip: If you're taking BART to the 16th Street Mission stop, my suggestion is that you walk down Valencia St. instead of Mission St. to 19th St.  Mission St. is a bit sketchy, while Valencia St. is very nice. When you first walk out of the BART station, it maybe a little scary, but don't worry... just walk to Valencia St.!
author: Monica T.

description: Excellent boba teas made from loose leaf tea. Good ingredients and clean flavors, nothing tasted like a packet. There is usually a line of Mission hipsters out the door, but it moves along at a good pace. Minus one star for pretending to not have a bathroom for customers.
author: Ben G.

description:
Boba Guys is like my Ten Ren away from home! Surprised I made it all the way into the mission and back during a thought to be heavier lunch hour. Kudos for scoring street meter packing right out front.

The shop was empty, so service and boba turn around time was quite speedy for the only patron on site. I had the classic milk tea with boba, which was unexpectedly strong and delicious. It contained just the right balance between tea and milk, none of that artificial Quickly/Tap X shit here. Even after the ice had melted, there was still a distinct tea taste as opposed to it just being diluted. I didn't really finish my drink until early evening, which led to the result of my caffine induced insomnia for the night. 

I havn't had the chance to compare it to the pop up shop version over at Ken Ken Ramen, which many are saying are drastically better. This location didn't appear to have the alcoholic drink versions on the menu either. Maybe an update once I can sample the others? Definitely want to come back for the sugar spun cotton candy as the flavors seem intriguing. Slow bar menu as well, when there's sufficient time to wait for the brew.
author: Julia C.

description: I got the matcha mixed horchata which sounded very interesting. I added their homemade grass jelly because I'm a huge grass jelly fanatic. That wonderful creamy silky grass jelly. When it came, there was a gorgeous layer of green and a bottom layer of white horchata, looked insta-worthy. When I had my first sip, it was noticeably watery. Minus a point, then I ate the grass jelly. It was extremely chewy and bouncy, the texture was all off. There were a lot of holes and air bubbles in their grass jelly, creating a not very silky creamy texture. I was left speechless. Weirdest grass jelly ever.
author: Gwendolyn F.

description:
I have to admit...I was super skeptical of this place.  Call me biased, but when I scoped the decor, it looked nothing like any traditionally cultish boba place I've been to countless times.  

I gotta say...SUPER surprised.  Their boba is spot-on, and their milk teas are excellent and pretty authentic tasting.  I think this might be the first place that I've found in the Bay Area (sorry, Purple Kow and Fantasia...not happening) that can stand up strong to Half & Half down south (circa before their wild expansion totally messed up their overall quality and excellence). 

Have high hopes for this place...keep it up!
author: Frederick L.

description: Love their Hong Kong style milk tea so much!!! But really hard to find parking there.
author: Harmony Y.

description:
Thank you for opening quality boba place outside of the Richmond/Sunset! (I don't mind going all the way to Irving for my fix, but still.) 

The thing that sets Boba Guys apart from the competition is their transparency. In typical tea rooms, you give your order to the cashier, they disappear behind a wall to make it and then quickly come back with a colorful cup of deliciousness. Here, the boba-ristas are on full display as they prepare your drink on the slow bar. You get to see what exactly is going into your drink and how they make it. I appreciate their conscious effort to step up the quality game - with a palate well-trained on the sweet, powder stuff, it's refreshing (literally) to try something different.
author: Auburn S.

description: The tea is okay. The bubbles are pretty good. My friend really didn't enjoy the grass jelly. In short -- not amazing, just okay.
author: Mark C.

description:
I think the milk teas with boba are excellent here!  

I have tried either a jasmine milk tea or green milk tea with boba at several places around the Bay Area.  I have to say, this one is my favorite so far.  

Something about the Strauss Family Dairy milk made the drink so creamy.  The tea was high quality and had good flavor and the boba had perfect texture and flavor.  The staff was very nice.    For the quality, the price was consistent with the other  higher quality places I have been to.  

I think I might ask for mine a little less sweet the next time, but otherwise, I thought this was the prefect milk tea.  I am looking forward to my next trip to Boba Guys.
author: Suzie Y.

description:
I went here on Sunday (during half time Niners vs. Packers game). They had the chocolate and strawberry boba special that day. 

Hong Kong Style Milk Tea ($4.00): my friend liked it, not a lot of places make milk tea with condense milk so this was a plus. 

Chocolate and strawberry -special ($5.00): Hrm.... this was a weird combination for a milk tea drink, my friend didn't like it, but if you drink if for a while, you kinda get used to it. The tea used was very very light (as if they reused the tea from a previous cup). 

Don't expect these drinks to be flavorful, it is light and refreshing. The tea was very very light. If you are craving an actual boba drink full of creamy richness, don't come here.
author: Erica T.

description:
HK Style Milk Tea - every time when I drink this, it reminds me of HK (duh, the name says it all)! The thing is a lot of restaurants attempt to make the HK Milk Tea but most failed. This is by far one of the best one.

Green Tea Latte - another highly recommendation. It's almost like the Starbucks green tea latte but with boba! Try it with the coffee jelly, equally delicious!

Classic Milk Tea - not my favorite.
author: Hunter S.

description: Finally checked out this place. Since they don't have BG in SJ I decided to visit it with two of my friends during this winterbreak's SF trip. The boba tasted really fresh (no powders/syrups I guess) and it was nice and light! The prices are a little more expensive for normal sized cups, but I'd expect it because of all the organic products BG uses. The inside of BG looks pretty nice, (and hipster!) and I love how they incorporated the science-y theme into everything. The place however, is a bit small, and in an awkward location. Getting through mission itself was a little scary, (especially for high school girls during the late afternoon) but the trek was worth it! Nice location near Clarion Alley as well! Quick service and good drinks. Don't know if I'd go out of my way to visit BG though. I had the lychee green tea, and my friends had the classic milk tea. They all said it tasted pretty bueno.
author: Bonnie T.

description: The employees are always nice and welcoming when we visit. I always get Jasmine milk tea, 75%, with almond milk and boba and they always make it perfect! My boyfriend always tries whatever he feels like and he always enjoys his drink. Overall consistent store with nice employees :)
author: Chi Bao N.

description:
Not bad, a bit pricy for boba. But you can tell the quality since most are brewed right in front of you.

Since almost everything is brewed fresh it'll take longer for you to get your drink, so longer lines.

Overall quality is good. I got the Hong Kong milk tea which was good. I would recommend trying the almond jelly! It's created fresh in house, but you can't get it with any hot drinks though.
author: Ben N.

description:
Taste-wise, the classic milk tea with boba is good.  Not the best ever, but the tapioca balls were soft and chewy and the tea wasn't too bitter or too sweet.  

It's also nice to know what ingredients actually went into your drink, instead of watching workers scooping mystery powder into your cup (okay, probably just milk powder, but still.)  

$4.  Not cheap. But look at the location.  I just bought like an ounce of chocolate covered almonds for $8.5 from Dandelion Chocolate.  Store owners have to pay rent somehow.
author: Candice B.

description:
Looking for quality Boba and a team that cares about the product and consumer experience? Step right up to Boba guys. Quality tea is quite a treat and the boba is consistent. Used to be all about straight up milk tea only but the jasmine milk tea is growing on me...

Not quite the place if you're looking for powder or ginormous portions. But highly recommend checking out if you want to taste the four barrel/ blue bottle equivalent of boba tea.
author: Jay K.

description:
We stopped by after a spicy meal at Mission Chinese, and they were surprised we found them (thanks Yelp!) because it was only their second day open.

They offered 3 flavours:  regular milk tea, soy milk tea, and the special of the day horchata flavour.  $4 flat.  Oh my GOD the horchata was da bomb.  It was perfectly milky and cinnamony, and the texture of the pearls was the best in recent memory.  I really liked the plain milk tea too.  The guys were super chill and friendly.  Definitely coming back if I'm in the mood for boba.
author: Letitia L.

description:
Been coming here for a while now and thought I'd finally write my review. 

Pros: 
-Teas are good. They actually use "real" milk w/o all the hormones and taste very fresh! No artificial creamers!!! 
-Boba is different than most places I've tried but not bad. 
-Horchata was my fave as well as my daughters. 

Cons:
-Every single counter girl we've come across seems miserable. I've been here a few times and it's never a pleasant experience. They never smile or greet you. It's as if I'm burdening them with my order.  

However, the owners, whom I follow on twitter do seem very friendly but they definitely need to retrain/hire more customer friendly servers.
author: lynn a.

description: The first time I came here, the tea quality was pretty bad, and the waits were super long. Because of a friend, I gave them a second chance, and they did impress. Jasmine milk tea, on point. Hong Kong style, could be better, but tastes like it does in most American places. Waits are pretty quick for your drink when there's no line, and the prices aren't terrible (in between $3-4). You'll have to go through hipster land to get here, so buyer beware.
author: Danny C.

description: I don't really get it. We've been here twice, and the pearls aren't that great, and the milk teas always taste funny. And there's always a line out the door. What am I missing here?
author: Vivian H.

description:
Delicious tea, just perfectly sweet, and perfectly QQ boba! A bit on the pricey side...so I won't be going there too often, but the quality is worth it. This place also offers homemade cotton candy! Delicious flavors like li-hing pineapple. I sampled the cotton candy and was pleasantly surprised by how delicate the candy melted in my mouth. 
A fun find on my walk home.
author: K R.

description: Unlike their newer location, I always have a good experience at this one. Lately I've been branching out from their classic drinks and trying their frescas and other tea flavors, and every time I've received high-quality taste, not too sweet with perfect amount of chewiness in their tapioca. Service is friendly too!
author: Hannah P.

description:
Awesome is all I can say. Of all the Boba places in S.F., this is now my go to place! 
Mmmm horchata goodness.
author: Alley S.

description: I took my mom and cousin here. The prices are pretty reasonable but the quality is SO high. I got the HK milk tea boba and it was almost spot on for HKMT. I only wish they had more locations because they are only in Union Square or the Mission but I highly recommend this place!
author: Fabian M.

description:
I saw this place while I walking to Dolores Park and two things caught my attention:

1) Boba place in the mission?
2) Horchata boba? 

I was caught off guard by this place but nonetheless, I decided to try this bad boy.

Location
This place is in the mission - right around the corner of Tacolicious, Vestry, and other great food places. However, be ready for a crazy long line - its a small place so the line is out the door. Be ready to invest a minimum of 15 mins.

Service
Nice and friendly staff. All smiles and business. They really try to get you in and out.

The Drink
I love all things boba. It is my little dirty secret - so when I saw that they had an horcata boba - yes please! The horchata flavor was incredible and the tea base was right on target. The boba was definitely the best part of the drink - not too soft and not hard - just right. 

The only reason why I dock this place one star is because the wait is not justified by the taste. Good place to try but not a place I will go all the time.
author: Pablo P.

description: Updating my rating to 4 stars. After my disappointing initial experience, the owners actually reached out to apologize and offer me a "make good" drink on them so I could try it again. I actually did take advantage of it one day, ordering the golden honey black tea. I was pleasantly surprised. Not only was the cashier (a guy this time) much more friendly, but the drink was much better--it was not half filled with ice, requesting light sweet actually resulted in a light sweet drink, the boba texture was also much more consistent.
author: Chris L.

description:
i grew up in Taiwan in the city where bubble tea is created. So I always consider myself as an expert of bubble tea. Frankly, no bubble tea shops near San Francisco qualify my standard, but Boba guys is quite close to my standard.

I went to boba guys last night after eating at ken-ken and the guy made a fresh batch of tea right there. He's very passionate and I could see they use absolutely the best ingredients. Tea is pretty decent, but what I loved was their "bubbles" (aka pearls or boba, whatever you call them). They were freshly cooked and really tasty. I was very satisfied.
author: Wendy K.

description:
Upscale boba tea....you just knew it had to happen sometime.  And where else was it going to happen but the San Francisco Mission...duh!

This is good high-quality boba tea.  The tea tastes like...wait for it...tea!  Believe it or not, this is actually a novelty.  I've had plenty of boba tea where there putting some weird coffee creamer powder in instead of actual milk.  The boba pearls are actually quite nice, neither gummy nor overly sweet.

It's a little weird when you order..they ask you to specify a sweetness percentage.  I think I blindly chose 50%.  Alas the proprietors are not so good at math, as I have no idea what number this is a percentage of?  50% of 3 teaspoons of sugar?  20 grams?  2 pounds?  It tasted fine in the end.

It's trendy, it's hipster, it's more expensive than normal boba tea, there will be a line.  I think I can't really give any boba place 5 stars, but this place is pretty tasty.
author: Ian P.

description:
You know boba is cool if you can find boba in the Mission. It's pretty hip here with the mascot and the simplicity of Pottery Barn decor. They're even pretty fresh with the unique drinks on their small menu such as the Horchata milk tea or the Hong Kong style milk tea. Cheers to the special touches that makes this place a little different than the rest. 

In terms of the flavor of the drink and the quality of the boba, it's a little lack luster. Good for where you really really want some chewy asian goodness (oh hayy) in the Mission and don't feel like heading west for the better drinks and you don't mind shelling $4 for something that could easily be $2.50. Would recommend the flavors that they don't have anywhere else, like horchata, but if you were thinking of getting that milk tea, i think you're better off elsewhere. The almond jelly though is pretty good.

Wouldn't recommend this place as a first, or second choice, but good if you happen to be in the area and want that craving of milk tea and boba to be filled.
author: Kristine T.

description: I don't get the hype either but it's okay I guess. I'm so used to going to Tpumps or the cheaper places so when I saw the price for the amount I just wasn't used to it. The horchata tea was actually pretty good but I wouldn't go oftenly. At least there's a decent boba place in the mission.
author: Sul L.

description:
Okay, I have got a soft spot for boba and these guys put a lot of care into what they do.

Sometimes my tea will take a while, sometimes they are out of the flavor I want, but truly the worst times are when they run out of boba, which I think should never take place, but... hey, taking all of this into consideration, I still love these spot, and I still give it five stars. Why? Well, grace...but mostly Love. 

There is also the exciting element of the special, limited, and exclusive flavor options that change daily. There are even seasonal options, like pumpkin chai-- which was awesome!!! 

Since I live right down the street I value the convenience, but I come back for friendly, bright, and fresh atmosphere; and the awesome flavors that are sweetened to perfection-- never too sweet- that is so important!
author: Stephie M.

description: It was ok, I like the style of the place and the guy working it was cool, but kind of pricey and I wasn't too impressed overall despite the fact that they had a few interesting tea choices.
author: Christopher Steven O.

description: Never thought I would be a boba tea connoisseur, but this is the best boba tea I've ever had.  Their tea selection is delicious, the tapioca is always fresh and delicious.  I remember raising an eyebrow when my husband told me this was "the best", but I have to agree.  We'll make special trips down here on the weekend.  There's usually a line and parking is tough because, well, it's the mission, but worth it if you need your boba fix.
author: Jessica A.

description: The boba was perfectly chewy and soft. The workers are super fast and I got my drink like 1-2 minutes after I ordered it. The drink was good but not amazing. But overall, this is a nice place to get milk tea! :)
author: Janet T.

description:
I know, I know...5 stars, deal with it.

Boba Guys is trying to do something new with Boba that will actually help the longevity of the people in San Francisco -- high quality ingredients.  While they may charge a premium, you won't get cancer from the tapioca balls or the other great add ons they make (+1 for Almond Jelly). Keep in mind that the freshness might taste a bit different than the powdered stuff you're used to having (i.e. powered milk, artificial flavoring, etc)...but get used to it because it's way better. The owners are always very welcoming and it makes you just wanna come back for seconds and thirds in that same day. Seating is way better in their new location on 19th and Valencia, though you could just order to go and sit at Dolores park on a less foggy day.  

I highly recommend Boba Guys for your boba tea craving in the mission. It's not only the best choice around...but it's pretty much the best quality milk tea you'll ever have.

Typical Order: 
1. Regular Milk Tea - Almond Jelly
  - This is a classic and MUST try for a first timer.
2. Jasmine Milk Tea - Almond Jelly
  - If you're feeling more festive, go for this drink as it will be more tea for your buck.
author: Anthony S.

description:
After enjoying dinner at a near by restaurant. We decided to take a stroll for some organic/upscale boba. 

I love the freshly brewed tea and that they use organic cream. Furthermore, the store front has a rustic/modern touch. The cashier wrap and counter top is open for viewing - you can watch them make your drink. They also have little snacks available for purchase (French macarons, Pineapple cakes, etc.)

We ordered:

- Classic Milk Tea
- Musket Oolong
- Hong Kong Milk Tea

Their tapioca (boba) has a nice consistency to it. - its not to sweet or to mushy.
author: Kristina S.

description:
I've been waiting to try this place for a while. All our friends and coworkers keep raving about this place and how it's gotten bubble tea down to a science! 

I didn't believe it, especially since I'm from Toronto (where BBT is everywhere) and have gone back to Taiwan to try the original  BBT. 

Well, I stand corrected. This place has awesome bubble tea. We ordered their signature Jasmine Tea with Tapioca. It tea was so flavorful, and milky. The tapioca was a perfect consistency - not to hard or chewy. The price was reasonable as well.

Two complaints, it takes soooooo long to get one cup of bubble tea. Yes. They warn you about it, but it's not fun standing inside the small shop packed like sardines... watching the team slowly brew and stir each cup (especially on hot days). The woman taking the order was a bit unconventional. She would write your order down.. Then punch it into the iPad .. How odd and inefficient. 

Would definitely go back
author: Winny F.

description: Amazing! I'm officially hooked on boba tea. So far, all their boba teas have been delightful. I hope to be never disappointed :)!
author: Marcia M.

description:
I am now addicted to milk teas and boba!  Today I tried the almond jelly in the milk tea and that was yummy too.  These guys are the first boba teas I have had that are really good...not like that other generic brand that's everywhere.
And they have this gourmet "adult" cotton candy.  Umm. Yumm.
author: Avi S.

description:
I was recommended by a friend to try this boba place in the mission. We ordered the jasmine milk tea and the Hong Kong style milk tea. The jasmine milk tea lacked any tea flavor and tasted mainly like milk but the  HK style was perfect with added condensed milk for a thicker drink. 

In general, the milk tea is good. They don't add a lot of ice and they have a decent amount of boba. The pearls are chewy and fresh and all ingredients here are organic!  

Downside is the higher price ($4) for only 16 oz. and there are no large sizes available. 

Definitely recommended if you want boba in the mission. Better than Quickly.
author: Robert T.

description:
I am not a boba connoisseur, but in my opinion this place by far has the best actual boba I've ever had - it's cooked to the perfect consistency, not overcooked/soggy or undercooked/chalky, but juuusttt rigggght. Disregarding all the other aspects of the drink, the boba itself is pretty top notch.

I ordered the horchata milk tea w/ boba, which was really tasty - not too sweet, but just right. My friends ordered the hong kong milk tea and jasmine milk tea and those both tasted good too, but I really liked my horchata drink.

Boba lovers: definitely check this place out!
author: Jasmine A.

description:
I don't really get the hype about this place. I came &tried the milk tea with boba &although it's refreshing, it's not really worth the $4 for a small cup. 

Sucks they don't have the mason jars either!

But their actual boba is pretty good. It had the right texture &sweetness.

And they sell sugar spun cotton candy! They had cookie butter flavor &it was delicious!!
author: Sabrina S.

description:
Note to self:

There is parking @4PM on Thursdays
There was no line @4PM
Coffee milk tea is best
Get 50% sweetness because regular sweetness makes me all jittery
The boba is good.

will be back if ever in the area (y)
author: Arthur L.

description: I'm a big fan of this place after only coming here once! The person taking the orders was the nicest guy and he loved to talk! He offered us samples of a new drink they were going to come out with soon and it was absolutely delicious! I ordered the lychee green tea from the slow bar and even though it took a while, it was still pretty yummy! I can't wait to come back here the next time I head to the city!
author: Cynthia L.

description:
There are plenty of boba places throughout the city, but Boba Guys is the shop I frequent the most.
