They have tripled their menu items since expanding out of their Ken Ken Ramen location, and every new addition is new and exciting.  Boba Guys have several of the classics like black milk tea and jasmine milk tea, but have also added horchata, matcha, Thai, and HK style to the mix.  Several of the toppings that were originally experimental have made the move to the regular menu as well.  If you're a bit tired from drinking boba, try switching in to their almond jelly!

Boba Guys are also offering macarons and cupcakes here too.  They have unique flavors like sesame and mango.

My favorite part of the new shop would have to be the slow bar, where the baristas brew your tea to order.  They have spent hours honing the perfect time and temperature for each type of tea in order to make some of the tastiest and unique tea blends I've had.  The slow bar menu changes here and there, but teas to try include lychee green and golden honey black.

My go-to: Muscat oolong with almond jelly, and a pandan macaron.

The shop is pretty small though, so if you want a place to sit down, try their Ken Ken Ramen location on 18th and Mission instead.  They also serve alcoholic boba there too.
author: Andrew Y.

description:
I've read so many good reviews about this place... So I went there right away when I was near by... And I was really disappointed. 
I ordered coconut green milk tea with boba (5$ is SO EXPENSIVE). I was waiting about 10 min and when I finally got it I had small plastic glass with green tea and milk (I didn't find any coconut there at all). And it was not sweet at all.. I asked her made it more sweet... She added more syrup, but still not sweet... I was there for a long time so I just went away. 
Boba... Yes... It was nice and tasty.
But not tea and not for 5$....
author: Anastasia G.

description:
Man, this place seriously gets all kinds of reviews. I don't know if this means certain milk teas are better, but here was my experience:

I ordered the Hong Kong Milk Tea, which is just regular milk tea with condensed milk instead. The order came out fairly quickly, but I was a little disappointed with the result. 

1. I'm sorry, but I really really dislike the boba here. I found them to be too hard and they had a really odd sour taste.
2. This may be biased because of point 1, but I think they put way too much boba in the cup.
3. The milk tea flavour was off too. Slightly watery, and it just doesn't have that guilt-inducing delicious taste like the milk tea at HK cafes. I think they still need to work on their milk/tea/sugar ratios.

Though their other milk teas might be better, the boba is enough to turn me off from this place. Until they have pudding, I don't think I'll be back.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
The strange mascot at the front of store lead me to believe this was a boutique shop, but another step closer and I found out this place sells one of my favorite drinks, milk tea. The entrance is quite small and only has enough room for a few bar seats near the window which was unforuntely taken by a bunch of yuppies while visited.

At 4 bucks for the average drink, this isn't a place that you can call cheap milk tea, but for a place that seems to still be getting it feet on the Mission/Valencia market, I can't really blame them. It's worth a shot!

If you've ever had milk tea from chain stores around San Francisco like Quickly or Teaway, this taste much different as they use real bitter tea and milk rather than powder. It's more like a cold version of a Hong Kong Style Milk Tea at Chinese cafes, but a bit more sweet. Not really my style and it sure caught me off guard. I can say that the tapioca pearls were really good. Wish they sold them by the bag!

Apparently, they're opening a milk tea lab at Union Square soon and even has a Kickstarter for it. Although I don't think my minimal contribution in terms of my 4 bucks will be even close to denting the amount they need, I'd like to give these guys a shout out because the concept of opening something like this sounds pretty unique. Good luck, Boba Guys!
author: George Z.

description: After trying to visit Boba Guys last summer at its set-up on 18th St. and learning that they were temporarily closed, I was excited about their reopening and additional opening of an actual storefront on 19th St. I tried the classic milk tea with boba and almond jelly. I also tried the horchata milk tea. Boba was perfect - fresh, chewy and each ball had a smooth surface. The almond jelly could have had more almond flavor. The milk tea had good balance, and the horchata was also good but it could have been sweeter. Service was courteous enough and it wasn't busy at all during lunch time on the Saturday I dropped by. Boba Guys definitely uses quality ingredients and you can smell it when entering the store (smells like real brewed tea and sweet milk). The $4 price tag is a bit hefty when considering that you can get comparable boba drinks that are a bit cheaper and come in a larger cup. I like the idea of the slow bar and wouldn't mind coming back to try their macarons.
author: Maya S.

description:
Lovelovelove. Their Jasmine Milk Tea (*order "extra strong" if you want more tea flavor) is amazing. 

The only comment I have is that any drink with substituted with soymilk is not worth it. It just doesn't taste the same. It's very bland. 

It's disappointing since I'm lactose intolerant, but the original Jasmine Milk Tea is so good that I'm willing to suffer through the tummy ache.
author: Mickaela R.

description:
I'm not a boba expert, but I am far from being a boba neophyte.  Being from LA, my experiences with boba are limited to lollicup, unless I trek out to the SGV.  

That said, I found Boba Guys to be a breath of fresh air with their boba.  With an interesting space, great service, and more than quality boba, I'll make it a go to spot whenever I'm in the bay.  I recommend the classic milk tea or hong kong milk tea.  

Completely recommended.  However, I do agree parking is a bit hard.  Worth a visit, though.
author: Joshua V.

description:
High-quality boba milk tea! The best you can ask for. 

This is not the artificially-flavored unhealthy and disgusting kind of bubble tea that gives boba a bad rep. They use real tea leaves, real milk (instead of powdered cream), and tapioca cooked to the right consistency. Even the popular bubble tea places in SF asian land AKA inner sunset, joints such as TeaWay still use flavored powder in most of their products.

Trust me, I know what I'm talking about. After all, I'm from Taiwan, where bubble tea was invented! 

My favorite kind of mix for bubble on a cold winter day (like right now) is: hot tea from the slow bar (I tried rose tea) + milk + tapioca. No sugar. The tapioca is already coated with sugar and that's enough sweetness for me. 

The first time I came here it was about to close and I got the jasmine milk tea w/ boba. The tapioca was very hard. I suspected it had something to do with the fact it was at the end of day and having cooked tapioca myself I knew that it could've just been a bad batch. So I came back and gave it a second try. Just as I thought, this time the boba was soft and chewy, just right!

Pro: 
 --- real, high-quality tea
 --- real milk
 --- good boba consistency
 --- reasonable pricing ($4-$5)
 
(Not really) Con:
  --- shop is small and doesn't have much space
  --- in the mission, so don't expect to be able to park

This is from now on my goto place for bubble tea!
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
My favorite bubba tea place in the whole bay are! 

Why?: please check their website and you will know about quality and promise.
http://www.bobaguys.com/nextlevelquality/

Unlike most places, this guys use premium quality tea, milk (straus organic milk) and their pearl aka buba are really tastly. Try their any tea, my favorite is lychee green tea. 

Most other places add powders, artificial syrups, and God know what. If you taste bud for detecting real stuff than you will enjoy this one!
author: R P.

description:
Pros: At any boba/pearl spot, I always go for the regular Boba Milk Tea. I definitely enjoyed the boba as it was perfectly sweet and chewy.
Cons: I felt that the milk tea was just average compared to other boba spots that I visited. This place was also a tad pricey than other boba folks.
Overall: You can do worse when grabbing a boba/pearl drink while visiting SF.
author: Edward P.

description: It's not a place to hang out with friends. It's a place where you take your drink to go. The place is really small and had a line out the door. I ordered the Iced Matcha Latte with boba. The drink had the right amount of sweetness, but it tasted like seaweed. I read that green tea can taste like that; however I didn't care for it. The boba on the other hand had a great soft and chewy consistency. Sugar and Spun cotton candy is also sold here, but they didn't have the flavors I wanted to get.
author: Helen H.

description: YO THIS PLACE IS PDG. I GOT THE LITCHI AND IT WAS REALLY SWEET WHICH WAS LIKE EH BUT IF YOURE INTO THAT THEN HECK YEAH U GO MAN. A+. Good service, knowledgeable staff. The man I talked to could probably tell you the history of every food ever. My friend got classic milk tea and said it was too sweet for her taste and my other friend got a strawberry Fresca boba thing with a side of the guy telling us how exactly the drink is made. Anyways weird location but yeah it was good, worth a try especially if you like your boba sweet
author: Katie S.

description:
It puzzles me to see that some of my friends have given good ratings to this place because that means they actually approve of the drinks here. Don't get me wrong, there's definitely potential to be the best boba in California, but they're not even close yet.

I mean, I love the name, I love the mission of the company, the guys who started it seem super awesome, and I love reading their good.is blog posts about their business (great marketing idea btw! That's actually how I found out about them). 

But alas, my Yelp reviews do not give these things much weight; the majority of my stars reflect the quality, taste, and overall experience.

Why 2 stars?
It's not about the price (I gladly pay $4 at Fantasia, Tea Station, Tea Era, Ten Ren, and Half & Half for quality boba), it's not about the lack of their own space (they are a bar that is part of this ramen shop), and it's not even about their location or lack of parking.

These are my gripes (and it's been a few weeks since I've been, so I may be forgetting a lot of things):
- very limited menu (I'm sure this is probably something that will expand and improve with time)
- very very limited hours, like 3 hours a day from Thurs-Sat only (so you can't go Sun-Wed...this is probably also something that will improve over time)
- currently, they only serve fresh boba on Saturday from 12-4 PM (they only serve fresh almond jelly the 3 nights they're open)
- way too much ice in the cup, and the tea seems watery already. Instead of a very flavorful tea balanced with milk, it tastes like the 99 cent watery milk tea from Quickly's

To like:
- a very different boba establishment - high quality ingredients, but different high quality than Fantasia and Tea Station
- you drink out of a mason jar!
- they have an aardvark logo!
- they're TAIWANESE! (pride!)

I hope things improve a lot and I can change my rating someday. It's quite inconvenient for me to come here, but I'll definitely give them another chance. This place has such great potential and I know the Boba Guys would not disappoint our Taiwanese staple. :)
author: Esther Y.

description:
If you ever been to China or Hong Kong, you know Boba Guys' milk tea is too water down. I have tried their Jasmine Milk Tea, Classic Milk Tea, and this time I ordered HK style Milk Tea. The milk is ok, but the tea is just not strong enough leaving no after taste whatsoever. And for $4, I expect much more. Way to go Boba Guys!

Update: The owner PM about my experience and asked me for another chance. I gladly took it, and surprised the drink is on the house. Anyway, this time again I ordered HK style milk tea and they did make my drink base on my preference. (You can choose your sweetness/how strong the tea/milk.) The drink was OK, nothing spectacular to be honest.
author: Kenny O.

description: I can't believe the lines. It's intense but it makes me laugh out loud every time. They're that good. No boba shop draws lines but these guys. Creative and classic flavors, the drinks are totally THAT good. Plus there's a super nice Asian guy who occasionally works the register. The nicest! Love this place. And him!
author: H C.

description: I got the horchata and it tasted like milk. Why did I wait thirty minutes and pay $5 for a drink that tastes like milk
author: Tiger N.

description: A very small tea shop locate at Mission. It's very modern and chic. The menu is very small but the quality is great. You can definitely taste the quality of the tea and the pearls are pretty good. I would recommend the Jasmine Milk Tea (it taste and smell beautiful) and Hong Kong Milk Tea (it's a sweeter side with a little kick)
author: Tuyen T.

description:
This place is exactly what San Francisco needed, a great specialty tea shop! There is nothing else like this in this city, and the next best thing doesn't even compare. The place is modern and clean, the staff is super nice, and if your lucky you might even get a chance to meet the Boba Guys themselves! You can tell that everything was very thought out and there is a lot of time, commitment and passion that goes into their tea and all products. Not to mention, their boba (balls as I like to call them) is fantastic - perfect taste and texture. 

If you're in the mission I would definitely recommend making a stop at this place. You will NOT be disappointed!
author: Kasey J.

description: Their original milk tea is my favorite bubble tea in SF. The soy version was not good (and I am used to soy flavor, so that wasn't the problem), so I just stick to the original and am very happy. It's also inside a great Japanese restaurant with a unique authentic Japanese brunch if you've got the time!
author: Shelby S.

description:
the grass jelly was not impressive. they were stingy on the boba. with all the cool decor, etc. I expected better.

with the anteater logo - that makes their boba ants?

hipster takes on boba and does it poorly. go to real boba like tapioca express.

the dripping a/c right where everyone has to come/go was not a good thing. and the fact that their t-shirts had smeared ??? on it. Put on your lab coats! rather than use them as decor.
author: Sophia Y.

description:
Boba guys is my go-to boba stop! They have hot boba, which many places don't offer and they always offer to tailor the sweetness, I like my tea more bitter. They also have the most flavorful boba I have ever had!

They are also always friendly and have become a wonderful new addition to our neighborhood!
author: Allegra M.

description:
This place is trying to be a hip and cool boba tea place.  Instead it's slooooooow and mediocre.

They seem to brew each glass of tea individually, which is totally unnecessary and makes the process extremely slow.  When we were there, there were less than a dozen people waiting, yet it took more than 25 minutes to get our teas.  They were out of boba (tapioca) and grass jelly, the only add-in they had was almond jelly (which wasn't bad.)

They carefully measure things using science-lab-style beakers.  Again, unnecessary and slooooow.  This is not rocket science (or any other kind of science, for that matter.)  The owners need to visit Taiwan, where bubble tea is a way of life, and see how to run an efficient operation that doesn't make people wait half an hour in their sweltering shop (which lacks even a modicum of ventilation.)

I had the jasmine milk tea, which was okay, nothing special.  It was a hot day but my drink contained no ice, it probably melted during the ultra-slow preparation.  So it was getting warm before it was half gone.  It was drinkable, thus the two stars.

I get that you're trying to be boba tea for hipsters or something, but the individual brewing and slow service does not make a better product, just a slower one.  You're going to be hurting once everyone has tried you out, because nobody is going to come back a second time.
author: David T.

description:
PROS
Unique Boba Flavors
Cute interior 

CONS
Unfriendly
Tummy ache

When I first arrived to SF I knew I had to try Boba Guys. Too bad the service was lacking. Happy to take your money, but that's it, no smile, no "thank you" nothing. So don't expect much unless you are clearly a friend or a regular.

I should add that I had a mean stomach ache after consuming Boba Guys boba. Oh how I miss the boba from back home. Such a disappointment. But great branding!
author: R. D.

description: Probably (most definitely) the most expensive bubble tea I've ever had.  Love the clean little white shop with nice staff, but that doesn't make up for the overpriced and watery milk tea. The almond jelly (aka almond tofu) tasted as homemade as they claimed, and not out-of-a-box.  But the almond jelly was too sweet and not quite firm enough.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I was pretty excited when I saw that they had a "hong kong styled milk tea." If you've had an authentic hk style milk tea before, then you would know that it is extremely rich in flavor, almost to the point of bitterness. Maybe I was too naive in thinking that would be served at a place that caters to such a different demographic.

Anyhow. The owner/cashier guy was very friendly. Props to him for that. The design and decor of the place was cool - it seems like a hip place to stand around. The hk milk tea, however, tastes nothing like a real hk milk tea. Even when I asked for "more tea", it did nothing to really enrich the flavor. I suppose I could have asked the barista to add more milk, but he seemed too busy at the time.

Also props for not giving me a cup full of ice.
author: Julie C.

description:
Boba guys is incredible!!  
I have been drinking milk tea for years from a variety of places, but this one is by far the best!  Fifteen minutes after it opened, the line was already out the door, but it moves fast.
I got the Hong Kong Style Milk Tea with the almond jelly, and my boyfriend got the horchata with pearls.  Both were wonderful.
This milk tea is the most creamy, delicious tea I have ever had.  It tastes extremely fresh and natural, no hidden sugars or powders.  The only thing I would change is ask for less ice next time.
The almond jelly was super light flavored, not overpowering of the tea, and was delicious as well.
If you are a fan of boba, you will not regret trying this place!
author: Rachel O.

description:
So today was the first day of school and I just got out. I saw a post from a friend and wanted to try it. Store was kinda small but I wasn't staying so I didn't mind. The cashier was friendly and asked about my first day of school. 
     I ordered a simple drink, a 16 oz. coffee milk tea with boba with regular sweetness. It was $4 which was a bit much because I know a few places that offer 24 and 32 oz bubble tea drinks for the same price. Before I finish my thoughts about the price, my drink was done. I was suprised it took less than 45 seconds, considering there was two people ahead of me. it was a bit bitter but I'm used to super sweet and sugar filled drinks so I guess it wasn't bad. 
     The boba had a good texture and chewiness. But it was a bit clumped as I got towards the middle, so I had 3 boba-less sips and then as I moved my straw, I got like 10 tapiocas at once. Also, there was a lot of boba towards the end but that may have been because it was clumped. 
     Overall, the boba was good, drink was not bad but it's a bit expensive considering the small size. If it is a bit cheaper, I would come here twice a week but for now, I would  come here 2-3 times a month.
author: Kevin L.

description: Sorry Boba Guys was not good. I didn't even have high expectations. The Thai Tea Boba and the Horchata Milk Tea was so below average. I was expecting at least taste like Thai Tea from an average Thai restaurant or taste like Horchata from a taqueria, but no, watered down and the taste was bland. I didn't even lower the sugar level for the horchata milk tea. The Thai tea cannot be adjusted. I was disappointed. With the lines and the rave reviews of these two drinks by other Yelpers, I am not convinced Boba Guys are up to par. One positive is the texture of the boba was good for the first couple of sips, then it goes down hill. Won't recommend this place to any of my friends.
author: Earvin T.

description:
Finally, I can get boba without driving to richmond or sunset!!!!  

What I love:
 - ALMOND JELLO (homemade) as a filling in my drink.  I've never had this before in my milk tea and it is delicious!!  I wish more boba places did this....bc it is way less calories than getting tapioca balls.

- BOBA - i try not to eat too much boba (calories), but the boba here is well made.  it is sweet and it is chewy and soft.  a bit firmer than t-pumps.  i like it.  

- Real Milk Tea - most boba joints user powder creamer in their milk tea, but boba guys is like, hipster boba, so they use real Straus organic milk as the creamer in the milk tea.  If you are used to the fake powder stuff, then this will taste different.  But I think it is a good different bc it is real milk and not mysterious powder.  

love the mason jar mugs and the aardvark logo!
author: Betsey L.

description: I love this place! I usually order their jasmine milk tea, which in my opinion is the best jasmine milk tea EVER or their thai tea which is good too! Their boba is good too, it has the right texture and sweetness. Its kinda pricey, but the quality of the drink is very good so its worth it.
author: Alyssa C.

description:
I visited Boba Guys when it was just a little "pop-up" in some random ramen shop and back then I had no clue it would become such a hit!

It's a tiny little store off of Valencia and the day I visited it was BURNING hot and the line was out the door! They haven't been able to get AC inside so if you plan to go, go during off hours so you can get in and get out, or go at night or something so you don't suffocate in the store before you even get your boba!! Just kidding, it's not that bad.. but I have to agree with the other reviewers, they are a little on the slow side. Also, they didn't have a lot of the drinks on the menu (iced milk, horchata milk tea etc), which was a slight disappointment, but I ended up ordering a Jasmine Milk Tea with boba and it was the perfect decision! The boba was sweet and chewy and definitely better than purple kow or t pumps! I also had a sip of my friend's almond jelly and that was pretty good as well.

What really puts them above is the quality of ingredients they use and how hard they work to perfect their recipes. I really respect this business simply because they want to put out the best quality drinks without cutting any corners and for that alone, I would return even if I had to wait in their oven of a store.
author: Iris C.

description:
Damn it, I wanted to be the first to review this place. I'll consider this to be the first in-depth review!

This place was first brought to my attention by home girl Linh P. a while back. Everybody that knows me knows that boba runs through my veins, and when I heard about this new location opening up, I had to get the inside scoop. Me and some friends came to the grand opening and there they were - lookin' fine as ever, rockin' those white lab coats, mixin' our drinks - the boba guys. They had their lab assistants on the side too. There was a strong distinct sweet smell that took a minute to get used to upon walking in. The space isn't all that big, but there's four seats by the windows to sit and chill with some homies. Compared to their previous location, they have a new selection of drinks lined up along with their slow bar and also various cupcakes and macarons! There's no additional charge for drink toppings!

For their first day, I was surprised that they ran out of Thai Iced Tea so quickly. We walked in less than two hours after they opened! I had the Classic Milk Tea and for some odd reason, my order took longer than usual. My friends all got their orders, but mine never came up. I eventually had to ask about my drink, which then came out after a couple of other orders placed after mine, but I cut them some slack and let it slide because they just launched.

I'm sippin' my drank and hey, it was one hell of a concoction! Hands down, the milk tea was honestly by far the best I've had yet. Perfect balance, ice cold, and made with the finest organic ingredients - just the way it should be! The grass jelly was pretty good too, but I've definitely had better. However, I caught what I think was a tea leaf in my mouth at one point which wasn't too big of an issue to me, but still questionable.

For day one and counting, they did a decent job. The whole lab experiment chemistry set-up with the coats and beakers was cute and all. I wish I had my drink in one of those cool jars rather than their to-go cups. It just seems cooler that way! I wanted to take a picture with the dynamic duo, but they were mad scientists at work and didn't seem willing for a photo-op. $4 is definitely the most I've ever paid for boba, but it'll be worth it to treat yourself to a concocted boba love potion every now and then!
author: Peter L.

description:
Finally got a chance to try Boba Guys.  

The decor was nice and clean.  The staffs was friendly and helpful.

I got the Ice Rose Tea with boba.  It was very good.  Very strong rose flavors and the right amount of sweetness.  The balls were good too, soft but chewy.  

The price was little higher than other boba places but they used fine ingredients, definitely worth it.
author: Liza T.

description:
Great boba drinks for pretty good prices, you can customize the sweetness, add extras, and get it hot or cold. 
My favorite right now is the Classic Milk Tea, with soy, boba, with 25% sweetness... mmm...tasty!
author: Sandor M.

description: Since I'm originally from the south bay I'm a huge fantasia fan.  I've heard a lot about boba guy and really wanted to try them.  I got the soy boba, which I found surprisingly light.  The flavors were very subtle, in my option, or maybe it's just because I'm used to the stronger taste of fantasia.  Plus this place can get a little pricy at $4/drink.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Muscat Oolang Milk Tea!!! Just the smell of this tea is like heaven. It's a bit pricey but it's soooo tasty! I highly reccomend this one. It's fruity, smooth and delicate tasting, a definite must try!

The Horchata was a little to Vanilla-y for my taste, I like my horchata to be more cinnamon-y. Still, it wasn't bad. 

You can tell the people that work here are really into what they do, and make sure that you leave there happy.  The guy who took my order was very helpful and gave me a  recommendations. Exceptional Customer Service! NO snootiness here :)

This will definitely be added to my stops when i'm back in the City.
author: Gina G.

description:
Let me preface with I am a recently indoctrinated huge fan of boba. I cut my teeth on Boba Time in Los Angeles. I'm spoiled.

It's really not hard to do a good Boba drink. While the product they offer is of good quality, it definitely was not of my liking. I got the Moche latte. 

Why 2 stars?
The utter lack of choices. 
The excessively sweet drink. (If you like Thai ice tea you will like it, I think)
The matte tasted a bit too strong. 

 I'm not saying be Boba Time at all. I would like some non-tea based choices. Maybe a little fruity selection. And definitely try the smoothie approach with lots if blendered  ice. Heck just a simple mocha and boba is the bomb in combination.

Moral of the story: nice people, decent service, but lacking in product. Sorry I'm just being honest based on my personal experience. I cannot speak for others.
author: Nichole S.

description:
Trending now: new/up and coming tapi (aka boba) shops offer to fill drinks in a reusable container, of course, coming with a price.

However: Shelling out  $10 to have them fill your drink in a reusable mason jar (with their aardvark mascot on it)..um...no thanks.  Plentea can offer the same drink, in a reusable glass jar, for half the price (even if there's no mascot).

Came here, just to try it out, and it's really a hipster thing, located in a hipster spot; don't get me wrong: I enjoy spending a lovely San Francisco afternoon in a hipster spot, but really, $4 - $5 is really the max I would pay for a tapioca drink (please do forgive my ranting).  Anyways, I asked them about their most popular drink; they mentioned the horchata drink so I leaned towards that.  The cashier offered a free sample and I went for it prior to making my final order.  Typically a horchata is creamy, but this one was refreshingly sweet.  I decided to order the horchata boba (no mason jar) and throw in almond jello. Another good thing, about The Boba Guys is that they allow any or all combination of toppings for no extra cost (perhaps hence the expensive prices?).  On top of that, they also allow customers to bring their own reusable container (ex: water bottles, coffee mugs, etc.), which is nice in case you're working nearby and only have time to make 1 stop here during your lunch break.

After finishing my tapi (aka boba), I was left with a forgettable feeling; didn't seem memorable.  They say their boba is soft and chewy, which is 100% true, but I preferably like my tapioca balls less chewy. Sorry, I'm not ranting just to rant, but honestly I'd rather return to Plentea or other authentic and local tapioca shops where I can get my milk tea and regular tea for $2.50 -$4.
author: Jessica S.

description:
I really like their concept and there's no doubt their milk teas are good. I think overall tho, it's not worth the hefty price tag. I understand though that they may be using the best of ingredients, so that's probably why it is so expensive. Plus, there's no other Boba place in the mission. 

I like that you have the option to use soy milk. and the boba is really fresh. So although i really enjoy the teas here, I probably won't frequent the place just because it's pretty expensive. I'd probably just stick to the other boba places in the sunset where the prices are half what it cost here. But if i was feeling fancy, or if i ever was in the mission then i'd check this place out again. Also, i think the process of making the drink can be improved, it's a little on the slow end. 

I like this place tho, they deserve the 4stars.
author: Margarita M.

description: Their tea is very unique & tastes very different compared to other milk tea places. I can actually taste the quality in every sip here compared to other places. The only downside is... it's kind of pricy but I mean the quality is good. Pearls taste fresh as well and not so hard and chewy. They're Juuuust right! I'll be back soon :)
author: Jane N.

description: I didn't think that boba could create such polarizing reviews, but I'm siding with the people who like the boba here. The texture of the boba is just perfect. The milks and the teas they use taste WAY better than any of the cheap joints out in the Sunset. The only caveat is that it does create an expensive price tag at $4 a drink. If they lowered their price a bit and changed their hours (12-5pm Wed-Sun?? What's up with that?), they'll be well on their way to 5 stars.
author: Kazu O.

description: I feel bad giving it only 3 stars because I go there all the time. It's not the best boba tea but it is the closet one to my home. I always get the classic milk tea with tapioca and 25% sweetness. I like the flavor of tea but boba is just ok. The staff is very friendly and service is fast. It is at a very good location at 19th and Valencia. It's very small and it can get pretty crowded. $4 for 16 oz iced milk tea with tapioca.
author: Ritika K.

description: The Hong Kong Style and Thai Tea were wonderful - refreshing and smooth. The staff were also really sweet and our drinks arrived quickly. Definitely hit the mark! Was happy to stumble upon their store front on this hot day. Will be back if I'm in the neighborhood
author: Laura C.

description:
My sister and I came here on a Sunday afternoon at around 5pm. Since Boba Guys is near the Mission district, parking can be relatively difficult, but if the parking gods are with you, it is possible to find a spot so don't be discouraged! Immediately as we walked in, one of the owners greeted us with a huge smile and informed us that the only drinks that they had were the first four on the menu, which were: Classic Milk Tea, Jasmine Milk Tea, Soy Milk Tea (no dairy) and Horchata Boba. Their toppings consisted of tapioca balls, almond jelly, grass jelly, aloe vera, and coffee jelly, but I'm assuming that the default topping is boba, since they didn't ask us which topping we wanted. They also had 2 cupcakes in the display, and they seemed to run out of macarons and other goodies, which was understandable since it was near closing time. Oh and they have a  "Slow Bar" where you basically choose from a selection of their loose leaf teas and they'll make it for you, but you need to wait 5 minutes. I'm not sure how that works, but I'll probably be back to try that! They proudly use Straus organic milk and real tea.. yes, real milk and real tea! None of that powder stuff that most boba shops use, hence why the prices are expensive for a small cup ($4-$5.) It's all about quality, guys! My sister and I settled on the regular milk teas and paid $8.

Classic Milk Tea - The tea to milk ratio was PERFECT! I was able to taste the strong tea flavor, while enjoying the creaminess from the Straus organic milk. The boba was chewy and there was plenty of it! For sugar fiends, this isn't the milk tea for you because it's not sweet at all! My only problem with the milk tea was that it wasn't cold! It was sort of like having a milk tea sitting out for an hour, hence the reason why Boba Guys gets 4 stars and not 5. 

We waited less than 5 minutes for our milk tea, which was great considering the amount of people that were there. The shop was clean, bright, spacious, and was aesthetically pleasing! The employees (owners) were friendly and they seem really passionate about their products and look like they really enjoy serving their customers. Yes, it's definitely pricier than most boba shops, but quality is key! I'll be back!
author: Joyce E.

description: Very tasty boba. Natural ingredients and made from scratch (no powders). I like the flavors they have. And for all the hipster hype, it's not as overpriced as I thought it would be.  Not cheap, but any means, but not so much more expensive than other boba places.
author: B. Y.

description:
Dear Boba Guys,
I am posting this one star review with the hopes that it will encourage some improvements.

taste: thank you for using high quality ingredients, your boba tea tastes great.

experience: boba tea for me is as much about the experience as the taste, and it is the experience you offer that I think needs improvement. I understand the hip and artisanal vibe you are trying to create, but I don't think that means you have to neglect the fun and enthusiasm that traditionally comes with boba tea. 

Liven up the mood, turn up the tunes, pretend like your having a good time, smile! take a lesson from your friends over at ken ken, they'r great at the mood/friendliness thing.

Also, buy one of those cup sealers, add a hint of color to the cup or do whatever you have to do to make your boba tea special and not just another cup of Joe.

YOU CAN DO IT!
thanks,
chris
author: chuck c.

description: I was never blown away by most of their drinks in what I would call the regular menu (Hong Kong style, Jasmine Milk Tea, Horchata etc.) but I finally found THE drink for me here. For $5, depending on what size, the Mango Matcha Tea Fresca gets an A++ (You'll find this in the menu near the register). It's made with a fruit puree so it's a bit thicker than the tea drinks. Kudos to the staff member who recommended it to me! You got good taste.
author: Kristine N.

description: I've been drinking Boba Guys ever since they were still a pop-up shop inside Ken Ken Ramen. My favorite aspect about this place is that they use real milk (or soy milk) versus the non-dairy powder that other boba places use. The drinks taste much better and more fresh with real milk/soy milk and you don't feel as gross consuming powdered Coffee-Mate.  Also, they have unique flavors such as horchata or matcha strawberry.  The vibe and decor of the shops are also a plus! Very bright, airy, and clean.  Keep up the good work, Boba Guys!
author: T D.

description: This place is overpriced in my book.
author: Lynn T.

description: I am so sad. We would drive an hour (one-way) just to have this spot and the last couple of times we have been seriously let down. They have been getting busier, usually with a long line out front, and we were happy for their success HOWEVER it seems that they are rushing now when making drinks (or possibly due to new employees) and it is having a negative effect on the taste :( I waited in line for at least 20-25 mins the last time only to have to stand in line ALL OVER AGAIN to get it fixed because it was clumpy and bitter. The last time 3 of the 7 drinks I ordered didn't even have boba in it (and it was on the receipt), I kept chewing on non-dissolved matcha clumps and there was a very bad aftertaste in almost all the drinks that I still can't figure out what it was, just had to toss them all :( Guess we will be saving gas money from now on...
author: Suzee Q.

description: One of the best place in SF to get super fresh and high quality boba drinks. My normal preferred is the jasmine milk tea with grass jelly. The combination of taste and freshness just makes me keep coming back to this place.
author: Dylan C.

description: This place is great! There are different tea varieties (green tea, oolong, etc.). I love that you can chose your sweetness level (25%, 50%, 75% 100%) because some places over sweeten it. Also, they have almond, soy and strauss creamy milk! You can make so many different combinations!
author: Vicky H.

description:
This boba place is so clean and stylish unlike usual boba place.
I had Thai Tea, it was little bland, less sweet but still tasty. 
I like the guys in the counter who helped me to choose and explained well. 

My friend tried Hochata. Yes! Here is in Mission! I will try it next time:)
author: Spinof P.

description:
I'll keep it short & sweet

More of a 3.5, it's a few blocks from Delores Park. Shooting to be a high end boba shop with freshly brew teas and all natural ingredients. Black, white, pastel color scheme. Armadillo. 

I tried the Horchata with boba ($4) which I really enjoyed. Horchata is the only drink you can't customize the sweetness on. Their boba is on point (jk they're round) with the right amount of sweetness, softness, and chewiness. The horchata itself did not quite seem homemade or authentic - it was very sweet, no rice pulp, no slightly roasted flavor like you get from taquerias or Mexican restaurants. It was still enjoyable but there's always room for improvement. 

I also tried the milk tea but it was very basic and not impressive.

Overall, a very okay spot.
author: Priscilla H.

description:
Their regular milk tea is made w/fresh milk from Straus farm and it's not too sweet at all.  

The texture of the boba was alright, but maybe that's just me. :/  I like boba on the softer side.  Will probably come back again, but only because of the milk they use.
author: Caitlyn C.

description: Love this place! They have options to make the tea with milk, soy and almond. They always seem to be playing awesome music. The boba is delicious, I would recommend the honey black or the horchata- only if I had to choose.
author: Tulsi M.

description: Boba texture is nice and chewy and the tea not too sweet. Very good.
author: David G.

description:
My wife is really crazy about this place, so we decided to go check it out when we were in town in July.

It's not bad but it's not as great as she made it out to be.
author: Will C.

description: Oh man oh Manischewitz this place is awesome. First time around I had the classic milk tea (my base judgement drink for all pearl tea cafes) and it was AWESOME. If anyone's ever had Sweet Heart Cafe's milk teas circa 1998-2004...you'll feel nostalgic with the Boba Guy's classic. My second time around, I had the Horchata at 50% sweetness, and it was as if the boba god's had a party...in my mouth...and everyone got drunk...while listening to EDM...yeah.
author: Julian N.

description: This place is okay. I give them 5 stars for their boba (it's a great chewy texture!) but their milk tea is way too milky and not very flavorful, which is a bummer.
author: Meg L.

description: I actually didn't like boba until I tried boba guys, and now I love it! i really appreciate the dairy free options, and that you can adjust the level of sweetness since I really don't like things that are too sweet. I highly recommend the matcha green tea boba.
author: Danielle B.

description:
Hi Boba Guys, 

this is a msg from someone who has been searching for good boba in SF.  When my sister told me about you guys, i was super excited.  I couldn't wait to try your boba and milk teas and i must say i have once again been disappointed.  However, you guys do have a lot of potential to make really good boba.  I can tell from what i was drinking!!! 

the problems: 
1.  Not enough boba!!! come guys, boba is cheap.  I'm sure you will make a lot more people happy if you just added a little bit more boba in there.  

2. it's too sweet!! many boba places will customize the sweetness level.  When i asked for half the sweetness, the response was oo everything is pre-made.  Yes that kinda turned me off.  I have no problem with your pre-made teas.  My problem is the fact that you can't make it less sweet because it is pre-made.   

3.  have less random hours.  people might enjoy a cup of boba milk tea after dinner. you guys are located in a hub of restaurants why not have later hours.  

Why i think you guys have potential to make REALLY good boba milk tea:
1. the boba balls are chewy but not too chewy.  It has a nice sweetness too it (hence you can make your tea less sweet!!!!!) 

2. the tea has really good flavor.  I got the milk tea and my sister got the jasmine milk tea.  When i tried the jasmine milk tea, my first response was WHOA!!!! that is jasmine.  Love the flavor and the smoothness of your teas.  Don't let that hide behind all the sweetness.  

3.  No lines!!! I didn't have to wait at all.. but that's probably because i went at a good time.  

hope you guys find this helpful and i look forward to trying your more boba less sweet milk tea next time.
author: JY L.

description:
Boba Guys opened up their first brick and mortar store right in the heart of the Mission recently.  It's a super cute spot for a quick boba treat.  The place is pretty small and there's limited seating (only 4 chairs against a bench mounted to the wall).  

I got the Jasmine Milk Tea and their tea is definitely not as sweet and more tea-tasting than the ones at typical boba places (T-pumps, Purple Cow, Tea Era).  The actual bobas were nice and chewy, but not chewy.  Heads up that they also ran out of bobas towards the end of the day (maybe about 45 min before closing), so may not want to go too close to closing time.  I also found that the wait for the tea after ordering was longer than the typical boba place.

Would go there again if I was in the area craving boba tea and try out some of their other flavors too.
author: Imee C.

description: I thought the boba was pretty good -- Muscat tea was already pretty sweet without the sweetener added, and the boba was pretty standard. I only walked in because I love aardvarks ;) but was glad I did.
author: Erika H.

description:
Alcohol meets hipster meets boba.

Spiked milk tea boba- 3 stars: Reminded me of a white russian but without the coffee flavor. The vodka was subtle at first.. until you get halfway down the glass... and then you can taste. Overall alcohol flavor was weak- don't expect to get buzzed (or get the asian glow) off this.

Jasmine milk tea boba- 4 stars: sweet and delicious, with bobas the perfect consistency.

*Not sure if alcoholic boba is served regularly.. we came in on a Sunday at 12p.
author: Emily C.

description:
This review is based solely on the jasmine milk tea I ordered:

I like bolder flavor milk teas, and I specifically asked for "stronger" tea flavor, which they did give me. In fact, the actual flavor (tea to milk to sugar ratio) was nearly perfect. However, it may be the type of jasmine tea or milk that really made it mediocre - it had no body to it, just a really watery texture. 

5 stars for service
3 stars for the actual product

I might go back if I were in the area and had some crazy boba craving again, but I wouldn't make a special trip just to go there.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
You know that happy feeling that you get when you realize your drink is delicious? Well, you will be happy when you try a drink at Boba Guys! Or at least the one that I tried :)

Ordered the Jasmine Milk Tea with Almond Jelly. Drink was simple and wait time was short. Perfect amount of sweetness and flavor with milk options.

I recommend Boba Guys and will return to try another drink!
author: Emily L.

description: Drove around for about 30 minutes to find parking for this busy area. We started to see a lot of people posted up IG and Snaps of boba milk tea from the boba guys and knew that we needed to try it out for ourselves. Since we have been on a mission to find the best boba spot, we had a high expectation of this place. The line was long as we approach and it gave her reassurance that this may have been the spot we have been waiting for. They only use fresh loose tea leaves (industry standard now when you are talking milk tea) and you had your choice of the classic tea or premium tea. You can also choose your choice of milk (organic, almond or soy). We each ordered our own, I ordered the jasmine and she ordered the classic. The drinks smelled really good, however, the taste did not meet our expectations. It wasn't the worst nor was it the best. It was middle of the pack for us. Just glad that we were able to try it, but it was not worth it for us. At least we tried.
author: Tony N.

description:
I like the rose flavored tea, but their boba was too harddd for me.
i wouldnt come back for the pearls. 

it is veryy hot inside -
not a good plalce to sit and chat.
author: Miffy L.

description: San Francisco Foodies' favorite boba shop in SF! We love that they use organic dairy, make their own almond jello and allow customers to moderate the sweetness of their drinks :)
author: SF F.

description:
I ordered a hot jasmine milk tea with boba to keep warm in the cold. I wanted to try the almond jelly but they warned the jellies would dissolve. 

I've had this particular drink at other locations and the boba is good. Unfortunately, the consistency of boba at Boba Guys was extremely gooey. I'm not sure if the boba is usually like this or the gooeyness was a result of the hot water. Bottom line, don't order hot drinks with boba. 

Service was not particularly friendly, so I'd recommend an improvement on that. 

I'd give the place another try for another drink. Sample the cotton candy; it's good!
author: Vivian V.

description: So far I have been here twice and I can definitely see more visits in the future! Their Boba is the best I have ever tried and I have been to many Boba places. Their's was soft and chewy and my drink was perfect at 75% sweetness.
author: Ashley R.

description: The jasmine milk tea was delicious - a fragant taste that was not overpowered by the milk and boba. The classic was not a standout though. The boba was a perfect mix of chewiness and softness. I really like that they use real tea leaves here - but you are paying for it at $4 per drink!
author: Amelia C.

description: Authentic-tasting Classic boba tea. Comparable to a mainstream boba tea in Taiwan where this drink comes from. The bobas were a tad too soft on the outer and slightly hard center spot, but I am being harsh. Already superior to many vendors here in the Bay Area.
author: Emo E.

description: Love the new store! The milk tea is still as good as the original place!
author: Gordon H.

description:
Came to this place after Nombe (see review if you want), and decided to get some milk tea after seeing numerous friends post about it. It was a small little hipster place and very clean looking. The place was freaking hot inside but guess cause it was 70 outside, but I wouldn't be able to sit in there,especially since there's like three seats. 

Anyways, the tapioca was good and the drinks tasted like any other tapioca place. We had the Thai tea and jasmine milk tea. Can't really compete with a Thai restaurants milk tea that you actually stir yourself and is actually good. Don't get me wrong, they weren't bad but they were great. $4 a tapioca is way too much for me as well. Go to Irving and wonderful foods has freshly made tapioca drinks for $2.75 plus a large for +$1. Still under the price of milk tea at boba guys. I know they have overhead to pay but the location isn't exactly the best location for a tapioca place. 

I'm not a boba/tapioca expert but this place is overrated. If you're in the area and want tapioca then go for it but don't drive around looking for parking and going out of your way just to go here. Plus.. Everyone got Boba guys cups with their logo on it and we got a plain cup. Not complaining but thought that was weird.
author: Tim M.

description: Long line that I assumed this place was good, so decided to give it a try. Timed the wait since I was so bored in line and it took 33 minutes to wait in line and get my drink. Service was super slow and the boba/tapioca was meh. This place/chain is overhyped.  There are so many better places in the city for boba. T-pumps was way better than here. Hell I rather even go to Quickly than come here.
author: Pudgy G.

description: Conveniently located near Dolores Park. Keep an eye out for the dude that fills up a coconut with rum at the park. You could maybe have him mix some rum in your boba drink bc it's not THAT great...in fact it'll probably make it taste better. I do like the Boba Guys' branding though. Nothing makes sense. But it's fun. Kinda like San Francisco.
author: Sonny R.

description:
This place is a little more hipster than I frequent for boba, but I was in the area and had heard about it, so I decided to give it a try.

I'm not the hugest fan of boba, but today I decided to get some in my drink.  I believe I got jasmine milk tea, and the tea itself tasted pretty good.  A little sweet, but not so much that I couldn't taste the tea. 

However, I did not enjoy the boba at all.  It wasn't sweet, it wasn't that soft; it didn't really have anything going for it, in my opinion.  I didn't even finish the boba, since I was way too full.

Also, this place is a little bit on the pricier side for boba.  It's $4, so about a dollar more than other places.  Not actually that much money, but proportionally, not as worth it, IMO.

I satisfied my curiosity and tried something new, but since I don't venture this area very much, I don't think I'll be coming here again any time soon.
author: Denise C.

description:
Boba guys is pretty good if you're looking for a quick boba fix. 

Most of the good boba places are in Richmond or Chinatown, so it's great that they are located in the Mission and have also expanded hours from just during lunch to throughout the day.

When I finally did go try it, the boba tasted mediocre and the tea was decent. The preparation of it was fun to watch. The boba-ristas used beakers to measure the levels of milk to add to the tea, and everything was done to a level of precision similar to the way fine coffee is made. Unfortunately they'll have to work on their protocol a bit more before they can impress me. Also, they limited in their flavors and are a bit pricey. 

Overall they have a good concept going, and plenty of room for improvement.
author: Lucia C.

description: While I've never actually made it out to their actual shop, one of my friends was kind enough to pick up a jasmine milk green tea with almond jelly for me several months back. Certainly one of the better preparations of jasmine milk green that I've had in the Bay Area so far, with tasty almond jelly and tea that isn't overwhelmed by the taste of syrup (I'm a huge fan of milk tea that actually tastes like, well, tea!). Shame that they aren't easier to get to now that I've moved, with Mission being among those neighborhoods I actively avoid driving to whenever possible.
author: Johnny W.

description: Iced matcha green tea latte made with almond milk, 50% sweet is the bomb! Really cute shop with great owners - one of them even lent me his phone charger when my phone died unexpectedly. Will definitely be back!
author: Rachel P.

description: I was really looking forward to this place because of all the hype. Alas, it was just ok. I got the jasmine milk tea, half sweet. The tea was not very strong in flavor. The boba was sweet and kind of hard, which is a turn off. I don't think I'll be coming back, sadly.
author: Kat C.

description: I work as a delivery driver in SF so I'm in the area all the time. I've been buying Boba Guys ( 3 to 4 times a week I'm here) for 6 months and nothing really compares to the quality and the most important part which is consistent taste time and time again. I've been to other boba places buying the same thing I buy at boba guys. The taste will be off at these other boba places nothing compares to what Boba Guys has to offer. When it comes to Boba guys nothing compares and once you try it you'll understand what i mean.
author: San F.

description: I've traveled Taiwan. I tried a lot of bubble tea there but Boba Guys is the best I've tried so far. I go for the Jasmine Milk Tea with whole milk and less sugar.
author: James F.

description:
I got the Hong Kong Milk Tea here and it was SUPER sweet. Though I guess I should have figured with it including condensed milk and all.

The tea taste wasnt too overpowering and was pretty on par with what I expected.

The boba was a tad squishy for my tastes. I like bouncier boba, not boba that you can squish with just the force of your tongue.

My friend ordered a regular milk tea and I had some of hers and it wasn't super sweet like mine was, so I'm guessing only the condensed milk HK Milk Tea is sweet beyond imagination. Heads up if you have a sweet tooth or are averse to sweet things.
author: Courtney Q.

description: Soymilk, vegan tapioca balls or jelly square, vegan & GF cotton candy. Great spot!  Love the coconut green tea boba drink. It's pretty sweet though- so next time I'll adjust that a bit.  But love this place!
author: Lisa M.

description:
Worst. Boba. I've. Ever. Had. 

I went into this place with anticipation because it looked great. I got the jasmine milk tea with grass jelly. It was really quite bad :( The taste of the tea was weak and kinda strange. The milk was overwhelming. The grass jelly was a huge, especially hard lump which could barely go up the straw. And boy was it expensive. Not gonna waste $4 on this hipster boba again.
author: Joel K.

description: Really good drinks! They even have ice cream!  We got lychee green tea, and strawberry Jasmine tea!!  They sweetened it with real strawberriew!!  So good!!  Definitely a must if you're visiting San Francisco
author: Krissy C.

description: I had their jasmine milk tea with grass jelly! Yum! and No sleep!
author: Ange G.

description:
Boba Guys is kind of hit or miss. If you get it when it's good, then it is rather fantastic. Otherwise, it's really meh.

Some examples:
- their coffee milk tea has gone down in quality over the last 9 months or so. It used to be quite good, and now it's watered down or something.
- back in their Suika pop up days, they did a really nice jasmine milk tea. They moved to their permanent location, and I went back hoping for the same quality jasmine milk tea. I sadly ended up throwing my drink away after a sip 2/3 times, and never got the jasmine milk tea again. It tasted water down and funky in a bad way.
- occasionally their boba just tastes....off. Hard to describe, but there are days when it's A+ and other days when it tastes like burnt plastic or something.

I currently like their strawberry jasmine tea fresca a lot. The drink itself has been fairly consistent (across both mission & union square locations), though I'm always wary of adding boba to it because it might ruin an otherwise good drink.

It's also impossible to get them to add no ice. They usually forget and I end up with an iced drink. The first few times I had them remake my drink, but now I'm kind of "meh, typical boba guys mediocre service" about it. I hate iced drinks cuz my teeth are a little cold sensitive and it also waters down the drink, but at least I don't immediately chuck away the drink like I do when the boba tastes funky.

I'd probably give them 2.5 stars. The strawberry jasmine tea fresca really bumps up their favorability, but I can't forgive them for everything just because of it.
author: Chris M.

description:
I prefer Asha in Berkeley in terms of quality of tea, but Boba Guys is a close second.  Their base milk tea is a bit sweeter, and there are more "interesting" flavours. I'll definitely drop in the next time I'm in the mission and expand my range.

I talked with Bin for a while in the shop - I'm a bit of a milk tea geek and he appreciated my feedback and we talked about trails in Yosemite for a bit.

This is a few doors down from where I lived a few years ago - a good and bad thing it opened up after I left the city. ;)
author: ErUta N.

description: Boba was okay.. Not as fresh as I thought. I had the classic milk tea and it was reallyy strong. You have to like stronger teas to like their drinks.
author: Neena T.

description: Got the Horchata and it was delicious! There was a long line, but worth it if you're not in a hurry. I will definitely be back.
author: Shannon A.

description:
Best of the best boba tea in the city. The Boba Guys team knows how to bring together the highest quality ingredients from half and half made by local dairy, Straus Milk Creamery to high quality loose leaf teas sourced from all over the world. 

If you're a seasoned boba aficionado looking for the perfect fix, or a curious adventurer wanting to try boba for the first time, you need to come visit their beautifully designed space and guaranteed you will leave a happy camper!
author: Samantha C.

description:
Was it the best boba tea i've ever had? Yes. Were they really grade A balls? Yes. I also enjoyed the glass mug it was served in and the fact they let me sit outside  few stores down and enjoy it in the sun. I was a little disappointed that I didn't see Taiwanese dudes behind the counter in lab coats making my drink. Price was a little high at $4, but it's freaking delicious and really, who cares about $0.75... what's that, like 17mins at a parking meter?

Beware their hours are limited. I arrived 30mins before closing and got the last two drinks, so make sure you are cognizant of their hours.
author: Johnson M.

description: Great boba and the tea is great. I appreciate that they use milk instead of non-dairy creamer. It's a bit pricey, but I guess I understand why.
author: Rad S.

description:
walk slowly, and look for the sign on the sidewalk, because this place is easily missed

ordered the original boba milk tea.  the milk was super thick and tasted as if were on the brink of expiration.  just a tinge of sourness

i was serviced by this nice white guy, the only thing that that went wrong is that he thought i gave him a 5 dollar bill instead of a 10 dollar bill.  he quickly rectified this issue, but common man! thats a mistake that shouldnt happen when you only have 3 customers in the shop.

hate to say it, but i actually like quickly's better than this place, and quickly's is half the price too...
author: Tina A.

description:
Bubble tea lovers..the best bubble tea to ever exist is right here at Boba Guys.. As other reviewers have said, you taste the high quality flavor of the tea and the milk. The bubbles are perfectly chewy as well, unlike some eateries where they're just too hard, these ones are soft and come aplenty. I wish it wasn't $4 per cup because I could drink many cups of these in a row - I even had an evil thought of stealing their entire jug when they weren't looking..but I digress my evil intentions. FTR, I had the Jasmine tea but would love to try horchata next visit (at this time, I couldn't stomach any more sweets after eating Bi-Rite right before this trip).

Knowing this place exists, I *have* to come back every weekend I'm in the area! Give it a try if you are a bubble tea fanatic - I guarantee you won't be disappointed at their quality tea!
author: Allie Y.

description: consistent with their other locations.  still enjoying their fresca tea -- refreshing strawberry jasmine tea-fresco.  and a great startup story.
author: Rob C.

description: Perfect place for a hipster. Popular, yet over priced and hyped. I don't think I will be going back since I felt like the boba drink was small, and tasted alright.
author: Christina C.

description: I got to say boba guy have a good quality of boba drinks not like other places that I have been to that they use powder that is not good.
author: Reangsey L.

description: Their other location, with smiling service and great milk tea!
author: Long C.

description: The boba drinks were alright! But that's about it. (Is that all that counts?) the staff is ok, but the place is way too small and lines way too long. They need to open up a second register and get a bit more staff on it! I don't like waiting 30mins in line for a drink I finish in 10mins or less.
author: Aiko R.

description: Strawberry Matcha green tea latte was as delicious as it was beautiful. The Hong Kong style was alright I've had better milk teas elsewhere.
author: Van H.

description:
I come from the land were every damn corner you find yourself a boba joint. Yes, I'm from Orange County. Boba is a religion to me! I need it! I must have it! 

So when i found out about boba guys I became uber excited. I got even more excited when I saw their reviews! So when I finally took a sip of their milk tea my heart dropped. :/ the tapioca was great but the flavor of the milk tea was bland and watery (had it three times and my experience was always the same). I'm still debating if I should give them another try. Eh who knows. I might not. 

These dudes need to take a trip to SoCal to try themselves some real boba drinks (7 leaves cafe and tasteas)! Nom 

Good costumer services though and I've tried the macaroons here and there to die for! 3 stars
author: Nathalie B.

description:
Typical hipster ice-breaker, 
that an anteater or aardvark? 
don't care, both have black balls, 
name is Boba Guys,  ballsy name,  
step to the prostate specialist, 
lab coats come correct, 
claim, small batch and loose leaf, the realist, 
Straus, organic, the freshest, 
located in the land of the hip, 
this was brewed for the refined breed, 
can't distinguish much flavors over PG tips, 
consider sprinklin' some white powder off 16th street, 
pure, light, organic, OG, that is generalization, 
price so high, that is gentrification, 
boba kush in Mission or bush in Bushwick, 
love the concept, hate the price tag, 
then again, not a businessman, 
this is friendly, neighbor pop-up, 
stick around, Spiderman
author: Roy C.

description:
It was horrible. I've always wanted to go, so I did. I had high expectations, and I was extremely disappointed. I come in like 5 and they say I need to wait 20 minutes because they're making more boba. I got the horchata boba since I wanted to try something new. I didn't like the drink at all. It seemed so bland. Nothing special. The tapioca - it was so bad! Worst I've ever had. I thought since the tapioca will be fresh, that it will taste even better. NOT EVEN CLOSE. It was weird to chew and IT WASN'T SWEET AT ALL. No taste whatsoever! I went with my friend and she hated hers as well. She wanted to spit out the tapioca balls whenever she would get one. They gave a lot of tapioca.. but the thing is.. it sucked. I felt bad throwing it away.. but it wouldn't make the drink taste better.

Seriously, the water I drank while waiting for them to make their bland tapioca and drink tasted BETTER than the drink I got. That's how bad it was. I know they used all natural stuff and don't use powders, but that didn't make it taste better at all.

Never going back ever again. Now i know. Overhyped, overpriced and it was just horrible.
author: Marcy A.

description:
first time i tried milk tea here, YUMMY.  and the boba here is soft and chewy, just the right texture!!!!!

so i wanted to try the premium tea.  i proceeded to ask the cashier.  coconut milk tea is the most popular, so that it was.  i got 25% sweet.  waited and it was pretty quick.  first sip, okay not that good, but not horrible.  second sip... all i tasted was coconut flavor with no tea flavor at all.  very highly disappointed, but the boba was very good.  this is strictly for the coconut milk tea.  it was just not good.... and i didn't even taste any tea...=(  i thought i said 25% sweet?  not 25% tea...........

the inside is super hipster and some stools to sit around at, but a bit small so i would just get it to go.  the premium drinks were $4.25+ and the regular was $3.50+.  boba will be $.50!  the boba though.... i like.  the drinks... eh i dont know.  maybe i'll try the other drinks next time.  i do like they use organic milk and also offer almond milk as a sub... i will try again with another drink next time and hopefully it'll be that good good.
author: Josie L.

description:
I had classic milk tea and it was just average. The only thing special about this place is located in the mission and it's somewhat cute. 

They use real milk instead of powder and the boba is perfectly al dente. It is definitely more hong style instead of taiwanese but really tho, which boba place in SF isn't?
author: Michael W.

description:
I came here one afternoon to satisfy my boba cravings while in the Mission. The service staff was extremely friendly and expedient with making my drink. I ordered the jasmine milk tea with boba, and was slightly disappointed. The beverage itself tasted watered down - hardly any tea component and more "milk". The tapioca pearls were also of a strange consistency - a bit too soft around the curves and not as chewy as one would have hoped. Next time I am ordering from Boba Guys, I shall try the Hong Kong Style milk tea - hopefully it will be better than my precious experience!

Other notes--
Pros: all organic! :)
Cons: pretty pricey for the size available ($4 for regular 16oz)
author: Hurnan V.

description: No line when we went. We got Thai tea and iced matcha latte bbts. This place seems overhyped. Missed out on seasonal or special items, which aren't posted on the main menu, but at the cashier, so we only realized after we paid. Wouldn't necessarily go again next time I'm in SF.
author: Michelle C.

description:
This is the best milk tea I've had in SF so far, and also the best boba. The milk tea is made with real tea and milk, no powder. It definitely shows the care they put into making the boba, because it is the right consistency and has good flavor; chewy, tasty, not too sweet.
Speaking of sweet though, I have a tiny bit of a sweet tooth, and while the milk tea was delicious and I'm glad it wasn't overly sweet, for my tastes it could have been just the slightest bit more sweet. [It'd be awesome if they'd adopt the sweetening system used at Koi (Man, I miss Singapore!)]
author: Lindsay N.

description:
Interesting place.  Cliff notes version is good boba, but a bit pricy at $4 a cup.

I've tried this place twice now and it's pretty good.  It sits inside Ken Ken Ramen so go right in, you've found the right place.  They serve the boba at the bar right at the front.

There's usually 1 Boba Guy that works the bar and I've found them to usually be very friendly and more than willing to chat with you.  The guy who was working this Sundaytold us that they were going to be opening up their own location sometime soon.  They are also constantly experimenting with flavors here.  He mentioned that Sundays they were offering boba cocktails with interesting mixes like boba and beer.  I didn't venture to try it this time, but I've heard they also experiment with flavors of the non-alcoholic nature.

They use high quality tea and Strauss milk and seem pretty proud of this fact.  Their bobas are also cooked well with the right amount of sweetness.

We tried their Soy Original and Jasmine Milk Tea.  The soy one done with black tea while the jasmine milk tea of course uses jasmine tea.  I preferred the jasmine tea one, but it's nice that they offer soy for those lactose intolerant folks.  If you get your drink for the shop they serve it up in these cool mason jars.  I have no idea why they use an aardvark for their logo.
author: David K.

description:
This place is definitely different than your normal Asian boba place. Has soy milk options & more, which is great since i'm lactose intolerant. I usually always stay away from getting milk teas but I wanted to try it with the soy milk here.

SUPER strong tea, very bitter. Not your typical sweet, syrup-y type of boba drink. It's pretty good but can be quite expensive. The price is understandable since they do use very high-quality ingredients. Overall, it's yummy, different, but not always the type of boba I want.
author: Vivian Z.

description:
I ordered the Horchata boba and the Horchata was nothing special. Tasted just like watery milk with cinnamon. 
The boba: well if you like your boba rock hard, go to Boba Guys. I on the other hand like my boba soft and chewy. Not impressed...
author: Jackie L.

description:
It's an interesting concept for sure. Milk tea with boba in mason jars? Very hipster. Located in Mission? Boba Guys are not stupid guys. 

Someone told describe Boba Guys as the following, and I can't say I wholeheartedly disagree: "It's milk tea for the white hipster crowd."

So what can I say about their product myself? It's not horrible, but it's not amazing. The tea? It's good. Solid. Great, even. But their boba? No bueno, man. It was chewy. Like, this-steak-is-very-well-done-I've-been-chewing-for-the-past-15-minutes chewy. And it wasn't just my drink. I went to Boba Guys with a group and I asked every single person on how their milk tea was and every single person's answer was the same: tea, great; boba, meh. This was about month or so ago so maybe they've improved their boba since then, but we haven't gone back since. 

Also, $4 a cup? That's really pricey. If you go to the South Bay, milk tea will only cost you $2-3. So Boba Guys? Sorry, but meh.

Edit: They reached out to me, which I think is worth an extra star!

They left this explaining their prices: 
"... Also, we believe our drink is an unbelievable value at $4 given the quality of our ingredients . Most other places use non-dairy creamer and manufactured syrups. We believe organic milk, homemade syrup, and our responsible business practices make it worth the extra $1. We hope you can experience us again at the new store."
author: Daniel K.

description: Got the HK style milk tea. Was a bit disappointed at how light the tea was. It wasn't bad and I wasn't impressed by it. My drink was kinda at a luke temperature like it was sitting out at room temperature for a while. Will probably give it another shot with a different flavor.
author: Vic L.

description: Revising my review.  Almond jelly seems more consistently available, milk tea is good, and the people are nice!
author: Jeff T.

description: They have lots of different styles of milk tea, and they're good about doing less sugar (especially important with the HK style condensed milk one).  The main thing that got me was that they have Sunny Hills pineapple cakes from Taiwan, which are my absolute favorite.  They actually have REAL pineapple filling (not just melon paste).  These are hard to come by in the US, so I would go just for this.
author: Marilyn H.

description: I came here to try the horchata boba. It was pretty good, but not great. The texture of the boba was hard and the horchata tasted a little watered down. Good concept of combining boba and horchata.
author: Kelly T.

description: Basically a gentrified boba spot. Don't call yourselves boba guys if your boba is subpar. Drinks are eh and boba is not tender at all, similar to the texture of german gummies but tougher.
author: Jeremy L.

description:
One star is being generous. I thought I'd give this place a second chance. You know, maybe that first time, it was made wrong or they were having a bad day... Or maybe not. On both accounts, the drinks I've tried (coffee milk tea, Hong Kong milk tea, and horchata milk tea) all taste the same. Like water. But, I actually like water so I take that back. I had to force myself to finish the coffee milk tea. Ended up just throwing it out. Normally, if I don't like a drink, I'd let the barista know so they could fix it (it'd be a waste to throw the whole drink away). But even if they did, with their going rate, it'd probably still taste the same. 

Maybe I guess one star for that almond jelly and interior. And props for trying to be healthy and not using artificial flavoring etc etc. But really, milk tea isn't supposed to be healthy or good for you. That's like trying to make healthy cookies (yeah, they don't taste good do they?). 

In short, definitely would not come back. Sorry not sorry. I'd rather go to quickly's to be honest. Even if they do use flavored syrups, at least it tastes better.
author: Lulu T.

description: Matcha latte with almond jelly was absolutely fabulous. The perfect refreshing, slightly sweet dessert-like drink for a post-brunch stroll around the Mission. Can't wait to go back and try more drinks!
author: Juliana C.

description:
The long awaited opportunity to come by in this neighborhood to grab some "boba" from Boba guys.

Came by on a sunny Saturday afternoon after lunch and there was a line out the door reaching about 15 deep or so. Damn - glad I got in line before the surge of people started lining up behind me!

Still - with about 5 people in front of me it still took about 20 minutes to order and get my drink.

Ordered the following:
1. Green Milk tea - light sweetness - w/ boba
The milk tea itself did taste freshly brewed BUT it was not tasty. I was expecting a stronger tea taste but that was not the case - it was more in the milky side. The boba however was cooked perfectly and was perfectly sweetened.

2. Matcha Green tea:
The taste was interesting but not the greatest. Goes better with boba - I wouldn't drink it with out boba. Oh if you let it sit long enough - you'll see the milk separate from the match powder.

In the end - I feel like there can be some improvements in their "assembly line".
Seeing how they use an ipad to accept payments, I think they should also get a printer that prints that order instead of writing it down on a note book - which they currently do. That should speed up the process and streamline it so there is less writing and less crossing off orders on that notebook - just saying!

Good luck to you Boba Guys - I love my boba but this place is a bit to hipster for me in terms of price and atmosphere.
author: Kenny L.

description:
I'm definitely a fan! I ordered the Horchata Milk Tea today.

I really like this place. The staff is very friendly and I find that the tea leaves they sell there are reasonably priced. WAY BETTER THAN TEAVANA. 

The boba was very fresh. Yes, overpriced at $3.50 WITHOUT BOBA which is an additional $.50 but I really liked the tea itself. I've had horchata many a times before and I thought it was an interesting take to turn it into a tea.

Overall, if you are looking to shell out a few bucks for some good milk tea, I would say that it's worth it.
author: Carina M.

description: The reason I came to Boba Guys a while back is because of their drinks that come in Mason jars, but recently they stopped doing that. The drink itself is nothing special at all. As I am never in this area, I don't think I will come here again. I just won't go out of my way to come here. Also the parking here SUCKS!!!!
author: G O.

description:
The Mission badly needed a great boba tea joint and this is IT. 
Earl grey tea with Boba is my favorite!
author: Kit T.

description:
I came to Boba Guys when it was still a popup shop at a Japanese restaurant in the mission.

I tried the boba and I was disappointed with the boba and the tea. The tea was weak.  The boba was not so good.

I also got a bento box here too with curry. 

Nothing to rave about but I'm glad they have their own shop now.
author: Jboogie L.

description: They were out of their regular milk tea drink. So, didn't get to try their signature.
author: Wendy L.

description: Very good boba tea. Comparable with Purple Kow (in Outer Richmond), but less sweet. Note that you don't get the mason jar cup, but it is because they prepare the orders to go. The inside is small,  so this makes sense. You can purchase said cups/mugs, but the highlight is the tea. The classic is just that. My daughter sucked down her tea that she was "sharing" in less than a block!
author: Crystal S.

description:
First time i had boba guys was at their old location, I loved their milk tea w/ boba. I had it there in a mason jar, but I highly doubt that makes it taste better....

I came back a second time and I really did not like it. I asked for milk tea with homemade jelly, but I think she wrote hong kong milk tea? I'm not sure if that's different or not, but I did not say Hong Kong when i ordered. Anyways, it was extremely sweet and wow, I don't think i finished the cup. 

It's starting to become a hot spot though. waited over 15 minutes for my drink.
author: Erica L.

description: I love that they don't charge extra for almond milk. Their almond jelly is also good in the Hong Kong style milk tea!
author: Waanmathi V.

description:
I've been seeing cute pictures of their cups and logo and I thought I should go give this a try.

It was really disappointing.

The place is tiny and it feels awkward if you sit at the stool with your friends--it was just not a comfortable atmosphere. Something else that nagged me was that the price of those drinks. It might have been worth it if the portion size was bigger or the drink was phenomenal. The Hong Kong milk tea was wayyyy too sweet along with the Jasmine milk tea that my friends ordered. We all were arguing which one was sweeter. The boba was soft which was to my liking.

The workers were really nice and that's why (along with the boba) I am giving this place at least a 2 star. Other than that, its probably a one-try-thing... I wished I enjoyed it more.
author: Karina N.
