description: This place annoys me. It's really not that good but everyone goes cause it's conveniently located in the mission. It's too sweet and I wasn't crazy about their flavors. You can do better at a more legit boba place in the tenderloin or the Richmond.
author: Erin W.

description: Definitely one of my favorite bubble tea places in the city! I still have yet to try all their flavors, since I always get the classic milk tea. I usually ask for 80% sweet, with almond milk and boba - the perfect amount of sweetness and tea. I just wish they had bigger sizes!
author: Vivian H.

description:
Really not impressed.

Came with my boyfriend on a warm, summer day in the city after walking around a few open houses.  We were looking for a nice, tasty treat.  Instead what we got was a very hipster shop which serves meh-quality boba.

The drink wasn't cold enough (we prefer blended ice) and the flavors weren't as strong as we were hoping.  Mind you - the time it takes for each "crafted" beverage was a bit too much of an investment for something which didn't taste bomb.com.

I'm saying it - I'd rather have some Quickly.
author: Liz A.

description:
milk tea: 4/5

low stars because milk tea should not be $5. Too expensive

Came here to see what all the hype was about. The place was empty on a week night, but I hear that the line can be long. I would say that the milk tea has decent flavor but is not good enough to charge the $4-5 prices. Apparently they make the teas out of good quality leaves and it is apparent. But against the other competition which has the same claims, this place falls short. Also, this is more of a to-go place rather than hang out. Definitely hipster milk tea and boba.
author: Cecile S.

description: Super delicious boba in the mission! They're also testing out this new real fruit with tea concoction - it was so good and fresh! Service is super good too.
author: Tiffany T.

description:
The Boba Guys serve awesome boba that has excellent flavor, isn't too sweet, and has perfectly textured balls.  We are very happy that they are back in the Mission at Suika Bento!

Did you know that they also do catering?  We got married recently and had the privilege of having the Boba Guys come to our wedding to provide their bodacious boba.  We knew that they were in transition after Ken Ken Ramen, and we were delighted to find that they were willing to work with us.  They charged very reasonable prices, provided regular, jasmine, and soy boba, and were on time and self-contained.  Oh, and the quality of their product was spot on as always.  The boba was the hit of the night!  Thanks Boba Guys!  8 D
author: Go S.

description: It's no surprise yup be a regular here despite not living nor working nearby. Why? Because their boba is solid. The only boba I'll actually eat, usually I only get just the milk tea. And their service, their attention to detail.
author: Peter M.

description: Loved the earl grey tea. This boba is the best I've ever had. Better than my usual Wonderful Foods in the Sunset. It's pricier than most boba shops, but the quality makes up for it.
author: Laurie M.

description:
3.5
Been here a few times, and based on their style, presentation, and philosophy, I wanted to really like this place, but they're just not quite there. 

Got the basic milk tea, coffee milk tea, and golden honey black tea.  Their drinks aren't bad at all, they definitely taste like real tea, made with real effort, but I feel the tea-milk-syrup ratios are a little off. Maybe just my taste. The boba itself was awesome though, chewy, and just sweet enough to complement the drink.

The coffee milk tea is cool because they definitely use cold-brew coffee to mix with tea, but again, the ratios are off. I like cold brew coffee, but it tends to be more acidic, and their recipe doesn't balance out the sourness of the cold brew's acidity. It doesn't beat a milk tea with a shot of espresso. The golden honey black tea, one of their special, "slow brewed" to-order teas, just tasted like a milk tea with honey..good, but not worth $5. 

Again, I love their style, commitment to using organic ingredients, and I can appreciate the hipster, "third wave" kind of approach to brewing milk teas, especially in the Mission. It just hasn't translated into great tasting tea that could stand out in an oversaturated boba market. I'll keep coming back to support the biz because I believe in the potential. And because I go into the Mission a lot. In the meantime I hope they're seeking and being receptive to feedback that could improve their recipes.
author: Peter N.

description: So, where I live there aren't many boba places AT ALL (and if there are, the quality is as cheap as the prices they sell for). My boyfriend came to Boba Guys on President's Day (a Monday), and we were enough to find prime time parking along the street right across the shop. When we arrived (around 230pm) there was a bit of a line. It took about 15 minutes to actually reach the inside, which was small and a bit cramped (like most boba places). The register had a display just the to the left of it which showed their signature mason jars and some treats they were selling (sugar spun cotton candy!). I decided to try out the iced matcha latte and my boyfriend tried the hong kong style. I loved both drinks. The boba balls were not too soft and chewy, the price was very typical in comparison to other boba places (that's if you don't purchase the mason jar), the service was on the longer side to most boba places i've been to, and finding parking can be tough. I would most likely come back, but hopefully when its not so busy!
author: Charlene B.

description: Such good boba here! Perfect blend of milk with tea.  I also loved their artesian cotton candy, made with organic ingredients and NO FOOD COLORing!
author: Kay L.

description:
Finally got to try Boba Guys. It's so difficult making my way over here to try this little joint especially with their really odd hours of operations. HMPH.

Anyways, this place was alright. Nothing great about it and really basic and simple menu.  I don't thin I'm a milk tea person, but I do enjoy boba and they don't really give too much boba to go with the drinks. 

Would I go here again?  No. It's too much of a hassle to find parking in this area, for okay drinks + little boba and also trying to get there during their limited hours. How did they get so popular?  I guess it's not too difficult when you're one of the only boba places in the mission...  

Goodbye.
author: Suzie B.

description: Visited on a Saturday and it was pretty busy.  Ordered the Jasmine milk tea with boba and almond jelly.  LOVED the almond jelly.  The Jasmine milk tea was a bit on the sweet side for me.  Will be sure to check if they can make it less sweet for me next time.  Otherwise, friendly staff, the boba was good and I really like that they use quality ingredients.
author: Julia C.

description:
I would actually rate this 3.5 stars but will round up to be kind.

I wish they had larger sizes. If I think about how long it took me to find parking, the time I've waited in line plus how long it takes for them to make my tea - a 30-40 minute wait time for consumption far outweighs the 2 minutes it took for me to drink it.

People complain about the price - I say shut up and get over it (especially if you go to the newly opened Plentea in FiDi and see their prices!) - If you want boba milk tea for $0.99, go ahead and go to Quickly. The profit margin in the boba business is slim and people are used to either cheap pre-made/powdered mixed drinks, coffee creamer (instead of high quality milk - I'm pointing at you T-Pumps), and basic flavors. I appreciate their mission statement and intent for using the highest quality of everything (esp. when everyone is trying to cut costs everywhere and doesn't care that pesticides and hormones are 80% of the end product). The best thing about this place for me is that they have almond jelly, which I can't find in any other place in the bay area. My favorites in order are the Muscat Oolong, Horchata, and regular milk tea. In the end, you just need to know what flavors you do and do not like - this place won't be for everyone.
author: Sandy T.

description:
I LOVE BOBA GUYS.

Let's get it straight, it's not your typical boba joint and it does cost a bit more, but it's SO WORTH IT. I am not someone who has to get their daily/weekly boba fix (seriously, I get almond milk instead of real milk), but I come here every time I visit SF. The employees are super nice and they are all about organics, so what's not to love??

*Iced Matcha Latte: My fave
*Thai Tea: Dee-lish
*Earl Grey: Soooooo good
*Muscat Oolong: Yuuumm
author: Kathy Y.

description: Great bubble tea! I got the golden honey black milk tea and loved it. A little more expensive than other places but the tapioca is excellent. The drinks come pretty sweet by default, so make sure you let them know if you want less sugar.
author: Jason X.

description: Boba Guys has good tea but it is expensive. I like how you can customize your drink and it's great that boba isn't the only option for topping (filling?). I like the almond jelly but you might need a spoon to finish the bigger cubes! They use good ingredients and their teas are fresh.
author: Paras J.

description:
I love the Boba Guys! So much in fact, that I have to put myself on restriction to one a week or I'll be there every day:) 

I'de never had these milk teas before I tried Boba Guys. They opened a pop-up in a restaurant near my shop and that's when I got hooked. My favorite is the Jasmine milk tea with boba. I've tried some others but I alway come back to the Jasmine.

Some of the other reviews I just don't get. I feel like most people are just bitching about the price. It may seem like a lot but I feel like you are getting a quality product and that's not cheap. Nor is renting a retail space in San Francisco! I think customers forget that all the costs are not wrapped up just in the product, there is rent, employees, utilities, insurance, etc. I am a fellow business owner in the neighborhood and I know how challenging it can be.
The staff is super nice and know me by name. Half the time I go there they see me in line and by the time I get up to pay my drink has already been made! 

Giving a one star because you think it's too expensive is not providing new customers with good information about the product, it's just complaining. Those of you who think you can do it better should try, then you'll see how difficult it is to own and operate a small business.
 
I'm very happy they are here in the Mission and hope they continue to be successful!
author: Z B.

description: I've heard this place described as "hipster bubble tea" lol. It's a great place to stop by on the way Dolores. Get the horchata or jasmine milk tea with boba (or almond jelly). The drinks are made with organic milks/teas and are sweetened to taste. Good quality, great staff!
author: Will Z.

description: The store was really small and cramped, however service was good. I liked my drink, but Boba was a little hard. It made it seem like a workout to chew the Boba.
author: Bettina G.

description: Boba guys is a new style of boba business.They also make tea in front of people.Boba guys milk tea is different from the other Taiwanese boba stores.The other Taiwanese milk tea shops are using the coffee mate instead of milk.We have a school project to explore mission area and the owner is really willing to help:)the boba guys team seems really bound to each other..Thank you boba guys!
author: Xi P.

description: Best boba in the city.  Everything is fresh and made to order, no artificial colors/flavors.  I especially love the horchata with boba.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Came here on a beautiful Thursday afternoon right after my grocery run to enjoy some boba. I enjoyed their milk tea w almond jelly at Ken Ken, so was hoping to enjoy the other flavors. To be blunt, my jasmine milk tea pretty lame. Flavor was watered down even after I asked for it to be more sweet. Also sucked that they had no almond jelly when it was only Thursday. The shortage of toppings also happened on my last visit to Ken Ken, only no boba that time. As a boba fiend, I wanna support this place so badly but unless you get more intense flavor and have your toppings regularly stocked, I dont think I will be back soon.
author: Thomas L.

description: Sorry Boba Guys, I was super excited to come and try this as I loved your website and was thrilled to see that you were back in operation but for $4/drink, it should not come out of the refrigerator pre-made, I expect it to be hand shaken and made to order. Also the boba was hard! Very disappointed indeed!
author: Betty C.

description: My most favorite milk tea spot in the Bay Area! The drink I mostly get is the coffee milk tea and the horchata. Tastes super sweet, which is what I really like! Lines here are usually long, but I think it's worth the wait!
author: Nicole S.

description:
Such a wonderful boba shop! My friends and I joke that it's the most artisan our boba gets, and it's not that much more expensive than the boba shops closer to home.

What I particularly love about this shop is that it doesn't have too many options. Most boba places have a gazillion options, and for indecisive people like me, I spend forever deciding what I want. Having fewer options makes me trust that their options were all carefully crafted/tested and are of high quality, which has been true so far! 

They even brew your tea right when you order, so it's fresh! The teas have a beautiful flavor, particularly the muscat oolong (you can really taste the muscat). I also appreciate that they have so many different options for milk (including almond and soy milk), and that they use healthy, organic products :)

My favorite so far has been the horchata with boba, which always has a delicious amount of spice and flavor. I've also tried their thai iced tea, as well as their hong kong style, which were both a bit too sweet (although I could have asked them to tone it down). I would suggest sticking with their boba, which has a great consistency, and is quite sweet, mostly because I'm not the biggest fan of jellies. Also, try substituting in almond milk for the regular milk! It adds nice body and flavor :)
author: Courtney N.

description: Amazing service! I originally ordered the matcha latte but it didn't really fit my tastebuds. So I went back, explained my situation, and they gladly got me a new drink! No questions asked (:
author: Rebecca N.

description:
I'd been wanting to try Boba Guys for quite some time now, but could:

- never make my way down to the Mission during their limited hours
- only ever find myself in the Mission when they were already sold out

Bugger.

Anyhow, finally recently hit success..

I walked in to a simple "hi" from a gal at the bar.  I returned pleasantries, but then was a bit confused because there was no menu in sight.  How was I to know what to order?  It wasn't until I inquired before I was told that the only options were:

- Regular Milk Tea
- Soy Jasmine Milk Tea

Both were available with boba and/or almond jelly.  I opted for two of the soy jasmines, one with each of the toppings.  Too bad both weren't very good.

The tea itself was super watered down.  The boba was too soft, and the almond jelly had no almond flavor.  What a letdown. 

The one plus?  Not being in love with BG, so I won't need to worry about going out of my way for more.
author: Mel T.

description:
My friend kept pushing me to come here and on my birthday. So I did. 

The store location is somewhat a hole in the wall, at least it felt that way because they didn't have a sign out front. 

Ordered 2 Thai milk tea with pearls for the boyfriend and I. Came out to a total of like 9 bucks I think (a bit pricey for milk tea tbh). The Thai tea came out pretty quick and I was eager to try what my friend has been raving about. The Thai tea here is probably one of the worst boba drinks I've ever gotten. The Thai tea tasted more like watered down milk with a tiny (veryyyyy tiny) hint of tea in it. FO REALLY? 

Blah, not sure if the Thai tea was no good that day or if that's how it's suppose to taste. Maybe their other drinks are better? Who knows. 

I'll pass on this boba joint next time I'm in sf. 

Ps: very awkward and quiet ambience here.
author: Anna H.

description: Yay boba for hispters! Made with organic Strauss milk, high quality ingredients in my Boba Tea. Yes please. Everything is good here, my favs: Horchata, Classic HK Milk Tea, Jasmine Milk Tea, Thai Ice Tea. If you haven't tried boba before or had a somewhat "bad boba tea experience" like alot of my Caucasian friends, try Boba Guys, it will blow your mind.
author: Ennie L.

description: My first time trying this place, got the Horchata and it taste great! Friendly staff also!
author: Tafari G.

description: love love love Boba Guys! Once you have fresh tea with no powders, you can not go back!
author: Sarah O.

description:
I like Mason Jars.
I like Boba (not the kind that is poured to order, but made to order)
I like Boba that isn't hard and stuck together.
I like Milk Tea.

=Boba Guys 

Definitely check out their pop-up in Ken Ken Ramen!
author: Carli F.

description:
Zomg. I've tried milk tea from practically everywhere and I've got to say that this is one of the best milk teas I've ever had, no lie.

My friends and I were planning to come here after eating dinner at Yamo this past weekend. However, the line there was so long that we decided to just come here instead. We accidentally passed by it at first and as we were walking back up the street, we discovered the Mission Night Market and spent some time there before continuing our search for this place.. which we soon realized was right next door LOL.

I judge milk tea on three factors: creaminess, sweetness, and tea flavor. Here, I got the soy milk tea. It had a good amount of creaminess and the tea flavor was subtle, but present. I really enjoyed my drink, but it would've been even better if it had been a little less sweet! My friends and I compared it to the regular though, and we all agreed that the soy was more flavorful :)

I am personally not a fan of tapioca, but I actually liked the tapioca here! The texture was perfectly soft and chewy. It was sweet, but not to the point where it changed the flavor of my drink. I found it very comparable to that of Tpumps, which is located in San Mateo (http://www.yelp.com/biz/tpumps-san-mateo#hrid:FD34G0KsvsS8AID8bydrCg).

Another thing that distinguishes Boba Guys from others besides their soy milk tea is their use of mason jars if you are drinking inside. The drink and the experience were well worth $4. I would definitely come here again! Next time, I wanna try the jasmine :)
author: Stacey H.

description: Its my first time at this location, i've been at their new location in downtown and I must say that.. the employee at the time was so awkward I couldn't even bare it. I was the only customer in there, and he spoke so quietly. I felt a bad vibe from him. He didn't even bother to give me his attention. I ordered a Horchata w/ boba & my boyfriend ordered a regular milk tea. We started drinking the drinks when we got home, mine was fine but his was straight up HK milk tea. Us being tapioca lovers, we're pretty sure we know the difference. But, I guess the awkward employee didnt pay attention to the point to get my order mixed up. I kind of would like to stick to the downtown location. No offense to this store even though its the original.
author: Michelle T.

description: One of the better/best boba places I've been to so far! Not many menu options but their drinks are good. I had the horchata boba which was really amazing, I was worried it'd be too sweet because I'm pretty sensitive but it was perfect! All in all, I'd recommend. :)
author: Doreen Z.

description: Really impressed with the unique flavors at this tiny boba cafe.  We ordered the matcha latte with boba (iced) and wow!  Delicious!  The boba itself is just really good, and combined with the strong matcha flavor...words cannot express my happiness haha.  We also got the coconut matcha tea (hot with milk) and such a unique flavor that I've never had before.  I definitely will be returning to try the rest!
author: Naomi P.

description: Fell in love with their drinks here! Absolutely better than many other tapioca places. Love love love their rose black tea! The lychee green tea didn't have much lychee flavor, could only taste the green tea. I've ordered those two drinks with the tapioca and grass jelly but I would go without it next time because the texture of the grass jelly and tapioca was a soft on the outside but a bit hard when you chew into it. Sadly they are always out of macarons :( Would be a great snack when you have a sweet tooth, perfect with their drinks.
author: Pam Ela Y.

description: I've had my share of boba, and this place is pretty good. Straus milk, good tea flavor,  and excellent boba balls make this place worth it. My go to for mission boba
author: Ali H.

description: Small menu, but their AWESOME at what they do. I've had the horchata, so delicious. And the matcha green tea, also sooooo good. Coconut tea, very coconutty. All in all, I will always get boba from Boba Guys when I'm in the Mission. Their shop is small though, not much waiting room without being in someone's way. Staff is always helpful and nice. You want a good boba experience in the Mission, go here.
author: Kimberly S.

description: I love the boba and milktea here. Hands down, nowhere better in the city. Usually, I don't get tapioca because the ratio to tea is too much and they never taste that good. But I can't not get it when I'm here. It's the perfect texture and the perfect ratio.
author: Stacy C.

description: Their milk tea is top notch. Their boba, however, is not. In fact, it's one of the worst I've had - they were way overcooked and eventually stuck to each other to the point that I couldn't suck them out of the straw anymore. I'd go back for just the milk tea, but I don't know if I'd want to pay $4 just for that. Judging from the other reviews, I'm going to consider it as an off night.
author: Jonas T.

description: Definitely NOT worth the hype. I've been seeing this place on instagram all the time and thought that it'd be amazing milk tea. I got the Rose Black Milk Tea from the slow bar expecting that it'd be superrr amazing but not really. I got it with 50% sugar since everyone here said it was too sweet and my drink ended up tasting like water. I didn't even really taste the rose tea at all. It was like water and milk mixed together, same with my friend's drink (Jasmine Milk Tea). It was probably the worst milk tea I've had, worst than getting powdered milk tea. I probably would not come back to Boba Guys just because it's not good and it was definitely not worth $5 a cup.
author: Polly L.

description:
The idea of spike milk tea boba just captivated me.  I had to try!

Atmosphere is funky and hip, but nothing to crazy. Its a little small but I'm not complaining. Bar area ordering - just like you would at a night bar.  Played music.

The spiked milk tea was not too sweet, the boba was ok, and overall pretty yummy.  i'm not quite sure how much alcohol they put it but I tasted a hint of it.

 A little on the pricier side but you get what you pay for, REAL tea leaves, good quality boba, creative mason jar presentation, and organic products!
author: Alyssaaa S.

description:
Plus: boba is chewy for sure, store is clean.
Minus: jasmine tea is less than flavorful, size is a bit small.

You can get more expensive boba drinks in SF.  Good for those times the craving strikes and you're in the neighborhood.
author: daphne w.

description:
Very inconsistent. It is not only expensive but either the boba is too rubbery or the tea is way too sweet, or it is all ice....
Crossing off list as it just isn't a great product anymore.
author: Diana B.

description:
BOBA guys have RETURNED!

They sell great flavored boba milk tea drinks in the Mission. The drinks come in milk glasses when drinking in the establishment. The milk tea is definitely of better quality out of the establishments in SF.

They use all original ingredients so there isn't any powder and the tea is definitely loose leaf. The boba is also cooked right and has a right chewy but firm texture.

Definitely a stop on my list during my Mission District visits!
author: Stephen C.

description: The boba is great - but try the cotton candy! It seems like a weird addition to the menu at first but it's amazing, and very different than any other time you've probably had cotton candy.
author: Rashmi J.

description: I was not impressed with the Boba Guys at all. I ordered the iced Matcha Latte and it was powdery and watered down tasting. The boba was also still very warm which wasn't refreshing at all and ended up melting most of the ice almost instantly. The boba was also undercooked, resulting in chewy balls of rubber. My girlfriend got the ice coffee and that too was watered down. It tasted like cheap instant coffee. I wad really excited to try this place and it ended up being a total disappointment.
author: Kenichiro C.

description: I got the or house blend and asked for it just a little sweet with bubbles.   It was absolutely delicious.  The grommet Cotten candy is to die for and very reasonably priced.
author: Missy M.

description:
My traditionalist Taiwanese husband hated the bubble tea here. He did not like that they used regular milk/cream instead of evaporated or condensed. It was way to milky for his tastes and he thought the boba was overcooked/chewy.

For my Amercanized taste buds, the bubble tea was AMAZING. I got the soy version and thought the blend of bitter and sweet was really nice. I even got the chance to mix the classic and soy into a yummy, creamy concoction. I'll probably request 1/2 and 1/2 the next time I go.
author: Mira K.

description:
Since I don't live in the mission, and am not used to waiting in ridiculous lines constantly, I haven't developed the hard, calloused feet which all the hipsters seem to have. Thus, I was not that pleased with the 10-15 minute wait just to order my tea. 

I got the soy milk tea and found it to be nothing special.. at all. It was not cold and refreshing as I had hoped. Instead, the tea was room temperature. It was also not creamy and delicious. It was watery, weird, and overly sweet. The tapioca was good though. Overall, I don't think I would go back. Check out Eggettes.
author: Jasmine M.

description: Isabelle made my day so much better with her amazing energy and smile. The rest of the staff seem cool too. All the drinks are made not too sweet like other boba places. If I was straight I'd totally flight with Isabelle. She's beautiful!!
author: Anjo C.

description: Pretty good. Boba bubbles felt a little off to be honest but it was still ok. I tried the hong kong tea and it was good though a little sweet. I would come here again.
author: Carlos R.

description: I really want to give this place 5 stars, but I'm really not very impressed at all. First of all, $5 for a kiddie cup and it's only one size!!!! I can get a big ass "PumpBo" size for less than $5 at T-Pumps! And a hella more choices! And the whole "Strauss" family creamery milk.... BS!  I saw one the mean chicks working behind the counter pour some milk from a "non-Strauss" carton! It's highly overrated! Too sweet! Can't be very good for you. At least T-Pumps gives you the choice on sweetness.... No sweetness at all to very sweet....and everything in between! So thanks Boba guys but I won't be getting my Boba Milk tea craving fix with you that often.
author: Deb D.

description: The boba guys are located in the ken ken ramen store in the afternoon only.  We got the jasmine milk boba and it was okay..it tasted like from any boba place I have been to.  Nothing really special.  There is not really a boba place around this area to get boba, so if in the area again and craving boba, I'll stop in, but I would not go out of my way to come here.  The curry here looked delicious tho, so maybe I will stop in and try that next time for lunch.
author: James L.

description:
boba guys is located in a space that's shared with ken ken ramen. the boba is served at a small bar in the front that pretty much resembles an alcohol bar, but instead of alcohol the "bartenders" whip up a mean milk tea. TRIPPY... and the restaurant is located in the back. from the other reviews, i'm sure you've figured out that the milk tea comes in a mason jar with an aardvark on it, but one thing to note is that their logo is an aardvark because it's an animal with a "built in bubble tea straw". if that's not creative, then i don't know what is!

the tea was deliciously sweet and complimented the post-ramen stage well. the balls were some of the best boba i've ever tasted. however, $4 for a relatively small mason jar of jasmine green tea and boba is pretty pricy. especially for a mason jar i can't take home with me! yes i'm super asian and super cheap, but i have been conditioned by the endless teaway/purplekow/wonderful foods trips from the past.

all in all boba guys was a good experience and i would recommend trying it at least once, but it's definitely one of the bougier boba places i've been to. i'd come back again, but not on a regular basis.
author: Caitlin C.

description: They forgot about my order and I waited for 20 minutes. Asked them and they didn't remember....had to restate my order. Doesn't matter whether the drinks are good or not but it was a waste of my time and made me late to my next appointment.
author: Mona W.

description: I love this place. The best Boba I ever had =) Try the Jasmine milk tea one.
author: Audrey L.

description:
Came here with my boyfriend for their after hours tasting from HowAboutWe. We've actually never been to this place beforehand, but we love boba and tea with a passion, so I thought it would be cool for us to check it out. This easily has to be the best boba I've ever tasted and am thoroughly surprised that it only has 3.5 stars on Yelp! 

I think it helps if people actually know the process behind the boba-making; coming from the after hours tasting, we actually got to talk to one of the founders and he personally walked us through the entire process and all the ingredients used. They brew their own tea (using only the finest of tea leaves), use Straus half & half or whole milk (no powders or creamers whatsoever), and their own secret recipe for the syrup. So for those complaining that it's too expensive, well, if you take all the premium ingredients & care/labor put into making the drink into consideration, you'll see that the price is actually pretty cheap for what you're getting. I also read a lot of reviews hating on Boba Guys because it's "mostly condensed milk" -- it's NOT condensed milk, because, as said, they ONLY use premium Straus milk for dairy. And if it's too sweet, you can actually ask them to put only half sweetness or less and double the strength of the tea.

Anyways, if you are on HowAboutWe, you should check the after hours tasting out because you'll really learn so much more about these guys and appreciate their intense passion and craftsmanship for tea & boba. I don't know if I'll ever settle for anything less than Boba Guys from now on. ;)
author: Trisha D.

description: Best $4 I've spent in recent memory. Go for the Thai iced tea with boba, you won't be disappointed! Also love the interior aesthetic of the shop. Adorable!
author: Eliza D.

description: Really great bobas. Pretty sure they make them on site every morning. Got the Hong Kong style. It was great.
author: Benj M.

description: It's unheard of to get boba tea with fresh ingredients.  Everywhere else is just powder and prepackaged.   Absolutely delicious!!!!!
author: Stan H.

description: I usually don't crave milk tea from anywhere specific because it all tastes generally the same to me. But omg, their Hong Kong Style Milk Tea, so yummy! Maybe it's cause they use condensed milk. MMM!!! The only thing is they don't have many flavors, but who needs a million flavors anyway?
author: Lina C.

description:
Boba guys, two enthusiasts who have the passion of producing an excellent cup of milk tea lives up to its hype. After meeting the creators and tasting their milk tea all i have to say they have put in great efforts and time to bring us bay area folks a refreshing cup of iced milk tea!

The milk tea tasted light, not to sweet(which is a good thing), slightly creamy/milky and most importantly, refreshing. It makes you want to have another sip after sip after sip...!

Boba had a consistent chewy texture... that's how it should be done! Not too hard not too soft...

The price is worth what you are paying for. An average cup of milk tea ranges around $2-3.50, but you don't get that high quality milk/tea/boba consistency. 

Keep it up guys!! Would definitely stop by again. :)
author: Ray H.

description: Easily the best boba I've ever had. The matcha one is incredible and you can ask them to double up the matcha if you like it strong. The owner did a breakdown of the entire process for us; getting into every detail on how they make their ingredients. I found it very inspiring.
author: Tony P.

description: Not the best milk tea I have had, but their balls are definitely the best I have ever had (insert inappropriate ball joke here). I wouldn't go out of my way for this place, but it is for sure something to check out if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Maria D.

description: I come here way too much! I love their thai boba tea, it's the perfect combination of sweet and decadent. I've never tried their treats because I don't want to be 200 lbs but they look so good! Maybe tomorrow!
author: Maeling D.

description: the boba is the perfect balance of chewy and soft. love it here!! i live really close by so its gonna be my go-to boba joint
author: Sammie K.

description:
I tried the Soy Milk Tea with grass jelly and I really like the strong tea flavor! I felt like it was the right sweetness for me, so there was no reason to adjust the sugar percentage which I realized later I could have done. I thought the grass jelly was okay..I felt like it had a weird texture - more firm and dense than the regular grass jelly that I'm used to. 
I came at a good time when there were not too many people..around 3 something..so I got my drink in like 2 minutes. I like that they have a little station for water with cups and also a jug where you could add extra syrup! According to their website, the syrup, almond jelly, and grass jelly are homemade! I appreciate that they strive to use the best possible ingredients (organic tea and organic condensed milk!) and the best possible milk-tea-making methods to produce good quality drinks. They have variety of interesting flavors that I was surprised to see and would definitely like to try when i come back: horchata, decaf, hong kong style, coconut green tea, chamomile mint, muscat oolong, etc. You can also order online and choose a pick up time! How convenient! 
The place is pretty small, with some window seating, so it's primarily a to-go place. There is also a bench right outside as well.
I would definitely come back! I'm excited to hear that they're going to open a store in Union Square, closer to where I live! I'm sure they'll get a lot of business.
author: Anna L.

description:
Before Boba Guys, it'd been a while since I've had a really authentic boba tea. Others tend to be too sweet and the boba are too gummy/chewy/old. It's really difficult to find perfectly cooked boba, but these guys have figured it out.

My favorite's one of their rotating flavors (the Jasmine), but the standard milk tea is excellent.
author: Ajay N.

description:
Ok! Here is the thing They use real tea leaves for their milk tea
Instead of instant powder. And also use Strauss milk which is organic. Usually when i drink Boba i feel unhealthy 
Because it is too sweet. But this one was not too sweet. 
I can taste real tea. They use Darjeeling tea for their original milk tea.
author: SS K.

description: Best boba I've ever had. Their Thai tea and horchata with boba are unique flavors made their own way with Strauss milk so it tastes richer. Their boba itself is perfectly chewy! Their shop is also really cute and their staff are extremely friendly.
author: Emma G.

description: My absolute favorite boba place in the bay area! I LOVE this place. I've only tried the jasmine milk tea with tapioca and it's delicious. The tapioca has just the right consistency of chewy and sweet and the tea tastes so fresh, it's almost like you're eating jasmine flowers :)
author: Malika R.

description:
pretty good milk tea. except i drank it around 6 right before dinner and i was up all night..

we also tried the cotton candy and the owner made us some hong-kong style toast. it was delicious and love the staff!
author: Janet Y.

description: I love the Boba Guys! Whenever I'm back in town, I have to stop by at least once to cure my craving for boba! Convenient location for me and I had no troubles in finding a parking spot to make a quick boba run. Drinks are great and boba is chewy! Can't wait to go back
author: Goby Y.

description: I got the Jasmine Tea with Boba (normal sweetened) and I had never had a greet tea boba before and i absolutely loved it! It wasn't overly sweet and it had such good flavor! I will def be back for this!
author: Brittini S.

description:
There's definitely potential there and the mission can use a quality boba place (Quickly doesn't count).  They are opening a perm location on 19th and Valencia soon so the hours will surely improve. 

My main gripes here are that the boba was inconsistently cooked - some were perfectly chewy and tender and some were hard / way undercooked.  Another issue -- too sweet.  Might just be me, but I would prefer a little less sugar and more tea flavor.  

I tried both the milk tea and the soy tea -- the soy was especially sweet, the milk was better and I appreciate them using Strauss. 

My favorite boba in the city is Purple Kow and this boba didn't quite measure up, but I'm hoping they use this feedback to improve the product and I'll be back to try soon at their new location!
author: Elad C.

description:
Great tasting boba, great tasting tea, but why were the small cups not filled to the top??  That is not ok for $4.

I think the tea could use a stronger tea flavor but so far this is the best boba I've tasted in SF.
author: Melissa W.

description:
I love boba, so I had to see if the hype was true. When I got there, they had ran out of the regular milk tea, so I got the Jasmine, and it was amazing! The Jasmine was delicate and simply sublime, the milk was so silky, and the tapioca was cooked perfectly. The only negative is that it was a little too sweet. 

Bin Chen, one of the founders of Boba Guys,  was tending the bar and putting some blood, sweat, and tears down and I applaud his work ethic. This guy is awesome and I encourage you to try his delicious balls!
author: Soo L.

description: Hong Kong style bubble tea!  This is a great little bubble tea shop in Mission that offers oganic bubble tea with either almond jelly or the traditional tapioca ball versions.  The HK style one is nice because its not cloyingly sweet and has a good milky flavor from the organic condensed milk.
author: Alex R.

description: First time trying the Boba Guys. It's actually better than I expected. We've ordered the soy milk tea with almond jelly and the Hong Kong milk tea with grass jelly. The soy milk tea w/ almond jelly is very light with silky almond jelly and the Hong Kong milk tea has a strong milk tea aroma with savory sweetness from the condensed milk.
author: Ash L.

description:
Best Boba ever!  I had the classic milk tea with almond jelly.  I stopped drinking boba years ago after I found out most places use artificial dairy powder creamer.  Boba Guys use real Straus milk. It is not sugary sweet too, just perfect.

The almond jelly is so creative and has perfect texture and almond flavor.  I sure wish they had a boba shop in Palo Alto/Mt View area.  Love love love it.
author: Jun L.

description: Boba Guys is my favorite boba place in the bay area. I love their jasmine milk tea. All the staff are so nice! If it's not super full, they will take the time to talk to you about their teas. I also have had their kaya toast and its really good but it's really big: I was sharing it with a friend and it was a lot just to eat half of it!
author: Alex J.

description: SO GOOD! The horchata boba is everything everyone says it is (aka amazing) - the only downside is that it only comes in one size and it's pretty small :(
author: Natalie M.

description:
The actual tapoica is the best I've ever had: chewy without being gummy and slightly sweet. Looking forward to more tea flavors coming soon, but the important thing is Boba Guys has enormous potential since they're starting with the very best basic ingredients and creative ideas up their sleeves. 

Go here before this place gets too crazy popular.
author: Allison Y.

description: I don't know... artisinal boba? Lol. I get better boba from brands like Chatime and Quickly for less but with better taste. In terms of drinks I'd rather go for the mass produced legitimately Asian stuff. Makes me feel less pretentious too with better feels in my tastebuds.
author: Domo S.

description: Tried the Lychee Green Tea iced with boba and 25% sweetness.  Was very disappointed as I don't like the aftertaste of flowers and such.  Took a few sips but couldn't get myself to finish it.  Won't be ordering from here again.  :(
author: Ratany L.

description: I love that there's never a line.  I wish they had a few more drink options.  However, I can forgive since they offer Horchata boba - very unique and refreshing!
author: Meredith K.

description: I am confused and a bit tepid about Boba Guys. It feels like a boba shop for non-Chinese people. Black and white minimalist interior, and really limited menu. However the rose milk tea I had was good! I guess I just can't put boba and hipster together. I need my milk tea with a side of fob.
author: Thlel Yan D.

description:
Got the coconut green tea with almond milk. Hubby got the duke of earl grey with dairy milk. Both with tapioca balls.

Good stuff!!!
Really friendly staff.
This is going to develop into an addiction I can just feel it.
author: Faten A.

description: The milk tea is strong yet sweet, I love the Boba and their own home made almond jelly, it's very tasty and not so much watery , but rich in flavor and texture.
author: Kelly L.

description:
When I first met Bin (one half of the Boba Guys and a standup fellow) several months ago, he mentioned having begun work on a boba startup. Though I've been acquainted with a few entrepreneurs over the past couple of years, never before had I heard the words "boba" and "startup" used side by side (nor even with "Fett" sandwiched between). Many months down the road, their quintessentially Bay Area approach to milk tea has been unleashed upon the public, in the form of two simple products developed through exhaustively detailed testing: regular milk tea and soy milk tea with tapioca pearls in the Taiwanese mode.

Even though I suck at boba (generally going for a fruit freeze and skipping the tapioca, in the tradition of many silly white people like me), I had to taste their results on opening day. Oh, surprise, by which I mean, not a surprise, the boba is great and the tea refreshing, especially on a beautiful San Francisco summer day. They've also teamed up with Ken Ken Ramen (genius combo) to hawk their bevs in the front of the house, and though it wasn't too crowded on day one, I'd bet the lines are going to get considerably longer. My advice: make it boba time, and bring a friend.
author: Peter B.

description: Right off of Valencia you will find this cute little gem with yummy boba teas. It's my favorite stop before heading to Dolores park or walking around the Mission window shopping. I love the Macha tea with tapioca. Just a heads up- They're pretty popular, I've never been when there wasn't a line out the door, but it's always worth the wait!
author: Danielle L.

description: I love how they have special options of flavors off the beaten path (for instance one day they had a pumpkin spiced Boba). I love the traditional brands , but my lord the horchata flavor is OFF THE CHAIN. I like knowing the ingredients are so fresh . Service can be nuts on the weekends , but it's worth the wait
author: Lauren V.

description: I love their drinks. What keeps me coming back is their Jasmine milk tea with soy milk and tapioca pearls. Their pearls are perfect! Not much room to linger around but it's also located in the mission and always nice to walk around or head over to Dolores Park and sip on your awesome tea!
author: Soo-Lin H.

description: I've heard a lot about San Francisco lacking in quality boba places (South Bay does much better with this), but Boba Guys is pretty good! I don't think it's as authentic (maybe just because of their decor - it looks like they tried to give it a wannabe hipster coffee shop look) but I got the lychee milk green tea with honey instead of sugar and boba, and I thought it was delicious. Boba could be more chewy, but I'd come back if I was in the area.
author: Chrystal Z.

description:
tl;dr 

Overrated boba for hipsters.

---

Cred: I grew up in Taiwan and lived there for 18 years.

We dropped by here last night waiting for Ken Ken Ramen, and we had the pleasure of meeting one of the co-founders of the Boba Guys. As much as I commend him on his motivation and drive to innovate boba tea, his product honestly cannot compare to numerous, numerous boba places in San Francisco that are better and tastier.

I've got a sense that the Boba Guys are trying to be "different" compared to your standard boba place, but I feel like they're almost trying too hard. If something ain't broke, there's no need to fix it. I appreciate your motivation to seek out more interesting tea leaves for your teas, but if that means I have to pay more ($4? you're almost NYC pricing!) for a slightly more interesting flavor, I rather pay less ($2 at Tea Way or $2.85 at Purple Kow) for a less "exotic," but very solid milk tea.

Granted, they're still in their trial-and-error period, but their current product is completely unremarkable and their business would not survive in the Inner Richmond or the Irving area.

We tried the regular and the soy milk - I expected more soy flavor in the soy milk one, but being a lover of soy I commend them on their integration of soy into boba. Then again, you can get soy at Starbucks, so they can't get too many points for that.

Their regular milk tea falls flat, as there is clearly not enough tea flavor (it's pretty bland) and not a lot of milk flavor either...it's just very meh. I don't know what kind of tea leaves you use for your mlik tea, but even if it's a fine tea leaf, I unfortunately was not able to taste it very much. The owner said that a stronger tea flavor was one of the strongest feedback they got for their upcoming improved boba, and I solidly agree on this change.

The standout is their boba balls - their boba balls easily places them into the top quartile of boba balls that I've had in the states - it's the right balance between chewy and too-chewy, and having made numerous batches of boba balls myself, I commend them on their balance. However, as the owner admits himself we came at a great time for the boba, and if we came a few hours later (~9 PM) the boba would have become soft and mushy, so if they can maintain their boba quality consistently, then it would definitely be a plus at this boba place. 

Recommendations:
1. Check out Purple Kow on Balboa, and get their boba with any of their milk teas. If you want to see how to balance tea flavor, try their roasted oolong milk tea. 
2. More tea flavor is definitely great - especially see if you can find a tea flavor that's memorable because you'll need a tea that really distinguishes itself if you want to stand out in the SF boba market. In essence, you need a niche market like you're doing with the horchata, which is a step in the right direction. I'm not sure if you can directly compete with black and green (more "standard") milk teas (purely given what I've seen so far).
3. Kudos on the organic milk, but many boba places make drinks with fresh milk too...so what's the biggie?

2/5 stars for the product, +0.25 for the glass jugs (feels a bit kitschy though), +0.50 for the bar and the bartender (really cool to have boba at a bar counter!), +0.25 for the innovation to keep improving.

I'm sure that the Boba Guys will go places if they keep up their innovation and their drive, but they'll have to really distinguish themselves somehow if they want to move out of the Mission. Right now, I honestly don't think they can cater to that many more people than hipsters who would shell out $4 (and $1 for the bartender?) for a mediocre milk tea.
author: Chris S.

description: Boba Guys' drinks are so good. I was a customer ever since they were located in Ken Ken Ramen. My favorite drink has to be the rose milk tea that is slow dripped. It's the right amount of sweet and it really tastes like roses! I also really like the jasmine milk tea because it tastes more of brewed tea instead of milk. They use organic milk and brew their tea in tea leaves. It's $4 for a drink here, but it's worth it. I also tried the pandan macarons here, which were ok. Parking can be a hassle and the hours are really weird, but if you get the chance to try this place then do it!
author: Vivian L.

description: This place was okay, not the best tea I've ever had.  And I love tea.  I got the Thai tea with grass jelly,  the jelly was hard and didn't taste like grass jelly.  Thai tea didn't have the flavor I was expecting either.  $4 for one size.
author: Trynh K.

description: I had tried most of the boba places in the city, and I like this place for its fresh ingredients. You could taste the quality of the tea. The mason jars also add a hipster touch.  However, it is $4 for a small cup, and I don't think the quality is justified for the price. Service is also very slow, especially if all the teas are already pre-made, and all the bartender had to do is to pour the pre-mixed teas in the cups.
author: Joy C.

description:
One star mainly due to sub par customer service from the owner no less, and the fact that their boba does not taste any better than something you can get on Clement street. 

First impressions are important. I got to Boba guys on a Sunday and got in line and waited approx 20 minutes. The owner talked to all the patrons before me and offered the guy in front of me a sample. When it was my turn I felt the level of service was different, the owner took my order and that was it. No sample, no small talk, not even a thank you; just nothing. It would not have bothered me as much, except he was not like that with the people in front of me or behind me.
I guess I'm not the type of patron he wants in his boba spot.

The actual Boba was highly forgettable as well, not worth the trek to the mission or the long line. I think it is mainly marketing since when it comes to flavor, their boba was not discernible from a boba you could get from Quickly.

Needless to say, I will not be going back.
author: Piers Y.

description: Finally got to try this place out about 3 weeks ago. I shared the HK style boba and it was meh. Initially, it was incredibly sweet even after mixing it, however, since 3/4 of my cup was filled with ice...it lessen the sweetness. But almost $5 for watered down boba, no thanks.
author: Jessica Z.

description: I highly recommend the HorchataBoba ! Great customer service. It gets really busy in there. You have to look for parking.
author: Jennifer G.

description: If you are finicky about a good bubble tea, like me, then you'd want to head straight to Bobba Guys! I love bubble tea, and I have tried it at a lot of different places, but nothing comes close to Bobba Guys. Their thai tea is my favourite and I would definitely recommend trying it out.
author: Manisha D.

description: My housemates and I come to this spot on a regular basis and really like the tapioca here. The ingredients are great-tasting and the servers are willing to adjust your choice - I've never had to - there are also 5 levels of sweetness so it is helpful for those that have particular choices. I usually get the Hong Kong or classic milk tea with no sweetness and boba, and haven't had to wait in line the times I've been. We've been introducing people to the place since going. They also let me charge my phone once on a rainy night so brownie points for being nice!
author: H C.

description:
This is the only place where I have found boba pearls very flavorful. Slightly sweet and chewy. Just right!! I have tried several other places but none like this. Bit pricy but tastes great. 

The flavors (of the tea, fruit) are so subtle that you can't get enough of it. I had lychee milk tea and it is the best I had so far, compared to other boba places in the city.
author: Su R.

description:
Officially 4-stars, but Boba Guys gets that "5-stars mention in the review" for being a great boba-joint in The Mission!

In my opinion, the best boba-joints in San Francisco are: Wonderful Dessert on Irving & PurpleKow on Balboa.  Considering the hipsters don't make it to the left side of the city, I can see why many would say Boba Guys is the best in the city.
author: Anthony B.

description: When I found out this place sold Horchata Boba tea, it was a dream come true. Unfortunately, my expectations led me to become disappointed with my own Horchata Boba Milk Tea. I had the option of choosing sweetness, but I got the default 100% sweetness. That was the reason for my main disappointment as I felt that my drink was not sweet at all. My drink tasted like a water and milk with a hint of cinnamon, not the sweet taste of Horchata I'm used to. The Boba pearls were good however, despite being on the soft chewy side. Compared to my favorite boba places on Irving Street, Boba Guys is a sub-par attempt.
author: Rond Allen D.

description: Hipster boba spot. If you want something more authentic, try chinatown. The tea itself is somewhat watered down. I need to give props for the perfect boba though.
author: Claudia Z.

description: Iced matcha latte and Hong Kong style milk tea are definitely worth trying. Ask for extra ice because it is not cold enough when you get it. But when the ice settles, it tastes really good. It's a little on the pricey side and the location is really random.. Boba in the mission district? Definitely a hipster boba spot but it is really good. Service is alright, nothing to rave about. They also sell macarons but every time I come, they're already sold out.
author: Brenda K.

description: Got the jasmine milk tea with pearls, 50% sweet and it was perfect. Love the concept of using fresh brewed teas and organic milk to make the milk teas instead of powdered stuff! Tried matcha with avocado and 100% sweet, I would recommend that you  have them cut the sweetness back on that one as the sweetness was too much and made it almost inedible for me. Would definitely go back and to try some of the fancy other teas with milk and pearls or almond jelly (made in house)!
author: C L.

description: Heard great things about this place so I decided to try it. I've come multiple times hoping to find the perfect drink, but their drinks taste too watered down. The flavor is bland. Atmosphere is nice, but the drinks are subpar
author: Katrina A.

description: I prefer other milk tea places. I don't even remember what drink I got. I just remembered wishing to have less ice in my drink. Small place. Limited seating by the window.
author: C. C.

description: I tried the Hong Kong style milk tea with grass jelly here. Not too as good as I expected.  The line was outside the store, but the wait wasn't too long. Maybe I will try something different next time.
author: Suki W.

description: My favorite place to get boba in sf :). It's fast, easy to get to and satisfying. The jasmine and horchata are my favorite :)!
author: Colette P.

description:
I wanted to visit here bc of all the hype. So much hype my friend from NYC asked if I've ever had Boba Guys. I guess that's saying something about how popular it is. 

My recent visit to the Mission just had to involve Boba Guys. They are famous for the HK Style Milk Tea, but I really couldn't hand over $4 for HK Style Milk Tea. I'm too used to less than $1 HK Milk Teas in Hong Kong. So I settled for Thai Tea with the grass jelly. While waiting to order, I couldn't help but notice all the food was sold out and how people actually sat there and worked. Like a coffee shop, except for milk tea. That was pretty cool.

On to the actual product - the Thai Tea was very sweet and it did taste good. As for the grass jelly, it screams out homemade. It was a bit hard and had the bumpy edges that come along with the dried tops of home made jelly.

All in all.. Boba Guys was not as amazing as I hoped. And really expensive for what I got.
author: Elaine S.

description: We love the drinks here the only thing is the boba is a bit on the hard side other than that service and quality are the best!
author: Yvonne T.

description:
Best boba hands down.  It's definitely worth the $4.  The milk tea was steeped to perfection as was the ratio of milk to tea.  My only complaint with the actual drink is that I wished it was served a little bit more chilled, but I'm just being nit-picky.  

I would give it five stars except that this heavenly bubble tea establishment is only opened 5 minutes a week.  Okay, so I'm exaggerating, but 6pm-9pm?  I have shed many tears while staring at their closed doors in disbelief.  But seriously, who can sleep after a caffeinated drink filled with beautiful dancing tapioca?
author: Carmen D.

description:
1 star for the tasty boba. But thats about it. Not recommended.

Too bad they only gave about 2 tablespoons. I usually like a boba with every sip, but this was super low on the balls!

Walked in on a Saturday afternoon. The service was slow. The guys were just chatting among themselves while slowlyyyy taking my order and slowlyyy making the actual drink. Didn't seem interested in their customer service.

Ordered the soy and regular milk tea. Couldn't tell what the difference was since it was so watered down :( and they also did not inform me which was which.

And finally, the $4 left me feeling totally ripped off. I went down the street for a delicious Arinell's pizza for $3  and some Birite for $4.50
author: E T.

description: Great quality Boba tea. Unlike regular boba tea places, which often is overwhelmed with syrup, one can actually taste the tea and all the ingredients. The tapioca are chewy and well done. Would definitely recommend for boba tea lover or any one wanting a quality cup of cold drink.
author: J Y.

description: I'm really confused because either people who have reviewed this place haven't had boba in socal or they're people from the inside.  The boba here is $4 and there were only 3 choices when I went there.  The selection was between milk tea, jasmine tea and soy milk. The boba was a little too well done that it sticks to your teeth when you chew it.  The milk tea was very bland and not sweet enough.  I already know milk tea is super unhealthy so bring on the sugar!  Not sure if the tea was freshly brewed and if they made it there on the spot because I was a little distracted.  Overall, MEH.
author: Steven S.

description: I love Jasmine milk tea and every time I go to a boba joint, I always compare this drink. It's more tea flavor and I definitely love it! I don't normally order boba in my drink because more than half the time it's not the right chewiness and flavorful but their boba was perfect!! When I'm back in the city, I'll definitely stop by here again
author: Jess J.

description:
Expensive compared to the usual Asain boba joints, yes.

But the taste and quality of the ingredients are worth it.

You can select your sweetness level. I prefer less sweet.
author: Evan W.

description:
One cannot untaste the deliciousness of Boba Guys. This wouldn't be a problem, but now it's impossible to go back to those other boba shops that rely on powders, non-dairy creamers, and sweeteners made for the pallets of children at McDonalds/hummingbirds. 

Definitely try the Slow Bar.
author: Derick L.

description: When I stop by BG, my go to drink is the Hong Kong style with almond jelly. They usually make it to my liking but this time was BLAH. This time it tasted very bland and as if the gal forgot to put in the condensed milk. Also, it had a bitter aftertaste. Disappointed.
author: Kim N.

description: We got boba soy milk tea from their pop-up in the front of Ken Ken Ramen. It was delicious and we could taste that it was made with real tea. If you have it in house, you can sit at the bar and drink from mason jars which looked quite fun. The tapioca balls themselves were yummy too. Highly recommended.
author: Amy D.

description:
I think they're on the right track to something great, but it's not quite there yet. The guys are great and super friendly. They'll talk to you and tell you everything you want to know about their business and how they got started, but the actual product still has a few kinks to work out...

It's a bit on the pricey side, and I laughed when I saw the review that called it "boba for hipsters" since it's funny, but I guess I couldn't have put it better myself. I get that its hard to contend w/ the big asian boba chains, but for the price I wish they threw in one of their cute mason jar cups!

TIP: I'm going to wait it out a bit and give them another try in a few months :)
author: Kristen C.

description: Had the iced matcha latte. Sad they don't have bigger sizes because it was so delicious! Only suggestion is adding a bit more ice to the drink. I understand how annoying it is to get a drink that fills the cup with 75% ice. But the ice in my drink melted within the first 5 mins. The entire time I was drinking my tea it was still on the warm side.  Nonetheless the flavor was amazing. And the tapioca balls were the best I've tasted in a boba drink yet. Still getting 5 stars in my book. Next time I'll ask for extra ice ;)
author: Lissette V.

description: Finally got to try this place! I came here on a Monday evening, so it was quiet. I was the only person there and I was thrilled there was no line! I got the Hong Kong Milk Tea with Condensed Milk and Grass Jelly. I am a big fan of grass jelly and that was not good grass jelly. I had a giant piece of grass jelly and not only that you couldn't even get any through the straw so after you finish your drink, you had to eat these giant chucks of grass jelly. Other than the giant grass jellys...the tea itself was delicious! I love how it's all organic and the price is ok- sorta expensive at $4 for a drink. I wish there were more on the menu because I'm use to my traditional boba place with a gazillion choices but this will do if you need that boba craving away from the Sunset/Richmond area.
author: Nancy L.

description: A-ok. The boba were a bit hard and gummy and the milk tea not as flavorful as you'd expect for the $4 premium price tag.  But I guess you're paying for the hype, the straus milk and the grade A tapioca balls, whatever that means.  Soy milk also available.  You can find them at 3378 18th St with Ken Ken Ramen.  So far open at least once a week after 12pm but hours may change so you have to follow them on twitter or something. Or you can go to Wonderful Foods and pay $2.70 for a better version that might not have the branding boba guys does, but who wants to go to the Sunset?
author: kiwi l.

description: Hong Kong style Boba tea was good.  Boba was soft and added a nice flavor.  Drink could've been a tad sweeter, but pretty good nonetheless.  Fun and friendly staff.
author: Sunny J.

description: I'll keep this simple: Small. Expensive. Below average classic milk tea. Hard boba that I dislike.
author: Kevin G.

description: I was lucky enough to be back in the Mission yesterday so we stopped by Boba Guys. I got the same thing as I did last week - three macaroons (pandan & mango) and two classic milk teas (no boba & no ice). Five stars all around for every single thing. It was an awesome day.
author: Connie W.

description: Literally amazing - best bubble tea I've ever had. Every flavor I've tried is amazing: matcha, horchata, Thai tea, lavender, matcha mango. All SO GOOD.
author: A H.

description: Parked in front of this place and there was a line out front, went to grab brunch and  came back there was still a line! Okay I was full but at that point I had to check this place out! My bf ordered horchata with boba and I ordered jasmine milk tea 50% sweet with boba.... I liked mine it wasn't overly sweet but not enough to finish it, but I do like the  horchata one more and he did finished his! I didn't see they have almond jelly, so I will return to try that and gets horchata next trip.
author: Joyce E.

description: Americanized bubble tea. They have only a few flavors, but this is a bad name for bubble tea. Not authentic at all. I did not enjoy it. Expensive for the price.
author: Vicky L.

description: The liquid (coffee milk tea) was good, but the pearls themselves were undercooked and crunchy. Not a huge fan.
author: Michelle H.

description:
wow, i never though i would do a one star review if i could this would be a zero star review... i was so excited to try you guys out, I was extra excited that you guys deliver..but that's where it ends, i try to do some research on there website to get some information about delivery which didn't have much infomation..So i decided to contact them under contacts on there website...one week without reply, 7/01 i though i give them another chance and i placed a order for 30 drinks for 7/5...now 7/2 @ about 4pm i got a email saying there busy and under staff.. oh well i guess there doing so good they don't need my business....

update 7/03 i just got a email from andrew and i have to say it takes class to personally email a customer..
author: jonathan h.

description: I'm pretty picky when it comes to bubble milk tea. I refuse to go to places that don't allow you to adjust the sweetness and the ice. I prefer places that offer loose leaf tea. So Boba Guys is exactly the kind of place I want to like. I appreciate the use of fresh ingredient, real milk, real sugar, and real tea. My gripe? The texture of the boba was not consistent. For paying almost $5 for a cup, I expect the boba to be slightly sweet with texture that is soft yet firm and melts in your mouth when you bite into them. The boba was good. Better than most places. Most of them were soft, melting in my mouth, so sweet, when I bit into them. But a noticeable portion the boba were firmer and chewier than others and were not melt-in-your-mouth good. I guess not all of them were fully cooked? Or maybe the boba wasn't as fresh? We did order at like 8 pm, which is near closing time. Other than that, my matcha latte was great.
author: Amy B.

description: I came here the other day with a few friends. I ordered the horchata drink, which I thought was good. It's not amazing in my opinion as I've heard from others, but good. I was really debating on getting the matcha latte instead but I got to try it from my friend. I also got to try the HK milk tea and Jasmine milk tea from my other friends. I loved the matcha latte! Jasmine milk tea tasted very fragrant in a good way. If I come here again I think I'd skip the horchata and get either the matcha latte or the Jasmine milk tea. It also so happened to be their 2 year anniversary and they gave away pins to celebrate, which was cute. The workers seemed friendly and attentive. There's definitely limited seating inside. Being in a group of 5 I felt like we were taking up half of their space. Thankfully they are quick on their orders, as others have pointed out, so you can be in and out pretty quickly. I'd definitely come here again if I happen to be in the area.
author: Connie C.

description: Checked out this place when I was visiting SF a week ago.  By far an away the best Boba I have had for the price.   Seriously though, the milk tea was sweet and tasty and for the cost is less than most stuff you would buy at a Yardsale.  Don't let the prices deter you into thinking this is low quality stuff though.   I am going to make this my goto boba tea shop whenever I am in the yay area.
author: Andrew Y.

description:
I was craving a bubble tea and this place was closest to me so I stopped in and was surprised how busy the place was. 

The bobas were the perfect texture, and I finished them just as I finished the tea, what perfect timing! The service was great and the atmosphere was perfect. Would definately be stopping by here with friends next time im in the mood for some HK style milk tea!
author: Alan L.

description:
Not impressed even with all the hype. I get the concept, hipster-ish/trendy boba place with unique flavors such as horchata. I did enjoy, however, the quality of my Jasmine Milk Tea. I barely like it sweet and the taste was on point. 

But, the boba itself was overly chewy and really, really sweet. This is not the best place in the city, but a fun novelty if you're in the area.
author: 3beeskitchen ..

description: Best boba I've had in SF! Though on the pricy side ($4.00 for milk tea) I think it's worth it. Chewy, flavorful boba and no powder in the milk tea. Line is also never long considering how good it is and how long the line is at other places like T-pumps. Yum!
author: Jordan M.

description: I had to try Boba Guys since all my friends talk about it all the time. I finally tried it a few weeks back with my friend (also his first). I got the horacha my first time and jasmine milk tea the second time. Am I impressed? No, but it's not bad. I like the concept of Boba Guys, I really do, but milk tea to me will always be milk tea. Hey! At least it's not the powder crap you'll get from Quicky's or Tapioca Express.
author: Edgar G.

description: I had the HK boba and I thought it was pretty good. They don't user powder and it wasn't too sweet and the tapioca was good as well.
author: Eric S.

description: Not impressed. Watered down, bland. 25% sugar tasted like no sugar. Nothing like Sharetea. I also hate the fact my cashier looked at the iPad during me signing the order and I felt obligated to tip. Terrible.
author: Jeanne C.

description: Limited choices. the 2 drinks I tried- both $4- are hong kong style milk tea with almond jelly & classic milk tea with boba. They were both good quality & tasting. The classic tastes different from the usual milk tea & is less sweet than the hong kong one. Both my boyfriend & I like the classic better. They gave a lot of jelly though.
author: Angelica L.

description:
Pretty awesome tapioca joint. Even though the place was hard to locate, as well as the seating in the facility, the milk tea they have is well worth the difficulties. I went with a group of friends, which included a fanatic jasmine milk tea drinker known as my girlfriend, and we all tried each of the milk teas they offered. They were all relatively slightly above standard, and only the jasmine milk tea stood out! It was rather fragrant and flavorful at the same time even though it is pre-made and poured out of a container stuffed in a bar fridge. The boba, however, is the reason that allowed me to click 4 stars instead of 3. Although it is just normal freaking boba... we could all taste the difference because we drink this stuff on a daily basis. The texture wasn't like overnight hard, but it had a harder and chewier yet still sweet and fresh taste to it! It was something unique. Get the jasmine milk tea with tapioca, and I hope you see what I am talking about!
Oh, and the 1 star off is for minor inconveniences.. short hours, hard to find, limited seating, etc.
author: Kev L.

description: Cool logo, but overhyped, overpriced.  Their prices don't include boba.
author: xxxx x.

description: Heard this place from my colleague. Can see that they use good quality milk and tea to make their signature drinks. Just that they need to fix the dripping water of their air con in front of the door. Place is tiny but the quality is pretty good.
author: Fatima L.

description: I had the muscat oolong milk tea. Didn't have a strong milk tea taste I was expecting. It's mediocre average with an above average price at $5.50. I'd prefer Quickly over this place.
author: Garrick G.

description: this place is perfect for the hipster crowd. local ingedients (i.e. Straus Family milk). all  modern, white and trendy decor. a random aardvark logo for who knows what reason. i'm not hipster, but i dig it too! the tapioca was perfectly cooked. just enough elasticity in the balls (that's what she said ?? haha). they weren't serving the Hong Kong tea or the coffee jelly yet, which was unfortunate because that's exactly what i went there for, but i suppose i'll be back in a few weeks to give it another shot. also, the black sesame/lemon curd cupcake was delicious. i wish it had a smidge more sesame flavor but it won't stop me from getting another one another time.
author: Regina C.

description: Absolute best boba place in the city!!! Awesome environment and awesome boba! These people care more about getting it right than any one else! The jasmine and rose milk teas are my absolute favorites! The pearls are always consistent and delicious!!!
author: Greg M.

description:
Went here today after seeing friends' photos of milk tea and boba in Mason jars and thought, "How hipster!" I knew coming in that the price was high ($4 compared to Teaway Express's $1.07) but I thought it would be worth it. It really wasn't. I got the Hong Kong style milk tea expecting it to be sweet and creamy with condensed milk-- it wasn't. It was very watery and thin. The tapioca itself is average-- good flavor, average texture; not as soft as Tpumps's honey boba. Also, my drink didn't even come in a mason jar! Disappointment all around. I didn't really like my boyfriend's iced matcha latte. 
Honestly I love the attitude and lifestyle of the neighborhood, especially since I live nearby. However it really irked me and my elitist view of being Asian and knowing boba when people come in here not knowing a thing about tapioca. But that's just my own personal tick. 
The one saving grace so far was the green tea cotton candy. It was a little shocking at first, strong, slightly salty matcha with sweet sugar, but it was soon addicting.
author: Malia B.

description: I tried the jasmine milk tea....too sweet for my taste buds, killed the jasmine tea flavor. i've had better for cheaper.
author: Helen T.

description: Pretty cool place. Almond jelly doesnt really taste anything out of the ordinary, feels artificial. Matcha was cool but probably taste better without the jelly and just with boba. I definitelly need to go back to try the other drinks. Logo is awesome tho.
author: Karen J.

description: Boba guys is a friendly boba store! One of my favorite spots to visit when I'm in the mission. Glad they have nice employees, good location, and fast service. My favorite drink so far has been the Jasmine Milk Tea (w/almond milk)! i go there often and reccomend it to many of my friends.
author: Emma D.

description: Because there are so many great boba joints in Los Angeles, I didn't think I would ever have an experience that would change the way I think about the drink. That is until I dropped in on Boba Guys while visiting friends in San Francisco. Sure they use fresh ingredients, and fancy milk but what is most important is the recipe and these guys have a winner. Not too sweet, perfect creaminess, and a soft rich tea flavor. Suddenly, I felt as though I had never truly enjoyed milk tea until that moment. Well done team. Well done.
author: Ezekiel S.

description: Neat idea. Good boba. A bit pricey. They need more flavors!
author: Margaret R.

description: Being a regular of Purple Kow, Tuttimelon, Infinity Tea, Tuttimelon, and Quickly, I can appreciate a wide variety of tapioca places. This place is by far my least favorite; they only have 8 flavors, all milk teas, and they ran out of boba mid-afternoon and skimped our cups. I see a photo below of a boba cup from there with only 1 layer of tapoica balls in it, I'd say that's about how hi both my my tea's were. And for $5 each i felt ripped off. I could have gotten horchata at a mexican place or thai iced tea at a thai place for half the price. I will never come back here. If I pay $5 for boba, I want boba!!
author: Brian G.

description: Boba milk teas taste good but just good. Super over prized though. I think it's worth a try but not something you can spend 2.75 like at quickly.
author: Jordi R.

description:
i was excited for the concept

i'm a fan of the awesome service (letting me tweek my drink a bit, asking if i liked it afterwards and offering to redo if not..gold, hopefully this perk doesn't get taken advantage of/ruined)

the boba?

that kind of needs work. 

maybe it was because i had a slight buzz from my drink earlier and dessert..but biting into that boba, it was not as soft as I'd like (morning brew cafe and that ramen place in sfc does better) 

and it was a bit too sweet for boba.

i love sweet and sugar so its rare you'll see me say something is too sweet.

will be back to try again, tho
author: Whitne Y.

description: I love Boba Guys! Top tier boba on my list. High quality tea you can taste. Minus 1 star for the customer service. Unfortunately, the folks behind the counter usually aren't the most friendly and welcoming.
author: Melanie N.

description: My first organic boba it was good but nothing amazing. I guess good to know there aren't any artificial flavorings in what I'm drinking
author: Karen T.

description:
This place has really gone downhill. The last time I was there, the boba were super hard and I am pretty certain that, based on the weird sour tinge, they had gone bad. I wouldn't normally write a negative review, but it's been this bad the last 6 or 7 times I've visited. It's strange because the price is a little higher than most other boba places. 

I can't imagine that anyone with great things to say have been to this place in the last 3 months. It started out great in June/July, but it's slowly going downhill. I'd even recommend chains like Quickly over this now.
author: Ravi S.

description: Best boba in town period! All the flavors are well tested and top quality ingredients from various areas. You must try it and agree with me!
author: Brian Y.

description:
4 stars for making boba milk tea with real milk and not that creamer crap you see at all the other boba places. If you see boxes of coffee mate piled up (ahem Tpumps), RUN! They are serving you crap.

Pluses: quality milk tea with quality ingredients. Soft and chewy boba, but my favorite is the classic black tea with almond jelly. 

Minuses: I think their jasmine milk tea is a little weak and can use more tea flavor. Their sweetness level is inconsistent and they seem to change it on a whim maybe based on a couple of reviews. First time I had it, it was overly sweet. The second time was perfect, but the last time was bland.
