For guys in lab coats, you'd think they'd take a more scientific approach to making their drinks and make it more consistent. Their new permanent store has been opened for maybe a month or two now and it still kind of looks like they just moved in. It's kind of a small storefront, so any clutter looks like a lot of disorganized clutter. Milk tea could be creamier.

I love that they use real milk though, so I will keep supporting their business!
author: Trinh N.

description: The horchata boba was a-ok with me. Definitely interesting! I told the cashier that while sipping on boba in Vietnam I had an idea to combine the two and bust into the Latino market, LOL! If you're into the overly sugary boba drinks (no judgment, I indulge too) this place might not be for you?
author: Josie C.

description: I don't get why it costs $4 for a  boba drink??? I get that they use organic milk but half the cup is ice and there's hardly any boba or jelly! They don't even make it fresh in front of you. It's just poured from a container. I'm not getting what is making it any different from the other boba places.  The macaron for $2 is also too expensive for what it is. The consistency is so dense it's like eating a cake.
author: Dana S.

description: Decent drinks but the place is super cramped and it takes about 15 min to get your drink even if there are not many people there. They also run out of boba and other toppings, which is funny because that's their main product. Overall, friendly staff and God drinks but horribly slow and inefficient.
author: Emily D.

description:
Yet another place that has been sold to me via hype.  Three stars because it looks cute, has an interesting menu, and a pretty sweet location.  In terms of taste, it was all right.  Not quite what I was expecting, as I'm used to my tea coming from Sunset, the San Mateo area, Milpitas, and LA...so I have an idea of the kinds of boba that I personally enjoy.  The service was okay, which is saying a lot for a place that boasts what so many SF joints seem to love boasting about.  When I go to Asian tea places, I already expect bad service.  That's just how it is.  I figured this place would be a bit more welcoming, though they're damn quick with the main milk tea menu.

I ordered what I usually get at milk tea places: honey milk tea.  This counted as a "slow bar" item, but I convinced myself it was worth the wait.  In the end, it was all right; I' just glad I had a group to chat with during my wait time for okay-ish tea.  I'm terribly picky about my boba, to the point where I won't usually order it until I've tried a friend's drink.  The texture I go for is a firmer boba, with just enough chewiness -- thus, I tend to think that most boba I get is too chewy.  You do not have to agree with me on this.  Now, texture-wise, the boba here was fine, but I didn't get much flavor from it.  I think I would have been better off just getting the tea on its own, but that seemed silly, as the place IS called "Boba Guys".  I'd try the tea by itself next time, but at $4 a pop, I'd rather head to a tea shop and get a pot of loose leaf with more flavors...if I'm just getting tea minus the portability.

I believe that the Food Snob in everyone's group will probably enjoy this place, but if you're used to milk teas that you could afford from middle school onward, it might take some convincing.  I wouldn't come out here for this, but it's an experience that might shift some opinions if people are unwilling to try milk tea at a typical boba place.  If the words "local" and "artisanal" make your ears perk up, this place is for you.  I dunno, maybe I'm just not classy enough.  I'll take stuff that tastes like childhood over this any day.
author: Robbin A.

description:
It appears a lot of the "reviews" on this place are made by friends and family.  I've been drinking boba before these guys even had a driver's license. This is just overpriced boba service with the marketing that it's some "high end" boba which in fact it is not. The pearls weren't well cooked and the tea taste the same as any other place that sells this stuff for $2-$3.

Save your money and time. Not good enough to warrant the excessive price.
author: Jerry L.

description: Great Japanese Pork Curry with Kabocha! Wash it down with a boba milk tea. The Boba Guys are good and hot!
author: Flynt I.

description: very good boba. a little too sweet for me. would love it if they had more options that did not involve milk (i.e. jasmine, green tea, etc).
author: Tasha D.

description: delicious boba - just the right texture and the thai tea is to die for.
author: Sarah W.

description: Jasmine milk tea and boba is the drink to have here. Just enough sweetness but the boba was a little hard for my liking. Really cute atmosphere, limited seating, but the smell of curry is real enticing. Have to come back to try the curry and the alcoholic boba! Tried the original black milk tea but it was very sweet. On the other hand the soy milk tea tastes just like vita soy milk boxes. The waitress working the bar seemed to enjoy working there and holding conversations with the customers. Have to give it another try to see if the experience changes.
author: Nicole L.

description:
Surprised I haven't written a review yet of this place.  

BEST BOBA IN THE CITY!  There are a few reasons this place is tops in no particular order.

1)  Customer service is excellent.  They constantly want to improve and enjoy feedback.  They seriously want to be the place to go.  

2)  Consistency - The product is always great.  The boba is the correct texture and taste each time.  The tea is perfectly brewed. 

3)  Great Ingredients - They use Strauss milk and brew real tea.  These things make a huge difference so you don't have weird aftertastes, powdery textures or other unpleasant experiences.  

I don't buy boba often but when I do, I make sure to go to Boba Guys!
author: Scott L.

description: I was excited to try this place as I am pretty tired of those typical milk teas from Teaway, Quickly's, T-Pump and etc. I ordered the jasmine tea w/boba and it was on point! They use homemade syrup and organic milk! Nothing can top that off!
author: Janny W.

description: I came in with certain expectations about this place. I heard some good things and saw a $4 price tag for a regular size so I expected better than what I received. I thought that they brewed each tea to order but mine came out in under a minute so I guess that didn't happen like I had initially thought. I ordered the regular milk tea with less boba. The milk tea was lacking in flavor, pretty watered down. The boba was inconsistent. Some were chewy on the outside but hard on the inside, some were ok. I can appreciate the fresh quality ingredients but when I get my boba drinks, I need the basics to be down pat before anything else.
author: Wilson T.

description: Boba guys is awesome! It's near my school so it's convenient. I tried jasmine milk tea, classic milk tea and Hong Kong style milk tea and hk style milk tea is way too sweet. I recommend classic though. One thing they can improve is OPEN EARLIER! So when us students get off campus lunch can get some boba! Should consider open at around 11 am instead of 2pm....
author: Anna L.

description:
Bartenders serving tapioca is what sets apart this place from others. I guess it's their way of reaching out to a different audience. I'm not going to lie, their tapioca was really good. Milk tea was good, not the best and I could definitely get the same quality somewhere else. There was too much ice and it watered down my horchata. It was worth a try. . even for $4.00

It was a little difficult to find because I didn't know that it was sharing space with the restaurant. I wasn't sure I was in the right place until I asked for the drink menu.
author: Tiffany P.

description: This does not taste like what you would expect a boba drink to taste. It's more for the health crazed people who wants organic drinks. I had the matcha milk green tea with grass jelly and boba. The grass jelly seemed a little hard and the milk tea wasn't sweet enough nor tasted like tea. It was more of a watered down taste or like a wheatgrass kind of taste. Menu was a bit different which was cool since they offered almond jelly but not much drink options like a typical boba shop would have. Some people may like it but it just wasn't for me, I prefer the sweet good o stuff.
author: Judy N.

description: Had a friend bring me some while they were there. The tea was more on the milky side and the bobas were average tasting. Not a bad spot for some milk tea and glad they're using local ingredients. I'll probably have to pop in myself to give some other drinks a try.
author: Annie D.

description:
The tapioca was really fresh, soft, and good! But the regular milk tea wasn't spectacular, it definitely was not worth $4.

On the other hand, my friend got the jasmine milk tea and it was very flavorful and worth the $4!!
author: Shelley W.

description: Went to the location and they weren't even open on the holiday hours posted around their store.
author: Justin K.

description: The quality of boba has definitely changed, not as soft and chewy as it was before. I ordered a regular boba and the boba was hard and the milk tea itself was no good. Pretty bummed about it since they used to be my favorite boba place in the city.
author: Ella P.

description: Used to come to this joint when it was a pop-up in Ken Ken Ramen. I'm a boba tea junkie and had to get my fix. I practically lived on bubble tea during my pregnancy and I considered moving to the Mission just to save time on my daily commute there. Then, they opened up their shop shortly before I left San Francisco. I like their clean look and the fact that they actually use real tea. I love being able to actually taste the tea flavor. My favorite is the jasmine, but I also like the original black tea and the horchata. I don't see any of the dreaded colored powders and the Strauss milk is a big plus. This is still my first stop when I fly in from JFK to visit my parents. My toddler knows that momma has to stop for her tea and always tries to take a swig. I was almost late for my return flight last time because I needed to get one to hold me over until my next visit. Please consider opening a location in Brooklyn or NYC! I would be there like e'ry day.
author: Katie L.

description: Great teas and awesome selection,  but long lines. Super friendly staff. Try the homemade almond jelly instead of tapioca balls.
author: Sandra S.

description: Boba guys do not live up to their slogan.."we take boba and tea to the next level". Tastes watered-down.  This review is coming from 3 ppl who are avid milk tea drinkers.
author: Thanh L.

description: Tried both house and soy milk tea.  I love that it's from real tea and milk, not from some powder.  The soy milk overpowered the tea, so I like the house blend more.  Will go back to try their jasmine tea!   :)
author: Mandy C.

description:
This is Boba on hipster. I'm not real uppity about my boba. I really just wanted a caramel milk tea with some coffee jelly and pearls but alas there was none of that to go around. 

I got the coffee tea with half boba and half almond jelly. 
The coffee tea was good and the pearls were a great consistency. The almond milk jelly was not great. I would definitely skip that option- it separated in my cup and it looked like I had milk curds floating in it. 


Overall, if you're in the area and MUST get boba then go for it but skip the jelly.
author: K F.

description: Tapioca here is over-hyped. The tapioca balls are way to sweet filled with a lot of sugar and on the hard chewy side. Had the typical milk tea and it was okay, but nothing to die for to come to the mission district for.
author: Timothy W.

description:
Words cannot even express how much I love Boba Guys.

Listen up guys, I have been to millions and millions of Boba places. Heck! I even worked at one. Let me tell you that no ones milk tea can measure up to Boba Guys. NO ONE. Sure it took a try or two to actually find out how to attain one of these miraculously amazing milk teas but the search was so worth it. 
So here's the deal, they don't actually have their own store because they're only available in the ramen shop which isn't the greatest thing.. I have to admit, it's awfully confusing but just walk in the ramen shop and sit your butt down at the bar. After that, everything will be worth it and you'll forget about being confused. 
So I got the regular milk tea and my friend got the jasmine milk tea. Unfortunately they didn't have tapioca so we decided to try the almond jelly. Usually I hate all kinds of jelly except tapioca so that was being risky for my usual taste. When they brought the cute glasses/ mason jars, I just wanted to take it home!!! (don't worry, i didn't) As we took the first sips of our milk tea, our minds were blown!!! All I could think of is "WHY IS THIS SO DARN AMAZING???" It has the perfect tea to milk ratio and the jelly wasn't overwhelmingly sweet or fake tasting. I CANNOT WAIT TO COME BACK. So now ... here's the bad points of this place (sadly, every place does have it's bad points..) One, the parking sucks!!! I recommend you take the bus out here or something.. Two, this place is confusing to get to because there's no sign or anything. Three, the area is not so safe so just be careful and four, it CAN get extremely busy!! Five, the milk tea is on the ... "expensive" side. But you get what you pay for. Obviously Quickly or Teaway's 99 cents isn't gonna make your taste buds jumping for joy.
You have been warned of Boba Guy's awesomeness.
author: Susie N.

description: I really enjoyed their jasmine milk tea!  I had the regular milk tea as well which wasn't as good, but the jasmine was delicious.  The boba was nice and chewy and sweet and the tea was great.  They also have spiked drinks, but didn't check those out.  If you're in the area and are craving good boba they are recommended!
author: Sophia D.

description:
I wish this place had a sign outside saying "Boba Guys" because it took me forever to find this place. It's hidden inside this Japanese ramen restaurant, I believe. I'm from Orange County (where boba stores are literally in every corner), and I just had to satisfy my boba cravings during my trip to San Fran. I decided to hit up this place due to its high ratings on Yelp. 

I was a bit disappointed because it wasn't what I expected it to be. The boba place is a small bar area that's located inside a Japanese restaurant. There wasn't much variety to choose from in the menu; they only had original milk tea, soy milk tea and jasmine milk tea. All of their milk teas are pre-made in pitchers that just sit on the counter. So once you order, they just pour out the milk tea into a glass and serve it to you. 

My boyfriend ordered a spiked jasmine milk tea and I ordered a regular jasmine milk tea. He took a few sips and didn't like it at all. I guess it was simply tasteless. Alcohol and milk tea does not go well together.. My jasmine milk tea was alright. It tasted a bit diluted in my opinion. The boba had perfect texture though and was chewy enough for my liking, which is good.
author: Emily Q.

description: Owners responded with lies just to justify their  terrible service.  I was in your store more then two minutes. Maybe you should learn to tell time.  I now drive over 4 miles one way to San Bruno ave to get really good if not the best in the city milk tea. Take a clue and don't lie to make your business sound better then it is.
author: Neal C.

description: Not sure why there is always a line outside; the drinks are just a OK.  Well, it's certainly better than the typical Quickly, but the price is also quite a bit higher.
author: Alan P.

description: Got their coffee milk tea can't really taste the coffee flavor would recommend getting classic milk tea with extra sweet because with regular sweet it was bitter
author: Heat L.

description: My friends and I dropped by for tapioca after dinner. They offer your traditional tapioca flavors - HK milk tea, jasmine milk tea, etc. Some other unconventional flavors included Soy milk tea and Horchata. My friends and I tried these 4 flavors. The one that made a lasting impression was surprisingly the soy milk tea. It was surprisingly sweet and full of flavor, totally opposite of what you think it would taste like. The guy working was also handing out samples of the cotton candy they make. They had chocolate and matcha - I especially liked the matcha. I would definitely come again when in the neighborhood.
author: Jackie M.

description:
Second best boba in SF. They have great tea, fresh brewed. They have great pearls. Big chewey. The milk is fresh and organic. That is a winning combination. But minus one star for : 
1. Price-on the high end price which would be OK if not for reasons 2, 3, 4.  
2. Service = SLOW, distracted, ADD level of attention
3. OUT of pearls on 2 occassions I went out of my way to be there. 
4. Small portion of pearls compared to most establishments.
author: Sara N.

description: Really bummed!!! The last time I came you were closed and this time you tell me you are out of boba and toppings! 2 strikes :(
author: Anita K.

description: Welcome boba to the MIssion! Yah, it's not anything off the charts special, but it's solid, organic, and they accommodate fussy customers like a Starbucks would. . . .As a lactose intolerant Asian who wishes there were non-dairy milk options at the mainstream boba places, this place serves my needs. . . I've tried the basics: the regular boba milk tea and the jasmine . . .they are both good. Today I tried the matcha latte and had the grass jelly added. It was pretty satisfying . . tho i had a hard time tasting the grass jelly, but that could be my own doing b/c matcha is a stronger tea flavor so it overpowered the grass jelly. Maybe next time i should just get a cup of grass jelly like the brother did with the almond jelly. I kind of wish they had custard pudding. . .Hey boba guys, how about some custard pudding? But maybe the direction they're going is more the mixing of teas with fresh fruits . . .Maybe I will try that next time!
author: Summer L.

description:
Short ver.: Watery boba. Good tea. Passable boba.

Long ver.:

I lived in Socal. And those of you looking at the low ratings reviews for bay area boba places might notice a trend. But claiming that your milk tea is not made from powder is like a restaurant claiming that their food is not shit. I think the fact that people think this is unusual and worth noting says a lot about the competition.

The first time I tried their Jasmine milk tea, it was decent. Good tea. Average boba. I thought the boba was a little soft and definitely tasteless.

The second time, I tried the same thing but the milk tea is waayyyy too watery. Its like they keep it cold by putting ice in it. 

Is it racist if I point out that the second time I came the servers on duty were caucasians? Yes? Okay, I won't make excuses for them then, they're just incompetent regardless.
Polite and nice does not a good boba make.

I think Boba Guys have their marketing and presentation down pat, now if only they can actually make good boba tea they're set. Keyword: good boba. Get those workers to try out what good boba taste like and compare it to the blah that they make and maybe they'll finally have what it takes. (hint: honey b tea in outer richmond). Also, I don't care if they make the tea from scratch in front of us. Unless that makes my drink tastes better, it's just a gimmick.

Last thing; 

Dear Boba guys,
Please do better~ I'm rooting for you. You're the only halfway decent boba place within a mile from my work place. So, you know, your success is my benefit...
author: Will S.

description: Ordered a regular milk tea to go and unfortunately it was not good. Looking at it I could already tell that it was going to taste really watered down. The color looked off and when I tasted it, I was right. It taste like milk tea you would try to make at home....the tapioca balls were ok. Good chewiness to it but also tasted too sweet. Oh and a cup cost $4!!!! Expensive! I probably wouldn't go back even if I was in the Mission. Sorry!
author: Terry D.

description: Really good boba. First place I tried boba at. It loses one star for having odd hours, but hey, it's a hipster store in SF so what do you expect. Service was quick and they seem very popular
author: Omaid F.

description: Hmm... I'm not really sure what the rave is. I was expecting a lot from this place after reading some of the reviews. But after trying so many other joints, I can officially think of myself as a boba snob. With that said, Boba Guys seems relatively... average. Nothing that stands out to me, I don't hate it, but I can't really justify paying $4 for the little cup when I can go elsewhere in the city and pay the same price to get a larger cup. I tried both the horchata flavor and the jasmine milk tea. The jasmine milk tea had a nice floral tea taste, but again, it didn't stand out enough to me since I can go anywhere for this drink. The horchata was good if I never tried a good horchata. It tasted a bit watered down to me. If anything, I would just go to a Mexican joint and buy a good cup of horchata and mix my own tapioca balls in. Tapioca balls were soft and chewy though, so that was a good thing. Overall, since there really isn't many options in the Mission for tapioca, Boba Guys hits the spot. Compared to the rest of the city though, it can easily be forgotten. Worth a try if you're in the area and really craving tapioca I guess!
author: Johnson S.

description:
I've been drinking Boba Guys for over a year now, ever since their popup, and boy has their quality gone down ever since their real store opened. Tonight's boba tasted like plastic, and the milk tea itself just tasted super watered down. I drank a few sips, and threw the rest of it away with a heart full of regret. A few weeks ago I had a similar experience, and hoped it was a one time thing... but alas, no :(

One extra star for the former glory days.
author: Yuanyu C.

description:
well as much as i am content with good old Quickly, i do love to try new boba where ever i can. boba guys was close by and my friend had raved my ear off about it... not worth it! sorry guys but for FOUR bucks i didnt expect a TWELVE OUNCE cup of watery tea with a teaspoon of milk ok? it wasnt as sweet as preferred but the boba was decent. you can get a $3.05, 32 ounce Pumpbo at Tpumps, customized with better boba!!!! look, it was acceptable but total highway robbery. spend four bucks on something worth it. 

boba guys was a letdown of appocolyptic size
author: Nancy W.

description: Organic milk tea? That got me curious so I stopped by the other day. I've had boba all over the world, and I must say, theirs' is perfectly chewy and sweet! I had soy milk tea the first time. The second time, I tried the jasmine milk tea. You can actually taste the tea in their drinks! Drinks aren't powdery or overly sweet. They are slower than other places, probably because they have to wait for the tea to brew...Price is also a bit high, but I give 5stars for having "healthy" boba and drinks that are actually good! aha~
author: Jen C.

description:
i cant find better soy milk tea with boba elsewhere in the city. your choices are very limited, what- like 3 milk teas only? fine, but can't go wrong with any of them, unless they run out of soy milk, haha all you lactose intolerant people haha... ummm...  :(

the only thing that is worrisome is you never know when they will run out of boba. they may have tons of milk tea left, but operating from 6pm to 9pm and running out of boba at 8:40 pm is crippling to customers, especially to that one girl who gave me the puppy eyes and the "looks like you got the last boba huh" as i paid for my two and left.  looking back, that was a prime opportunity to get a number..... oh well...
author: Ethan L.

description: Solid boba teas.  Several of us were visiting from Dallas, TX  so had a chance to taste many flavors.  Tap balls near perfect, horchata was uniquely special.  Worth the trip when in Mission or the new Union Sq location.
author: Warren C.

description: This place is eh okay.  When my boyfriend and I came here there were only 2 flavors to choose from.  I got the jasmine milk tea and it was kind of watered down.  The boba was okay.  I love boba and this is definitely not the best boba spot.  And disappointed that the boba guys with lab coats weren't there!
author: Joyce L.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!  The boba is definitely pricier than many places but it's worth it!  If you like good tea, then this is the perfect place for you. They brew your tea when you order and it definitely seems like high quality stuff.  The boba is always fresh and the staff are very friendly.
author: Teresa H.

description: got some togo. their milk teas are pretty on point. tapioca balls are just not the same anymore to me if they aren't soaked in honey. This place is kinda pricey buts not too bad when you can actually taste the tea flavor. If I'm in the area, i'd stop by again. Their jasmine green milk tea. thats my go to
author: Kristina L.

description:
Been wanting to try this place for awhile.
Love the idea of the MASONJAR
Had the Original Milk Tea with Boba because the server suggested that was the best,
it was A-okay to me because it tasted just like any other milk tea I would get from another boba place.
$4, not bad
Parking is meters and sometimes tough
BUT they do have spiked boba drink choices (if you prefer some alky) - Never tried but maybe one day
Hours are short so be sure to check the hours before you come
author: Virginia L.

description: Best Boba in the City hands down. Tea is not from powder and they use the best ingredients available.
author: arthur t.

description:
A bunch of my officemates and I got together and ordered boba to be delivered from Boba Guys. I was really excited, since boba is delicious when done well, and these guys had sold me on their efforts to do it well. 

Verdict? Tea, tasty. Pearls, suck. 

An informal survey among the officemate pool found that we were all in agreement. Our order included the three milk teas on their menu: original, soy, and jasmine.

I ordered the jasmine milk tea with pearls. The tea was well prepared, creamy from the Straus milk they used, which was nice. The pearls were too gummy. Was this a result of the pearls sitting around for too long whilst being delivered? Doubtful, since I work 10 minutes via car from Boba Guys.

As one officemate put it: "they could corner the market on hipsters and white people." As for me, I'll continue to go to Fantasia, Verde, or Ten Ren for a solid cup of bubble tea that doesn't cost four dollars (or five when it's delivered). Sorry, Boba Guys.
author: Linda T.

description: their horchata with boba and almond pudding is like CRACK. im addicted.
author: Jamie P.

description:
Finally got a free Friday to check out the famous Boba Guys establishment.

1.  Hours are terrible.
2.  Got there at 12:45, only 1 hr 15 min after their opening time and they said they were SOLD OUT of boba.  You've got to be kidding me.  Only open from 11:30 to 2 and it's not like I came near closing time either.
3.  Woman offered to sell milk tea sans balls for $3.  A bit steep for just the milk tea.

Until I find time again to revisit and get a chance to actually try their boba, this place gets a tentative 1 star.
author: Angela T.

description: Nice addition to the Mission and the City.  I like the soy milk option.  Not too sweet which was good.  The tapioca was very good.  I would strengthen up the tea a little bit but this is a matter of personal preference for me as I like strong tea.  Looking forward to the special tastings on Saturdays.
author: Moe J.

description: Came here on a night when the Boba Guys weren't here to man their craft. But luckily, their drinks are integrated into the Ken Ken Ramen menu. The two offerings on the menu were the black milk tea and the black soy milk tea. Sadly, the bartender informed us only the BLACK MILK TEA was left and it automatically comes with almond jelly included in it. So with that being our only option, we ordered two. The drinks are very cool because they come in MASON JARS. But that's where the coolness ends. The contents were pre-prepared and tasted that way. I wish I could say more or had enjoyed it better, but for $4, it was just OK.
author: Dennis L.

description: i love the jasmine tea with bobas.  so good.  it's really addicting.  the only downside is that sometimes its PERFECT and other times it's not sweet enough or it's watery.  It's $4 a pop + $1 tip so I can feel like kind of a dummy when it isn't great.  But when it is - - - so good!!
author: Amy M.

description: Wandered in one day right after they opened for business and talked to the guys for a while. It was clear that they really care about boba and crafting the best tea possible. I really appreciated their friendliness and the independent nature of their shop. It's nice ordering from people that 1) speak english and 2) are friendly; and their fare tends to be a little different and fuller flavored than what you'd normally find at a big chain place, so it's worth a shot to swing by!
author: John S.

description: Absolutely average milk tea at best served premade from plastic pitchers.  We had such high expectations too and made a trip out just to try it given the hours they are open.  The main issue is that the milk tea was too sweet with not enough tea flavor, the most common complaint I have about milk tea joints. The tapioca (boba) was nicely cooked and the bartender was pleasant and friendly.
author: Brutally H.

description: Meh. I heard this place was really good like a while back, the place to hang. So when I walked in with my friend one day I was totally surprised. There were like no seats to really chill or anything and the menu had like only FOUR CHOICES you must be kidding me right? But ey maybe its really good with thise flavors. I consulted yelp and there were rave reviews on the horchata boba. Me being kinda dumb did not realize that it was the whole rice cinnamon drink thing till I tasted it. Even then it took me a while to realize it. It was like a reallly watered down version of Horchata. Like if I wanted a good one I could have went a couple blocks down to some tacqeria instead of paying $4 ah. Well. The boba was slightly sweet and chewy so that was good but they give you so little so that sucked. The regular milk tea my friend got is more or less if you prefer more tea than milk. It sucks cause i think it's the only milk tea place in the Mission. Ah well you gotta do what you gotta do.
author: Lena T.

description: They have a perfect balance between tea and milk. The tapioca boba had a good consistency. I enjoyed it a lot and would definitely go back when I'm in the Mission. The price ($4) is a little higher than most but I think it was worth the price. The only complaint I have is the amount of ice they put into the tea as it takes up half of the cup.
author: Brenda T.

description: Wanted to try this place due to the limited hours and check out what it's about. Ordered an original and a jasmine tea with Pork Curry. Their milk tea has so much flavor and the tapioca balls were cooked perfectly. It was a bit pricey though but was worth a try. Wanted to purchase the mason jars but they had limited availability.
author: Ej O.

description: If you are willing to pay a premium for boba then this is the spot for you. Straus milk, organic ingredients, great customer service, and novel unique flavors makes this spot a must stop whenever I'm in SF.
author: Tony W.

description: A hidden gem! I use to live in NYC where I could get a lot of amazing boba tea. I recently moved to Baltimore and unfortunately I have yet found a decent boba tea shop. When I got to San Francisco I was on a mission to find a delicious boba tea! Boba Guys crafts the best boba tea I have ever had. There is a variety of high quality teas to choose from and the milk is organic and local! The staff was extremely friendly and when I told them it was my birthday they gave me a bag of their delicious loose tea! I could never go back to a typical tea house with so-so tea and powdered milk. I highly recommend you checking this place out! Mission accomplished!
author: Julia D.

description: I had been getting original milk tea here regularly (3-4days a week). The last 3 times I experienced very inconsistent flavor, was way too sweet once, too bitter once and,  the latest time, it was lack of any flavor. Will not be back.
author: W M.

description: I got the jasmine boba milk tea. It's some of the freshest, chewiest tapioca balls I've ever had, great milk, and the sugar taste is not overwhelming. The only downside is it's a bit expensive, so not really in everyone's price range in terms of boba. I'd probably give it another try, with another drink. In terms of how much of a tea taste I get, it's harder to tell because jasmine teas are just more subtle in general
author: Edison T.

description: Their jasmine milk tea was good. Their regular milk tea was even better! Their milk tea was creamy, milky and had a very nice tea taste to it. Although their jasmine milk tea was good, I thought the jasmine was a little bit too overpowering. Came here for boba, but what we got instead was almond jelly :{ I hate it when places run out of boba. Overall I thought their milk tea was pretty good. Parking was terrible as I got swooped two times -_-, but other than that, I would come back again but only if there is boba.
author: Alice Z.

description: the staff is always really nice. the boba though is too sweet for me. since i live near the mission once in a while i'll go here when i really need a boba fix but otherwise, i always to go sharetea on geary. its cheaper and 100% better.
author: Vicky L.

description: I went here and they told me they don't have anymore drinks or boba.. This was during the day, 3 hours before they were closing... How do you run out of boba drinks when that's what you do?!
author: Jack L.

description: I've been to this place a couple times and it's amazing! The boba is great and the drinks actually taste like tea, unlike other places like quickly. I would have given this place 5 stars, but I just had the worst experience ever. First off, BEWARE OF THE BLONDE GIRL MAKING DRINKS. I saw her mix a drink with a spoon, taste the drink with the spoon, and then put the spoon back into the drink to mix it some more!!!! Someone needs to be retrained. I then ordered my usual coconut green tea and matcha latte despite what I just witnessed. The coconut drink didn't even taste like coconut and the matcha drink had black bitter chunks in it! Later when I got home, I realized the chunks were matcha. I would love to come back here, but never am I going to have this girl make my drinks.
author: Kathleen N.

description: The Muscat Oolong milk tea from the slow bar is the best! Full oolong scent and flavor. Minus 1 star since it's pretty pricey, but worth the 0.5 mile walk.
author: Cheryl X.

description: I came here once with my boyfriend because he was telling me how much hype this place was getting. I came and was disappointed. There's nothing too special about this boba place that stands out amongst the rest of the thousand other boba places in the Bay Area. They have limited options for boba. I tried their milk tea with boba and my boyfriend had the Thai tea with boba. We weren't to amazed by their tea. The wait wasn't long at all here either, so that was a plus. Overall, I probably wouldn't come back here for boba.
author: Cat L.

description: My boyfriend and I walked past this place after dinner and decided to stop in and try. I ordered the HK milk tea with boba. The tea was alright, but the boba was too soft. It felt like boba that has been sitting out for a while. Maybe it was just a bad batch, but it definitely spoiled the drink for me.
author: Alison L.

description: nice touch with using local brand name ingredients, good tea flavor but this bubble tea is still only just comparable with many other bubble tea places in the Bay Area. The main thing going for you is that you have a great store location and congrats on getting the non-Asian market. But the bubble tea is only average.
author: Marky T.

description: Love this place. Right now it's just a pop up but they are making their own store soon. It's 4 dollars for a cup and they only have 3 flavored, but you can just tell they have high quality ingredients that set it apart.
author: Alice W.

description: Cool little shop with the emphasis on the tea and not necessarily 'bubble tea.' Loved their tea, disliked their bobas. For the price, their boba should be cooked to perfection, not soft and bland. Would try again if I were in the area, but wouldn't go out of my way for it.
author: Maria Y.

description:
does not have a lot of choices, the green tea they have is not really green tea, more like green milk tea. tapioca is hard.  since I am a Taiwanese, I am very picky on my tapioca drink. I say Sharetea is the best so far, the most authentic one.
I do like Boba Guys's branding, interior design and mugs.
author: Diana C.

description: I love their green milk tea with almond jelly!
author: Joy Y.

description: I finally got around to trying this place out. I got the original black milk tea, good amount of sweetness, not sickly sweet. It was smooth and didn't have that artificial flavor you find with many other boba places. The tea flavor was subtle and personally I would have preferred it to be a little stronger. The boba had good texture. I appreciate that they're making fresh milk tea and all, and if you're a boba fan it's worth a try, but at $4 each I probably won't be coming back.
author: Meli S.

description: I'm giving them three stars because they had excellent customer service. Unfortunately, the drink I ordered left much to be desired. I ordered the strawberry tea with grass jelly - I was really excited because they told me all about how they make their strawberry puree, and grass jelly in house, and it was going to be delicious. When I got my drink (quite quickly actually) it was over 3/4 ice and the jellies were floating all around the drink (not on the bottom where the straw is). The first sip was great, but by the time I got to the jellies, all the drink was gone and the ice had diluted the flavor to taste like a watered down strawberry vitamin water. I was left with a pile of green jellies and no tea to drink it with. So, I essentially threw out half of the $4.5 I bought. I dont know if this has to do with the fact that the jelly is homemade, but it was extremely frustrating. Not sure if I will be going back, but if I do, I will not order the jellies again. :-/
author: Julie P.

description: I got the jasmine milk tea. I liked that it was refreshing and you can really taste the quality of the milk. However the tea flavor was really weak and the boba wasn't anything special. I think boba guys can stand to improve their recipe. For $4 a drink, the boba should be softer to match the quality of the milk. I hope they will keep brainstorming to make their boba drinks more interesting because right now the drinks are super basic and the novelty of the mason jar will wear out.
author: Tina L.

description: For me, this beverage is all about the brew. I'm sad to say that I didn't get a strong tea flavor, and it was much too sweet. I suppose the sweetness could be adjusted fairly easily. Not so for the brew. I appreciate their intent with quality ingredients, but the end product was unexceptional.
author: J R.

description: I would give this place 4 stars, but I took off a two stars for the price and the amount of ice that was in my glass. This place has very good milk tea. I came here with a bunch of friends and I was able to try all of their flavors. You are able to taste the tea in the drinks. They gave you a decent amount of tapioca balls and they were soft and chewy. One drink is $4 and for that price, I expect plenty of drink. All of our glasses were filled half way with ice and not a lot of drink. I probably won't come back here because the only special thing about this place is that you get to drink it out of mason jars.
author: Tracy C.

description: One of the best milk teas I've ever had. It feels really light (in a good way), refreshing and healthy without skimping out on taste. They ran out of tapioca so we got the almond jelly instead and it turned out to be really good! I'm just sad that this place isn't open every day but it might be a good thing because then I'd be drinking way too many milk teas for my own good. Anyway, highly recommended, everyone should try this place out!
author: Margaret Y.

description: read lot of reviews and decided to give boba guys a try. i ordered jasmine milk tea with boba. the boba wasnt marinated and you can feel sugar grains in the drink. one of the worst jasmine milk tea i had.
author: Allen Z.
